loans.name: Claudia

texts.es:
Claudia es socia del Banco Comunal Los Ladrilleros de Compañía, Ana vive en la comunidad de Compañía que se ubica a 40 minutos de la ciudad de Ayacucho.
Claudia es casada, tiene 33 años y 4 hijos, Claudia junto a su esposo se dedican a la fabricación de ladrillos de manera artesanal, para la cual cuenta con un horno artesanal, actividad que realiza con el apoyo de peones. Además Claudia tiene una tienda de abarrotes en su vivienda.
Claudia necesita un préstamo de 1500 soles dinero que será invertido en la compra de leña, arroz y fideo.
Los sueños de Claudia son brindar una buena educación a sus hijos, aumentar con mas productos su negocio y tener otro horno.
texts.en:
Claudia is a member of the Community Bank “Los Ladrilleros de Compañía” (the brick-makers of Compañía). She lives in the town of Compañía, located 40 minutes from the city of Ayacucho. Claudia is 33 years old, married, and has 4 children. Together with her husband, she earns a living by making artisan bricks, which she makes with an artisan oven and the help of day laborers. She also has a small grocery store in her home. Claudia needs a loan of 1500 soles that she will use to purchase firewood, rice and noodles. Her dreams are to give her children a good education, increase the merchandise in her store, and to have another oven [to make bricks].

Translated from Spanish by Rachel Crouch, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Firewood, rice, noodles

loans.name: Hilola

texts.ru: Хилола кредитуется на КИВА во второй раз. Ее бизнес заметно расширился и ассортимент товаров увеличен. Хилола ответственный и пунктуальный бизнесмен, показала себя с хорошей стороны. Хилола планирует увеличить ассортимент детской одежды, она знает какой товар сейчас наиболее востребован на рынке. Для реализации своих планов она просит займ на КИВА.
texts.en:
Hilola is taking out a loan at Kiva for the second time. Her business has noticeably expanded and assortment of goods has increased. Hilola is a responsible and punctual businesswoman and has shown at her best. Hilola plans to increase the assortment of children's clothing. She knows which merchandise is most in demand on the market right now. To realize her plans she is asking for a loan from Kiva.

Translated from Russian by Elena Fedorchuk, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy spring assortment of clothing

loans.name: Dina

texts.es: Dina tiene 41 años de edad, vive con su esposo, quien es policía, y ambos son padres de una hija de 8 años, que cursa estudios primarios, la casa que habitan es propia. Ella es propietaria de cinco motocarros, los mismos que son manejados por chóferes particulares que contrata para realizar transporte de pasajeros (taxi). Estos vehículos los tiene hace 4 años, los mismos que trabajan de lunes a sábado en un horario de 5 de la mañana hasta 9 de la noche. Dina es la encargada de administrar las ganancias de sus motocarros, verificar su estado y llevarlos a hacerles mantenimiento o reparar si tienen algunas fallas. Dina está muy contenta, porque hasta el momento este negocio le está resultando muy rentable. Es la primera vez que tiene un préstamo con MFP, y todavía no sabe como es el trabajo en su banco comunal, pero ya ha notado que son personas unidas y muy comunicativas. Con el dinero que solicita mandará a construir un garaje seguro, ya que sus motocarros, en la actualidad, se guardan en un espacio fuera de su casa, a la intemperie corriendo el riesgo de robo.
texts.en:
Dina is 41 years old and lives with her husband who is a policeman. Both are parents of an 8-year-old daughter who is in primary school. They own the house where they live. She is the owner of five three-wheeled light vans with private drivers she hires to transport passengers (taxi). She has had these vehicles for 4 years and they run from Monday thru Saturday from 5 in the morning until 9 at night. Dina is in charge of administering the profits from her vehicles, verifying their condition and taking them for maintenance work or repairs if they have any problems. Dina is very happy because this business has been very profitable up to now. It is the first time she has had a loan with MFP (Microfinanzas Prisma). She doesn’t know how the community bank works yet, but she has already noticed that the people are united and very communicative. She will have a safe garage built with the money she applied for since she currently keeps her vehicles in a space outside her home, unprotected and running the risk of theft.

Translated from Spanish by Susan Haynes, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Build a garage for her vehicles

loans.name: Tes

texts.en: Tes T., 46, is married and resides with her husband in the Kampong Cham province. To earn a living, she sells mangoes and typically makes US$4 of profit per day. Her husband is a taxi driver and earns US$3 per day. Mrs. Tes T. would like to take out a loan to purchase mangoes from growers to sell at the market.

loans.use: Buy mangoes to sell

loans.name: Jannett

texts.es:
Jannett es socia del Banco Comunal Tulipanes.
Jannett es soltera, tiene 21 años y vive con sus padres, Jannett junto a su hermano tienen una cerrajería que esta en su casa, la producción es de acuerdo a pedidos de sus clientes, Yaneth se encarga de la administración del negocio.
Jannett necesita un préstamo de 1050 soles dinero que será invertido en la compra de fierros.
Los sueños de Jannett son ampliar su negocio y comprar su casa.
texts.en:
Jannett is a member of the community bank of Tulipanes. She is 21, unmarried, and lives with her parents. She runs a locksmith shop with her brother out of their house, and their production is in accordance with the wishes of their clients. Yaneth is in charge of the administrative side of the business. Jannett needs a loan of 1050 soles which she will invest in the purchase of iron. Her dreams are to expand the business and buy her own house.

Translated from Spanish by Cyrus Maher, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of iron

loans.name: Trần Thị

texts.en:
V. Trần Thị (244970692) is a 49-year-old woman living in the town of Sóc Sơn. She is married and has 2 adult children. To make a living, V. owns and operates a general store. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes from selling both food and daily-use products in the local community. V. has been engaged in this business for over 12 years and earns approximately 4,000,000 VND a month from these activities.

In 1997, V. joined TYM Fund to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. V. has successfully repaid a previous loan of 10,000,000 VND from TYM Fund. This previous loan was used to purchase additional products to sell. V. is now requesting a new loan of 10,000,000 VND which will be used to invest in expanding the business. This will be the 12th loan taken out by the borrower from TYM Fund. V. plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand her business

loans.use: used to invest in expanding the business

loans.name: Rolando Antonio

texts.es: Don Rolando Antonio E. tiene la edad de 53 años, habita en el barrio Laureles Sur en la capital de Managua, su esposa le tiene dos hijos que están estudiando, ella ayuda en la panadería en el cual llevan diez años trabajando para sobresalir adelante, el inicio estos prestamos con prestamos que Afodenic otorgo este es su noveno crédito el cual invertirá en la compra de harina, azúcar. Levadura, manteca y otros productos para elaborar el pan que día, a día hacen para vender a los diferentes barrios de la capital. Sus planes es poder contratar dos panaderos para que eleven la producción y venta del pan, a si como comprar otra camioneta para hacer fácil el traslado.
texts.en:
Don Rolando Antonio E. is 53 years old and lives in the Laureles Sur neighborhood in Managua, capital city of Nicaragua. He and his wife have two children who are students. His wife helps him in the bakery where they have been working for 10 years, trying to get ahead financially. Don Rolando began accepting loans granted through Kiva partner Afodenic. This is his ninth loan, which will be invested in the purchase of flour, sugar, yeast, butter and other products used to make bread to be sold daily in different neighborhoods in the city. His plans are to be able to hire two bakers to increase the production and sales of bread. He also wants to buy another truck to facilitate transportation.

Translated from Spanish by Kara Gibson, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy flour, sugar, yeast and other products for making bread.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: purchase a larger amount of used clothes to sell in her neighborhood

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase more material such as vitenge and kanga

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: adding to her working capital

loans.name: Fabiana

texts.es:
La señora Fabiana es socia del Banco Comunal “Santa Rosa de Lima”  que esta ubicado en el distrito de Juli, Provincia de Chucuito, Departamento de Puno, ella tiene 53 años de edad, estado civil soltera y es madre de 01 hijo, estudio educación secundaria completa, vive en el Barrio Asunción Jr. Asunción 419.

Trabaja con el Movimiento Manuela Ramos hace 3 años,  su préstamo inicial fue de S/. 300.00 nuevos soles, el mismo que lo invirtió comprando golosinas. 

En este momento ella solicito un préstamo de S/. 2000.00 Nuevos soles, para la compra de galletas, dulces, yogures, chisitios, gaseosas, etc., para venderlo en su tienda.

Su deseo es mejorar y surtir mejor su tienda.

A ella le gustan las facilidades en los pagos.

loans.use: Para la compra de galletas, dulces, yogures, chisitios, gaseosas, etc.,

loans.name: Juan Ventura

texts.es: El Señor Juan Ventura C. Sapón cuenta con 54 años de edad casado se dedica al comercio desde hace diez años a esta actividad vende en  diferentes partes de la ciudad por lo que sus números de clientes cada día va en aumento también la demanda de sus clientes son muy buenas por lo que acudió a la Asociación Asdir con el objetivo de adquirir un préstamo ayudando así a su negocio generando mas empleo a las personas que le entregan su mercadería como también un buen crecimiento de capital de trabajo así poder cubrir aun mas puntos de la ciudad  para el crecimiento y la variedad de su mercadería obteniendo  mejores ingresos mensuales y mercadería innovadora.

loans.use: Comercio (ampliacion de capital)

loans.name: Creciendo Juntas Group

texts.es: El banco comunal “Creciendo Juntas” esta representada por la señora Ana Maria y conformada por 13 miembros bastante responsables y dinámicas siempre puntuales en sus pagos la mayoría D. los miembros del grupo se dedican a la venta D. comida Nexus propios restoranes o puestos ambulantes, el resto D. los miembros se dedica a la elaboración D. pan y a la venta D. cosméticos por catálogos. La competencia dentro D. su rubro es alta pero las socias del grupo ya trabajan años y cuentan con clientela fiel y experiencia en el negocio por lo que no le preocupa mucho la competencia. El destino del financiamiento es para la adquisición D. mercadería, insumos y materiales que ayuden a generar mayor rentabilidad para brindarle a su familia una mejor calidad D. vida. En cuanto a la experiencia crediticia las socias van cursando un ciclo mas dentro D. la institución demostrando siempre puntualidad y responsabilidad en sus pagos ya que D. ello depenD. no solo el pago D. su obligación si no también el sustento y futuro D. toda su familia.
texts.en:
The "Creciendo Juntas" (Growing Together) Communal Bank is represented by Ana Maria and composed of 13 very responsible and dynamic members who are always on time with their payments. The majority of the group members sell food, either in their own restaurants or from traveling carts. The rest of the members make bread and sell cosmetics from catalogs. The members are highly competent in their trades and have worked for years, gaining loyal clientele and business experience, so their capability is not in question. The purpose of the financing is the acquisition of merchandise, supplies and materials that will help to improve profitability and proviD. a better quality of life for their families. As for credit history, the members are completing another cycle within the institution and consistently demonstrate punctuality and responsibility with their payments, since not only the fulfillment of their obligation but also the support and future of their families depends on it.

Translated from Spanish by Amanda McDermott, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: operating capital

loans.name: Alba Luz

texts.es: La señora Alaba Luz  C.  de 39 años de edad, se dedica a la venta ropa y venta de fritanga desde hace 14 años el cual ha logrado mantenerlo muchas veces con ventas bajas, y se vende bastante por la temporada, reside en Villa Reconciliación junto a su esposo e hijos procreo cuatro  dos trabajan y dos estudian, su esposo es mecánico muy trabajador y buen padre, el cual la apoyado no solo en la educación si no hacer una mujer independiente, el cual he apoyado a mis hijos para que logren sus sueños de un futuro mejor. Desde horas tempranas se levanta para preparar los alimentos para la venta ya que en horas de la mañana es el movimiento de los desayunos y por las tardes esta descansa ya que es cansado al preparar los alimentos. Con este préstamo comprara alimentos para vender su rica fritanga a si como comprar zapatos y poder atrae clientes nuevos con nuevos productos es su noveno ciclo el cual agradece por el apoyo con los financiamientos que por la tasa baja de los intereses y los plazo ha logrado crecer.
texts.en:
Alba is 39 years old and for 14 years she has sold clothing and food cooked over a grill. This has maintained her, though sales have sometimes been low and seasonal. She lives in Villa Reconciliación with her husband and 4 children, 2 of whom work while 2 are students. Her husband is a hard working mechanic and a very good father. He has helped her, not only educationally but to become an independent woman, which has helped her children to achieve their dreams of a better future.

From the early hours of the morning Alba is up preparing food to sell, since breakfast is her main product. In the afternoon, she rests, weary from the labors of preparing meals all morning.

With this loan she will buy food to sell from her tasty grill and to buy shoes, in order to attract new customers with new products. This is her 9th loan cycle and she is grateful for the financial help. The low interest rate and longer repayment periods have enabled her business to grow.

Translated from Spanish by Harold Sims, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: TO BUY MEAT, VEGETABLES, BASIC GRAINS, AND SHOES TO SELL

loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.es:
La socia ELIZABETH, pertenece al banco comunal “AMAUTA”, es natural de la ciudad del Cusco.

La socia tiene 52 años de edad, es casada, tiene tres hijos dos varones y una mujer. Ella por las mañanas trabaja como profesora del nivel secundaria en el colegio “Comercio 41” del Cusco y por las tardes ella alterna sus actividades del hogar con el negocio de venta de castaña que le traen de la ciudad de Puerto Maldonado (Madre de Dios, Perú). La hija estudia la carrera profesional de Medicina Humana en la Universidad Nacional del país de Bolivia. La socia requiere el préstamo para aumentar su producción de venta de castaña y la educación de su hija.        .
  
La socia se encuentra agradecido por la oportunidad brindada mediante este medio y así mismo se compromete a cumplir con el pago correspondiente al cronograma.
texts.en:
Elizabeth belongs to the Amauta communal bank. She is from the city of Cusco. She is 52, married, and she has three children. She has two boys and a girl. In the mornings she works as a teacher at the Comercio 41 High School in Cusco. In the afternoons she alternates her activities between the home and her business of selling chestnuts, which she gets from the city of Puerto Maldonado (Mardre de Dios, Perú). Her daughter is studying for a professional career in medicine at the National University in Bolivia. Elizabeth needs a loan to increase her chestnut sales and for her daughter’s education.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy chestnuts and pay for her daughter's education

loans.name: Edzon

texts.es:
Edzon es un joven soltero de 26 años, actualmente vive en una casa alquilada.
Su lugar de origen es una comunidad nativa donde no hay exceso al transporte, por ello en busca de un porvenir diferente, hace aproximadamente 2 años llegó al pueblo en crecimiento donde ahora vive, donde fue acogido brindándole un trabajo. Edzon ya se acostumbró a este lugar y ahora quiere sembrar sus propios cultivos de café y plátanos en chacras alquiladas. Él está muy convencido de que le irá bien, ya que en todo este tiempo de jornalero ha ganado la experiencia y destreza para el buen cuidado y desarrollo de estos cultivos, pues estos trabajos no le parecen nada pesados, manifiesta; culminado con su frase: “es cuestión de maña”. 
Los anhelos de Edzon son de comprarse sus propias chacras en este lugar y por ello trabajará duramente.

Este su primer préstamo con MFP, por lo que está muy contento con la oportunidad de crédito, ya que para él “es una bendición”, pues ahora podrá sembrar. Con el dinero solicitado alquilará un terreno y comprará plantitas de plátanos para iniciarse con ese cultivo.
texts.en:
Edzon is a single young man who is 26 years of age. He currently lives in a rented house. Since his native community had limited access to transportation, he decided to leave in search of a different life. It has been two years since he arrived in the village that provided him a job and he now calls home. Edzon has grown accustomed to the place and now wants to rent a piece of land to begin growing his own coffee and banana crops. He is convinced that he will do well in this endeavor because of the time he spent as a field laborer. Through this job, he acquired experience in developing and caring for these types of crops. Edzon does not find the work difficult and says, “It is a matter of skill.” He hopes to continue working hard and eventually buy his own farm.

This is his first loan with MFP. Edzon is pleased to have this opportunity and says “it is a blessing” because the planting season has started. The money requested will be used to pay the rent on his farmland and buy banana seedlings to start his first crop.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase banana seedlings & pay the rent on a piece of farmland

loans.name: Benilda

texts.en:
Benilda A. is from the village of Binuanagan, in Misamis Oriental. She is 45 years old.  Benilda is married and has 1 adult children. To make a living, Benilda owns & operates a sari-sari (general) store. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes  from selling food & essentials in the local community. Benilda has been engaged in her business for over 4 years and earns approximately 8000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2008, Benilda joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Benilda has successfully repaid a previous loan of 8000 PHP from HSPFI. This previous loan was used to to purchase additional products to sell. Benilda is requesting a new loan of 11000 PHP which will be used to expand her business. This loan will be the 4th loan taken out by Benilda from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand her business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: Expanding her business

loans.name: Neyaz Mohammad

texts.en:
The man in the picture is Neyaz M., the son of G. M.. He lives in district 8th of Kabul Afghanistan. He is 50, married, and has six children. As in Afghanistan, it is wintertime and the weather is getting colder. All the people prepare for this season. 

Neyaz M., who lives in a small house having three rooms and a kitchen, wants to repair most of his house. During the rain and snow in winter, he and his family members face lots of problems. So, he came to AFS and requested an individual loan of 50,000 Afghani to buy the required construction materials to start the repairs to his house. 

Neyaz M. is glad that these kinds of processes exist in Afghanistan for the support of those who are in need of money. He would like to thank the Kiva lenders so much.

loans.use: To purchase construction materials.

loans.name: Paulette Isabelle

texts.fr: Paulette Isabelle C. est âgée de 42 ans, mariée et mère de 2 enfants. Elle tient un étal au marché ou elle commercialise divers produits alimentaires. Son objectif est de participer à améliorer les conditions de vie de sa famille.
texts.en:
Paulette Isabelle C. is 42 years old, married and mother of two children. She runs a stall in the market where she sells various food products. Her objective is to contribute to the improvement of her family's living conditions.

Translated from French by René McConnell, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Retail of various food products

loans.name: Julienne

texts.fr: A. Julienne réside depuis environs 40 ans au quartier Sainte Cécile à Cotonou, capitale économique du Bénin. Julienne est mariée à DJOTCHOU Nounangnon, un pêcheur, et est mère de six enfants. Seulement quatre des enfants restent encore à la charge du couple. Certains enfants sont scolarisés. Le couple assure ensemble les charges de la famille. N'ayant jamais été à l'école, pour assurer ses différentes charges, Julienne vend du poisson frit et de l'akassa (aliment local préparé à base d'amidon de maïs) dans son quartier à Sainte Cécile. De façon secondaire, Julienne vend également des crabes, ce qui lui permet d'avoir une autre source de revenu. Julienne s'approvisionne à Dantokpa, marché international du Bénin. C'est une ancienne cliente de ALIDé, ayant déjà bénéficié de trois crédits auprès de l'institution, crédits qu'elle a bien remboursés. La clientèle de Julienne s'accroît au jour le jour ; mais Julienne n'arrive plus à satisfaire toute la demande, compte tenu du peu de moyens financiers dont elle dispose. Julienne sollicite à cet effet, un quatrième crédit afin de renforcer son activité et de mieux satisfaire ses clients.
texts.en:
A. Julienne has lived for about forty years in the Sainte Cécile neighborhood of Cotonou, economic capital of Benin. Julienne is married to DJOTCHOU Nounangnon, a fisherman, and is the mother of six children. Only four children are still supported by the couple. Some of the children are in school. The couple supports the family together. Never having been to school, in order to pay various expenses, Julienne sells fried fish and akassa (local food prepared from cornstarch) in her neighborhood in Sainte Cécile. Secondarily, Julienne also sells crabs, which allows her to have another source of income. Julienne gets her supplies in Dantokpa, international market of Benin. She is already an ALIDé client, having previously received three loans from the institution, loans which she has fully repaid. Julienne's clientele grows from day to day, but Julienne is not able to satisfy all the demand, given her limited financial means. For this reason Julienne is seeking a fourth loan in order to build up her business and better satisfy her customers.

Translated from French by Robin Clochard, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of corn and fresh fish

loans.name: Juliet

texts.en: Juliet P. is from the village of Mahinog, Camiguin Province. She is 38 years old, is married and has four school-aged children. Juliet owns and operates a business raising pigs for sale. She has been engaged in her business for over three years and earns approximately 5,000 PHP a month. In 2010, Juliet joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5,000 PHP from HSPFI. This previous loan was used to to invest in expanding her business. Juliet is requesting a new loan of 8,000 PHP which will again be used to invest in expanding her business. This loan will be her 2nd from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand her business. About HSPFI: HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To invest in expanding her business

loans.name: Rene

texts.en:
Rene I. is 33 years old. He owns 1½ hectares of rice fields, where he closely monitors the growth of his rice plants. Aside from rice, he also raises chickens. The income really helps him to be able to afford the basic needs for his home.

He would like to apply a loan of PHP 12,000 from Community Economic Ventures Inc. He will use the loan to buy farm supplies to grow his harvest.

loans.use: To buy farm supplies

loans.name: Tamaraneh Ii Group

texts.en:
Saffie J. is the leader of this group from Makeni, a city in northern Sierra Leone. Saffie and her colleague are seeking a loan of SLL 2,600,000 from Kiva lenders. With the help of this loan, they can expand their businesses, make more sales, and consequently improve their standard of living. The 41-year-old Saffie sells market-food – Maggi cubes (used to give sauce a sweet taste), salt, sugar, etc. She has been in this business for many years now. 

Saffie is married with five children. With her share of the loan, she will expand her business by buying the above-mentioned items wholesale to add to her current stock.

loans.use: Buy Maggi cubes, salt, sugar, etc. to add to her business inventory

loans.name: Pampahasi 2 Group

texts.es:
El Banco comunal PAMPAHASI 2 está conformado por 9 clientes, todas mujeres, que están ubicados por los alrededores D. la oficina Emprender y por Alto Pampahasi subiendo por SAMAPA,. se dedican a la venta D. comida, venta D. verduras, cosméticos, elaboración y venta D. salteñas ventas en abarrotes y otros, pese a tener actividades muy distintas se conocen muy bien entre sí asistieron a todas las charlas y escucharon con atención porque la mayoría ingreso por primera vez a un banco comunal.

La Sra. Nely Representa a su banco en  el cargo D. Presidenta del banco se dedica a la confecccion D. todo tipo D. ropa, segun pedido D. los clientes, cuenta con esta actividad hace 10 años, el préstamo será destinado a la compra D. insumos (tela por rollo, esponja, algodón, store). Vive en la zona Escobar Uría con sus familiares, no tiene esposo pero tiene una hija producto D. una relación espontánea.
Ha sido elegida por su gran capacidad D. manejo D. personas y D. conocer a todas sus compañeras, responsable y dinámica desD. el inicio en las capacitaciones brindando su apoyo a todas sus compañeras coordinando en la conformación del banco 

La Sra. Eliza,  Socia que asume el cargo D. Tesorera del banco, se dedica a la venta D. comida y refrescos  a pedidos para las instituciones públicas y privadas se dedica a esta actividad hace 5 años en su propio domicilio el préstamo esta destinado a la compra D. víveres por mayor  para sus pedidos. 

La Sra. July, Ha sido elegido como Secretaria, por su desenvolvimiento en la redacción, dinámica para la redacción y coordinación, se dedica a la venta D. cosméticos por mayor también realiza viajes a Cochabamba y a Santa cruz el préstamo esta destinado para la compra D. productos D. belleza que se encuentran en promosion, tiene dos hijos menores D. 12 años y ella sola mantiene el hogar.

Todas las socias estan agradecidas con Emprender y Kiva por la confianza brindada en la otorgacion del credito.
texts.en:
The Pampahasi 2 Communal Bank is maD. up of nine customers, all women, who live near the Emprender office in Alto Pampahasi just past the SAMAPA water company. They work in food sales, vegetable sales, cosmetics, preparation and sale of salteñas (Bolivian empanadas), grocery sales and other businesses. Despite their very different business activities, the members know each other very well. They attended all the training talks and listened attentively because the majority of them were becoming members of a communal bank for the first time. Nely is the president of the bank. She works making all types of clothes to fill customers' orders. She has been doing this for ten years. The loan will be used to purchase supplies (rolls of fabric, sponges, cotton, etc.). She lives in the Escobar Uría zone with her relatives. She is not married but has a daughter from a previous relationship. She has been chosen as president for her great ability to manage people and her knowledge and understanding of her companions. She has been responsible and dynamic since the beginning, lending her support to all her companions during the formation of the bank. Eliza, the treasurer of the bank, sells food and drinks on order to public and private institutions. She has been doing this for five years in her own home. The loan will be used to buy foods wholesale for her orders. July has been chosen as secretary because of her writing ability. She sells cosmetics wholesale and also makes trips to Cochabamba and Santa Cruz. The loan will be used to purchase beauty products on sale. She has two children under the age of 12, and she supports the family alone. All the members are grateful to Emprender and Kiva for the confidence placed in them with the granting of this loan.

Translated from Spanish by Danielle Maxson, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of merchandise

loans.name: Soledad

texts.es:
La socia Soledad; pertenece al banco comunal “SEÑOR JUSTO JUEZ”, Nuestra socia es vive en el distrito de Huanchac, provincia del Cusco y departamento de Cusco.

Nuestra socia tiene 57 años de edad ella es casada, tiene 3 hijos, 30, 27, 21 años de edad  Nuestra socia tiene una tienda de abarrotes pero desde hace unos meses atrás decidió dedicarse paralelamente a esto a vender zapatos por catálogo, la socia tiene unas 3 revistas que las ofrece a todas las entidades y deja los zapatos para que se le pague en dos partes, la primera que es la mitad del costo se paga al entregar los zapatos que pidieron y la segunda exactamente al mes siguiente, vende carteras y todo tipo de zapatos y zapatillas, A nuestra socia le gustaría poner en un futuro cercano su propia tienda de zapatos, ella es una persona muy carismática y muy optimista, nos comenta que ella hace el pago total del producto por anticipado, pero a fin de que sus clientes le compren ella les deja a dos partidas de pago. Nuestra socia desea el préstamo para pagar el pedido que está haciendo a Lima.

Nuestra socia agradece y valora el préstamo otorgado por este medio y se compromete a cumplir con el pago total de la deuda en el plazo establecido.
texts.en:
Soledad is a member of the Señor Justo Juez village bank. She lives in the district of Huanchac, in the department of Cusco. Soledad is 57 years old. She is married and has 3 children, 30, 27, and 21 years old. She has a grocery store but a few months ago decided to also sell shoes by catalog. She offers three catalogs and allows people to pay her in two payments. She collects the first half when she delivers the shoes and the second the following month. She sells handbags and all kinds of shoes and sneakers. In the future, she would like to set up her own shoe store. She is a very charismatic, optimistic person. She tells us that she pays for all her merchandise in advance, but that to encourage her clients to purchase from her, she allows them to make two payments instead of one. She would like to have this loan to pay for the orders she making from Lima. Soledad is very grateful for the loan and is committed to paying off her debt in full and on time.

Translated from Spanish by Andrea Rosenberg, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Pay for merchandise orders

loans.name: Nancy

texts.en:
Nancy R. is 44 years old and is married to Eddie R.. The couple has two children, both of whom are college students. She and her husband have worked hard but they had a very small income, and they didn't have enough capital to start up a business. 

In 1997, Nancy heard about the Kiva field partner, ASHI, and began dreaming of having a stable life, a stable home and of starting a business. When she received her first and succeeding loans from ASHI, Nancy started her own business of selling fish in the local community. She has had this business for many years. Fish selling has been a great help to her family. As a busy entrepreneur, Nancy also embarked on a tricycle transport business (motorcycle with sidecar). Her husband, Eddie, manages this business.

However, the demands of her family grow as years go by. She wants to have more businesses that can add to her present income so she will have bigger profits and savings. She had the idea of operating a sari-sari (variety) store. It has been great! Nancy is earning a good income and she wants to make a larger investment in it. On her 11th loan, she is proposing a new loan amounting 45,000 PHP to expand her growing variety store business.

With this kind of business, Nancy can still manage her previous business of fish selling, because either her children or her husband can operate their sari-sari (variety) store at home when she's away selling fish. Someday, as her income increases, she dreams of funding her children’s education until they complete college degrees and have professional jobs. Her greatest dreams are to get out from the downward spiral of poverty and to have a happy life.

loans.use: To expand her variety store by purchasing more groceries.

loans.name: Mrs. Srey Me Village Bank Group

texts.en: Mrs. Srey M. is the village bank president of a group loan consisting of ten people who live in Peam Reang Leu village in Kandal province. She was selected by all the members who will use the loan for different purposes. She and her husband, Mr. Morn Bork, are farmers who own 3.5-hectares of land to grow crops to sell to support their family. Their problem is that their corn field is ready to be planted but they do not have enough money to get it done. So to improve production, Mrs. Srey M. is applying for a loan to hire farm laborers. Mrs. Srey M. is the mother of five children, three of whom are seamstresses in a garment factory, while the others attend the local public school.

loans.use: To hire farm laborers to grow corn

loans.name: Anonymous

texts.en:
This Kiva borrower is a 21-year old single man from Lebanon. He is living with his parents and three siblings who are still too young to start helping with the family expenses. He and his father collaborate to provide for the family. In 2006, he opened his own car repair shop specialized in selling and repairing vehicle’s body. He has been involved in this occupation for the past 10 years, having begun to work at a very young age.
He is now requesting for a $1,200 loan from Kiva partner, Ameen s.a.l to purchase used car parts in order to expand his business in the coming year.

loans.use: to purchase used car parts

loans.name: Gabriel Moises

texts.pt:
Gabriel Moisés M. nasceu no Distrito de Homoine, Província de Inhambane, sul de Moçambique, casado e pai de 2 filhos de 2 e 3 anos de idade, ainda não vão a escola. Fez nível médio não continuou devido a falta de condições financeiras. Vive na casa de aluguer com a sua família e sustenta a sobrinha que vive com ele e seus pais enviando dinheiro para despesas domesticas. 
Saiu de Inhambane para Maputo afim de continuar com estudos, mais conseguiu um emprego nos serviços Distritais de Educação e Tecnologia de Boane. Trabalha ha mais de 4 anos, não possui nenhum empregado e tem um salário de 5.586.00mt por mês, que aplica nas despesas e ainda poupa algum na sua conta bancária.
Nunca teve empréstimos em outros bancos, conheceu a Hluvuku através de amigos que também são clientes desta instituição. Este é o seu 1º empréstimo no valor de 20.000.00mt com o qual pretende comprar material de construção (cimento, pedra, areia, ferro e outos) para aplicar na construção da sua casa. 
Compromete se a pagar devidamente este empréstimo para poder aceder a outros. No futuro pretende solicitar mais empréstimos para continuar com a construção da sua casa e sair na casa de aluguer.
texts.en:
Gabriel Moisés M. was born in the District of Homoine, Province of Inhambane, southern Mozambique, a married father of two children of 2 and 3 years old, who are not attending school, yet. He finished middle school but did not continue due to lack of financial resources. He lives in a rented house with his family and supports a niece who lives with him and his parents sending them money for household expenses. He left Inhambane to live in Maputo in order to continue with his education, but he got a job in the District Services of Education and Technology in Boane. He’s worked there for over four years and has no employees. He earns 5,586.00mt a month, which he uses for household expenses, and he even saves some money in his bank account. He never requested for any loans in other banks. He came to Hluvuku through friends who are also clients of this institution. This is his first loan for 20.000.00mt, which he will use to purchase construction material (concrete, stone, sand, iron and others) to apply in the construction of his home. He is committed to repay this loan in time in order to access to others. In the future he plans to request for additional loans to continue with the construction of his home and to leave the house rental.

Translated from Portuguese by Jimena Lopez, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase construction material (concrete, stone, sand, iron and others)

loans.name: Victoria

texts.en: Victoria A. is 18 and is single with no children. She is starting a business venture selling baked goods in the local community. Victoria needs a loan of WST 1,000 to buy flour, flavoring, sugar, and plastic bags. She plans to use the earnings from her business (estimated to be 350 talas or approximately USD 136 per week) to improve and expand her business. In 2010, Victoria joined SPBD and this is her first loan with them. SPBD's loans are her only access to capital because she was never able to qualify for a loan with traditional banks. About SPBD: In 2000, Greg Casagrande founded SPBD and, since then, it has expanded from the main island of Upolu in Samoa to Savaii, as well as Tonga. SPBD's philosophy of lending is based upon the Grameen Bank lending method. Please join SPBD's lending team on Kiva to receive on-the-spot updates about SPBD.

loans.use: To buy flour, flavoring, sugar, and plastic bags

loans.name: Inmar

texts.en: Inmar is a 31-year-old man from Lebanon. He has been the owner of an amusement center since 2008, with 8 years of experience in this field of work. This is Inmar’s fourth time to request a loan from Al Majmoua, and he has a perfect loan repayment schedule. This time Inmar is requesting a loan in order to add new equipment to his business and do the necessary maintenance to the other machines. His clients are his neighbors, teenagers and foreigners. He started his business with the money he borrowed from a friend, and from his work he was capable of paying back the money to his friend and add extra equipment to his business.

loans.use: To add new equipment to his business and do the necessary maintenance to the other game machines

loans.name: Ddembe Women's Group-Lugazi

texts.en: Fifty-four-year-old Robinah N. always takes stock of her business dealings at the end of every operating day. This, the married mother of six says, has helped her give a good account of not only her business, but herself, too. Five years of operating a food sales business at a stall in Buikwe market-Lugazi has kept her well grounded. Prior to running this business, she was a housewife. Much encouragement from a friend helped her take root. In a week, she makes profits that total up to 320,000 shillings. With this loan, she wants to purchase more maize flour, rice, cassava, potatoes and beans for resale.

loans.use: To purchase more food for resale

loans.name: Maria Narciza De Jesus

texts.es:
María de 52 años, vende productos Yambal (empresa que ofrece a mujeres emprendedoras comenzar con sus ventas independientes),  vive en una zona periurbana rodeada de un estero salado. 

Para ayudar con los gastos familiares ella comenzó a vender productos de uso personal y cosméticos, aunque no tenia experiencia decidió comenzar por el bienestar de su familia, vendiendo por catalogo. Desde que comenzó a incrementado su clientela y trabaja desde las 07h00am hasta las 20h00pm todos los días. 

Para tener mas variedad en sus productos ella quiere comprar con el préstamo cosméticos y perfumes para tener mas ingresos. En el futuro quiere tener una papelería.
texts.en:
María, 52, sells Yambal brand products (a company that offers enterprising women the opportunity to be independent salespersons). She lives in a periurban area surrounded by a salty estuary. To help meet household expenses she started selling personal use items and cosmetics. Despite having no experience she decided to go ahead with catalogue sales for her family’s wellbeing. Since she started she has increased her customer base and works from 7am until 8pm every day. In order to stock a wider variety of products to increase her income she wants to use the loan to buy cosmetics and perfumes. In the future, she’d like to have a stationery shop.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: For cosmetics and perfumes.

loans.name: Antonio

texts.en:
Antonio T. J.. is from the village of Sandiat West. He is 31 years old, married and has 1 infant. Antonio owns and operates a business raising livestock, primarily pigs, for fattening and sale. Antonio has been engaged in his business for over 3 years and earns approximately 3,000 PHP a month from it.

In 2008, Antonio joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve his living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Antonio has successfully repaid a previous loan of 8,000 PHP from ASKI, which was used to purchase livestock feed and other supplies. Antonio is requesting a new loan of 9,000 PHP which will again be used to purchase livestock feed and other supplies. This will be the 6th loan taken out by Antonio from ASKI. He plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand his business. 

About ASKI:

ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 29 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase livestock feed and other supplies

loans.name: Leonida

texts.en:
Leonida B. lives in the town of Banga. She is 55 years old and has a 16-year-old child. She has made a living as a rice farmer for many years, and works hard because she wants to give her child a bright future. 

Leonida joined CEVI to gain access to financial services to help improve her life and ability to engage in business. She has successfully repaid a previous loan from CEVI and is applying for a new one, for 8,000 PHP, to buy additional seeds and fertilizer. She plans to use the additional revenue made possible by this loan to continue improving her business.

loans.use: to buy seed and fertilizers

loans.name: Long

texts.en: Long K. is 42 years old, married, and has four school-aged children. She earns a living by planting various crops on their own farmland. Long K. grows different kinds of crops, such as cabbages and cucumbers, which she harvests when they are ripe. Recently, her crop did not grow well because it was ravaged by insects. Because of that obstacle, she is seeking a loan to use for purchasing fertilizers to protect her crop.

loans.use: To purchase fertilizers to protect her crop

loans.name: Safokhudja

texts.en:
Safokhudja is married with two children. He owns an auto accessories store in his hometown. His little vending place is located right in the center of Isfara, which makes it a popular stop for car owners. He sells tires, acoustic systems, and car parts. Safokhudja started this business 13 years ago. Safokhudja is hoping to invest this loan of $2,000 USD in the purchase of more goods to sell. He believes a diversified assortment of merchandise will help meet clients’ demands. Safokhudja has proved to be a responsible borrower, having a repaid previous loan without any late payments. One of his long-term plans is to start a second venture and open a grocery store some day. 


More about Tajikistan and IMON International

Tajikistan is known for its rich history, which includes a key post along the Silk Road and the end of Alexander the Great's rule. It has also produced great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets, including Rudaki, Avicenna, Ferdowsi, Omar Khayyam, Jomi, and Rumi. The country is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language, epic mountain passes, and a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium BC. And, even today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture and Central Asian traditions.

But Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics. The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged the already weak economy. In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous and only 7% of the land is arable. These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia. While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty.

IMON's History

Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low-income clients represent a viable business proposition. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj

loans.use: To purchase spare parts for cars in order to increase his range of goods

loans.name: Meam's Group

texts.en:
This group loan consists of four people located in Thmei village, Kandal province. This group selected Mrs. Meam L., 58-years-old, as the group leader. Each member of this group will use their portion of the loan to support their different purpose.
 
Mrs. Meam L. works as an assistant at the commune where she can receive a little salary to support her family. With her job, she needs a computer, but she does not have enough money to buy it. So, she would like getting a loan to buy a computer to support her job activities.  Her husband, Mr. Long Siphann, stays at home. This couple has two children: one is a seamstress in a garment factory and another is employed in the casino club.

loans.use: To buy a computer to support her job activities.

loans.name: Maria

texts.es: María, de 49 años, es una mujer muy alegre y trabajadora, vive en su casa propia junto a su esposo Eloy de 49 años y sus 2 hijos menores William de 19 y Janeth de 13 años, a quienes desea brindar una mejor calidad de vida. En la ciudad de San Francisco, si uno desea comprar unos zapatos o sandalias muy bonitos y a la moda, tiene que visitar la tienda de María, sus novedosos modelos traídos por ella misma desde la ciudad de Lima, marcan una gran diferencia con la mercadería de la competencia, lo cual ha hecho que su negocio sea muy concurrido por los clientes. Lo que más le gusta de su trabajo es aconsejar a sus clientes sobre los zapatos o sandalias que mejor les quedan, lleva 7 años realizando esta actividad y considera que lo más difícil es tener que permanecer todo el día dentro de su tienda en espera de clientes. Con el tiempo, desea poner otro negocio, esta vez incursionaría en la comida, ya que ha visto que es una buena fuente de ingresos. Este es el quinto crédito con MFP, ha sido muy puntual en el pago de sus cuotas y espera serlo ahora también. En su banco comunal es una persona muy querida por el resto de sus compañeras. Con los dos mil nuevos soles solicitados, comprará más zapatos y sandalias de la ciudad de Lima, para mejorar el stock de su tienda.
texts.en:
María is 49 years old.  She is a very happy and hard-working woman.  She lives in her own home with her husband, 49 year-old Eloy, and her two dependent children, William who is 19 and Janeth who is 13, who she would like to provide with a better quality of life.  In the town of San Francisco, if you want to buy some very nice, fashionable shoes or sandals, you have to visit María's store.  She brings her new styles from the city of Lima herself.  They are very different from the merchandise provided by the competition which has made her business very popular with her customers.

What María most likes about her work is advising her customers on which shoes or sandals suit them best.  She has been in this business for 7 years and she considers the most difficult aspect of her work to be having to stay in her store all day waiting for customers.  Over time, she would like to set up another business.  She would like to break into the food business as she has seen that it is a good source of income.

This is María's fifth loan with MFP.  She has been very punctual with her repayments and she hopes to continue to be.  In her community bank she is very well liked by the rest of the members.  She would like to use her loan for 2,000 nuevos soles to buy more shoes and sandals in the city of Lima to improve her store's stock.

loans.use: To buy more shoes and sandals to stock her business

loans.name: Iván

texts.es:
Iván tiene 27 años de edad, es soltero y no tiene carga familiar, reside en casa de sus familiares, ubicada en el sector 9 de Octubre, una zona urbano marginal de la ciudad de Chiclayo, capital de la región Lambayeque.

El reside en el lugar desde hace  3 años y durante este tiempo ha logrado instalar un pequeño taller, en donde suele confeccionar mochilas. El estudió confección y luego trabajó en Lima para una empresa especializada en el rubro, con el tiempo decidió independizarse y abrir su propia empresa, actualmente su  negocio viene desarrollándose favorablemente. 

Iván desea ampliar su producción adquiriendo  materiales (como cierres, telas, moldes , entre otros)  con las cuales piensa satisfacer la cantidad de pedidos con la que actualmente cuenta ya que durante la campaña navideña la demanda por sus productos suele aumentar.
texts.en:
Iván, 27, is single and doesn't have any family responsibilities.  He lives with relatives in their home, located in sector 9 de Octubre, an urban zone on the outskirts of the city of Chiclayo, capital of the Lambayeque region.

He has lived there for the past 3 years and during this time has succeded in setting up a small workhop where he  makes satchels.  He studied sewing and then worked in Lima for a business specializing in that area.  He soon decided to go out on his own and open a business which currently  is developing well.

Iván would like to increase his production with supplies (such as zippers, fabric, patterns, etc) and that is how he plans to fill the orders that he currently has.  He is counting on the Christmas season when the demand for his products usually grows.

loans.use: To purchase supplies so that he can increase his sewing business and the sales of satchels

loans.name: Sister

texts.en: Sister A. is single and sells foodstuffs such as plantain, cassava and cocoyam. She has been in this trade for five years. Sister is requesting the loan in order to buy more and varied types of food, as requested by her customers. With the new profit from her expanded business, she plans to buy land.

loans.use: Sister is going to use the loan to buy more foodstuffs for sale

loans.name: Future In Our Hands Group

texts.en:
These are members of the “Future In Our Hands” group. They are small-scale business people in the northern city of Makeni. This is not their first loan from SMT/Kiva. With the help of this loan, these entrepreneurs will be able to expand their businesses, make more sales and increased profit. Consequently, their living standards will improve.

John C., left, is the leader of this group. Born in Makeni, he is thirty-five and married with two children who are attending primary and secondary school respectively. John has been selling used bags for twelve years and with his share of this loan, will buy bales of used bags to add to his business.

loans.use: Buy bales of used bags to add to his business

loans.name: Adjoa Essoun Felicia

texts.en: Adjoa Essoun Felicia C. sells underwear, dresses, rice, soaps and other goods in Elmina. Adjoa has gone to a senior-high level of education. She is married and takes care of three children. Her husband is a fisherman. She has been in this trade for four years. She assists her husband in the general upkeep of the home. Her loan will be used to buy more underwear and dressses to increase the quantity of goods sold. She hopes to use the new profits from her business to educate her children.

loans.use: Her loan will be used to buy more underwear and dresses to increase the quantity of  goods sold.

loans.name: Pheap's Group

texts.en:
This group loan consists of four people who are located in Preaek Hour Kaeut village in Kandal province. 

Mrs. Pheap S. was born in 1988 and is a married woman. She is the group leader. She was selected as the group leader by the other members. She is a grocery seller in the local village. Since her business is doing well, she would like to ask for a loan to buy more groceries to enlarge her business. Her husband, Mr. Sum Chanthou, is a truck driver who owns a truck to transport soil. With their careers, they are able to earn some income to support their family. 

This couple has a child who is only three years old.

loans.use: To buy more groceries.

loans.name: Karren  Atieno

texts.en:
Karren is 47 years old and married to John. They have four children, all of whom attend school. Karren owns a retail shop that she has been operating for the past ten years. She earns 18,000 KES in monthly profit. 

A friend who is a KADET client introduced Karren to KADET LTD. She is applying for her first loan to purchase shop inventory such as sugar, wheat flour, and cigarettes to sell.

Karren is a very hard-working lady. She plans to use her additional income to provide for the basic needs of her family, pay school fees, and save for the future.

loans.use: to buy inventory such as cigarettes, wheat flour, and sugar

loans.name: Marcelina

texts.es:
Marcelina pertenece al banco comunal “Los Solidarios” D. la Asociación Arariwa y se encuentra agradecida por la oportunidad brindada mediante este medio y así mismo se compromete a cumplir con el pago correspondiente al cronograma.

Marcelina, tiene 55 años D. edad y tiene nueve hijos, ella nació en la ciudad D. Urubamba del departamento del cusco y actualmente vive en la misma ciudad. 

Marcelina se dedica a la venta D. flores. Ya son 2 años que se dedica a este negocio  y le va muy bien gracias al empeño que pone en su labor.  Marcelina en esta oportunidad requiere el préstamo para comprar semillas y abono.
texts.en:
Marcelina belongs to the communal bank "Los Solidarios" in the Asociación Arariwa.  She is grateful for the opportunity provided through these means, and pledges to make her payments according to the established schedule.

Marcelina is 55 years old and has 9 children.  She was born in the city of Urubamba in the department of Cusco, and that is also where she currently lives.

Marcelina has a business selling flowers.  She has had this business for 2 years, and it is going very well thanks to the effort that she puts into her work.  Marcelina needs a loan now to buy seeds and fertilizer.

loans.use: to buy seeds and fertilizer

loans.name: Buhara Group United

texts.en: Joseph is 46 years old and lives in his own house in Fort Portal, Uganda.He is a farmer and also has a retail shop which has facilitated him in providing for a family of 12 members.He has a hardship of price fluctuation; his desire is to become a wholesale trader. Joseph is requesting a loan to buy salt, cassava flour, and cooking oil to sell.

loans.use: To purchase salt, cassava flour, and cooking oil to sell

loans.name: Elisa

texts.es: Elisa, de 27 años, es una mujer muy amable y trabajadora, vive en su casa propia al lado de su esposo Jesús de 27 y lo que más desea es trabajar muy duro para sobresalir en la vida. Cuando era pequeña, aprendió las técnicas agrícolas necesarias, y en la actualidad siembra habas y arvejas, junto a su esposo. Dice que le gusta mucho la labor agrícola pues con las ganancias que obtiene de la cosecha puede brindarles lo mejor a sus hijos. Cada día junto a su esposo se levanta al amanecer para empezar  a cuidar sus cultivos que están ubicados algo lejos de su casa. De esta manera los vigila a diario, contra las plagas y los factores climáticos que muchas veces son adversos para la buena producción, eso es lo arriesgado de la agricultura manifiesta porque no se sabe si todo lo sembrado rendirá en la cosecha, pero sabe que el esfuerzo se ve recompensado cuando vende su producción a los mayoristas. En adelante tiene planeado sembrar en mayor cantidad y variar un poco en la producción sembrada. Es el tercer crédito con MFP y esta muy agradecida con todas las personas que hicieron posible el crédito que le permitirá continuar trabajando, además dice que se mantiene puntual en el pago de sus cuotas pues quiere seguir trabajando con su grupo de manera responsable. Elisa tiene pensado invertir el crédito solicitado en la compra de semillas de habas y arvejas, además de insecticidas que necesita para asegurar su siembra para  la próxima siembra.
texts.en:
Elisa is 27 years old.  She is a very kind and hard-working woman who lives in her own home together with her husband, 27 year-old Jesús.  What she most desires is to work very hard so that she can excel in life.

Elisa learned how to farm when she was a young girl and she currently grows beans and peas together with her husband.  She says that she really enjoys her farm work because she can use the profits she makes from each harvest to provide her children with the best.  Every day, Elisa and her husband get up at dawn to start caring for their crops which are located quite a long way from their home.  They take care of their crops every day, protecting them from pest infestations and changes in the weather which are very often not favorable to a good production.  She says that this is the risky part of farming.  You don't know if all the crops you sowed will make it to harvest time.  However, she knows that the effort is rewarded when she sells her produce to the wholesalers.  In the future, Elisa plans to grow her crops in larger quantities and vary them a little.

This is Elisa's third loan from MFP and she is grateful to everybody who made her loan possible as it will allow her to continue working.  She also says that she will remain punctual in making her repayments as she would like to continue working responsibly with her group.  Elisa plans to invest the loan she has requested in buying bean and pea seeds as well as insecticides that she needs in order to protect her plantings for the next sowing season.

loans.use: to buy bean and pea seeds, and insecticides

loans.name: Yolanda

texts.es: Yolanda vende perfumes, cremas, maquillajes por catalogo desde hace 8 años, ella esta pidiendo un crédito a la financiera para comprar varios productos que vende en el catalogo para tener en existencia, Yolanda esta casada con el señor Juan el cual es chofer, ellos viven solos ya que sus hijos son casados y viven aparte. Comenta Yolanda que emprendió este tipo de negocio porque es una persona muy activa y le gusta el comercio y emprendió este negocio, también comenta que vende colchas, sabanas por catalogo y surte sus productos en una distribuidor autorizado en la población de Zitacuaro, la meta que tiene doña Yolanda es ser distribuidor autorizado y tener mas clientas ya que nada mas les vende a personas que conoce que sabe que le van a pagar por que muchas clientas le han quedado mal.
texts.en:
Yolanda has been selling perfume, creams and makeup through catalogs for 8 years.  She is requesting a loan to buy several products that she sells through her catalogs so that she has some in stock.  Yolanda is married to Juan who is a driver.  They live alone as their children are married and live in their own homes.  Yolanda tells us that she started this type of business because she is a very active person and she likes selling things.  She also tells us that she sells bedspreads and sheets through catalogs.  She stocks up with products from an authorized distributor in the town of Zitacuaro.

Yolanda's goal is to become an authorized distributor and to gain more customers since she only sells to people that she knows, who she knows will pay, because many customers have let her down.

loans.use: to buy cosmetics, creams and perfumes through catalogs

loans.name: George

texts.en: George is 35 years old and a member of Mapema group in Faulu Kenya. He does stone quarrying to earn a living. He has been in the business for nine years and has five employees. He was previously employed and he decided to leave his job and go into business so that he would earn enough income to support his wife and two children. He is looking forward to owning a lorry for transporting stones. He has requested for 80,000 Kes to buy sand and ballast.

loans.use: to buy sand and ballast.

loans.name: Mary

texts.en:
Mary is a farmer and also operates a clothes shop in Ndunyu Njeru town. She has operated her clothes shop for the last two years. She is 53 years old and a single mother of one child.
Mary was introduced to Kiva partner, KADET, by one of her friends and this will be her second loan. She paid her previous loan of 12,000 KES well and in good time. She plans to use this loan to buy more clothes for resale. In the future, she hopes to expand her clothes shop into a bigger boutique.

loans.use: to buy more clothes for resale.

loans.name: Chicas Dulces Group

texts.es: Este grupo se llama  Chicas Dulces  y se ubica en el Estado de Puebla. El grupo esta conformado por 9 integrantes y es la quinta vez que solicitan un prestamo. Martha es la presidenta del grupo. Ella se dedica a la venta de ropa interior que inicio hace 3 años. Solicita el prestamo para comprar ropa interior. Ella tiene 44 años, estudio hasta 4to año de primaria, ella vive en union libre y tiene en total 3 hijos. Al momento de solicitar este prestamo se siente entusiasmada por la oportunidad que le brindan de invertir en su negocio y tener mayor mercancia para su venta. Quiere este credito para comprar mercancia que ya tiene comprometida y con esto tener mas clientes y brindarle una mejor calidad de vida para ella y su familia. También quiere ahorrar un parte de sus ganancias para brindarles educación a sus hijos, ya que su mayor sueño es ver a sus hijos con una carrera profesional.
texts.en:
This group is called 'Chicas Dulces' (Sweet Girls) and is located in the State of Puebla.  The group has nine members and this is the fifth time that they have requested a loan.

Martha is the group's president.  She has a business selling underwear which she started three years ago.  She is requesting this loan to buy underwear.  Martha is 44 years old and studied up to the fourth year of elementary school.  She has a common-law marriage and three children.  At the time of requesting this loan, she feels excited by the opportunity that she is being given to invest in her business and have more merchandise to sell.  She would like this loan to buy merchandise that she has already promised to customers.  She thereby hopes to gain more customers and provide her family with a better quality of life.  She would also like to save part of her profits so that she can provide for her children's education since her biggest dream is to see her children gain professional degrees.

loans.use: to buy underwear for her business

loans.name: Viviana

texts.es:
Viviana forma parte del banco comunal “Mi banco Mi amigo 2” perteneciente a la comuna de Pudahuel, ciudad de Santiago.
Ella se dedica al rubro del comercio desde hace 15 años, trabaja junto a su marido y venden diferentes artículos de temporada, sobre todo aquellos que se puedan vender rápido y a bajo costo. Viviana instala su puesto en una feria persa libre los días jueves, sábados, domingos y festivos de 8ºº a 15ºº horas. Viviana comenta que le ha ido muy bien en su negocio y que las temporadas altas de venta son los días 15 y 30 de cada mes, sin embargo el resto de los días también le va bien. 
Con el crédito comprará pantalón de buzos polares y parlantes de automóvil.
Gracias a su negocio Viviana ha podido concretar algunos de sus sueños como cancelar el total de su casa propia, pagar sus estudios de Técnico en químico farmacéutico y ser el sustento económico de su hogar.
Sus metas son comprar una camioneta para trasladar su mercadería. 
Viviana vive junto a su esposo y sus dos hijos de 27 y 23 años de edad, ambos trabajan, pero le ayudan en su negocio los fines de semana, de ésta manera la familia se ha unido más en sus relaciones. Uno de sus hijos está casado, por lo tanto también vive junto a su nuera y sus dos nietos de 7 años y 6 meses de edad. Sus motivaciones y sueños son continuar con su negocio, para que le permita seguir concretando sus proyectos. 
Viviana está muy contenta y agradecida de Fondo Esperanza ya que le ha dado la oportunidad de contar con un capital para invertir en su negocio. Respecto a la relación con las socias del grupo del banco comunal, ésta ha sido muy buena, ya que existe confianza y solidaridad entre ellas. También considera que es muy importante aprender e incorporar nuevos conocimientos a su propio negocio. En general Viviana se encuentra muy contenta por sus logros.
Pudahuel es una comuna del sector poniente de Santiago (capital de Chile), región Metropolitana. Es un vocablo del mapudungun (lengua mapuche) que se traduce como “lugar donde se juntan las aguas” o “lugar de charcos”, debido a que posee una variada red fluvial compuesta por el río Mapocho y los esteros Lampa, Carén y Las Cruces, lo que favorece sus suelos para la producción agrícola por la existencia de abundante agua subterránea.
texts.en:
Viviana is a member of the “Mi Banco Mi Amigo 2” (My Bank My Friend 2) which belongs to Pudahuel Commune, city of Santiago.

She has been a merchant for the last 15 years.  She works alongside her husband selling various seasonal items, especially those they can sell quickly and at low prices.

Viviana sets up her stand in a bazaar on Thursdays, Saturdays, Sundays and holidays from 8am to 3pm.  Viviana comments that she’s done very well in business and that the days with the best sales are the 15th and 30th of each month; however, she does well the rest of the days too.  She will use the loan to buy sweatpants and car speakers.

Thanks to the business Viviana has been able to make some of her dreams a reality like, paying off her house, paying for her Pharmacy Technician training and supporting her home’s economy.  Her goal is to buy a pickup truck to transport her merchandise.

Viviana lives with her husband and two children who are 27 and 23 years of age and who both work but who help her with her business on weekends.  This has led to more family togetherness.

One of her sons is married so her daughter-in-law and two grandchildren who are 7 and 6 years of age also live with her.  Her motivation and dreams are to continue in business so that she can continue to carry out her projects.

Viviana is very happy and grateful to Fondo Esperanza because it’s given her the opportunity to have investment capital for her business.  With respect to the relationship with the other communal bank group members, it has been very good because trust and mutual support exists among them.  She also considers that it’s very important to learn new things to apply to her own business.  In general, Viviana is very happy about her accomplishments.

Pudahuel is a commune in western Santiago (capital of Chile) Metropolitan District.  The word comes from Mapudungun (Mapuche language) that means “place where the waters come together” or “place of puddles” because it has a varied network of streams composed of the Mapocho River and the Lampa, Carén and Las Cruces creeks which make the soil favorable for farming due to the abundant subterranean water.

loans.use: to buy sweat pants and car speakers.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase cosmetics like perfumes, creams, and makeup.

loans.name: Hiyam

texts.en: Hiyam works in preparing mouneh requested by loyal customers. "Mouneh is an old food tradition still produced in rural Lebanon involving the annual processing of fruits, vegetables, herbs, flowers, and animal by-products. It is done naturally according to availability during each season. The foods are later stored away in the pantry or "oodet el mouneh" – which translates to the mouneh room and these preserves are consequently consumed all year long." Hiyam is a 40-year-old married woman, the mother of four children, who works hard to provide them with the best living conditions. She works hard to help her husband increase their income and cover most of their expenses. In addition to preparing mouneh, Hiyam is going to help her son fix his garage that was in a fire, so he can continue his work fixing motorcycles. She hopes to improve her business more and more through expanding her mouneh varieties. . .

loans.use: to start preparing her mouneh requests.

loans.name: Husein

texts.en:
Husein is a 39-year-old married man and father of five children. He raises cows on his own farm and takes good care of them in order to ensure they give him the best milk to sell, and benefit from the milk's selling income. He is a well-known man, with a good reputation.  He is a hard worker and seeks perfection in his work and for his family members. He hopes to provide his children with the best education.

It has been three years since Husein started his dairy business; he provides the best fresh milk ever. To ensure improvements in production, he has requested a loan from Al Majmoua. He will use the loan to buy wooden logs to fix up the farm with a good fence and to clean the farm more, which will keep it healthy and comfortable for the cows and thus increase their productivity. He hopes to improve his business more and more in the future by expanding his farm and increasing the number of cows he owns.

loans.use: To buy wooden logs to fix up the farm with a fence and to better clean the farm

loans.name: Amelia

texts.es: Amelia cuenta con 58 años de edad es una mujer muy trabajadora y emprendedora, ella es originaria de una localidad donde todavía sus raíces las tienen muy bien arraigadas donde la gente todavía habla y visten el mazahua. Su principal actividad económica es la venta de artesanías de Ocoshal el cual la materia prima la obtienen del los árboles de encino. Doña Amelia es viuda y tubo 5 hijos pero ella vive sola, ella se dedica a la elaboración y venta de artesanías de Ocoshal las cuales las vende a personas que van a su localidad a comprar ese tipo de artesanias para revenderlas y abeces sale a venderlas a la ciudad de Mexico y ahorita esta emprendiendo un negocio de cultivo de aguacate ya que ella ve que si es un buen negocio, esta pidiendo un crédito para la compra de material para hacer sus artesanías como agujas, hilo, una tina grande, plantas de aguacate y fertilizantes orgánicos para no maltratar la tierra. Doña Amelia esta muy contenta por el préstamo que le están haciendo ya que así podrá tener otra fuente de empleo y tal vez más adelante emplear a la gente de su población para que le ayuden con el cultivo de los árboles de aguacate.la meta que tiene es tener su huerta de aguacate y mas adelante sembrar durazno.
texts.en: Amelia, 58, is a hard-working, enterprising woman.  She is from a place which still has very strong roots and the people still speak and dress in the Mazahua tradition.  Her main activity is selling Ocoshal crafts which are made from shrub pine wood.  Doña Amelia is a widow with five children, but she lives alone.  She makes and sells Ocoshal crafts to people in her village who buy it for resale.  Sometimes she travels to Mexico City to sell her products.  She also grows avocados since she sees this is a good business.  She is requesting a loan to buy material for her crafts such as needles, thread and a large tub, as well as avocado plants and organic fertilizer that won't hurt the land.  Amelia is grateful for the loan which will allow her to have another source of income.  Perhaps in the future she will hire someone from the village to help her with the avocado crop.  Her goal is to have an avocado plantation and in the future begin to grow peaches.

loans.use: To grow avocados and make Ocoshal crafts.

loans.name: Glenda Giomar

texts.es:
EL Banco Comunal Bienestar y Progreso que se reúne cada quince días en Colorado del Cantón Montecristi , conocido por su rica cultura pre colonial y por su artesanía a nivel nacional e internacional. Lugar de los famosos sombreros de paja toquilla.

En este lugar conocimos a la señora Glenda, tiene 50 años de edad, está casada y de esta relación tienen tres hijos todos mayores de edad pero aun vive con ella. Su esposo es chofer profesional.

Es una ama de casa que para obtener sus propios recursos se dedica a la venta de productos naturales de la marca Garden y de productos de Yanbal (productos de belleza, cosméticos, perfumería y accesorios para damas). Su forma de venta es puerta a puerta, Trabaja tres días a la semana, deja sus productos a crédito y cobra cada quince días. Tiene seis años que se dedica a esta actividad y empezó con el primer crédito que recibió del banco.

Este crédito es para comprar perfumes, cremas, cosméticos y productos naturales. Esta 6 años  en el Banco Comunal y le gusta porque los pagos son fáciles de hacer.
 
Sus sueños son seguir adelante en su negocio creciendo dia a dia.
texts.en:
The Bienestar y Progreso ["Well-Being and Progress"] Communal Bank meets every fifteen days in Colorado, in the Montecristi canton. This region is known nationally and internationally for its rich pre-colonial culture and artistry. It is the home of the famous straw hats.

Here we meet Mrs. Glenda. She is 50, married, and has three children. They are all grown but still live with her. Her husband is a professionnal driver.
She is a housewife who, in order to make her own income, sells Garden natural products and Yanbal products (beauty products: cosmetics, perfumes and women's accessories). She sells door-to-door. She works three days a week. She leaves her products on credit and charges every fifteen days. She has done this for six years and started it with her first loan, which she took out from a bank.

This loan is to purchase perfumes, creams, cosmetics and natural products. She has been in the Communal Bank for 6 years, and she likes it because the payments are easy to make.

Her dreams are to continue moving forward with her business, growing every day.

loans.use: to purchase perfumes, creams, cosmetics and natural products.

loans.name: Pun

texts.en: Pun (pictured here), 47, is a widow. She lives in a village about 20 kilometers from Phnom Penh City. Pun asked for a Kiva loan to lay bricks and plaster the ceiling and walls in order to visually enhance them. She is in the process of doing so and is asking for another loan of $600 to make the finishes.

loans.use: To lay bricks and plaster the ceiling and walls in order to visually enhance them

loans.name: Rosa Marina

texts.es:
La señora Rosa  es socia del banco comunal los Manguitos. Distrito Yarinacocha, Departamento De Ucayali, tiene 54 años de edad, casada, 6 hijos mayores con sus respectivas familias.
Hace muy poco tiempo que está trabajando  con los préstamos de Manuela Ramos, la buena distribución  de su dinero está haciendo que su negocio este mejorando. 
Cuenta con un pequeño negocio  en su casa, que uno de sus hijos se encarga de administrarlo  cuando tiene que viajar para vender  sus  productos por los caseríos, de esa manera puede generar más ganancias.
Con su nuevo préstamo de S/. 1,200.00 nuevos soles comprará: 5 paquetes de gaseosa, 1 paquete de sal, 10 casilleros de huevo, 2 paquetes de fideos, azúcar.
Su esposo es comerciante y es el que mantiene el hogar, está feliz porque tiene la ayuda de su esposa que también da su pequeño pero significativo aporte  económico, que les sirve para poder cubrir otros gastos.
Gracias a Manuela Ramos pueden decir que su vida está cambiando para bien, y todo lo ha logrado con mucho trabajo y dedicacion.
texts.en:
Rosa, 54, is a member of the “Los Manguitos” (The Little Mangoes) communal bank in Yarinacocha District, Ucayali Department.  She’s married and has six adult children who have their respective families.

She’s been working with Manuela Ramos loans for just a short time and the good distribution of her money is causing her business to improve.  She has a small, home-based business that one of her children runs whenever she has to travel to sell her products among the settlements; this way she’s able to earn more profits.

She will use her new, 1200 new sol, loan to buy five packets of soft-drinks, one packet of salt, 10 flats of eggs, 2 packets of noodles and sugar.

Her husband’s a merchant and he supports the home.  He’s happy because he can count on his wife’s support for her economic contribution may be small but it’s significant in that it helps them cover other expenses.

Thanks to Manuela Ramos they can say that their life is changing for the better and they’ve accomplished everything they have with much work and dedication.
