loans.use: to buy foodstuffs.

loans.name: Delwendekonkilye Group

texts.fr:
Mme Sophie est la représentante du groupe DELWENDEKONKILYE. Elle est mariée et mère de 04 enfants. Le plus âgé a 15ans le moins âgé a 12ans.04 vont à l’école. Elle a 05 personnes en charge.

Elle vend une boutique et des légumes depuis 10ans. Elle s’approvisionnement dans un magasin à larlé en ville. Ses clients sont les femmes, enfants et les hommes.

Elle veut s’acheter 10 bidons d’huile de 5 litre, 05 cartons spaghetti, 01 sac de choux et 01 sac d’aubergines.

Mme économise pour agrandir sa boutique. Elle ambitionne assurer la scolarité de ses enfants, s’occuper de ses parents devenus vieux et aussi ouvrir d’autre point de vente.
texts.en:
Sophie is the DELWENDEKONKILYE group´s representative. She is married and the mother of 4 children aged between 12 and 15 years, all of whom attend school. She has 5 dependents in all and has been selling food and vegetables from her own shop for the past 10 years. She gets her supplies in the town of Larlé and sells her products to all types of people. She will use the loan to buy 10 5-liter cans of oil, 5 boxes of spaghetti, 1 sac of cauliflower and 1 sac of aubergines.

Sophie is building up her savings so that she can enlarge her store. She would also like to be able to cover her children´s educational expenses, support her aged parents and eventually open another store.

loans.use: to buy 10 5-liter cans of oil, 5 boxes of spaghetti, 1 sac of cauliflower and 1 sac of aubergines.

loans.name: Fredesvinda Felicitas

texts.es:
Fredesvinda D. 49 años D. edad. Vive junto a su esposo y tres hijos en su casa propia, cuentan con servicio D. agua y luz, ubicado en el distrito D. Pacasmayo que pertenece al departamento D. La Libertad.  Esta zona se dedica a la pesca, agricultura y turismo.

DesD. hace varios años, cuenta con su propio negocio que lo a colocado en las afueras del mercado en donD. ofrece a sus clientes todo lo que es productos D. primera necesidad y abarrotes. Cuenta con una clientela establecida, con los ingresos que obtenga podrá solventar susobligaciones familiares.

Fredesvinda observa que su negocio va creciendo favorablemente desD. un principio. Desea seguir ampliando su negocio con la compra D. más mercadería como productos D. consumo diario y abarrotes en general.  Va a comprar sus productos en grandes cantidades lo que ayuda en bajar el precio que paga. Por ello, ha creído conveniente solicitar a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito D. 2,000 nuevos soles. Fredesvinda es muy trabajadora y responsable, desea lograr mayores ingresos para seguir sacando adelante a su familia.
texts.en:
Fredesvinda is 49 years old.  She lives with her husband and 3 children in their own home, which has electric and water. It is located in the Pacasmayo district in the La Libertad department. This area is devoted to fishing, farming and tourism. 

For a number of years she had her own business which she ran in the market. There she offered her customers groceries and all of the products of prime necessity. Due to her established clientele and her earnings she will be able to cover her family expenses.

Fredesvinda notices that her business has been growing favorably since it began.  She wants to continue growing her business and to buy more merchandise such as staple products and general groceries.  She is going to buy these products in large quantities which will help her in lowing the price that she pays. 

This is why she is requesting a loan of 2,000 soles from Edpyme Alternativa.  Fredesvinda is a very hard worker and responsible.  She hopes to obtain a greater income in order to continue advancing her family.

loans.use: to buy more staple products and general groceries for her business.

loans.name: Eusebia

texts.en:
Eusebia is 27 years old. She is married and has two children. 

Eusebia has a retail store which sells green bananas and coconuts. She has had this business for two years. She requested a loan for 8,000 PHP to buy more green bananas and coconuts.

Eusebia joined as a member of HSPFI in the year 2011. In the future, she hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to purchase additional coconuts and green bananas to sell

loans.name: Njua

texts.en:
She is 51 years old. She is married and has five children with just one of them below fifteen years old. She lives in a five bedroom apartment with her family in mile Two Nkwen, Bamenda, Mezam Division, North west Region of Cameroon. The death of her two grand children and the theft of her goods are the major challenges she has faced in her life.

She joint GHAPE in 2000 and has received and successfully repaid Empowerment Credit several times. She invested her past loans in the sale of cloth and used the profit to feed and educate her children. Given a loan, she will stock men, women and children’s dresses which she will carry to rural areas for sale. She believes that this business will be a great success because she has many years of experience in this line of business and also because it is very profitable. The business activity will be of help to the community in that people in the rural areas will easily have dresses without having to go to town to buy dresses.

With the profit from this loan, she will increase her house in size. She prefers a GHAPE loan because the interest rate in moderate, the install mental method of repayment is convenient to her

loans.use: to purchase of clothing for men, women and children to sell in rural communities.

loans.name: Safi Group

texts.en:
Greetings from Safi Group in Western Kenya! Pamela is the facilitator of the Safi group. This group joined One Acre Fund in the year 2011 and will re-enroll in the 2012 program.

Pamela takes care of four children at home. She joined One Acre Fund in order to access fertilizer and hybrid seed. In the recent 2011 season, Pamela had an excellent maize yield harvesting 41 1/2 bags on 1/2 acre of land. Before joining One Ace Fund, Pamela was only able to harvest 1 1/2 bags of maize on 1/2 acre of land.

With this loan, One Acre Fund will purchase fertilizer, seeds, and other important inputs to distribute to Pamela and her group during Kenya’s next planting season in February 2012. The distribution of farming inputs is part of One Acre Fund’s integrated agriculture package, which includes training, reliable input supply (such as fertilizer and seeds), credit and insurance.

With income from her maize sales, Pamela will educate her children and invest in livestock rearing.

In 2012, the members of Safi Group will each plant between ½ and 1 acre of maize.

The photograph shows three members: two women and one man. The field officer appears at the far left of the photograph.

loans.use: To source farming inputs, such as seeds and fertilizer, at low prices for the 2012 planting season.

loans.name: Dinah

texts.en: Dinah is a single mother of two children living in Hioma, Uganda. She has owned a textile business for five years. She started as a farmer and then saved money to start the textile business. She faces a challenge of the business being seasonal. Her personal goal is to build a house and her business goal is to expand her business to new markets. Dinah intends to use the loan to buy clothes to sell during the Christmas season.

loans.use: To buy clothes to sell.

loans.name: Sokkhoeun's Group

texts.en:
Sokkhoeun is a 39-year-old widowed mother with three children who are still in school. She is a farmer who has been farming for ten years. For the past three years she has supplemented her income by working at an ice factory. In addition, she raises poultry including chickens and ducks. She is currently able to earn about three U.S. dollars a day to feed her children.

Sokkhoeun leads a group made up of three females. She and one of her group have been with VisionFund since 2010 while the third member has just joined VisionFund. Her first loan from VisionFund helped her to have regular income, to purchase some basic household necessities and send her children to school. 

She is requesting a loan partly to pay for harvesting and partly to purchase feed for her chicken and ducks. The loan will allow her to finish harvesting her rice and also feed her chicken and ducks enough so that they will become fat. This will enable her to make a better living and keep her children in school.

loans.use: to pay for harvesting and buy feed for her poultry.

location.town: Kampong Cham province, Cheung Prey district

loans.name: Ekua

texts.en: Ekua is married to a farmer and has seven dependents. Ekua sells hair creams, footwear, bags, and also prepares banku (a Ghanian cassava dish) for sale at Besease. She has been in this business for the past 10 years. Ekua uses her income to assist her husband in paying the utility bills. She will use her loan to purchase more bags, hair creams, and footwear to sell.  Ekua plans to open a shop to sell her goods with the new profits she will get.

loans.use: to purchase more bags, hair creams, and footwear to sell

loans.name: Florence

texts.en:
Florence is 38 years old and lives in the town of Bugiri in the Iganga region of Uganda. She is married and has 2 children who are all currently in school. For the past 3 years, Florence has been working hard to manage her small business, where she sells maize and beans.

To help expand her business, Florence has requested a loan of UGX 1,500,000 from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to purchase more maize and beans for resale, and will help Florence to generate greater profits and improving her business structure. Florence hopes that in the future she will be able to educate her children. 

Florence is a member of BRAC's Small Enterprise Program (SEP).  The program primarily serves small entrepreneurs like Florence who do not have enough collateral for commercial loans, but have businesses that have grown too large for microloans.

loans.use: to purchase more maize and beans for resale.

loans.name: Susana Del Carmen

texts.es:
Susana es una mujer soltera de 34 años que vive en "Santo Domingo" que es una de las ciudades más jóvenes del Ecuador, actualmente se ha constituido en el punto de enlace entre la región Sierra y Costa del Ecuador. Es un sitio privilegiado, no solo por la riqueza étnica, sino también por los paisajes que se pueden encontrar desde el ingreso mismo a esta bella ciudad. Santo Domingo de los Colorados pertenece actualmente a la provincia de Santo Domingo de los Tsáchilas, recientemente conformada.  La fiesta principal de Santo Domingo, se celebra con un movimiento intenso de visitantes, intercambio comercial y cultural. Una gran feria tiene lugar en las instalaciones de la Asociación de Ganaderos, allí se muestran y compiten los mejores ejemplares de las distintas razas y cruces que son criados en las haciendas de la región. 

Susana tiene una tienda de víveres en  la parroquia de ”Alluriquin” del cantón donde reside. Inició hace 4 años por iniciativa propia y desde ese entonces esta tienda le ha servido como único sustento. Ella desea dar un salto más y quiere invertir en estanterías y productos para su local. De esta manera ella quiere retener mayor clientela y con ello tener mejores ingresos.


El alza de precios en el país ha sido un gran obstáculo para Susana sin embargo ella está muy optimista con su crédito ya que su negocio está bien ubicado. Fundación Alternativa que es la institución que intermediará su crédito y la que le brindará capacitación y asesoramiento, ha determinado que Susana es un buen cliente y con un bajo riesgo de morosidad. Esperamos que esta emprendedora pueda tener una mejor calidad de vida y pueda cumplir sus metas y anhelos.
texts.en:
Susana is a single, 34-year-old woman who lives in Santo Domingo, which is one of the newest cities in Ecuador.  It is set up at the meeting point between the mountainous and coastal regions of Ecuador.  Is it an exceptional spot, not just because of its ethnic richness, but also because of the scenery that can be found as soon as you enter this beautiful city.  Santo Domingo de los Colorados is part of the province of Santo Domingo de los Tsáchilas, which was only recently formed.  The main holiday in Santo Domingo is celebrated with a huge wave of visitors and cultural and commercial exchanges.  There is a huge fair at the Rancher's Association's facilities where they show and compete the best specimens of breeds and crossbreeds that are bred in the area's ranches.

Susana has a grocery store in the Alluriquin neighborhood of her canton.  She started it on her own initiative four years ago and since then the store has been her only means of support.  She wants to take the next step and invest in shelves and products for her store.  By doing this she will maintain a larger clientele and thus generate more income.

The rise in prices in her country has been a huge obstacle for Susana, but she is very optimistic about her loan because her business has a great location.  Fundación Alternativa, which is the institution that will act as the intermediary for her loan and that will provide her with training and advice, has determined that Susana is a good customer with a low risk of defaulting.  We hope that this entrepreneur will be able to have a better quality of life and achieve her goals and dreams.

loans.use: to buy shelves and products for her store

loans.name: Clara Marisol

texts.es:
Clara Marisol tiene 38 años de edad es casada tiene dos hijos, vive con el esposo y los hijos de 1 y 11 años de edad en Ventanas Provincia de los Ríos.

Es integrante de la VRC LA UNION, se encuentra ubicada en el Recinto Aguas Frías, Perteneciente al cantón Ventanas, esta Ventanilla se dedica a labores Agrícolas de ciclo corto siembra de maíz, arroz, frejol.

Clara se dedica a la agricultura a la siembra de maíz. Las compras y las ventanas lo hace en ventanas.

Solicita el crédito para el cultivo de maíz compra de abonos agrícolas, fertilizantes. Con la ayuda del préstamo podrá  comprar los abonos sin ninguna dificultad por el dinero.

El sueño es poder comprar terrenos. En el tiempo libre le gusta ver televisión.
texts.en:
Clara Marisol, 38, is married and has 2 children.  She lives with her husband and her two children, aged 1 and 11, in Ventanas in the province of Los Rios.  

She is a member of the communal bank "La Union," which is located in Recinto Aguas Frias in the canton of Ventanas.  The members of this communal bank are farmers who specialize in short-cycle agriculture, cultivating corn, rice and beans.

Clara is a farmer who cultivates corn.  She makes her purchases and sales in Ventanas.

She is requesting a loan for her corn crops.  She will use the loan to buy manure and other fertilizers.  With the help of this loan, she will be able to buy the fertilizers without having money problems.

Her dream is to be able to buy some land.  In her spare time, she enjoys watching television.

loans.use: to buy manure and other fertilizers for her corn crops

loans.name: Ashirbuvi

texts.en: Ashirbuvi was born in 1959. She has seven children three son and four daughters. She is very kind and responsible woman. She has 15 year experience in a farming sphere. She starts her works with buying and selling cattle as a cows and sheep. She has great experience in this sphere. She is ill. She wants to treat herself.   She needs to money.  She is asking for a loan 5000 Somoni with this aim. She awaits your help and mercy.

loans.use: To buy medicine

loans.name: Meru

texts.en:
This description was written by Richard Mazengo, a staff member for Village Enterprise Fund in Tanzania. He is also a partner representative for Kiva.

Meru C. is married with six Children and two in school. The business started 2001 after receiving grant from VEF of Tsh. 80,000.00. Currently, the business value is Tsh. 400,000. Currently, one US dollar is worth 1,174.90 Tanzanian Shillings. Thus, the value of this business is now over $300 US. Maintaining cash in a business is important for future purchasing. A loan will highly accelerate the possibilities for this group. Meru has a small staff and it has been observed that they are a very successful team and that is why they now qualify for this loan from Kiva.

The used clothing business is very successful in Tanzania, as it is in all of East Africa. Many East Africans have found great use for used clothing from Europe and America. It is less expensive than African clothing and of pretty high quality. Thus, you can see many Tanzanias walking around wearing t-shirts displaying American brands, schools, regions, performers and sports teams. This is just a reality here.

The loan will expand the business by openning a small shop for selling more clothes also she will be able to go to Dar-es-salaam to buy stock for the business and the business. The ability to travel this far will set them apart here in Dodoma, for most locals do not have the opportunity to make such a long voyage for business. This will allow them to buy the clothes as they come straight into the country from foreign lands.

loans.use: To buy bells of used clothing

loans.name: José Isaías

texts.en:
Isaías has been selling barbecue for the last 20 years. His is a two-generations business, since his parents and grandparents also worked in this type of activity. At first, he used to sell his product to other businesses, and later he decided to open his own store, which is frequently visited and very respected up to this day. He has struggled a lot to grow, and to provide his 3 children with a better quality of life and quality education.

Currently, Isaías needs a loan in the amount of US$475, because he needs to buy advertisement material and a counter for his business. Don’t hesitate any longer, your generosity can mean a great help for him and his family.

Translated from [Spanish] by [Gabriela Urricariet], Kiva Volunteer.

Isaías tiene ya 20 años de dedicarse a la venta de barbacoa, siendo este un negocio de dos generaciones, pues sus padres y abuelos también se dedicaron a esta actividad en su momento. Inicialmente vendía su producto a otros negocios y establecimientos, pero tiempo después decidió poner su propio negocio establecido y hasta la fecha es un negocio muy visitado y ampliamente acreditado. El ha luchado mucho por crecer y por brindarles a sus 3 hijos una mejor calidad de vida y una educación de calidad.

En este momento Isaías necesita de un crédito de 475 DLLS, pues requiere comprar material publicitario y un mostrador para su negocio. No lo dudes más, tu generosidad puede ser de gran ayuda para el y su familia.

loans.use: purchase equipment

loans.name: Xavier

texts.en:
Xavier P., 45 years old, native of Montepuez, province of Cabo Delgado, grew up with his parents until he turned 20. His family's situation did not provide him the opportunity to study. He only reached 5th grade. In 1980, he was in the military and was demobilized in 1994, having opted to start his own commercial business.

He currently has a clothing sales shop, where he is the only worker.

With a loan of 10,500.00 mt, he plans to increase the volume of merchandise which will result in the increase of revenue and provide a better quality service to his customers.

His activity has a greater impact on the community because in addition to providing a job for himself, this allows him to earn income to support his family's basic expenses, put clothing articles on sale at competitive prices closer to customers who are residents of District 1 in Boane.

Translated from Portuguse by Naomi Baer, Kiva volunteer.

Localização: Bairro 01 - Boane Cliente: Xavier P. Sector de actividade : Comercio Valor de empréstimo: 10.500,00 MT (420.00 US$) Aplicação de montante: Venda de Roupa Inicio: 02/04/2007 Fim: 31/03/2007 Xavier P. de 45 anos de idade, natural de Montepuez, província de Cabo Delgado, cresceu sob a responsabilidade dos pais ate atingir 20 anos, a situação financeira da família não lhe proporcionou oportunidades para estudar fez apenas 5@ classe. Em 1980 esteve na vida militar e foi desmobilizado em 1994, tendo de seguida optado por iniciar seu próprio negocio de actividade comercial. Actualmente conta com uma banca de venda de roupa, onde ele é o único trabalhador. Com empréstimo de 10.500,00 mt pretende aumentar o volume de mercadoria o que vai resultar no aumento dos rendimentos e proporcionar um serviço de qualidade para seus clientes. A sua actividade tem um impacto maior na comunidade porque alem de providenciar emprego para ele próprio o que lhe permite obter rendimentos para suportar despesas básicas da família, coloca artigos de vestuário apreços competitivos mais perto dos clientes residentes no bairro 1 de Boane.

loans.use: To increase the stock of used clothing in his shop

loans.name: Anver

texts.en: G. Anver Osman oglu is a teacher in Varkhankend village of the Saatli region. This income is not sufficient for his big family, consisting of 7 members. He has one cow and now he wants to extend his animal husbandry business. He has requested 1000 USD for purchasing a cow and fodder for animals.

loans.use: Going to purchase 1 cow and fodder

loans.name: Mao

texts.en: Mrs. Mao S. is 26 years old and married with two children. She earns $5 a day selling traditional Khmer cake. Her husband would like to set up a motor-taxi business to increase the overall income of the household, but does not have the money to cover the start-up costs. Mao S. is therefore going to use this loan to purchase a motorcycle for him. They estimate that this will increase their household earnings by $5 a day.

loans.use: Mrs. Saem would like to purchase a motorcycle for her husband to operate a motor-taxi business.

loans.name: Sonia

texts.en:
Sonia lives in Batey, the migrant camps which house immigrant Haitian sugar-cane workers and their families. She lives with her family in one of the Batey company houses, barracks owned by the nationalized sugar-cane industry. She is 29 years old, unmarried and raises her children on her own. She has two children, ages 11 and 15.

Her Colmado, a small grocery store, provides food and small convenience goods to her community (i.e. rice, cooking, oil, soap). She buys her products in El Seybo and sells them to her community.

This is her third loan from Esperanza. She successfully paid back her first two loans of 300 USD and 330 USD respectively. Her profits allow her to buy food for her family and keep sending her children to school. She moved to the Dominican Republic from Haiti 8 years ago.

loans.use: To invest in her business

loans.name: Talitai

texts.en: Talitai is a 49-year-old woman with three children. She is divorced, raising her children on her own, and has come to us for a loan to buy the tools and chemicals she needs to run her plantation. She supports her family by selling her crops at the local market, mostly on weekends, and nets a profit of 320 Tala (or $128 US) per week. In recent years, her business has grown, thanks to the help she is now getting from her oldest son. This increased income has helped her family a lot, and she hopes to do even better in the future, thanks to financial assistance such as this loan.

loans.use: To buy tools and chemicals for her plantation

loans.name: Apélété

texts.fr:
Mr. A. Apélété is 25 years old and is single. He has just finished his apprenticeship as a shoemaker and is asking for a loan of $1,000 to open a shoemakers shop and to purchase materials and equipment. His plan is to make shoes and handbags of leather and synthetic that could be commercialized for a larger market. The realization of this dream will contribute to improving his economic and social conditions.

Translated from French by Susan Bell, Kiva Volunteer.

Monsieur A. Apélété, âgé de 25 ans est célibataire. Sortie tout fraîchement de son apprentissage de cordonnerie, il demande par le biais de ce projet un financement de $1000 pour l’ouverture d’un atelier et l’acquisition de matériels et fournitures de la cordonnerie. Son programme est de fabriquer des chaussures et sacs en cuir et synthétique qui seront destinés à la commercialisation afin de gagner une marche bénéficiaire pour subvenir à ses besoins. La réalisation de ce rêve contribuera à l’amélioration des conditions économiques et sociales de sa personnalité.

loans.use: Opening of shoemakers shop and the purchase of raw materials

loans.name: Laura

texts.es:
Laura lives at home with her mother on Pioneros de Rochadle street in the Alto San Pedro area of La Paz. She makes pieces of artwork made of plaster and sells the finished products at the Alasitas market, but also to bookstores. The loan she is asking for is to buy material to be able to produce more artwork to take advantage of the Alasitas fair which begins January 24 and ends at the end of February. She has not worked with Impro in the past but she qualifies to apply for a loan as a microentrepreneur with experience in her field.

Translated from Spanish by Alison Rives, Kiva Volunteer.

La señora Laura vive en casa de su madre en la calle Pioneros de Rochadle de la zona de Alto San Pedro de la Ciudad de La Paz con su mamá; la actividad que realiza es la elaboración de artesanía en yeso y vende estos productos terminados en la feria de Alasitas, pero también acomoda en las librerías. El crédito que solicita es para la compra de material y poder elaborar en mayor cantidad y aprovechar la feria de Alasitas, que comienza el 24 de Enero y termina a fin de Febrero. No tiene antecedente con Impro pero califica para acceder a un crédito en su condición de microempresaria con experiencia en su ramo.

loans.use: To buy raw materials for her plaster crafts

loans.name: Alberto

texts.es:
Alberto E. is a very courageous man that is characterized as someone who can manage tough jobs like raising livestock and agriculture in the district of Villanueva in Chinandega. He's the father of three children and has the responsibility of supporting his family and providing them with everything that they need.

In spite of his difficult economic situation, and after much time, he has been able to get ahead in his business through the purchase of animals to breed them on his property.

His greatest goal nowawadys is to improve his economic situation and provide a better way of life for his family. It's for this reason that he comes to Ceprodel for loans for the purchase of animals so that he may breed them.

Translated from Spanish by Kim Baker, Kiva volunteer.

Alberto E. es un caballero muy esforzado que se ha caracterizado por realizar fuertes trabajos de crianza de ganado y agricultura en el municipio de Villanueva del departamento de Chinandega. Es padre de tres hijos y con la responsabilidad de mantener su familia y brindarle todo lo que necesiten.

A pesar de su difícil situación económica que por mucho tiempo ha atravesado ha logrado salir adelante en su negocio por medio de la compra de los animales para reproducirlos en su sector de habitación.

Su mayor anhelo hoy en día es mejorar su situación económica y así brindar mejores condiciones de vida a su familia es por este motivo que acude a Ceprodel para ser beneficiado con créditos utilizados en la compra de los animales y de igual manera en la crianza de estos mismos.

loans.use: Raising and Breeding of Livestock

loans.name: Okouromi

texts.en: Okouromi I.is 45 years old, married and has a kid. He resides in Benin-City, Nigeria. He uses motorcycle to move people from place to place. He needs a loan of $625 to enable him replace his old motorcycle.

loans.use: To buy another motorcycle

loans.name: Rosalie

texts.fr:
The aim of this micro project is to convert palm nuts into red palm oil. It was created by Rosalie K., well-known in her area for palm nut processing. She has operated this business since 1985 in Agadon, in the Akpro-Misserete township, in collaboration with several other women whom she deems active and experienced in the field. This is not Mrs K.’s first experience of loans, as she has previously benefitted from some MFI-qualified NGO loans. This has enabled her to attain an acceptable level of activity but she feels it is insufficient, hence the request for financing in order to boost her economic activity and especially to contribute to the development of her nation.

Translated from French by Sarah Llewellyn, Kiva Volunteer.

Ce micro projet a pour objectif de procéder à la transformation des noix de palme en huile rouge. Il a été concocté par K. Rosalie reconnue dans sa localité dans la transformation des noix de palme. Cette dernière mène cette activité depuis 1985 à AGADON dans la commune D’AKPRO –MISSERETE avec la collaboration de quelques femmes qu’elle juge activent et expérimentées dans le domaine. Dame K. Rosalie n’est pas à sa première expérience de prêt car elle en a bénéficié dans certaines ONG à vocation IMF. Ceci lui a permis d’atteindre un niveau acceptable mais qu’elle juge insuffisant d’où la recherche du financement pour rehausser son activité économique et surtout pour contribuer au développement de sa nation.

loans.use: To buy 3 metric tons of palm nuts

loans.name: Yves Ekoué

texts.fr:
Born in Cotonou in BENIN, Mr. Yves Ekoué M. is 28 years old. A computer services technician, he is married and is the father of two children, with three other people in his care. Given the quality and speed of his work, the size of his clientele continues to grow. Thus, he is able to partly satisfy his family's needs.

With the hope of increasing his income, he wanted to open a workshop to repair electronic equipment. However, due to a lack of financial means, he has never been able to achieve his goal. Currently, having decided to realize his dream, he is asking for a loan. This will help him increase his income and allow his family to flourish.

Translated from French by Vilas Menon, Kiva Volunteer

Né à Cotonou au BENIN, monsieur Yves Ekoué M. est âgé de 28 ans. Maintenancier Informatique, il est marié et père de deux enfants avec trois autres personnes à charge. Vu la qualité et la rapidité dans ses prestations, le nombre de sa clientèle ne cesse d’augmenter. Ainsi, il arrive à satisfaire en partie les besoins de sa famille.

Dans le souci d’augmenter son revenu, il voulait ouvrir un atelier de réparation d’appareils électroniques. Mais par manque de moyens financiers, il n’est jamais arrivé à atteindre son objectif. Aujourd’hui, décidé à réaliser son rêve, il vient solliciter un crédit. Ceci l’aidera à augmenter son revenu source de l’épanouissement de sa famille

loans.use: To open an electronics repair workshop

loans.name: Juana

texts.es:
Juana left her hometown of Desaguadero, Peru with dreams of forming a home filled with love alongside the father of her son. However, a few months after moving to the city of Juliaca the two decided to separate. While this event caused Juana extreme disappointment at first, she put herself to work in a business selling a variety of products (candles, combs, batteries, etc.) as a walking vendor. Through much hard work and strong will, she was able to grow her business little by little. Thanks to these long years of sacrifice and dedication she currently has the satisfaction of providing a roof and an education for her beloved son Oscar, who is 10 years old. Juana still has many plans for her business and she is certain that with your help she will be able to put her projects into action.

Translated from Spanish by Debra Faszer-McMahon, Kiva Volunteer.

Juana, salió de su ciudad natal, Desaguadero, con muchas ilusiones de formar un hogar lleno de amor al lado del padre de su hijo, pero a pocos meses de radicar en la ciudad de Juliaca decidieron separarse, luego de este hecho que en un principio le causo decepción se dispuso a dedicarse al negocio de venta de chiflerías (velas, peines, pilas, etc) en forma ambulatoria, pero Juana con voluntad y mucho empeño logro poco a poco ampliar su negocio, gracias a estos largos años de sacrificio y dedicación en este negocio actualmente tiene la satisfacción de ofrecerle un techo propio y sobre todo educación a su amado hijo Oscar de 10 años de edad.Juana aún tiene muchos planes con su negocio y está segura que recibiendo tu apoyo podrá encaminar sus proyectos.

loans.use: Injection of capital in order to improve her inventory and sales.

loans.name: Agathe

texts.fr:
Born around 1976 in Aguegue in the valley of the Ouémé in the southeast of Benin, Mrs. Agathe Agoussou is married and the mother of four children: Marie (16) is an apprentice seamstress; Mahugnon (14) is an apprentice mason; Roger (11) is in 7th grade, and Mireille (9) is in 4th grade.

Mrs. Agathe Agoussou prepares porridge made out of corn in the mornings and also distributes sacks of corn. Since she has financial difficulties, she is requesting her second loan to bolster her business and also to satisfy the needs of her customers.

Translated from French by Teresa Kramer, Kiva volunteer

Née vers les années 1976 à AGUEGUE dans la vallée de l'Ouémé au Sud-est du Bénin, dame A. Agathe est mariée et mère de 4 enfants: Marie 16 ans apprentie couturière, Mahugnon 14 ans apprenti maçon, Roger 11 ans en classe de Sixième au cours secondaire et Mireille 9 ans en classe de CE2.

Dame A. Agathe prépare la bouillie à base de maïs les matins et fait aussi la distribution des sacs de maïs. En difficultés financières, elle sollicite son deuxième crédit pour renforcer l'activité et aussi pour satisfaire à la demande de sa clientèle.

loans.use:
Purchase of 4 sacks of corn

Achat de 4 sacs de maïs

loans.name: Guillermo Willy

texts.es:
Wily is a very hardworking person. He manages a small restaurant with his wife where they serve both national and international dishes. They have sacrificed to get where they are in life, working from early in the morning until late at night. They have three children, all of which are now studying at inexpensive private schools. His children also work in the restaurant cleaning and waiting tables to earn tips.

Translated by Daniel Kahn, Kiva Staff

Don Wily es una persona muy trabajadora, junto con su esposa atienden un pequeño restaurante, en el, se sirven platos nacionales e internacionales; llevan una vida sacrificada, ya que atienden desde tempranas horas de la mañana hasta altas horas de la noche. Tiene tres hijos, los cuales se estudian en colegios particulares,con mensualidades bajas, sus hijos tambien trabajan el el restaurante atendiendo las mesas, llevandose para ellos la propinas.

loans.use: Capitalización de su negocio

loans.name: Saidbek

texts.ru: Файзов Саидбек житель Явана. Работает таксистом. Имеет собственный автомобиль. Работает по маршруту Душанбе – Яван. Деятельность приносит доход. Но для того , чтобы увеличить доход и уменьшить стоимость проезда Саидбек хочет установить газовое оборудование. Для этого он должен получить кредит  , срокм на 12 месяцев. Это поможет ривлечь клиентов , которым будет дешевле ездить на его машине. Кроме того он сможет сделать больше рейсов и заработать больше. Таким образом он обеспечит свою семью лучше. Он женат и имеет четверых детей.
texts.en:
Saidbek F. resides in Yavan, and is a taxi driver with his own automobile. He works the route between Dushanbe and Yavan. This business brings in income, but to increase his earning and reduce the cost of each trip Saidbek wants to install equipment to reduce gasoline consumption. To do so, he must take out a 12-month loan. This would attract clients whose ride in his taxi would be less expensive. In addition, he would be able to make more runs, earn more, and better support his family. He is married and has four children.

Translated from Russian by Joyce K., Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Automobile Repair

loans.name: Francisco Rene

texts.es:
El señor Francisco M., es un cliente que tiene 63 años de edad, es soltero, no tiene hijos a su cargo ya que son mayores, no tiene compañera de vida, la actividad eocnomica de este señor es una pequeña pulperia la cual logro poner como producto de su liquidacion como trabajador, teniendo cinco años de dedicarse a este pequeño negocio, su sueño es poder mantener este pequeño negocio, ya que a su edad dificilmente va encontrar empleo, por lo que su unica fuente de ingresos es esta pequeña ventecita que es muy pequeña, pero con el apoyo nuestro tiene el deseo de poder ir invirtiendo mas y fortalecer su inventario actual, para ello solita un credito con leon 2000.
En la actualidad con el credito pretende adquirir productos como gaseosas, bisuteria que es lo que mas comercializa, no da al credito, ya que su negocio no se lo permite. Sus hijos le ayudan en lo que pueden pero cada uno ya tiene su familia establecida. Por lo que espera contar con nuestro apoyo en el fortalecimiento de su ideas de negocio.
texts.en:
Mr. Francisco M. is 63 years old and is single, his children are all grown up and he has a small grocery store that he was able to start with the money he got when he was laid off. He started his business 5 years ago. His dream is to be able to keep on his little business because at his age is difficult to find a job, and his little store is his only source of income. With our help he will be able to increase his business. With the current loan he is looking to get products like sodas, women’s jewelry, which sells very well, although he doesn’t, has lay away, at this time. His children help him on everything they can, but each one has their own family. This is why he hopes to get our support to strengthen his business.

Translated from Spanish by Nina Delgado, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Working Capital

loans.name: Elsa

texts.es:
La señora Elsa pertenece al Banco Comunal Nuevo Edén ubicado en el Jr. 7 de Junio s/n, distrito de Yarinacocha, provincial de Coronel Portillo, departamento de Ucayali. Tiene 56 años de edad , es madre de 9 hijos, 8 de ellos mayores de edad y uno que aún depende de ella, es casada y su esposo se dedica a la extracción de madera. Con el primer préstamo que recibió de Manuela Ramos de S/. 300 decide invertir en la venta de comida.

En la actualidad cuenta con el mismo negocio, trabaja de Lunes a Domingo en el patio de su vivienda desde las 3 hasta las 10 p.m. 

Con este préstamo de S/. 2,000, el cual será pagado en 4 meses, comprará 6 kilos de arroz, 8 pollos, 5 cabezas de cerdo, 10 kilos de pescado, 3 kilos de cecina, etc.

Gracias a Manuela Ramos su negocio ha crecido y también agradece a Dios y a todas las personas que la apoyan.
texts.en:
Señora Elsa belongs to the New Paradise Communal Bank located in the 7th of June neighborhood, district of Yarinacocha, provincial of Colonel Portillo, department of Ucayali. She is 56 years old and a mother of 9 children; 8 of them of legal age and one that still depends on her. She is married and her husband is dedicated to the extraction of wood. With the first loan that she received of Manuela Ramos of 300 soles, she decided to invest in the sale of food.

Currently she relies on the same business. She works from Monday to Sunday on the patio of her dwelling from 3 to 10 p.m.

With this loan of 2,000 soles, which will be repaid in 4 months, she will buy 6 kilograms of rice, 8 chickens, 5 hogsheads, 10 kilograms of fish, 3 kilograms of jerky, etc.

Thanks to Manuela Ramos her business has grown and also thanks to God and to all the people that support her.

Translated from Spanish by Barbara (B) Brown, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy 6 kilograms of rice, 8 chickens, 5 hogsheads, 10 kilograms of fish, 3 kilograms of jerky, etc.  for her food business

loans.name: Fizétou

texts.fr:
Madame A. Fizétou est née en 1962 et réside dans le quartier d’Agoè dénakpoè situé dans la ville de Lomé (Togo), elle a trois (03) enfants et est divorcé de son mari Mr OURO BOUTCHO Tagba, officier de police. Elle fait le commerce de produits d’alimentation générale depuis 2004 dans son quartier où elle a ouvert une boutique et s’approvisionne à Lomé.
Avec ce premier crédit de 450000F qu’elle sollicite, elle complètera son stock de marchandises avec dix (10) sacs de riz, dix (10) sacs d’huile, six (6) cartons de tomates et sept cartons de spaghettis. 
L’expansion de son commerce lui permettra de couvrir les charges de sa famille.
texts.en:
Ms. Fizétou A., born in 1962, resides in the Agoè Dénakpoè disrict, located in the city of Lomé (Togo). She has three children and is divorced from her husband Mr. Tagba OURO BOUTCHO, a police officer. She has been trading in grocery items since 2004 in the district where she opened a shop. Her supplies come out of Lomé. With this initial loan of 450,000 francs CFA she is requesting, she will round out her inventory of merchandise with 10 sacks of rice, 10 containers of oil, 6 boxes of tomatoes, and 7 boxes of spaghetti. The expansion of her commerce will enable her to cover her family's expenses.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy grocery items

loans.name: Viviana

texts.es:
La señora Viviana Benítez es peluquera, tiene 23 años, es separada, tiene 1 hijo de 6 años de edad, vive con su madre.
 
Viviana abrió su propia peluquería hace más de dos años, luego de mucho sacrificio. Precisa del crédito para la compra de productos para peluquería tales como cremas para el cabello, agua oxigenada , tinturas y así poder tener completa su peluquería, ya que sus clientes piden a diario mayores atenciones.
texts.en:
Viviana Benítez is a hairdresser. She is 23 years old, separated, and has a 6-year old son. She lives with her mother. Viviana opened her own hair salon over 2 years ago, after much sacrifice. She says the loan will be used to buy products for her salon such as hair creams, hydrogen peroxide, and dyes so that her hair salon will be well stocked, as her customers are more exacting every day.

Translated from Spanish by Laure Kwon, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy dyes, hydrogen peroxide, and hair creams.

loans.name: Brenda Lucia

texts.es:
La Señora de Nombre Brenda Lucia Torrez M. tiene la edad de 28 años, su estado civil es casada, Doña Brenda tiene 2 hijos su edades son las siguientes un varón de 5 años de edad y cursa el tercer nivel de primaria su otro hijo tiene la edad de 4 meses y recientemente no estudia, sus propósitos son de seguir colaborando con la ayuda económica que ella aporta através de su negocio, sus deseos son que la actividad económica del país mejore y que por consiguiente mejore su negocio para lograr los objetivos propuestos sus sueños que Dios le de mas vida para lograr educar a sus nietos para ver que estos se preparen de forma profesional y además sepan enfrentar las difíciles situaciones que se le presenten para el día de mañana ya que quiere salir adelante y dejar de vender ambulante por las calles y realizar esta actividad en su vivienda.

La actividad económica a la que se dedica es la venta de vigoron, la ubicación de su negocio es de forma ambulante, el tiempo de poseer el negocio es de 2 años, Doña Brenda inicio este negocio por cuenta propia ya que con el dinero que su esposo ganaba no le ajustaba lo suficiente para los gastos de su casa y todo inicio con el apoyo de su familia quienes le ayudaron con este negocio ya que su hijo mayor le ayudaba con a cargar con los productos por lo que no tenia un medio de transporte para la venta de sus productos y ambos recorrían las calles en busca de clientes que pudieran apreciar el delicioso vigoron que ofrecía en las calles por lo que mas tarde decide conseguirse un carretón para que su hijo descansara de transportar esta carga pesada todos los días por lo que ahora le ayuda a llevar el carretón y es una manera mucho mas fácil, el financiamiento es para capital de trabajo ya que tiene que realizar la compra de su materia prima como: yuca, chingaste, frito, queso, charrasca y repollo por lo que todos los días ofrece el vigoron a sus clientes y dice estar muy contenta de trabajar con Fundación León 2000 y las organizaciones amigas a quienes les importa el progreso de las personas y del país.
texts.en:
Brenda Lucia Torrez M. is 28 years old and married. She has 2 sons. Her eldest son is 5 years old and is in his third year of primary school. Her younger son is 4 months old. Recently, Brenda stopped her studies. Her intention is to be able to continue to provide for her family, which she is able to do thanks to the income from her business. She wishes for her country's economy to improve, and hopes that this improvement would in turn improve her business so that she may achieve the success she needs. Her dream is for God to grant her a long life so that she may be able to educate her grandchildren and see that they grow up knowing how to succeed professionally and how to handle the difficult situations that they may encounter in their lives. In the more immediate future, Brenda wishes to move forward with her business, to no longer have sell her food as a street vendor, and to be able to sell her food from her home. Brenda's business is selling the traditional food vigoron. She sells it on the street, and has run her business for 2 years. Brenda began her business on her own because the money that her husband earned was not sufficient to cover their household expenses. Everything relied on the support of her family, who helped her with the business. Her eldest son helped her to carry her food because she did not have anything that she could use to carry it when she went out to sell. She and her son would walk the streets looking for customers who would appreciate her delicious vigoron. Eventually she decided to get a cart to carry her food, because her son was growing tired from carrying it around every day. Now they carry the cart around together, and it is much easier for them to work. The loan will provide capital for her business, with which she will buy raw materials such as yucca, pinol sediment, cheese, cabbage, and a knife, so that she may continue to make and sell vigoron every day to her customers. Brenda says that she is very happy to work with Fundación León 2000 and with the friendly organizations who are concerned with the progress of the people and of the country.

Translated from Spanish by Kevin Lenhart, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: capital de trabajo

loans.name: Marat

texts.en:
Marat is married with a 10-year-old daughter. His family lives in Kherson. Marat is a private entrepreneur selling sports footwear in the central city market. Marat is very disciplined. One of his strong characteristics is his ability to listen and persuade, which helps him in his work with customers. Marat has been in the market for 10 years. Today he has about 60,000 Grivnas invested in his business. 

Marat‘s main goal is to provide his family with a decent life and stable future. He has always tried to achieve financial and economic independence and make a career. Marat is hoping to see his business flourish and succeed. He believes this loan of 9,000 Grivnas will be one of the steps towards this goal. Marat has repaid 15 loans to Nadiya Ukraine without any delinquencies.

loans.use: To increase the assortment of inventory

loans.name: Abla  Sepegna

texts.fr: Cette dame habite le quartier d’ agoè nyevé, un quartier nord de la ville de lomé, elle a pour activité génératrice de revenu le commerce de produits d’alimentation générale  qu’elle fait depuis 2001, elle s’approvisionne au grand marché de lomé. actuellement son stock de marchandises est pratiquement épuisé, elle demande à wages un prêt pour acheter 08 paquets de tomates en boîte, 06 cartons de patte alimentaire, 02 sacs de riz, 04 cartons de couscous, 08 cartons de vin. Elle est celibataire et aide certains membres de sa famille.
texts.en:
This is a women who lives in Agoè Nyevé, a northern district of the city of Lomé. Her income-generating work involves commerce in grocery items and is something she has been doing since 2001. She supplies herself at the grand marketplace of Lomé. Right now, her stock of merchandise is practically exhausted. She is asking WAGES for a loan to buy eight lots of canned tomatoes, six boxes of pasta, two sacks of rice, four boxes of couscous, eight boxes of wine. She is unmarried and assists certain members of her family.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy general grocery items

loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.en: Since 1996, Elizabeth T. has sold various provisions and cosmetics such as powder, perfumes and bomo in Kotokraba near Cape Coast.  She is single with 2 children and has received her senior high school degree.  She is responsible for paying light and water bills. Her loan will be used to buy provisions and cosmetics to help fill up her store with more merchandise. She hopes to use the new profits from her business to build a house.

loans.use: To buy provisions and cosmetics to sell in her store.

loans.name: Hagar

texts.en:
For four years, Hagar A. has sold secondhand clothing and also prepares kenkey (a cooked, fermented white maize food) for sale at Siwdo. She is married with one child and received an education through junior high school. Hagar’s husband also works as a trader.

Hagar is responsible for helping to pay for various household expenses such as food for the family. Her loan will be used to add more capital to her business of selling used clothing and also to buy carn and plantain leaves for the preparation of the kenkey. She plans to reinvest her profits to further increase her success.

loans.use: To invest in used clothing business and to buy carn and plantain leaves for the preparation of kenkey

loans.name: Duong

texts.en: Duong N., 50, sells fruits in the market of Kampong Cham province. She typically makes US$5 per day. Her husband is the village chief and earns US$5 per day as well. The couple has three married children. Duong would like to take out a loan to reinvest in her fruit store.

loans.use: Reinvest in her fruit store

loans.name: Tatasu Group

texts.en:
This is Kadiatu K., Isatu K. and Isatu B.. They called their group Tatasu. They are all local entrepreneurs in Waterloo, a small town twenty miles from Freetown. This is the first loan these entrepreneurs are requesting from SMT/Kiva. Each of them is requesting a loan of SLL 500,000. With this loan, they will be able to expand their businesses both in terms of size and quality. Consequently they can make better profit and improves on their standards of living. 

Kadiatu (middle) is the leader of this group. She is thirty-five years of age. She was born in Makeni City, in northern Sierra Leone. She is married to a plumber and they have four children. All of their children are in secondary schools. Kadiatu sells market food: palm-oil (the most popular cooking oil), pepper, rice and many more in Waterloo market. She has been a businesswoman for four years.

loans.use: Invest in her business

loans.name: Nguyễn Thị

texts.en:
T. Nguyễn Thị (1311020214) is a 44-year-old female living in the town of Hưng Nguyên. She is married and has seven school-aged children.

T. owns and operates a business raising cattle for sale. She has been engaged in this business for over seventeen years and earns approximately 3,500,000 VND a month.

In 2002, T. joined TYM Fund to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 10,000,000 VND from TYM Fund. This previous loan was used to purchase livestock feed and other supplies.

T. is now requesting a new loan of 10,000,000 VND which will be used to purchase breeding livestock. The loan will be her 7th from TYM Fund. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand her business.

loans.use: To purchase breeding livestock

loans.name: Elizabeth Angelica

texts.es:
La señora Elizabeth, pertenece al Banco Comunal “Las Poderosas de Santa Rosa”  que esta ubicado en el distrito de Azangaro, Provincia de Azangaro, Departamento de Puno, ella tiene 38 años de edad, de estado civil conviviente, es madre de 03 hijos y tiene estudios de primaria completa,  vive en el Barrio Revolución.

Trabaja con el Movimiento Manuela R. desde hace 02 años, su primer préstamo fue de S/. 500.00 nuevos soles el cual utilizó para la compra golosinas y gaseosas. 

Con este préstamo de S/. 500.00 Nuevos soles, comprará caramelos, galletas, gaseosas, chocolates, etc.

Su deseo es comprarse un carro. A ella le gustan los ahorros ylas charlas que dan en el  Banco Comunal.
texts.en:
Mrs. Elizabeth belongs to the “Las Poderosas de Santa Rosa (The Powerful Women of Saint Rose)” Communal Bank which is located in the Azangaro district, Azangaro province, in the region of Puno. She is 38 years old, has a civil marriage, is the mother of three children, and completed elementary school. She lives in Barrio Revolucion (Revolution neighborhood). She has worked with the Manuela R. movement for two years. Her first loan was for 500 PEN and was used to purchase candies and sodas. With this loan of 500 PEN she will purchase caramels, cookies, sodas, chocolates, etc. Her desire is to buy herself a car. She likes the savings and the chats that they give at the communal bank.

Translated from Spanish by William Gray, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: For the purchase of caramels, cookies, sodas, chocolates, etc.

loans.name: Grupo Solidario Dios Nos Guia Group

texts.es: El Grupo solidario Dios Nos Guía está conformado por Nora Yessenia Anaya Z., María Concepción López y Ángela Mercedes Ríos López. Sus actividades económicas son diferentes, pero esto no les impide desarrollar una amistad y lograr sacar adelante a sus familias y negocios. Nora se dedica a la venta de verduras, la ubicación de su negocio es las afueras del mercado, en cambio María se dedica a una pulpería. Hace más de 7 años que se dedica a este negocio, por lo que es su única fuente de ingresos para su familia. La actividad económica de Ángela es la venta de ropa. Hace más de 5 años que se dedica a este negocio. Ángela inicio con mucho sacrificio este medio de vida porque tenía que salir adelante con su familia. Por lo que el financiamiento es para capital de trabajo y así comprar materia prima. María Concepción es la otra integrante de este grupo. Ella se dedica a una pulpería. Hace más de 7 años que se dedica a su actividad. Ella proporciona a sus clientes lo necesario para así que siempre satisfacer la demanda. Es por eso que las 3 deciden realizar este financiamiento con el fin de seguir adelante con sus actividades.
texts.en:
The Dios Nos Guía Solidarity Group is comprised of 3 members: Nora Yessenia Anaya Z. María Concepción López Ángela Mercedes Ríos López

They operate different businesses, but this does not prevent them from developing a friendship and sharing a common goal of moving their families and businesses forward. Nora sells vegetables from a vending location outside the local market. María runs a small grocery store, which is the only source of income for her family. She has been in business for 7 years and always tries to satisfy her customers with what they need. Angela is a clothing retailer who has been in business for 5 years. She made sacrifices to start her business because it was the only way for her to improve her family’s living situation.

Their loan will be used as working capital to buy materials for their respective businesses. They decided to pursue financing so that they could keep their businesses in operation.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Operating capital

loans.name: Adjoa

texts.fr:
Cette femme exerce dans la vente de produits d’alimentation générale, elle fait ce commerce depuis 2000, son ancienneté dans ce commerce lui a permis d’avoir une grande clientèle. Son stock actuel de produits d’alimentation générale a connu une baisse, elle veut se réapprovisionner et sollicite de WAGES un crédit pour se réapprovisionner avec 4 bidons d’huile, 4 boîtes de conserves, 1 carton de lait  et divers produits d’alimentation générale.
Elle est mariée et mère de 03 enfants
texts.en:
This is a woman who earns an income from selling grocery items.  She has been in this business since 2000.  Her seniority in this commence has enabled her to have many customers.  Her current stock of grocery items has experienced a drop.  She wants to stock up again and is requesting a loan from WAGES for 4 drums of oil, 4 boxes of canned food, 1 box of milk, and various food items.  She is married and the mother of three children.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy food items to sell

loans.name: Robinah's Group

texts.en: Robinah N. is the leader of her lending group in Lugasa. She is 49 years old and married with 10 children ages 11-25.  Her oldest child is attending University. She also cares for orphans, taking them to school and feeding them just like her own children. Robinah is a fishmonger in Buwoya town.  She started out selling matooke but changed after realizing that she could earn more selling fish, and now she has been doing so for 15 years. She is grateful for the loans because it allows her to buy enough stock without running out. She requests a new loan to buy more fish so she can earn more profits and pay for her children to attend school next term.

loans.use: To buy more fish for resale.

loans.name: Lisette

texts.es:
Lisette tiene 30 años, vive con su esposo y sus hijos en una casa arrendada. Desde hace varios años atrás se dedica a la elaboración y venta de panes. Para ello, usa el honro de un familiar y se instala en la esquina de su casa para su comercialización. Adicionalmente, al terminar la venta de sus panes, el resto del día se dedica a la venta de cosméticos, estos productos los ofrece a sus vecinas y amistades a través de un catálogo, para luego acordar una fecha de pago (al crédito) según la necesidad de su cliente. Con estos negocios Lisette sostiene la economía familiar y su deseo es continuar dedicándose al comercio, pero ir incrementando sus ventas.   
Esta es la cuarta oportunidad que tiene un préstamo con MFP y se siente muy comprometida en ser una integrante de su banco comunal puntual en sus pagos, también está decidida a ser una persona proactiva. El dinero que viene solicitando será invertido en la compra de cosméticos, al por mayor. Además, también adquirirá harina, manteca y levadura; ingredientes primordiales para la elaboración de sus panes.

loans.use: Incremento de su mercadería y compra de ingredientes para la elaboración de panes

loans.name: Emanuel Ii Group

texts.es:
ESTELA A. D., A QUIEN VEMOS SENTADA EN LA FOTOGRAFÍA, TIENE 48 AÑOS DE EDAD, TIENE 5 HIJOS, 3 ADULTOS, INDPEPENDIENTES Y 2 MENORES DE EDAD QUE AÚN ESTAN A SU CARGO. ELLA ES SOCIA DEL  GRUPO “EMANUEL II”, INTEGRADO POR 10 PERSONAS MUY EMPRENDEDORAS.

LA SRA. ESTELA, ES MUY ENTUSIASTA, ALEGRE, JOVIAL Y SOBRETODO MUY TRABAJADORA. Y COMO ELLA MISMA MANIFIESTA ES MIL OFICIOS, PORQUE VENDE TODO TIPO DE MANUALIDADES. ELLA SE DEDICA A LA VENTA DE ARTESANÍA, OFRECIENDO A DOMICILIO A SUS AMIGOS Y CONOCIDOS SUS PRODUCTOS SOBRETODO ARTICULOS EN TEJIDO. ÉSTE TRABAJO LE HA PERMITIDO VIAJAR, Y HACER LLEGAR SUS PRODUCTOS A PROVINCIAS.

HACE 1O AÑOS, INICIÓ EN ÉSTE NEGOCIO, LUEGO DE HABER ESTUDIADO, MANUALIDADES, TEJIDOS Y OTROS CURSOS MAS. 

LE GUSTA MUCHO SU TRABAJO, PORQUE LE PERMITE TENER UN INGRESO ECONÓMICO, LA RELAJA, CONOCE GENTE Y SOBRETODO PORQUE PUEDE APOYAR ECONÓMICAMENTE A SU ESPOSO EN LOS GASTOS DEL HOGAR.

CON SU TRABAJO, HA CONSEGUIDO TENER UNA ESTABILIDAD ECONÓMICA, VIVIR CON TRANQUILIDAD, SATISFACER GUSTOS Y NECESIDADES DE SUS HIJOS.

LE GUSTARÍA MUCHO, ALQUILAR UN LOCAL AMPLIO, DONDE PUEDA OFRECER SUS PRODUCTOS.

EL DINERO SOLICITADO LO INVERTIRÁ CON EL APOYO DE SU PAREJA, EN LA COMPRA DE UN MOTOTAXI, Y ASI TENER OTRO TIPO DE NEGOCIO.
texts.en:
Estela A. D., who we see seated in the photo, is 48 and has five children. Three are adults, and two are minors she is still raising. She is a member of the Emanuel II Group, which is comprised of ten very enterprising people. Estela is very enthusiastic, happy, jovial, and, above all, hard-working. She is a “jack-of-all-trades” because she sells all types of handicrafts. She sells door to door to her friends and acquaintances. Her products are woven articles. This work has allowed her to travel to take her products to the provinces. It has been ten years since she started in this business after studying handicrafts, weavings, and other courses. She really likes her work because it allows her to have an income, it relaxes her, she gets to know people, and, above all, it helps her husband with the household expenses. With her work she has obtained economic stability, she lives more peacefully, and she can meet the needs and wants of her children. She would really like to rent an ample location where she can sell her products. The money she is asking for is to buy, with help from her husband, a “mototaxi” (three wheeled motorized cart) so that she can have another type of business.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy a "mototaxi"

loans.name: Tomasa

texts.es: Tomasa es una persona colaboradora y trabajadora, vive en la ciudad D. Pucallpa  provincia D. Coronel Portillo, tiene 60 años y es madre D. tres hijos mayores D. edad, se dedica al alquiler D. motocarro que le permite recibir ingresos diario, ella es separada hace muchos años. Es parte del  Banco Comunal “Bellavista” desD. hace tres años, el primer crédito que recibió fue D. 300 soles que le permitió invertir en golosinas para vender en un tablero en la vereda D. su casa, ahora ella necesita un crédito D. 1300 soles que le permitirá invertir en la compra D. otro motocarro y  D. esta manera aumentar sus ingresos. La meta D. Tomasa es tener un negocio D. abarrotes en general.

loans.use: Iinvertirá en la compra de otro motocarro

loans.name: Juliana Dorotea

texts.en:
Juliana has been running her 'pulperia', the Nicaraguan equivalent to a corner store, for the last 12 years. She is requesting this loan to buy products to stock her store. Though she has had a 'pulperia' for years, the loans she has received from CEPRODEL have helped her expand the number and type of products she offers her customers. Now her 'pulpería' is well-stocked and she has a display case and a freezer.

Juliana has been working with CEPRODEL for 5 years now. This is her 29th loan. She originally started her 'pulpería', however, with a loan from a different micro-finance agency. Loans have helped her expand her business and offer better products, she said.

loans.use: To buy products to stock her store

loans.name: Esther

texts.en: Esther sells colorful sarongs and shoes at retail prices to her customers. She hopes to own a boutique in the future. She is a hard-working woman and she works long hours to ensure that she meets the needs of her family. She is 46 years old and married. She and her husband have 3 children. Her husband sells building materials to support the home. She has been in this business for a long time. She hopes for a loan amount of NGN 50,000 to purchase more sarongs to sell. She says thanks to all her kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more sarongs to sell.

loans.name: Afiavi

texts.fr: K. Afiavi est née le 11 Novembre 1966 à Allada dans le département de l’Atlantique au Bénin. Afiavi est une veuve et mère de cinq enfants tous scolarisés, dont trois sont à sa charge. Afiavi vit à Ahito à Allada depuis 24 ans. Afiavi supporte seule les charges de la famille. Afiavi n’a jamais été à l’école. Pour faire face à ses besoins et à ceux de ses enfants, Afiavi mène comme activité, la vente de nourriture (riz, haricot, accompagné de sauce). A côté de cela, Afiavi vend des produits vivriers (riz, haricot, etc.) à son domicile à Allada. C’est à Bohicon dans le Zou au Bénin que Afiavi s’approvisionne. Afiavi mène cette activité depuis environs 40 ans. C’est une ancienne cliente de ALIDé qui rembourse bien ses crédits. Afiavi compte augmenter davantage la taille de son activité en cette période de préparation des fêtes, afin de mieux satisfaire les besoins de la clientèle. C’est pourquoi, Afiavi sollicite un troisième crédit auprès de ALIDé.
texts.en:
Afiavi K. was born on November 11, 1966, in Allada, in the Atlantic Department of Bénin. Afiavi is a widow with 5 children, all of whom educated. She still supports 3 of them financially. She never attended school. Afiavi has lived in Ahito, in Allada, for 24 years. She is the sole provider for her family. Her business is sale of food, such as rice and beans with sauce, as well as animal feed. She sells from her home. Afiavi purchases her ingredients and grains in Bohicon in the Zou in Bénin. She has been doing this work for nearly 40 years. A long-time client of ALIDé, she has always repaid her loans without problem. She requests this loan to increase the amount of product available to sell during this pre-festival period, to satisfy client demand.

Translated from French by Linda Koza, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase 3 bags of beans, 3 bags of rice, and 2 containers of vegetable oil.

loans.name: Svay

texts.en: Svay H. is an older woman and the widowed mother of three children. Two of them are married and they all have jobs. Svay H. sells a few groceries to her neighbors and also takes time to braid traditional mats to sell. Svay H. needs a loan to increase the inventory of her grocery business.

loans.use: To increase the inventory of her grocery business

loans.name: Nansalmaa

texts.en: N. is 29 years old and lives with her husband and two young sons in a house in the Tuv province of Mongolia. Her husband is a taxi driver and N. operates a meat retail business in her town. She began her business in 2004, and since then, has earned enough to buy the home where her family currently lives. She is already planning for her children’s education, even though they are very young. She says, “All I want is to be able to afford a good education for my children in order for them to have happy, productive lives.” N. is requesting a 2,000,000 tugrug (~1400 USD) loan in order to purchase a large amount of meat, which she will sell this winter when prices rise.

loans.use: Purchase raw meat

loans.name: Rosemary

texts.en:
Rosemary is 33 years old and is married with one child. Her husband works as a prison officer in Benin City.

Rosemary sells groceries and drinks and loves this business because of the one-on-one interaction that she has with her customers. She hopes to own a world class supermarket in the future.

Rosemary needs a loan of NGN 100,000 to purchase more groceries and drinks to sell. She says a big thank you to all Kiva lenders.

Rosemary is a LAPO (Lift Above Poverty Organization) client. LAPO is committed to improving lives in Nigeria and elsewhere in Africa.

loans.use: To purchase more groceries and drinks to sell

loans.name: Beatriz

texts.es:
Beatriz, de 47 años, es una mujer muy alegre y sincera, vive en su casa propia y está dispuesta a trabajar muy duro para sobre salir en la vida.

Su tienda de abarrotes es una de las más visitadas en su barrio, desde muy temprano por la mañana abre su tienda en espera de que sus clientes lleguen a comprar las cosas que necesitan. Ella es una vendedora muy alegre y atenta, ya que siempre recibe a sus clientes con una sonrisa y está dispuesta ayudarlos en sus compras.
Por otro lado, lo que más le gusta de su trabajo es conversar con sus clientes, lleva 20 años en este negocio y considera que lo más difícil es tener que permanecer todo el día dentro de su tienda sin poder salir. 
Con el tiempo, espera ampliar su bodega y abastecerla de más mercadería para ofrecer a sus clientes una mejor variedad de productos.

Este es el octavo préstamo de Beatriz con MFP y está dispuesta a pagar todas sus cuotas a tiempo, ya que no quiere causarle problemas a su banco comunal, donde es muy querida por el resto de sus compañeras. Con los mil nuevos soles solicitados comprará más productos para implementar mejor su tienda de abarrotes.
texts.en:
Beatriz, 47, is a very happy and sincere woman. She lives in her own house, and she is prepared to work very hard to succeed in life. Her grocery store is one of the busiest in her neighborhood. She opens her store very early in the morning, waiting for her customers to come and buy the things they need. She is a very happy and attentive salesperson. She always receives her customers with a smile and is ready to help them with their purchases. What she likes most about her work is talking with her customers. She has been in this business for 20 years. The most difficult part is having to stay in her store all day without being able to leave. In time she hopes to expand her convenience store and stock it with more merchandise to offer her customers a better variety of products. This is Beatriz’s eighth loan with MFP. She is prepared to make all of her payments on time because she does not want to cause problems for her communal bank. She is much loved by her colleagues in her communal bank. She will use the 1,000 PEN she is requesting to buy more products to better set up her grocery store.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Increase merchandise

loans.name: Marissa

texts.en: Marissa, 35, is a married woman with two children. Her oldest child is only 14 years old. Both of her children go to school. She works hard to sustain their education and her family’s needs. She manages a rice field, which she said had a good harvest the last time. In order to have an even bigger harvest she has applied to CEVI for financial assistance. She is requesting a loan of Php 6,000 to fund her farm. With this amount, she will be able to buy seeds, fertilizers, and other farm supplies.

loans.use: Farm supplies

loans.name: Madeleine

texts.es:
Madeleine, de 21 años, vive con sus padres y aunque es joven, cada día se esfuerza mucho por salir adelante.

Desde hace 2 años se dedica a la confección de ropa, al principio ayudaba a su primo y veía cómo trabajaba él en su taller ubicado en la ciudad, pero tiempo después aprendió y empezó a trabajar sola. Le gusta mucho la costura, debido a que es un trabajo tranquilo, además obtiene buenas ganancias económicas que le permiten ahorrar para estudiar diseño de modas que es lo que más le interesa ahora. Esta joven emprendedora tiene muchas metas por cumplir y piensa concretarlas a corto plazo. En adelante, planea instalar un pequeño taller de confección, además le entusiasma mucho la idea de darles trabajo a otros jóvenes como ella que quieran progresar con su trabajo.

Este es el primer préstamo que tiene con MFP y está muy agradecida con todas aquellas personas que hacen posible que acceda al crédito que le permitirá seguir trabajando en lo que tanto le gusta. El dinero solicitado lo invertirá en la compra de varios fardos de telas, ya que quiere cumplir con un pedido de uniformes que tiene pendiente.
texts.en:
Madeleine, 21 years old, lives with her parents and although she is young, every day she tries very hard to succeed.

For 2 years, she has worked making clothing. At first, she was helping her cousin and she saw how he worked in his studio, located in the city. However, later she learned and started to work on her own. She likes sewing a lot, since it is a calm job. In addition, she earns a good income, which allows her to save money so that she can study fashion design, which is what she is most interested in now. This young enterprising woman has many goals to achieve and she thinks they will be a reality in the short term. She plans to set up a small sewing workshop; in addition, she is excited about the idea of offering work to other young people like herself who want to make progress with their work.

This is the first loan she has had with MFP and she is very grateful for all the people that make her loan possible, since she will be able to continue working in what she likes so much. The requested money will be invested in the purchase of various bundles of fabric, now that she wants to fulfill a pending order of uniforms.

Translated from Spanish by Lauren Jackson, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to buy fabric

loans.name: Antoinette

texts.fr: Née en 1972 à Calavi au Bénin, Y. Antoinette est mariée à MASSENON Patrice, un agent de transit. Il y a environs 38 ans que Antoinette vit à Enagnon Est, un quartier de Cotonou, capitale économique du Bénin. Antoinette est mère de trois enfants qui sont tous scolarisés. Antoinette vit ensemble avec ses enfants et son mari. Le couple assure ensemble les différentes charges familiales. Antoinette vend de la nourriture (riz, "atassi" : mélange de riz et du haricot) dans son quartier. De façon secondaire, Antoinette vend des produits vivriers. C'est à Dantokpa, marché international du Bénin, que Antoinette s'approvisionne. Antoinette exerce cette activité depuis son jeune âge, et a déjà bénéficié de six crédits qu'elle a bien remboursés. Face à la demande de plus en plus nombreuse de sa clientèle, Antoinette souhaite augmenter son stock de produits et mieux répondre à la demande des clients ; ce qui lui permettra de se faire plus de profit. C'est ce qui amène Antoinette à solliciter un autre prêt.
texts.en:
Born in 1972 in Calavi in Benin, Y. Antoinette is married to Massenon Patrice, who is an import/ export professional. For about 38 years Antoinette has lived in Enagnon Est, a neighborhood of Cotonou, the economic capital of Benin. Antoinette is the mother of 3 children, all of whom are attending school. Antoinette lives with her children and her husband. Together the couple takes care of the family's needs. Antoinette sells food (rice and "atassi" (a mixture of rice and beans) in her neighborhood. As a secondary business, Antoinette also sells a variety of food products. She supplies herself in Dantokpa, the international market of Benin. Antoinette has been in this business since a young age and she has received 6 loans, all of which were properly repaid. In order to handle the requests of her increasingly growing clientele, Antoinette would like to increase her stock of products and better respond to client's requests; this will enable her to increase her profits. It is for this reason that Antoinette is requesting another loan.

Translated from French by Margot Bonner, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: For food products (e.g. beans, rice, etc.)

loans.name: Cleotilde Del Carmen

texts.es:
En el Mercado Mayoreo en Managua, la señora Cleotilde G. se ha destacado como excelente comerciante desde hace 25 años vendiendo diferentes frutas y en especial deliciosas papayas que son ofertadas por ella misma en su localidad.

Actualmente está solicitando un crédito para la compra de las papayas para continuar con la venta y de esta manera obtener los ingresos para el mantenimiento de su hogar.
texts.en:
Clotilde G. has stood out as an excellent merchant for over 25 years selling assorted fruits, especially papayas, in Managua's Mayoreo market; she tends to her stall herself. She is requesting funds to buy papayas in order to continue selling them thus earning income to support her home.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy papayas.

loans.name: Octavia

texts.es: La Sra. M. V. Octavia, vive en el Caserío de San Antonio perteneciente al distrito de Santiago, junto a su esposo y sus 3  hijas. Trabaja como obrera de campo en el fundo del Sr. Martinez desde hace 5 años. Solicita  financiamiento para  terminar la construcción de su casa que fue afectada por el terremoto en el año 2007. Su sueño es poder terminar de construir su casa y que cada uno de sus hijos tengan una mejor calidad de vida. La Sra. Octavia M. V.  agradece el apoyo que le podamos brindar a travez de este financiamiento.
texts.en:
Sra. M. V. Octavia lives in the settlement of San Antonio, located in the Santiago district, together with her husband and three children. For 5 years, she has worked as a field laborer on the farm of Sr. Martinez.

She is applying for a loan in order to finish work on her house, which was damaged in the 2007 earthquake. Her dreams are to finish constructing her house and that each one of her children will have a better quality of life. Sra. Octavia M. V. is grateful for the support she has been offered through this financing.

Translated from Spanish by Richard Brown, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Improvements to her home.

loans.name: Delgertuya

texts.en:
Delgertuya is 39 years old and a widow who lives with her two children in Ulaanbaatar, the capital city of Mongolia. She and her family live together in a ger, the traditional Mongolian nomadic tent. She operates a grocery store in her yard. Delgertuya has been operating this business since 2006 and has built a stable operation over the past four years.

However, her husband passed away and she was left to raise her two children. At that time it was hard for her to continue her work, but she has since worked diligently to grow her business to its current successful position. Her grocery store is in a good location and her business is stable. Delgertuya has been planning to purchase large amounts of products for her store to increase her sales. She is a very hard-working person and says, “I would like to expand my grocery store and to open a supermarket in future.” She is requesting a loan to increase her inventory.

loans.use: To increase her inventory

loans.name: Eliud

texts.en:
Eliud is a 33-year-old businessman. He sells used clothes especially ladies' wear in Nairobi. He has been in this business for six years and terms it competitive. His customers are mainly ladies and he employs one person.

Eliud has requested a loan of Kes. 50,000 to increase his stock of ladies' clothes for sale. He hopes to diversify into other businesses and to own a supermarket in the future. In five years, he plans to have bought a house, employed more people and have children. He describes himself as hard-working.

loans.use: To increase his stock of ladies' clothes

loans.name: Janet

texts.es:
Yanet es conviviente, tiene 25 años y 1 hijo de 3 años, de profesión profesora y trabaja en un colegio, Yanet tiene proyectado casarse este año y terminar de construir su casa en el terreno que se compro con sus ahorros..
Yanet vende ropa, zapatos, colonias de acuerdo a pedidos, sus productos los ofrece a amigos y familiares, la mayoría de sus ventas son al crédito.
Yanet pertenece al Banco Comunal Nueva Vida y lo que mas le gusta son las capacitaciones que recibe y el incentivo a ser responsable. Yanet necesita un préstamo de 2000 soles dinero que será invertido en la compra de casacas, botines y ropa de niños.
Los sueños de Yanet es terminar de construir su casa, comprar un departamento de Lima y un carro para alquilar a empresas.
texts.en:
Yanet has a partner, is 25 years old, has a 3-year old son, and works in a school as a teacher. Yanet plans to get married this year, and to finish the construction of her house on a plot of land she bought with her savings. Yanet sells clothes, shoes, and colognes based on demand, offering her products to friends and relatives. Most of her sales are done on credit. Yanet belongs to the Nueva Vida Cooperative Bank, where she appreciates the resources has access to and the incentive to be responsible. Yanet needs a loan of 2,000 Peruvian soles, funds that she will use to invest in the purchase of masks, boots and children’s clothing. Yanet’s dreams include to finish building her house and to buy a car to rent out to various enterprises.

Translated from Spanish by Mary Lynn Malaby, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy masks, boots, and children's clothing.

loans.name: Girasoles Group

texts.es:
