El grupo Girasoles está integrado por tres personas trabajadoras, esforzadas y decididas. El coordinador es el señor Dismar de Jesús C. H. quien es comerciante de ropa desde hace cuatro años e invertirá en mayor cantidad y variedad de mercadería como blusas, camisas, pantalones, jeans, faldas...etc.

Sus compañeras de grupo son Patricia del Carmen García quien vende ropa usada y Ana Cristina Torre quien vende ropa y cosméticos en los cuales invertirá el crédito.
texts.en:
The group Girasoles [Sunflowers] is made up of three diligent, hard-working and decisive people. The coordinator is Mr. Dismar de Jesús C. H. who is a clothing merchant for four years now. He will invest in a greater quantity and variety of merchandise such as blouses, shirts, pants, jeans, skirts, etc. His co-members in the group are Patricia del Carmen García who sells used clothing and Ana Cristina Torre who sells clothing and cosmetics, more of which she will purchase using the loan.

Translated from Spanish by Margaret Wolfe-Roberts, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase clothing

loans.name: Resplandor Group

texts.es:
El Banco Comunal Resplandor inicia su quinto ciclo con 19 socias.
Diana es presidenta del Banco Comunal y lo que mas le gusta son las capacitación en temas D. salud y el incentivo en el ahorro.
Diana es soltera y tiene 1 hijas D. 4 años, Diana es natural D. la provincia D. Victor Fajardo y vive en Ayacucho hace 8 años en una casa alquilada, Diana tiene un puesto en el mercado D. las Americas en donD. venD. mercería como ganchos, aretes, tambien artículos D. limpieza y escritorio, actividad que realiza todos los días, su negocio lo inicio hace 3 años. Sus sueños D. Diana son estudiar una carrera D. corte y confección, tener una tienda granD. y una casa propia donD. brinD. comodidades a su hija.
Su préstamo será invertido en la compra D. peluches y ganchos.
texts.en:
The Communal Bank “Resplandor” (Brightness) is in its fifth loan cycle with 19 members.

Diana is the Communal Bank President. What she likes most are the health seminars and having the incentive to save. She is single and has a four year old daughter. Diana is a native of Victor Fajardo Province and has lived in Ayacucho for eight years in a rented house. She has a vending post at the Market of the Americas where she sells sewing supplies such as hooks and studs as well as cleaning supplies and stationery. Diana started her business three years ago and works every day. Her dreams incluD. studying for a degree in fashion design, having a large stO., and owning a house so that her daughter can live comfortably. Her loan will be invested in the purchase of plush toys and sewing hooks.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase plush toys & sewing hooks

loans.name: Angelita

texts.en:
Angelita A. is from the village of Gappal, Cauayan City, Isabela. She is 59 years old. Angelita is married and has 1 adult-aged child. To make a living, Angelita owns & operates a business venture in the services sector. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from providing tailoring in the local community. Angelita has been engaged in her business for over 15 years and earns approximately 2500 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2009, Angelita joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Angelita is requesting a new loan of 7000 PHP which will be used to purchase materials needed to expand services provided. This loan will be the second loan taken out by Angelita from ASKI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand the borrower's business. 

About ASKI:

ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 29 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly of farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase materials needed to expand the tailoring service

loans.name: Eduardo Carlos

texts.es:
El Señor Eduardo Carlos S. Vásquez es una persona joven y dedicada a su trabajo, él desde muy temprana edad tuvo que trabajar porque su padre era una persona dedicada a la bebida es por esta razón que desde muy pequeño se dedico a trabajar como ayudante en un taller mecánico.

Al pasar los años el se independizo y actualmente trabaja en el sindicato de moto taxis “COPACABANA”, se levanta por la mañana para empezar su cotidiana labor, Eduardo tiene muchas ganas de auto superarse y así para en un futuro no muy lejano el este capacitado para formar un hogar con las comodidades que él no pudo gozar en su niñez y adolescencia.

El señor Eduardo Carlos S. Vásquez se apersono a CIDRE por el comentario de sus compañeros y los directivos del sindicato para poder solicitar un crédito destinado  para la compra de un vehículo (motocicleta) para así poder facilitar la vida que lleva y así poder mejorar económicamente.
texts.en:
Eduardo Carlos S. Vásquez is a young person who is devoted to his work. He had to work at a very young age because his father drank a lot. That is why he started working as an assistant in a mechanic’s shop when he was very young. As the years passed he became independent. He currently works in the Copacabana “moto taxi” (three wheeled motorized vehicle) syndicate. He gets up in the morning to start his daily work. Eduardo has a great desire to improve himself. In the near future he will be prepared to set up his house with the comforts he was not able to enjoy in his childhood. Eduardo Carlos S. Vásquez came to CIDRE to request a loan because of what his colleagues and the board of directors of the syndicate told him. He will use the loan to by a vehicle (motorcycle) that would help simplify his life. That way he will be able to improve financially.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Working capital

loans.name: Betty Edilma

texts.es:
Betty de 28 años, vende ropa y sandalias desde hace año para poder mantener a sus hijas ya que su esposo vende frutas. Ellos viven en una casa de caña y solo cuentan con agua como servicio básico. 

Inicio vendiendo sandalias poco a poco como le fue bien, con los ahorros que tenia comenzó a vender ropa. Ahora ella trabaja dese las 08h00am recorriendo las calles de tierra de su sector. Aunque ya le han robado la mercadería ella sigue trabajando para darle una mejor vida a sus hijas. 

Para poder incrementar sus ingresos ella quiere comprar con el préstamo ropa, en el futuro quiere construir su casa de cemento y tener un local de ropa.
texts.en:
Betty, 28, has been selling clothes and sandals for a year in order to take care of her daughters because her husband sells fruit. They live in a house made of reeds and their only basic service is water. Betty started selling sandals. Gradually, this went well for her. With the savings she had, she started to sell clothes. Now she works from 8:00 AM travelling the dirt roads in her area. Although some of her merchandise has been stolen, Betty continues working to give her daughters a better life. In order to increase their income Betty would like to buy clothing with the loan. In the future she wants to built a cement house and have a clothing store.

Translated from Spanish by Samantha Cerone, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase Clothing

loans.name: Catherine

texts.en:
Catherine A. is from the village of Tigbao. She is 25 years old. Catherine is engaged. To make a living, Catherine owns and operates a general store. The main source of income for the business comes from selling a variety of different products in the local community. Catherine has been engaged in her business for over three years and earns approximately 10,000 PHP a month.

In 2009, Catherine joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Catherine has successfully repaid a previous loan of 10,000 PHP from PMPC. This previous loan was used to to purchase additional inventory and to increase her working capital. Catherine is requesting a new loan of 15,000 PHP, which she will use to purchase new items to expand product offering. This loan will be her second loan from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business. 

About PMPC:

Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation.  Because manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template which allows Field Partners to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase new items to expand product offering

loans.name: Fuerza Del Mañana (Cuenca) Group

texts.es:
El banco comunal Fuerza del Mañana está formado por 10 socias amigas que laboran en diferentes actividades con un fin común que es mejorar sus economías y así salir adelante junto a sus familias. Viven por diferentes parroquias que pertenecen a la ciudad de Cuenca, en donde su mayor actividad es la agricultura y cría de animales.

La Señora Piedad U. vive en la comunidad de Susudel que pertenece al cantón de Oña, tiene 53 años, es divorciada hace 28 años, tiene 4 hijos mayores de edad que son casados y viven independientemente. Esta orgullosa que gracias su esfuerzo y trabajo tiene su casa propia. 
Doña Piedad se dedica a trabajar en un comedor que es de su propiedad, en el cual labora desde las 5 de la mañana en la preparación de sus platos y trabaja hasta las 9 de la noche cuando termina de vender sus productos, también se dedica a la cría de animales como cuyes y cerdos que los vende en su propia comunidad. Este es el primer crédito que realiza en este banco comunal ya anteriormente ha sido socia de otro banco comunal en el cual fue miembro activo un año y medio. Su crédito lo va a invertir en la compra de víveres como un quintal de arroz, azúcar y más productos para la elaboración de sus platos.

Su meta es  aprender a conducir para poder trasladarse con más facilidad a su hogar.

La Señora Carmita C. vive en la comunidad de Misicata que  pertenece a la parroquia de Baños. Este es  su primer crédito, fue invitada por una amiga quien le ha incentivado a que forme parte de este hermoso grupo de mujeres. Se dedica a la venta de productos Yanbal hace 4 años y vende solo en sus tiempos libres. También se dedica a la agricultura, siembra verduras y ya cuenta con clientes a los cuales les  entrega sus productos  y el sobrante lo vende en el mercado de la feria libre, esta actividad  la realiza hace 15 años.
Doña Carmita tiene 38 años, es casada y tiene 4 hijos de 20, 18, 13 y 11 años de edad, sus dos primeros hijos trabajan y su sueldo es para sus gastos personales, su tercer hijo estudia en el colegio y su ultimo hijo  estudia el último grado de la escuela. Su esposo es chofer y labora conduciendo su propio bus, gracias al trabajo conyugal cuentan con su  casa propia. Su crédito lo va a invertir en la compra de cosméticos como perfumes, cremas etc., de la marca Yanbal y también en semillas para sus cultivos.

Su meta es  comprarse un vehiculo para llevar sus verduras y vender con mas facilidad.
texts.en:
The communal bank Fuerza del Mañana is made up of 10 members who are friends. They work in different activities with a common purpose which is to improve their finances and thus get ahead with their families. They live in different parishes that belong to the city of Cuenca, where the main activity is agriculture and raising animals.   

Mrs. Piedad U. lives in the community of Susudel which belongs to the Oña canton. She is 53 years old and has been divorced for 28 years. She has 4 grown children who are married and live on their own. She is proud that thanks to her hard work she owns her own house.  

Piedad works in a restaurant that she owns. She works there from 5 in the morning preparing the food and works until 9 at night when she finishes selling her products. She also raises animals such as guinea pigs and pigs that she sells in her own community. This is the first loan that she has taken out with this community bank since previously she was an active member of another community bank for a year and a half. She will invest her loan in buying groceries such as a a 100 pound sack of rice, sugar, and other products to make her dishes.    

Her goal is to learn to drive to be able to get around more easily. 

Mrs. Carmita C. lives in the community of Misicata, which belongs to the Baños parish. This is her first loan. She was invited by a friend who encouraged her to join this beautiful group of women. She has sold Yanbal products for 4 years and she only sells in her free time. She also is a farmer; she plants vegetables and she has customers whom she delivers her products to and she sells what's left over in the free market. She has been doing this for 15 years.

Carmita is 38 years old. She is married and has 4 children, aged 20, 18, 13 y 11. Her two oldest children work and their wages are for personal expenses. Her third child goes to high school and the youngest is in the last grade of elementary school. Her husband is a driver and he works driving his own bus. Thanks to the couple's work, they own their own home. She is going to invest her loan in purchasing Yanbal cosmetics,  such as perfumes, creams, etc. as well seeds for her crops. 

Her goal is to buy herself a vehicle to transport her vehicles more easily.

loans.use: To buy a 100 pound sack of rice, sugar and groceries; cosmetics, creams, perfumes; seeds.

loans.name: Adjoa

texts.en: Adjoa A. is married and has two children. She has received junior high education. Adjoa sells canned tomatoes and smoked fish at Abura. Adjoa will use the loan to acquire extra fresh fish to smoke for sale. With the new profits from her expanded business, Adjoa plans to help her husband educate their children.

loans.use: acquire extra fresh fish to smoke for sale

loans.name: Ganbold

texts.en:
Ganbold J. is 53 years old and lives with his wife in Ulaanbaatar, the capital city of Mongolia. The couple lives together in a ger, a traditional Mongolian nomadic tent. They have one daughter who lives on her own. 

Ganbold works as a taxi driver after operating a small grocery shop. Also, he repairs people's automobiles to supplement his income. He is planning on trading his car in for a new car. Since opening his business, he has been able to improve his family's quality of life, and his earnings have enabled him to purchase a new plot of land where he has been building a new house and fence for his family. 

Ganbold is requesting a 600,000 MNT loan in order to purchase necessary parts for his car.

loans.use: To purchase necessary parts for his car

loans.name: Lourdes

texts.en:
Lourdes U., a 50-year-old single woman who lives in the island village in the town of Binangonan, Rizal Province in the Philippines, is a woman of courage who maintains hope in her ability to rise above poverty.

Lourdes joined ASHI (Ahon Sa Hirap, Inc.), an MFI and KIVA partner in the Philippines, in 2009, and during her membership, she has been noted for her exemplary performance in meeting her obligations in the organization. Her previous loans were carefully used as rolling capital for her sari-sari (variety) store business. Because this venture allows her to earn just enough income for her needs, she recently ventured into operating a food stall, an enterprise that will bring her enough profit to save for the future.

Now requesting her third loan of 15,000 pesos to purchase more grocery inventory and to support her food stall business, Lourdes is hopeful that the trust and opportunity given by ASHI and KIVA, coupled with hard work, will allow her to reach her dreams of expanding her business, sending her nephew to school until he finishes college, and building a new and more spacious house.

Lourdes is very happy to be a Kiva borrower and says thank you for helping her to reach her dreams.

loans.use: To purchase more grocery inventory and support her market stall

loans.name: Luna Radiante Group

texts.es:
La B.C. “Luna Radiante” inicia su segundo ciclo en Pro Mujer, como parte del Centro Focal de Panamericana es un grupo muy animado que se ha reunido para  continuar con el trabajo en Pro Mujer, recibiendo los servicios de crédito, capacitación y atención en salud.  Además, ellas comentan que es un espacio en el que pueden compartir y aprovechar de la compañía de sus compañeras, reír y olvidar los problemas. Está compuesta por nueve integrantes.  Los negocios son diversos:  venta de ropa interior, venta de pan, panadería –venta de llauchas, costura, venta de perfumes, venta de ropa deportiva, venta de juguetes, venta de jugo de quinua.

La presidenta de la banca comunal, señora María René es una mujer joven de 28 años, madre de 4 niños,  ingresó a formar parte de la banca comunal porque necesitaba capitalizarse para llevar adelante su negocio de venta de ropa deportiva.  La señora María René vende en su puesto de la zona 16 de Julio, en la feria de los días jueves y domingo.   Aprendió a vender hace algunos años, cuando era vendedora en una tienda de la ciudad de La Paz, luego decidió independizarse y contar con su propio negocio.  El préstamo que ha solicitado es por Bs.800.- y será invertido en la compra de una docena de deportivos.
Cuando se le consultó que le gusta de Pro Mujer, ella comenta que le gusta la reunión que se tiene en el centro focal y en particular su grupo porque es muy unido.
texts.en:
The “Luna Radiante” (Radiant Moon) communal bank is starting its second cycle in Pro Mujer as part of the Panamericana Focal Center.  It is a very lively group that has come together to continue working with Pro Mujer receiving credit services, training and health services.  In addition, they comment that this is a place where they can share and enjoy the company of their fellow members, to laugh and forget their problems.  It has nine members with various businesses like: underwear sales, bread sales, bakery, llaucha (cheese turnovers) sales, sewing, perfume sales, sportswear sales, toy sales, quinoa juice sales.

The President of the communal bank, María René, is a young, 28-year-old mother of four children.  She joined the communal bank because she needed training to run her sportswear selling business.  She has a stand in the 16 de Julio neighborhood’s Thursday and Sunday markets.  She learned to sell some years ago when she was a salesperson in a store in the city of La Paz.  She later decided to become independent and open her own business.  She has requested a Bs.800 loan to buy a dozen sports outfits.

When she was asked what she liked about Pro Mujer she commented that she likes the meetings that take place in the focal center especially because the group is very united.

loans.use: To buy sportswear.

loans.name: Kenzhebubu

texts.en:
Kenzhebubu T. is a 57-years-old widow with four children.  Her family has been engaged in cattle breeding for the past 15 years, which is the only mean of subsistence for them. They started this business with the initial capital of 30,000 Kyrgyz Soms and managed to earn 6,000 Kyrgyz Soms monthly. To reduce expenses for the livestock's foraging, Kenzhebubu pastures her livestock in the mountainous areas with native grasses. Also, she works as a sorter of beans in the seasonal periods at the local processing plant. 

Now Kenzhebubu is applying for a loan of 70,000 Kyrgyz Soms to buy bull calves for fattening and reselling. With the revenues, she plans to broaden her business by means of breeding. 

Bai-Tushum and Partners uses Kiva funding to target the especially vulnerable population. Bai-Tushum and Partners is one of the leading Microfinance Institutions in Kyrgyzstan. As a reliable financial partner, Bai-Tushum contributes to the economic development of the Kyrgyz Republic through the delivery of microfinance services in rural and urban areas that lead to increased employment and meet the interests of its clients and investors.

loans.use: To buy bull calves for fattening and breeding

loans.name: Mawussi

texts.fr: Elle est mariée est  et a 2 enfants en charge. Elle  est  âgée  de 49 ans. Elle fait la vente de pagnes, des ustensiles de cuisine et un peu de produits d’alimentation.  Elle s’approvisionne au grand marché de Lomé et revend dans une boutique à son domicile. Elle demande un prêt   pour faire face à la demande sans cesse croissante.
texts.en: This lady is married and has two children in her care. She is 49 years old. She sells "pagnes" (pieces of colourful West African fabric), kitchen utensils and a few food products. She gets her supplies at the large market in Lomé and resells them in a shop in her home. She is requesting a loan in order to face ever increasing customer demand.

loans.use: Purchase of "pagnes" and food products

loans.name: Isabel

texts.es: Isabel, D. 43 años, vive con su esposo  Alejandro (45) y  juntos tienen tres hijos menores que  habitan en su casa que es  propia y esta  ubicada en el distrito D. Quimbiri.Isabel, es muy querida por los habitantes D. su vecindario; desD. muy pequeña quería salir adelante y tenia el sueño D. poseer negocio propio. En otros tiempos  apoyaba a su esposo en las labores cotidianas D. su chacra, así aprovecho los ingresos que le brindaba su parcela y gracias a esto  pudo instalar  su propio negocio. En la carnicería que tiene en la actualidad ofrece variedad D. carnes D. res, así  trabaja hace cinco años y le gusta mucho su labor; porque obtiene jugosas ganancias y sabe administrar bien su puesto. Además  tiene mucha demanda y  trabaja con varios restaurantes D. la zona y provee D. alimentos  para diferentes actividades como: fiestas D. promoción y festejos D. todo tipo. Su negocio  se sitúa en el mercado central D. su distrito y en la atención cuenta con el apoyo D. su esposo e hijos, además para el futuro  tiene planeado comprar más ganado y  D. esta manera quiere satisfacer con los pedidos.Es el  tercer crédito que tiene con MFP, y se compromete a cumplir con sus obligaciones D. pago puntualmente.Isabel tiene planeado invertir los tres mil soles en la compra D. ganado en su viaje que realizara a la sierra del Perú.
texts.en: Isabel is 43 years old, she lives with her husband Alejandro, 45, and they have three young children together. They live in their own house located in the district of Quimbiri. Isabel is well liked by her neighbors. Since she was very young she has wanted to come out ahead and to have a business of her own. In a previous time she used to help her husband with agricultural activities in their field. She took advantage of the income that she was earning and thanks to that she was able to set up her own business. In the butcher shop that she now has, she sells a variety of beef meats. She has had the business for five years and she very much enjoys her work. She sees excellent earnings and she knows how to properly manage her business.  She also sees a great demand and she works with various restaurants in the region that cater to various special occasions, such as: promotions and all types of celebrations.  Her business is located in the central market of her district and she gets help with the store from her husband and children. In the future she plans on purchasing more livestock in order to satisfy client demand. This is her third loan with MFP (Kiva Field Partner), and she is committed to her repayment obligations. Isabel plans to invest the three thousand soles in the purchase of beef cattle while on her trip to Peru.

loans.use: To purchase beef cattle.

loans.name: Nueva Generacion Group

texts.es:
el grupo Nueva Generacion esta integrado por 3 mujeres las cuales viven en EL Matazano Jamastran, son mujeres que tienen tiempos de concerse y son muy amigas, a continuacion se detallan las diferentes actividades que ellas realizan:

la sra. Reina Isabel Cáceres se dedica a la venta de productos de consumo popular y granos básicos, tiene una pequeña pulperia en su casa de habitacion, su pulperia opera bajo el nombre de pulperia "ENID". lo atiende personalmente por lo tanto es bien administrado y se nota que lo a manejado muy bien dicho negocio esta ubicado entre la intersección de las aldeas de la zona montañosa del valle de jamastran.
el credito lo utilizara para la compra de mercaderia para surtir su pulperia.

la sra. Orfilia Escoto López se dedica al comercio su actividad principal es la venta de productos agropecuarios, papelería y fotocopiado de todo tipo de documentos denominado “Agropecuaria Matazano” cuenta con mas de 2 años de experiencia en este tipo de actividad comercial, nos comentaba que le a ido muy bien ya que se encuentra en una zona netamente agrícola y ganadera, lugares aptos para este tipo de negocio. 
el credito lo utilizara para la compra de productos agricolas, papeleria en general.

la sra. Yeny Lizzeth Cáceres se dedica a la venta de cosméticos desde hace mas de 2 años, durante ese tiempo le a ido muy bien, ya que con los ingresos que percibe de las ventas apoya a su esposo en los gastos familiares y a la vez no descuida sus oficios domésticos y a su familia.el credito lo utilizara para la compra de cosmeticos.
texts.en:
The Nueva Generacion ["New Generation"] group is made up of 3 women who live in El Matazano Jamastran. They have known each other for a long time and are good friends. The following is a description of their businesses:

Mrs. Reina Isabel C. sells common consumer products and basic grains. She has a small general store in her home. Her store operates under the name "Enid". She works in it herself, and it is clear that it is well-managed. Her business is located at the intersection of the neighbourhoods in the mountainous zone of the Valle de Jamastran. 
She will use her loan for the purchase of merchandise to stock her store.

Mrs. Orfilia Escoto López is a merchant. She mainly sells agricultural products and stationery, and provides photocopying for all types of documents. Her store is called “Agropecuaria Matazano”. She has more than 2 years' experience in this kind of business. She told us that it has gone very well for her since she is located in a strictly agricultural area, a prime location for this type of business.
She will use her loan for the purchase of agricultural products and general stationery.

Mrs. Yeny Lizzeth Cáceres has sold cosmetics for over 2 years, during which time things have gone very well for her, since she uses her income to help her husband with the household costs without having to ignore her domestic responsibilities and her family.
She will use her loan for the purchase of cosmetics.

loans.use: the purchase of beans, rice, corn, sugar, coffee, cosmetics, general stationery and agricultural items

loans.name: Honey Fe

texts.en:
Honey Fe G. is from the village of Katutungan, Wao, Lanao del Sur. She is 41 years old. Honey Fe is married and has 4 school-aged children. 

To make a living, Honey Fe owns & operates a specialized retail store. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes from selling cosmetics and beauty products from NATASHA & AVON  in the local community. Honey Fe has been engaged in her business for over 4 years and earns approximately 10000 PHP a month from these activities.

In 2010, Honey Fe joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Honey Fe has successfully repaid a previous loan of 7000 PHP from HSPFI. This previous loan was used to purchase additional inventory & fund working capital. 

Honey Fe is requesting a new loan of 9000 PHP, which will be used to purchase additional products to sell, such as cosmetics & colognes. This loan will be the 3rd loan taken out by Honey Fe from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase cosmetics products to resell

loans.name: Dometila

texts.en:
Dometila is a widowed woman with three children, all of whom attend school. She owns a house that has neither electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is school fees.

She has operated a restaurant business for the past five years, her potential customers being travelers and neighbors. Dometila faces the major challenge of seasonality. She hopes to expand her business in the future. 

With the 80,000 KES loan she wants to purchase a supply of wheat flour, maize flour and cooking oil. She decided to work with Yehu to access funds to boost her business.

loans.use: To purchase a supply of wheat flour, maize flour and cooking oil.

loans.name: Eliza

texts.es:
Eliza, tiene 55 años D. edad y tiene seis hijos, ella vive en la ciudad D. Zurite provincia D. Anta del departamento del Cusco. Eliza es mujer trabajadora y emprendedora que saca adelante a su familia, ella es comerciante y se dedica a la preparación y venta D. queso. Ya son varios años que se dedica a este negocio y le va muy bien gracias al empeño que pone en su labor. Eliza en esta oportunidad requiere el préstamo para comprar insumos para preparar queso y necesita leche y sal. 

Eliza pertenece al banco comunal “San Bartolomé D. las Casas” D. la Asociación Arariwa y se encuentra agradecida por la oportunidad brindada mediante este medio y así mismo se compromete a cumplir con el pago correspondiente al cronograma.
texts.en:
Eliza is 55 years old and has six children.  She lives in the city of Zurite in Anta Province in the department of Cusco.  Eliza is a hard-working, enterprising woman who provides for her family.  She is a merchant and sells the cheese that she makes.  She has been involved in this business for several years and has been successful at it thanks to all her effort.

Eliza needs this loan to buy ingredients such as milk and salt to make cheese.  She is a member of the "San Bartolomé D. las Casas" communal bank which belongs to the Arariwa Association.  She is grateful for the opportunity she is receiving and committed to paying back the loan on time.

loans.use: To buy ingredients such as milk and salt to make cheese

loans.name: Hope To God Ii Group

texts.en:
Pictured here are members of the “Hope To God II” group from Waterloo, a small town in western Sierra Leone. They are small-business people who have come to SMT, a partner of Kiva, in order to seek a loan of SLL 4,000,000 for the entire group. With this loan, they will be able to add more goods to their businesses, attract more customers, make more sales and profit, and consequently improve on their living conditions. 

The leader of this group of entrepreneurs is Ishmail K.. Ishmail was born in the village of Yoni, 47 years ago. He is married and has 6 children. His wife is a businesswoman and 5 of his children attending primary and secondary school. Ishmail sells books, soaps, tooth-pastes, batteries, milk, etc. and has been running this business for 10 years now. With his share of this loan, he will buy books, soaps, tooth-pastes, batteries, milk, etc. in large quantity to add to his business.

loans.use: To buy books, soaps, tooth-paste, batteries, milk, etc., in large quantity to add to his business

loans.name: Manos Trabajadoras Group

texts.es:
Alcancía Comunal "MANOS TRABAJADORAS"

Alcancía Comunal "MANOS TRABAJADORAS" trabaja con EDAPROSPO-PROSPERIDAD desde mas de 5 años y han demostrado ser mujeres con mucha fortaleza, gracias a los prestamos obtenidos ellas han podido mejorar su negocio e incluso incursionado a negocios mejores, logrando asi sus metas a corto plazo, tambien cabe mencionar que son personas unidas y aun con muchas metas por lograr.
Elizabeth es una de las socias de este grupo, ella se dedica a la venta de ropa a pedido, a clientes ya conocidos, ella planea usar el préstamo para comprar mas mercadería, a su vez desea comprar al por mayor para tener un stock de las prendas mas comerciales, en su grupo ella es la presidenta seleccionada por ser emprendedora y de caracter firme.
texts.en:
"MANOS TRABAJADORAS" [Working hands] Community Bank

The "MANOS TRABAJADORAS" community bank has worked with  EDAPROSPO-PROSPERIDAD for more than 5 years. They have shown themselves to be women of great strength. Thanks to the loans they have obtained, they have been able to improve their business and even gone into better businesses. They have been able meet their short term goals. It is also worth mentioning that they are united and have a lot of goals to achieve.  

Elizabeth is one of the members of the group. She sells clothing through orders to customers and acquaintances. She plans on using the loan to buy more merchandise. She also wants to buy wholesale to have stock of the more commercial pieces of clothing. In her group, she is the president, chosen because she is enterprising and has a solid character.

loans.use: to buy more merchandise

loans.name: Fe Y Accion 3 Group

texts.en:
This is Carmencita´s 4th loan with Esperanza International after she successfully repaid her previous loans, which each gave her one step toward improving her business. She will invest this loan to increase her sales. She has had her business for over two years, starting when Esperanza gave her the first loan. She said that her most difficult challenge has been to build her house.

Carmencita lives in Hato Mayor, one of the country’s more rural cities whose economy depends on agriculture. Carmencita and her group of five members are taking loans for their businesses. Most of them sell clothing and miscellaneous products. This group is named Fe y Accion 3 (Faith and Action).

She requires a loan to buy more underwear and clothing to sell. She runs a small store in her house where she sells those products to her neighbors. By walking door to door she could assist new clients in other places and companies. 

She says that her favorite dream is to study to be a beautician, and she wants to have a Beauty Salon in the future. Carmencita and her group are thankful for your support!

loans.use: to buy underwear and clothing to sell.

loans.name: Lydiah

texts.en: Lydiah is 51 years old and is a single mother of three children.  She sells curios and African attires to earn income.  She has been operating her  business for three years.  Previously, Lydiah ran a retail shop to earn a living.  Her marketing skills have helped her to attract more customers to her business.  Through Faulu Kenya,  Lydiah has increased her business stock.  She has requested a loan of 40,000 Kes to buy beads, African design fabric and sisal fibre.

loans.use: To buy beads, African design fabric and sisal fibre

loans.name: Hasmik

texts.en:
Hasmik is married and has two school-aged children. She lives in Yerevan with her husband who works in construction.

Hasmik sells women’s clothing. She would like to develop her business by selling more clothes. With the help of a loan she will increase her income, which will help to cover daily costs, as well as grow her business.

loans.use: to buy more clothing to sell.

loans.name: Oscar Andrés

texts.es:
En el departamento de Managua el señor Oscar Andrés se ha caracteriza  por ser un hombre trabajador, para poder darle un mejor nivel de vida a su familia y así salir adelante.

En esta oficina de Ceprodel se presentó a solicitar crédito él señor Oscar Andrés para invertir en su negocio en la venta de perecedero, este crédito lo utilizara para compra verdura como papa, yuca, aguacate, naranja, limón agrio, mango ctc.
texts.en:
Oscar Andrés, from Managua department is known as a hard-working man who wants to be able to give his family a better quality of life and thus to get ahead.   

Oscar Andrés came to the Ceproduel office to request a loan for his perishibles business to buy vegetables such as potatoes, yucca, avocados, oranges, limes, mangos, etc.

loans.use: to buy perishables (vegetables)

loans.name: María Virgelina

texts.es:
A pesar de su edad, María Virgelina es una emprendedora a todo dar, pues con el fin de cubrir sus gastos, desde algún tiempo se dedica a la confección de implementos para el hogar como tendidos, colchas, cortinas, así como ropa sobremedida, sus clientes vecinos y conocidos la prefieren porque hace muy bien su trabajo, así lo expresa esta luchadora de 68 años de edad con gran entusiasmo. 
 
Para continuar con su negocio, María Virgelina necesita de un préstamo para comprar insumos propios de su oficio como hilos, telas y demás implementos que le permitan realizar mayor producción en menos tiempo y así mejorar sus ingresos y su calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Despite her age, María Virgelina is a complete entrepreneur because, aiming to cover expenses, she’s been sewing household items like bedclothes, comforters, drapes and made to order clothes, for quite some time.  Her customers, neighbors and acquaintances prefer her because she does her work very well.  This is how this 68-year-old fighter states it with great enthusiasm.

To stay in business, María Virgelina needs a loan to buy more supplies typical of her line of work like thread, fabric and other supplies that will allow her to increase production in a shorter time to improve income and her quality of life.

loans.use: to buy sewing supplies.

loans.name: Grace

texts.en: Grace is a 44-year-old married woman with seven children, living in Kasese, Uganda. She has been in a produce business selling ground nuts [peanuts] and popping corn for 20 years. Before that, Grace used to sell tomatoes in the markets. Her hardships are price fluctuations and high transport costs. Her vision is to become a wholesale dealer of dry foods.

loans.use: to buy ground nuts and popping corn to sell.

loans.name: Nuru Group

texts.fr: La cliente Moseka, leader du groupe d’affaire « Nuru »,est entrepreneur, âgée de 33 ans, mariée, mère de 7 enfants qui étudient tous. Elle est  vendeuse de viande en détail. Son mari est aussi boucher, sociétaire d’une boucherie. Elle installe ses marchandises au marché sectoriel Afia Bora. Il y a 12 ans révolus qu’elle exerce ces activités. Cependant, elle vient de réaliser  4  cycles avec le crédit de Hekima. Ce nouveau crédit doit lui servir  de s’approvisionner  avec  2 cartiers de vache (bœuf).  En plus, elle ambitionne scolariser ses enfants et acheter une moto, une voiture jeep et une parcelle dans les quartiers résidentiel de VIP.  La cliente remercie Hekima pour  ses actions en faveur de pauvres femmes exclues de banque classique. Il sied de signaler que le groupe d’affaire « Nuru» est majoritairement féminins.Une des clientes, porte joyeusement son bébé en main.
texts.en:
Moseka is a client and the leader of the business group "Nuru". She is 33 years old, an entrepreneur, married, and the mother of seven children, who are all in school. She sells meat retail. Her husband is also a butcher and a partner in a butcher shop. Moseka sets up her merchandise at the sector market Afia Bora. She has been in this business for twelve years. Yet, she just completed four loan cycles with Hekima. This new loan must serve her to stock up on two quarters of beef. Her ambition is to educate her children and to buy a motorbike, a jeep, and a plot of land in the VIP residential district. 

This client is thankful for Hekima for its actions favoring poor women who are excluded from traditional banking. It is appropriate to note that the business group "Nuru" is composed mostly of women. One of the clients is happily holding her baby.

loans.use: to buy 2 quarters of beef

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy merchandise

loans.name: Melissa Del Carmen

texts.es: Melissa se dedica a la venta de víveres licores, y mercancía variada, en un negocio que está ubicado en su propia casa donde vive con sus hijos en las edades de 3 a 9 años. Melissa inició su negocio después de que su pareja no continuó en esta actividad, pues desde muy joven había aprendido a administrar cuando vivía en casa de sus padres y esta experiencia le sirvió para sostenerlo y generar ingresos para su hogar. En su tienda-miscelanea, Melissa vende de contado, aunque maneja con sus mejores clientes  créditos a corto plazo; su clientela está estructurada principalmente por amas de casa, que le compran diariamente los productos de la canasta familiar que en su tienda vende al detalle, los hombres que se inclinan por los licores, especialmente los fines de semana  y los jóvenes que se compran  los productos de misceláneas como accesorios, detalles, útiles escolares y de papelería. Su sueño es convertir su tienda en una gran distribuidora que abastezca a los negocios más pequeños, porque sabe que esta es una gran necesidad que ahorraría transporte a los propietarios de estos y también tiempo y espacio en su local. Mientras todo esto ocurre, Mellissa continua trabajando fuertemente para cumplir sus sueños y manejando una rentabilidad sobre las ventas no menores del 17,92%, una rotación de cuentas por cobrar de 2 días, y de inventarios de 24.  En la actualidad está aplicando a su credikiva, primer financiamiento que hace a la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, con la cual comprará, ranchos, víveres y refrescos, para surtir su negocio con los productos de mayor rotación y ganar descuentos por las compras en mayor volumen y de contado. Su gran desafío es ofrecerles una educación de calidad a sus hijos, lograr que sean personas de buenos principios morales y logren alcanzar su éxito.
texts.en:
Melissa sells foodstuffs, liquor and assorted merchandise in a store located in her house where she lives with her children whose ages range from 3 to 9 years.

Melissa started her own business when her partner stopped doing this activity because she’d learned how to run a store since she was very little and still living with her parents.  That experience helped her stay in business and earn income for her home.

Melissa sells for cash in her general store although she does give short-term credit to her best customers.  Her clientele is composed primarily of housewives that buy from her daily items needed for basic food preparation that she sells at retail in her store.  Men tend to buy the liquor, especially on weekends, and youngsters buy the miscellaneous items like accessories, school supplies, and stationery items.

Her dream is to turn her store into a big supplier of smaller stores because she knows that this is much needed for it will save store owners transportation costs as well as time and space in their locales.

While all this occurs, Melissa continues working hard to reach her goals and currently has a profit margin of no less than 17.92%, a two-day accounts receivable turnover rate and 24-day stock inventory turnovers.

She is currently applying for a Kiva loan, the first financing she’s gotten from Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, that she’ll use to buy snacks, foodstuffs and soft-drinks to stock her store with the items that sell out most quickly and to earn discounts on her purchases for volume and for paying cash.  Her great challenge is to provide her children with a quality education and to see that they become people with good moral principles and attain success.

loans.use: to buy snacks, foodstuffs and soft-drinks to stock her store.

loans.name: Jeanny

texts.en:
Jeanny is 29 years old and from Clarin, Misamis Occidental, Philippines. She is a single lady who has been able to manage corn production. It was hard for Jeanny at first to cope with it, but by and by, she got to love it.  Now she is interested in doing the job assigned. She has been told by her parents to manage the agricultural business of the family in order to practice and enhance her skills in running a business.   A successful entrepreneur starts small. Every month, she gets an estimated total of PHP 10,000.

Earlier this year, Jeanny joined GDMPC to be able to use financial services. Her first loan of PHP 12,000 will be used to compensate labor costs for weeding and for the purchase of some fertilizers. She expects to reap a good harvest and will invest in business expansion from the expected revenue to be generated.

loans.use: To pay for labor costs for weeding and to buy some fertilizers.

loans.name: Vanny

texts.en:
Vanny is a security guard, while his wife is a weaver. They live on an island of the Mekong River, about 15 kilometers from Phnom Penh. They have five children. Vanny is requesting a loan of $1,000 to purchase a motorbike to drive to work.  

Photo: Vanny and his wife.

loans.use: To purchase a motorbike to drive to work.

loans.name: Saturnina

texts.es:
Saturnina nació en la provincia de Urubamba en la comunidad de Racchi y tiene 41 años de edad,  ella es casada y fruto de esta unión tiene tres hijos. 

Actualmente, Saturnina vive en la misma comunidad donde nació y donde realiza sus actividades económicas, ella después de realizar sus actividades del hogar se dedica a la venta de granos secos como por ejemplo papa, cebada, avena, maíz, trigo y otras más.  

Saturnina requiere el micro crédito para comprar abono y fertilizantes.
 
El Banco Comunal “Qorihuayrachina” se reúne cada treinta en la comunidad de Racchi de la provincia de Urubamba  del departamento del Cusco (Perú). Cusco es conocido por ser una zona muy turística, comercial y por su fiesta tradicional del Inti Raymi y también porque se encuentra una de las siete maravillas del mundo “Machupicchu”.
texts.en:
Saturnina was born in Urubamba Province in the community of Racchi.  She’s 41 years old, married and has three children.

Currently, Saturnina lives in the same community where she was born and where she carries out her economic activities.  After doing her household chores she sells dry grains like, for example, potatoes, barley, oats, corn, wheat and others.  Saturnina needs the micro loan to buy manure and fertilizer.

The “Qorihuayrachina” communal bank meets monthly in the community of Racchi in Urubamba Province, Cusco Department (Perú).  Cusco is known for being a very touristy, commercial zone as well as for its traditional “Inti Raymi” festival and also because one of the Seven Wonders of the World, Machupicchu, is located here.

loans.use: to buy manure and fertilizer.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy raw materials such as wood, paints, and brushes.

loans.name: Tessie

texts.en:
Tessie is 40 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with 1 child. 

Tessie has a retail shop that sells spices & vegetables like okra, eggplant & squash. She has had this business for 10 years. She requested a loan for 4,000 Philippine pesos (PHP) to buy vegetables & spices to sell.

Tessie is a new member of HSPFI.  In the future, Tessie hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy vegetables & spices to sell.

loans.name: Mary

texts.en:
Mary is a 22-year-old married woman with four school-going children. Her husband Kaulu is a businessman who contributes to the provision of the family's basic needs. They have a house with neither electricity nor piped water. Mary's greatest monthly expenses are food for her family and school fees for her children. 

She has operated a retail shop for the past two years; her potential clients are her neighbors. She faces a major challenge of theft where sometimes some of her items are stolen. She dreams of owning a wholesale shop in the future.

With this 20,000 KES loan, she wants to purchase bundles of wheat flour, maize flour, sugar and soap for her shop. She decided to join Kiva's partner, Yehu, for easier access to loan facilities.

loans.use: To purchase bundles of wheat flour, maize flour, sugar and soap for her shop.

loans.name: Aba

texts.en: Aba is married and has 6 children. She is readying the plantain leaves she will be using to rap the dough for the kenkey she sells in Elmina, which she has done for 6 years. Her husband is a farmer. She supports her husband in educating her children. Aba will use the loan to purchase maize to prepare kenkey to sell. With the new profits from her expanded business, Aba plans to reinvest for further growth.

loans.use: to purchase maize to prepare kenkey to sell.

loans.name: Frida

texts.en:
Frida is aged 34 and married with five children. The first four are already in school. She has been in farming for the last four years and currently employs one farmhand who helps her produce milk, maize, beans and vegetables in her home area of Kitale, Western Kenya. She is also in a motorcycle transport business.

Frida has requested for a loan of 100,000 KES from Juhudi Kilimo to enable her to construct a greenhouse where she will grow tomatoes for commercial purposes. She adds the greenhouse will make her production possible in all seasons and benefit her especially during the dry season when the supply is poor in the market.

She is grateful for Juhudi Kilimo's support and reiterates that the loans will economically empower smallholder farmers.

loans.use: To construct a greenhouse

loans.name: Mabrouk

texts.en: Mabrouk, a 25-year-old taxi driver with a low income, also raises sheep to increase his earnings in order to improve his living conditions. Mabrouk is now requesting a loan from FATEN to purchase more fodder for his sheep.

loans.use: to purchase fodder for the sheep he is raising.

loans.name: Nurinsa

texts.ru:
Нуринсе  48 лет, воспитывает  двоих детей. Муж находится на заработках в России. В поисках источника финансирования для своей семьи, 10 лет назад Нуринса начала свой бизнес в откорме и перепродаже скота, использовав стартовую сумму в 2,000 сом (KGS).   
Благодаря упорному труду Нуринсы, ее хозяйство на сегодняшний день насчитывает четыре дойные коровы. В целях дальнейшего развития своего бизнеса, Нуринса обратилась в компанию «Бай – Тушум и Партнеры» за кредитом в сумме 100,000 сом (KGS) на покупку дополнительных голов скота. Доходы Нуринса планирует вложить в дальнейшее увеличение поголовья скота, в будущем мечтает построить новый дом для семьи.
texts.en: Nurinsa is 48 years old and is raising two children. Her husband is located abroad working in Russia. In searching for a source of funding for her family, Nurinsa started her business in cattle fattening and resale ten years ago, using a starting amount of 2,000 som (KGS). Through the hard work of Nurinsa, her household today has four milking cows. In order to further develop her business, Nurinsa asked the company «Bai-Tushum and Partners» for a loan in the sum of 100,000 som (KGS) for the purchase of additional livestock. With her profits, Nurinsa plans to invest further in livestock and in the future hopes to build a new home for her family.

loans.use: to purchase cattle

loans.name: Porfirio Antonio

texts.es: Porfirio nuevamente necesita un credikiva, pues es su fondo de efectivo con el cual aumenta su capital de trabajo y con ello su productividad, sobre todo en esta època de buen movimiento comercial,  donde se levantan las ventas de estos productos. Con su credito anterior le fue muy bien y hasta logrò reinvertir sus utilidades, su negocio cada vez crece un poco mas y él se siente muy orgullosos de su trabajo. Su mensaje a los fianciadores de Kiva es el siguiente: " Muchas gracias por el apoyo financiero", él ha logrado, aumentar su capital de trabajo, su liquidèz y sus ventas crecen constantemente; en la actualidad, debido a su gran mejoramiento y con la ayuda de sus familiares planea comprar su vivienda y esto lo hace muy felìz.
texts.en: Porfirio needs again a Kiva loan, because it is the source of cash which he uses to build up his working capital and with it his productivity, especially in this period when his products have a high turnover. He did very well with his previous loan and even managed to reinvest his profit. His business continues to expand step by step and he is very proud of his work. Porfirio has this message for the Kiva lenders: "Thank you very much for the financial support." He managed to increase his working capital; his liquidity and his sales are growing steadily. Thanks to his improved well-being and the help from his family, he currently plans to buy his home and this makes him very happy.

loans.use: to buy meat, sausages, soft drinks and beverages.

loans.name: Paul

texts.en:
Paul is 28 years old and lives in the town of Iganga in the Iganga region of Uganda. He is married and has two children with ome of them currently in school. For the past 3 years, Paul has been working hard to manage his small shop, which sells phones.

To help expand his business, Paul has requested a loan of 1,500,000 UGX from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to buy more phones for resale, and will help Paul to generate greater profits and improve his family's standards of living. Paul hopes that in the future he will be able to buy a plot of land and own a bigger shop that sells phones. 

Paul is a member of BRAC's Small Enterprise Program (SEP).  The program primarily serves small entrepreneurs like Paul who do not have enough collateral for commercial loans, but have businesses that have grown too large for microloans.

loans.use: to buy more phones for resale.

loans.name: Petrona

texts.es:
Petrona de 55 años de edad, madre soltera por viudez, tiene   4  hijos de  28, 32, 35 y 37 años de  edad  y  vive en la aldea la Limonera de Santa Cruz de Yojoa.
Doña Petrona trabaja todo el día atendiendo una pulpería donde vende productos de la canasta básica familiar, como arroz, pan, huevos, refrescos, azúcar, harina, churros etc.
Desde hace tres años  estableció este negocio y ha incrementado el inventario con esfuerzos propios, con la ayuda de un hijo y con los préstamos que ODEF ha otorgado. Este es el cuarto préstamo, con el cual va comprar productos como arroz, azúcar, harina de maíz y  refrescos para mantener siempre productos que ofrecer a sus clientes.
De este negocio obtiene sus ingresos para mantener económicamente a su familia.
texts.en:
Petrona, 55, is a single mother due to widowhood.  She has four children who are 28, 32, 35 and 37 years old.  She lives in the village of Limonera in Santa Cruz de Yojoa.  

Petrona works all day tending to her grocery store where she sells basic staple items like rice, bread, eggs, soft-drinks, sugar, flour, snacks, etc.  She opened the store three years ago and has been increasing inventory through her own efforts and with help from a son and from ODEF loans she’s gotten.  This will be her fourth loan and she will use it to buy products like rice, sugar, corn flour and soft-drinks to have the items her customers want always in stock.  She earns income to support her family from this business.

loans.use: to buy stock merchandise for her grocery store.

location.town: La Limonera, Santa Cruz de Yojoa

loans.name: Jahir Wladimir

texts.es:
Jahir Wladimir  tiene 19 años de edad es soltero no tiene hijos, vive con la mamá y el papá en ventanas provincia de los ríos.

Es integrante de la VRC LA UNION, se encuentra ubicada en el Recinto Aguas Frías, Perteneciente al cantón Ventanas, esta Ventanilla se dedica a labores Agrícolas de ciclo corto siembra de maíz, arroz, frejol.

Jahir se dedica a la agricultura a la siembra de maíz y fréjol, además tiene animales como pollos de campo. Las compras y las ventas de los productos agrícolas lo hace en Ventanas.

Solicita el crédito para comprar semillas, fertilizantes, urea, abonos para poder trabajar mejor en el campo. Con la ayuda del crédito podrá comprar los abonos para tratar la tierra.

El sueño es poder comprar tierras para poder trabajar en la siembra de maíz. En el tiempo libre le gusta jugar pelota.
texts.en:
Jahir Wladimir, 19, is single.  He lives with his parents in Ventanas, a canton in the Ecuadorean province of Los Rios.

Jahir is a member of the LA UNION community bank in the rural Ventanas town of Aguas Frias.  The members of the community bank operate farming businesses.  They grow maize, rice, beans, etc.  

Jahir grows maize and beans for a living.  He also raises animals--chickens, for example.  He buys what he needs in Ventanas and sells whatever he has to sell there, too.  

Jahir is applying for a loan to buy the supplies--seeds, fertilizers, urea, etc..--he needs for the farm.  Your help will allow him to continue his business.

Jahir would like to buy farmland of his own.  In his spare time, he likes to play football.

loans.use: to buy supplies for his farming business.

loans.name: Paraje Tzancoral Group

texts.en:
Santa Lucía La Reforma is a town in the Department of Totonicapán in the Western Highlands of Guatemala. Ten women who live in the town have formed the Friendship Bridge Trust Bank “Paraje Tzancoral” and have the mutual goals of expanding their small businesses, sending their children to school, improving their homes and empowering themselves. The women have various businesses that include agricultural endeavors (growing corn and beans), animal husbandry and a tortilleria where tortillas are freshly made three times daily. Another member of the group has a convenience store. The women’s average age is 35 and ¾ of them did not attend elementary school. 

Juana was elected President of the Trust Bank and is a good leader who sets a great example for the ladies in the group. She had six years of formal education. Juana is 34 years old with two children who are 8 and 12 years of age. Her children are both in school. This motivated woman has the dream of expanding her businesses (agriculture and animal husbandry). She grows corn and beans and raises chicken, turkeys and pigs. She sells all in the local market. She also has a convenience store in Guatemala City! Juana is requesting her third loan from KIVA investors and will use the funds to open an additional convenience store and will buy supplies like sugar, salt, oil, pasta, beans and other products for the store. This is a hard-working and motivated woman!

The ladies are on the road to more prosperous futures thanks to the generosity and kindness of KIVA investors. They understand that KIVA investors come from all parts of the world and are very grateful for the opportunity to secure loans. Thank you, KIVA investors!

loans.use: to increase inventory of the store, purchasing essential items, like oil, rice, beans, pasta, juices, and soft drinks, as well as dish soap, laundry soap, and body soap.

loans.name: Pilika Pilika Group

texts.en:
Ibrahim, who is mid 20's is married. He has been running a Retail shop for three years now. He works from 8 am to 9 am daily and he's able to generate a good monthly profit.

This will be Ibrahim's 1st loan with Tujijnge Tanzania. He will use this loan to increase on the shop inventories and to cover the shortage of stock. Ibrahim is dreaming of transforming his retail shop into a whole selling store.

He will share this loan with his loan group "PILIKA PILIKA " which consist of four members who will hold each other accountable for paying back the loan.

loans.use: to increase on the shop inventories and to cover the shortage of stock

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Buying firewood and paying labor to make bricks

loans.name: Kifayat

texts.en: Kefayat is Internally Displaced Person (IDP) from the Armenian-ocupied territory of Azerbaijan Gubadli region. She  settled with her family in Sumgait city. She is 52. She widow and has 3 children. Kefayat has lost the husband. Not looking all difficulties in current of 9 years this mother has grown up hers children herself. Five years ago she rented the small shop and has bought foodstuffs: sugar, tea, rice and etc.

loans.use: To construct her own food market and to buy the new refrigerator

loans.name: J Socorro

texts.en:
Mr. G. owns a small restaurant. He wishes to advertise his business, and is asking for financial support so that he can advertise and offer wider variety on his menu. “I would like everyone in the city to come by and try the delicious stews prepared by the woman who assists me. I am asking for $1,200.00.”

Translated from Spanish by Joanne Egnatchik, Kiva volunteer.

El Sr. G. cuenta con un pequeño restaurante, el desea dar a conocer su negocio, solicita apoyo para la publicidad y para tener mas variedad en su menú gastronómico. "Quiero que toda la gente de la ciudad venga a probar los guisos riquísimos que son elaborados por parte de la señora que me ayuda, el apoyo solicitado es de $1,200.00 dlls".

loans.use:
For advertising and a wider variety of dishes.
Para publicidad y mas variedad de platillos.

loans.name: Cao

texts.en: Mrs. Cao is 61 years old. She lives with a grandchild, 3 years old. She has no land aside from a hut. She sells groceries at home in order to save money to support herself and her grandchild. The family income is $9 per person/month. Mrs. Cao hopes to get a loan of $75 to run her grocery store. She will repay the loan monthly.

loans.use: To run the grocery store.

loans.name: Gregorio

texts.en:
Gregorio is a dairy and small crop farmer and also works dispensing medications to cattle in the rural areas around La Paz. These activities provide the income necessary to support his wife and two children, who also work the fields with him. They live in the village of Tahari - Achacachi, two hours from the city of El Alto.

He will use this loan to purchase a dairy cow to increase milk production and in that way increase his family's income. This is his first loan with IMPRO.

Translated from Spanish by Rosario McFaull, Kiva Volunteer.

Gregorio es pequeño agricultor, productor de leche y trabaja como dosificador de ganados en el área rural de La Paz, de esa forma genera sus ingresos para la manutención de sus dos hijos y esposa mismos que ayudan con el trabajo del campo. Vive en la Comunidad de Tahari – Achacachi (Ubicado a dos horas de la ciudad de El Alto). El crédito requiere para comprar una vaca lechera, de esa forma incrementar la producción de leche y mejorar sus ingresos económicos para su familia. Es el primer crédito con Impro, la evaluación realizada lo califica para otorgarle el préstamo.

loans.use: To purchase a dairy cow

loans.name: Lun

texts.en: Mrs. Lun C., age 23, is a housewife who takes care of her two young children. Her husband works as a vehicle tire repairman. In order to expand his business and meet customer demand, she would like to borrow $1,000 to purchase an air compressor to pump tires and invest in a stock of tires to sell to his customers. They expect the expanded business will bring in $10 per day in revenue. They will use the extra income to continue to invest in the growth of the business and to save money for their children’s education.

loans.use: To purchase an air compressor and tire inventory.

loans.name: Nia

texts.en: Nia is 58 years old, married and has six children. She is very talented at making elei (a traditional Samoan printing material) prints, a skill she acquired last year at a seminar held in her village. She is applying for her first loan to buy the materials and tools needed to start a small printing business. She plans to sell her elei materials to shops in town as well as take orders at her home from her fellow villagers. In the future, she hopes to apply for a second loan that will allow her to expand her business by building a small room where she will practice her craft.

loans.use: To buy tools and materials for her new elei-printing business

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Buy more fruit and invest in a new cart

loans.name: José

texts.es:
José is 57 years old and has been married for 24 years to Blásida, who is 46 years old. Their marriage produced 5 children, of which one passed away. Their children are 26, 24, 20, and 11 years old respectively. The two oldest are married while the two younger children live at home with their parents and are in school.

José is the owner of a store that operates out of his own house, while his wife tends to the home. His business is very well stocked has a very good customer base. He sells sodas, fruits, vegetables, canned goods, candy, flour, sugar, rice, etc.

In addition to the store, José has a premises for parties, which he rents for events like marriages, birthdays, and popular music concerts among other things. For 15 years he has dedicated himself to these activities. In the future he would like to be able to obtain some land to use for feeding a cattle herd. He requests this loan in order to buy more merchandise for his business.

Translated from Spanish by Geoff Rubin, Kiva volunteer

José tiene 57 años y está casado hace 24 años con Blásida que tiene 46 años. El matrimonio tuvo 5 hijos de los cuales uno falleció. Sus hijos tienen 26, 24 , 20 y 11 años respectivamente. Los dos mayores ya están casados mientras que los dos últimos aún viven con ellos y están estudiando.

José es propietario de una despensa que funciona en su casa propia mientras que su esposa cuida el hogar. Su negocio está muy bien surtido y cuenta con buena clientela ya formada. Vende gaseosas, frutas, hortalizas, productos enlatados, golosinas, harina, azúcar, arroz, etc.

Además de su despensa, José, posee un local de fiestas, que alquila para acontecimientos como casamientos, cumpleaños, conciertos de grupos musicales populares entre otros. Comenta que hace 15 años se dedica a tales actividades. Y en el futuro le gustaría poder adquirir un terreno para utilizarlo en el engorde de ganado vacuno. Solicita el préstamo para comprar mercaderías para su negocio.

loans.use: Purchase of drinks, rice, noodles, sugar, meat, canned goods, soda, fruit, etc.

loans.name: Uryi

texts.en:
Uriy supports his wife and two children with a business selling and installing small natural gas water-heating units. He started his business about seven years ago at a time when he and his family were experiencing some financial difficulties. Since then, he has developed a successful, profitable business. He has about $4000 invested in his business and earns around $1200 per month. With the rapidly growing economy that Ukraine has been experiencing, many people are upgrading and remodeling their homes and businesses. The units Uriy sells are a popular way to modernize both heating and hot water arrangements.

Uriy has requested a loan to help purchase a bulk supply of plastic piping that he uses to install the heating units. His business has grown and been successful due in part to the financial assistance he has received through Nadiya Ukraine. We are happy for this new opportunity to assist him with his enterprise.

loans.use: Purchase bulk supply of plastic piping

loans.name: Beatrice

texts.en: Beatrice M. has been selling new women’s clothing for the past 21 years.  She is married to an integrated officer who is currently stationed in Sierra Leone, and she has 2 children.  She is requesting a loan of $525 to buy a wider variety of women’s and girl’s clothing. Beatrice is also a member of a lending group called “Nyame Ye Kase Traders”, which consists of 14 borrowers in Cape Coast, Ghana.

loans.use: To buy a wider variety of women’s and girl’s clothing.

loans.name: Rahel's Peace Group

texts.en:
Rahel is married with five children. She has been selling fruit and other food items since 1993. Every day, she works from 5.30am to 4.30pm at her business and can earn a monthly profit of about $250 from her sales.

Rahel now hopes for a loan to buy more fruit and other food items for her business. She will share this loan with her subgroup member, Naitovuaki, who has also sells fruit and other food items.

This is a group loan. The loan funds will be distributed among the group members, each of whom will invest in her own business. The members mutually guarantee one another's loans. If one member does not repay, the other members are responsible.

loans.use: To increase inventory

loans.name: Francisca

texts.en: Francisca A. is 30 years old. She is married with 2 children, aged 15 and 9. She owns and operates a grocery shop and sells items like rice, sugar, beans, canned foods, evaporated milk, soap, etc in her locality. She deems the loan an opportunity to expand her shop and wants to use the loan to buy increased stocks of rice, sugar, canned foods, soap, vegetable oil, etc to serve her customers and to increase her income for her business and family. She belongs to the community group called Adomako Trust Group. In this group, members guarantee for one another as a form of social collateral in order to access loans and provide peer pressure to repay the loans.

loans.use: To buy increased stocks of rice, sugar, canned foods, soaps, vegetable oil, etc

loans.name: Aref

texts.en: Aref, 27 years old, owns a perfume, accessories and "Faux-Bijoux" shop in Saida South, Lebanon. Specializing in Arabic perfumes, this is Aref's first contact with the lending Institution of Al Majmoua.  He needs a total amount of $2,000 to purchase goods for his shop, but we will be providing him with a $1,200 loan in order for him to first build a credit history with the institution.

loans.use: To purchase inventory for his perfume shop.

loans.name: Pudensiana

texts.en:
Mambo from Dar es Salaam, Tanzania! This is 37-year-old Pudensiana R.. She is married and has three children with ages between 2 and 13.

In 2007, Pudensiana established her poultry business. She earns about US $170 every month from this business. Pudensiana requires a loan in order to purchase additional chicks and feed. In the future, Pudensiana plans to to increase the quantity and range of the stock. She thanks you for your support.

SELFINA is engaged in the economic empowerment of women in Tanzania through the provision of a leasing and leaseback microfinance facility, as a practical way to achieve the economic and social emancipation of women.

SELFINA has taken a lead role as a pioneer of micro-credit in Tanzania through Micro-Leasing. Customs and traditions in Tanzania normally make it difficult for women to own land and assets, thus they are termed not-creditworthy by financial institutions as they lack tangible collateral assets. This leads to poor financial support and poor access to basic needs and services for women with low incomes.

SELFINA buys and leases equipment to women. Where a client needs working capital, SELFINA buys equipment from said client, extending a loan to her, then leasing back the same equipment – a process called a sale-and-leaseback arrangement.

loans.use: To purchase additional chicks and feed.

loans.name: Eufemio

texts.es:
Don Eufemio is 46 years old. He lives in the neighborhood Laureles Sur. He is married and his wife is a domestic employee and helps with the expenses of the household. He has 3 children, 15, 13, and 10 years old. Since he was very young, he worked as a bricklayer, an activity that has served to support his family. He has come to realize with much pleasure that after many years of working as a bricklayer he has come to love his work. Don Eufemio is asking for a loan in order to construct a wall in his house, and therefore be able to give better security to his home and to his family.

Translated from Spanish by Jessica Kaminsky, Kiva Volunteer.

Don Eufemio tiene 46 años de edad, habita en el barrio Laureles Sur, es casada y su esposa es empleada doméstica y le apoya con los gastos del hogar. Tiene 3 hijos de 15, 13 y 10 años de edad. Desde muy joven se ha dedicado a la labor de albañil, actividad que le ha servido para el sustento de su familia, y que él mismo cuenta realiza con mucho gusto porque ya son muchos años trabajando de albañil que le ha tomado amor a su trabajo. Don Eufemio está solicitando el préstamo para construir una pared en su vivienda, y así poder darle mayor seguridad a su vivienda y a su familia.

loans.use: To build a home on the west side of his house

loans.name: Davlatali

texts.ru: Алихонов Давлатали проживает в городе Яван. Работает главным бухгалтером на предприятии ООО»Гаюр». Кроме того зарабатывает деньги путем занятием животводством. Имеет хозяйство где разводит КРС. Поэтому планирует получить кредит для того , чтобы закупить комбикорм и сено. Это поможет ему своевременно откармливать животных и продавать хороших , откормленных бычков. Погасить кредит планирует в течение 12 месяцев.
texts.en:
Davlatali A. lives in the city of Yavan. He works as the head accountant for the firm Gayur Ltd., but supplements his income by rearing livestock. Davlatali has a farm where he raises large-horned cattle, and plans to take out a loan to purchase feed and hay. This will aid him in both feeding his animals and selling well-fattened steers. He plans to repay the loan within twelve months.

Translated from Russian by Joyce K., Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of feed

loans.name: Nasreen Tariq Masih's Group

texts.en:
Nasreen is the wife of T. M. and lives in a small neighborhood named Bund Road in the city of Lahore, Pakistan. She is the mother of three children: one son and two daughters. All of her children are in kindergarten. Nasreen baji's husband is a blacksmith. He makes iron boxes and door locks. He learned this art from his brother and started this work 15 years back. Nasreen baji is a housewife and also sews clothes for her neighbors. She charges $1 for one dress. Nasreen baji completed her education through10th standard [grade]. She dreams to see her children in good conditions. She successfully repaid her first loan from Asasah (a microfinance institute of Pakistan and a Kiva Field Partner). Now she is applying for a loan to buy more iron to expand her husband's business.

Nasreen baji is joined in her loan group by a few more members. Yasmeen baji wants a loan to buy mason tools. Yasmeen baji wants a loan to buy a sewing machine to complete her customers’ orders. Gogi baji wants a loan to buy electronic items (particularly televisions) to sell them on installments.

This is a group loan. The loan funds will be distributed among the group members, each of whom will invest in her own business. The members mutually guarantee one another's loans. If one member does not repay, the other members are responsible.

loans.use: To buy iron for her husband to make more iron boxes and door locks

loans.name: Narcisa

texts.es:
Narcisa tiene 30 años, es madre soltera de tres hijos Mayela de 9, Everson de 7 y Marisol de 4. Se dedica a la venta de verduras de manera ambulatoria para poder sacar adelante a sus tres hijos, los cuales cursan sus estudios primarios y requieren cada vez de mucho más cosas y por ende de mayores gastos.
Lo que agradece Narcisa es que el negocio va progresando, haciendo que ella quiera expenderse mucho más, lo complicado está en que al ser la verduras alimentos perecibles, tiene que vender toda su mercadería en el día y no puede guardarla, haciendo que si le sobra mercadería la tenga que consumir ella misma, o dejar que perezca, lo cual sucede muy pocas veces, ya que en su mayoría termina la venta de todas las verduras. Narcisa se encuentra en el primer préstamo con MFP siendo ella una cliente muy puntual. Con el dinero comprará mayor cantidad de verduras para comercializar en su puesto.
texts.en:
Narcisa is a 30-year-old single mother of three, Mayela (9), Everson (7), and Marisol (4). She works as a street vendor selling vegetables in order to give her children a good start in life. They are currently in primary school and always need more and more things, which requires more spending. Narcisa would be grateful if her business could keep expanding, allowing her to sell much more. The problem is that since she sells perishable vegetables, she must sell all her products in one day and cannot store any. This means that she must consume all the leftover merchandise herself or leave it to spoil, which happens infrequently as she generally sells all of her vegetables. Narcisa is requesting her first loan from MFP and is a very punctual client. With the money she will buy more vegetables to sell from her cart.

Translated from Spanish by Emily Martyn, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of vegetables for resale

loans.name: Pho

texts.en: Mr. Pho C. is a villager in Dam Nak Ampil village in Kampong Cham Province. He is a farmer who owns a piece of land to cultivate rice to earn a living. His wife, Mr. Eng Phat, is a duck breeder. Since her duck business is going well, she wants to expand it. Thus, Mr. Pho C. decided to request a loan to buy more ducklings and duck food for her breeding ducks business. He is 48 years old and the father of six children, three of whom are employed in different positions, while the remaining three are attending the local school.

loans.use: To buy more ducklings and duck food for the breeding ducks business.

loans.name: Juanita

texts.es: Juanita tiene 24 años, es soltera, vive con sus padres quienes se sienten muy orgullosos de tener una hija muy trabajadora. Ella se dedica a la venta de frutas regionales en la afueras de su vivienda, esto lo viene realizando desde hace 5 años atrás y le gusta estar en contacto directo con sus clientes para darles una buena atención. Este negocio le es rentable, ya que se encuentra ubicada en una zona muy transitada, y sus principales consumidores son los chóferes de los camiones de carga que tienen sus paraderos muy cerca. Este es su primer crédito con MFP, y está comprometido con sus cuotas de pago. Con el dinero que solicita incrementará la cantidad de fruta que vende, además de iniciar un nuevo negocio de venta  de comida.
texts.en:
Juanita is 24 years old, single, and lives with her parents who are very proud of their hard-working daughter. She sells regional fruit in the area outside their home, which she has done for the past five years. She enjoys being in direct contact with her clients to provide the best customer service. Her business is profitable since she is located in a high transit area and her main clients are the truck drivers whose stops are nearby. This is her first loan with MFP and she has committed to making the payments. With the loan money she will increase the amount of fruit she has for sale as well as start a new food selling business.

Translated from Spanish by Pamela Carreón, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Increase the amount of fruit for sale

loans.name: Channy

texts.en:
Mr. Channy P. is a villager in Teuk Long village, Kampong Speu province, Cambodia. He is a farmer who owns a plot of land to cultivate rice. His wife, Mrs. Chhoeun Sreymom, sells firewood. Even though they work hard, they do not earn enough income to provide a better life for their family, which includes two young children.
