She’s been with the group since the beginning and she enjoys it because her fellow members are like her family and are there for her when she needs them.

A few years ago she opened a small pub in her home so that she could make money to pay her expenses.  She sells water, soda, energy drinks, ice, and beer, among other drinks.  She takes advantage of the fact that people meet each day across the street to play sports, where there are soccer fields and volleyball courts.  She tells us that they do this every evening.  She also makes delicious frozen treats.  She tells us that she’s been doing this for more than ten years and thanks to God this has helped her with her expenses because she lives alone.

She will use the money from this loan to buy sodas, water, and ice among other things.  She wants to continue ahead with her business and hopes that it will continue to provide for her expenses.

loans.use: to stock her pub.

loans.name: Juana Maria

texts.es:
Doña Juana se dedica a la venta de tortilla, y cosa de hornos con mas de cinco años, trabajando para el bien comun de la familia, su esposo labora como operario, y sus hijos cursan la primaria.
Juana ha venido mejorando su casa con prestamo en Afodenic, el cual ha sido de gran sastifaccion ya que ha avanzado bastante poco a poco en tres ciclos. en la construccion de un cuarto, aumento su porche y sigue mejorando.
Con este nuevo prestamo podra hacaer su baño para lograr mejor condicion de higiene como mejor aseo personal. Comprara materiales como: perlines, arena, laminas de zinc, bloques y cemento logrando terminar la obra.
texts.en:
Juana has been selling tortillas and baked goods for five years.  She is working for the common good of her family.  Her husband works as an operator, and her children are in elementary school.  

Juana has been improving her house with loans from Afodenic.  It has been very satisfying because she has, little by little, made good progress in three cycles.  She has built a room, expanded her porch, and she continues to make improvements.

With this new loan she will be able to construct a bathroom in order to obtain improved hygienic conditions and better personal care.

She will buy materials like crossbeams, sand, zinc metal sheeting, cement blocks, and cement to finish the work.

loans.use: to buy construction materials to build a bathroom in order to obtain improved hygienic conditions and better personal care.

loans.name: Namaskali's Group

texts.en:
Namaskali is the leader of this group. She is 62 years old and is unfortunately a widow. She has raised a daughter and two sons.  Her daughter and older son live separately from their mom, and the second son, 13, is studying at a local school. 

Namaskali works as a cleaner.  Her monthly salary is 2000 soms. In order to earn additional money to meet their daily needs, she also breeds livestock and then resells them at a higher price. 

Namaskali has applied for this loan because she needs additional funds to purchase more livestock for breeding, fattening and further reselling. In the future she hopes to expand her business and with the profits gained she wants to improve her family's living conditions.

--- Where Did This Loan Come From? ---

This loan is brought to you by Mol Bulak Finance (MBF), a young, ambitious and socially-focused Microfinance Institution in Kyrgyzstan. 
MBF is strongly committed to the principles of sustainable development and upholds the triple bottom line – People (building human capital and taking care of its customers as well as society), Planet (keeping environmentally friendly) and Profit (earning revenue to expand autonomously). MBF is the only Microfinance Institute in Kyrgyzstan that delivers its services to customers 365 days a year. To learn more about MBF and view a Video presentation about the organization, please visit: http://www.kiva.org/about/aboutPartner?id=135 
If you would like to support and learn more about Kyrgyzstan and microfinance in Central Asia, please join our Lending Team - Supporters of Kyrgyzstan – Mol Bulak Finance at http://kiva.org/team/kyrgyzstan. Members will get special updates and news from Kiva Fellows in Kyrgyzstan and from the MBF staff.

loans.use: to purchase livestock

loans.name: Say

texts.en: Say runs a grocery store at her home. She is a widow with four sons. She lives along national road number one about twenty kilometers from Phnom Penh City. Say has asked for Kiva loan several times already. She now is requesting another loan of $600 to buy more groceries for her inventory.

loans.use: To buy more groceries for her inventory.

loans.name: 12 Đông Sơn Group

texts.en:
Lan operates a food stall selling rice noodle. She is requesting a loan to purchase material for her rice noodle stall. She is 48 years old and she is married with 2 children. She is the group leader of the 12 Đông Sơn solidarity group, which consists of 9 members. Lan lives with 2 dependents in Thanh Hoa city, an urban town in Thanh Hoa province. 

In 2008, Lan joined Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women to improve her business. She has successfully repaid 1 loan from Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor women. She has been involved in this business for 5 years. The main hardship that she faces in her business is the lack of capital.

With her business profit, Lan hopes to buy more supplies and equipment for her business and to buy more land. She wants her family to be healthy and happy.

loans.use: to purchase material for her rice noodle stall.

loans.name: Lora

texts.en:
Lora, a 38-year-old married woman with five children, four of whom are in school, has a business selling bananas, tomatoes, and onions in Hai Mahad branch in Yei, South Sudan. She has had this business for four years.

Lora requested this loan through BRAC South Sudan in the hope of expanding her business. She says that the extra income arising from the loan will help her to pay for the school fees of her children.

loans.use: to purchase more onions, bananas, and tomatoes for sale.

loans.name: Teresita

texts.en:
As a married mother of seven children, Teresita works hard to support her family.

She has a business of selling frozen foods in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from raising pigs. Teresita is borrowing 25,000 Philippines pesos (PHP) through NWTF to purchase more frozen foods to sell in her stall.

Teresita has been sustaining her business activities through her past 21 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: To purchase more frozen foods to sell in her stall.

loans.name: Belarmina

texts.en:
50-year-old Belarmina is a married woman with five children. Her husband works as a farmer and coconut gatherer.

Belarmina earns a living through basket-weaving. She has been engaged in this kind of business for almost 30 years. Belarmina also owns and manages a sari-sari store business. She sells items like soft drinks, canned goods and soap. She requested this loan to buy materials for basket-weaving and more items to sell at her store. Belarmina hopes for her family's living conditions to improve.

loans.use: to buy materials for basket-weaving and more items to sell at her store

loans.name: Akosua

texts.en: Akosua has three children. She sells cassava, plantain, fresh pepper, tomatoes, onions and other items at Elmina. She has done this for four years. Her husband is a farmer. Akosua uses her income for general upkeep of their home. Akosua will use the loan to obtain cassava, plantain, fresh pepper, tomatoes, onions and other items to resell. She anticipates building a shop one day.

loans.use: to obtain cassava, plantain, fresh pepper, tomatoes, onions and other items

loans.name: Mujeres Luchadoras Group

texts.es:
En la ciudad de Luque, 16 mujeres se unieron con el propósito de ayudarse las unas con las otras por medio del trabajo en equipo. De esa unión es que surge el grupo llamado mujeres luchadoras, en el cual, las integrantes tienen mucha esperanza de crecimiento, no solo en lo económico, sino también en lo personal. 
Una de esas mujeres luchadoras es la señora Mirna, quien se dedica a la venta de bebidas de todo tipo. Por medio de este negocio ella gana el dinero necesario para ayudar a su familia y también para poder mantener su negocio. Mirna se define como una mujer muy trabajadora, luchadora, emprendedora y muy sacrificada. 
Solicita la ayuda de fundación paraguaya y de kiva para la compra de vinos, whiskys, energizantes y demás con lo cual podrá abastecer su negocio y ofrecer más variedad a sus clientes.
texts.en:
In the city of Luque there are 16 women who joined together to help each other through team work.  They formed a communal bank called "Mujeres Luchadoras" in which they have placed great hope for growth, not only economic but also personal.

One of these "determined women" is Mrs. Mirna who sells all kinds of beverages.  Through her business she has been able to earn enough income to support her family and maintain the business.  Mirna sees herself as a hard-working, determined entrepreneur with much of self-sacrifice.

She is requesting a loan from the Fundación Paraguay and Kiva to buy wines, whiskeys, energy drinks and other items to stock her business and offer more variety to customers.

loans.use: To buy wine, whiskey, energy drinks and other items.

loans.name: Simana Group

texts.en:
Magdaline is the facilitator of the Simana group. Magdaline and her group joined One Acre Fund in the year 2011 and will re-enroll in the 2012 program.

Magdaline takes care of eight children at home. He joined One Acre Fund to access One Acre Fund’s best prices and ensure food security for her family. In the recent 2011 season, Magdaline had an excellent maize yield harvesting 12 bags on ½ acre of land. Before joining One Acre Fund, Magdaline was only able to harvest four bags of maize on ½ acre of land.

With this loan, One Acre Fund will purchase fertilizer, seeds, and other important inputs to distribute to Magdaline and her group during Kenya’s next planting season in February 2012. The distribution of farming inputs is part of One Acre Fund’s integrated agriculture package, which includes training, reliable input supply (such as fertilizer and seeds), credit and insurance.

With income from her maize sales, Magdaline will educate her children and invest in livestock rearing.

In 2012, the members of Simana group will each plant maize plots between ½ and 1 acre of land.

loans.use: To source farming inputs, such as seeds and fertilizer, at low prices for the 2012 planting season.

loans.name: Kitwe_Twetungure Group

texts.en: For the last eight years, Aston has earned a living by selling food items such as maize flour, cooking oil, beans and bread to people who live in his town, Bushenyi, Uganda. He has overcome many hardships and challenges to keep his business going, and uses his income to support his wife and three children. His goal for the future is to expand his business. He is applying for a loan to buy more items to sell to his customers.

loans.use: to buy more items to sell to his customers.

loans.name: Laura Delia

texts.es: La Sra. Laura es una persona  trabajadora  que  día  con día se  esfuerza  por  sacar  adelante  a su  familia,  ella  se  dedica  a la venta de ropa usada lo  cual le a  permitido  salir  adelante   día  con día,  es  por ello  que  en  esta  ocasión  requiere   realizar  la compra  de mercancía  para  la  venta,  ve  en  el  crédito  la  posibilidad  de  hacer  crecer   su  negocio lo cual le  generara  mayores  ingresos.
texts.en: Laura is a hardworking person who day by day makes the effort to get her family ahead.  She works selling used clothing, which has allowed her to get ahead every day.  Because of this she now needs to buy merchandise to sell.  She sees the loan as the possibility to make her business grow, which will generate greater income for her.

loans.use: to buy used clothing to sell.

loans.name: John

texts.en:
John is 56 years old, married to Ruth. They are blessed with two children aged 20 and 17 years respectively. He has been in the farming business for the past ten years with a monthly income of KES 5,000, which he uses to support his family.

He is applying for his first loan with KADET after being introduced by an existing KADET customer. John will use the loan to buy seedlings and fertilizer for his farm. With the anticipated profit from the business he will educate his children. His hopes and dreams are to venture into pig rearing, which will increase his income and improve the living standard of his family.

loans.use: To buy seedlings and fertilizer for his farm.

loans.name: Jhon

texts.es: Jhon tiene 26 años, es un hombre trabajador y empeñoso, así como alegre y amable. Convive con Betsy, quien es empleada. Juntos habitan en su casa propia en compañía de su hija de 4 meses de nacida. La actividad que realiza Jhon es la venta de gaseosas, para esto cuenta con una congeladora que compró con sus ahorros, y la instaló en su propia casa. Desde hace tres años que atiende a sus clientes con bebidas heladas. Paralelo a ésta actividad también se dedica a la pintura, realizando hermosos cuadros con motivos amazónicos, lo cual realiza en sus ratos libres y a pedido, En tanto su pareja lo apoya en atención de los clientes si requieren de alguna bebida. Le agrada ambas actividades ya que cuenta con un ingreso económico y gracias a ello le permitió salir de apuros económicos. Ahora que tiene su hija recién nacida, tiene la necesidad de invertir su capital para poder generarse más ingresos. Tiene planes de seguir con su negocio y además de incursionar en la venta de abarrotes abriendo una tienda en su casa. Este será el préstamo número 1 con la institución MFP, por ello espera de su colaboración para que pueda concretar sus planes. Con el monto solicitado de 800 nuevos soles, lo invertirá en la compra de bebidas gaseosas a precio por mayor en diferentes presentaciones y sabores, además de pintura óleo, telas y otros  para pintar más cuadros.
texts.en:
Jhon is 26 years old.   He is a hardworking, dedicated man; he’s also cheerful and pleasant.  He lives with Betsy who is an employee.  They live together in their house in the company of their four-month-old daughter.

Jhon’s activity is selling soft-drinks.  To do so, he has a freezer that he bought with his own savings and installed at home.  He’s been providing his customers with ice-cold beverages for three years.  Alongside this business, he also paints.  He makes beautiful paintings with Amazonian themes in his free time and to order while his spouse helps him take care of customers who need beverages.  He enjoys both activities because he has income that has gotten him out of some economic difficulties.  Now that he has a newborn daughter he needs to invest capital to generate more income.  He plans to continue with his business as well as to go into grocery sales opening a store at home.

This will be his first MFP loan and he hopes to have your collaboration to make his plans a reality.  He will use the requested 800 new soles to buy soft-drinks in assorted presentations and flavors at wholesale prices; he will also buy oil paints, canvasses and other supplies to paint more paintings.

loans.use: to buy an assortment of beverages and also oil paints and canvasses for his paintings.

loans.name: Esra'a

texts.en:
Esra'a is 19 years old single woman, she lives in Hay Nazal, Jordan.
Esra'a is looking to have a loan of 500JDs thus she can buy nuts and cereals and improve her social level.
Esra'a is under 30 years old her loan is youth.

loans.use: to buy and sell cereals and nuts

loans.name: Thida's Group

texts.en: Thida is a 32-year-old mother of two dependent children who residing in Mondulkiri province. The main source of her family’s income is from cassava growing and selling grocery items for seven years. Because of drought, her crop has grown not well recently and it earns her a lower income. In order to save her business, she is now leading a group of three members to take a Kiva loan via VisionFund, and she is willing to use her loan portion to buy fertilizer which expected to increase her crop yields. She hopes that this loan will help to grow her crop well and gain her more income.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer which expected to increase her crop yields.

loans.name: Juan Pablo

texts.en:
I have spent the last years as a door to door salesman but my enterprising spirit inspires me to have my own ice cream agency, in addition I am very proud to generate job opportunities in a country like Nicaragua where they do not arise easily. 

Having my own agency will allow me to obtain greater income and to improve the standard of life of my family and the people to whom it benefits with the jobs

loans.use: With the loan I will buy freezers, with them I will maintain freezed my products; also, I will buy the carts that will allow me to distribute ice creams  in the streets

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Mary would like to buy shares from stock exchange market

loans.name: Faapopole

texts.en: Faapopole S. makes flavored ices (locally referred to as “ice cakes”).  Her customers are the locals in her village; the local primary school children are especially good customers of hers.  Faapopole is committed to being a successful businesswoman; she feels confident that she can succeed and puts most a lot of effort into ensuring her business succeeds.  Her family is very supportive of her efforts.  Faapopole’s entrepreneurial spirit now allows her family to pay their electricity and water bills as well as the children’s school fees.  A loan will help Faapopole purchase supplies for her business and particularly will allow her to purchase bottled spring water to make her product.  Using bottled water is necessary for Faapopole to make a safe product.

loans.use: :  Buy supplies for her flavored ice business, e.g. sugar, cordial, spring water, plastic bags

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Expand her Business

loans.name: Rosario

texts.en:
Rosario lives in her own home in the Sopocachi neighborhood of La Paz. She has two grown children and has been separated from her husband for more than 12 years. She's an artisan and makes flower arrangements using dried and artificial flowers. She sells her crafts in markets both in her city and in other locales like Cochabamba, Santa Cruz, etc. She needs this loan to purchase materials and supplies such as bamboo, which she uses in her flower arrangements.

Based on her credit history with IMPRO, Rosario qualifies for this loan. She has been an IMPRO client for over 3 years and has repaid all previous loans in a timely manner.

Translated from Spanish by Rosario McFaull, Kiva Volunteer.

Rosario vive en casa propia en la calle Chaco de la zona de sopocachi de la ciudad de La Paz. Tiene dos hijos mayores de edad, esta separada del esposo hace mas de 12 años, es artesana y elabora macetas de plástico con flores artificiales y flores secas ( que traducidas al ingles serian flower arrangements including the bases). La venta de su producto es realizada en cada feria ya sea dentro de la ciudad o viajando a los Departamentos de Cochabamba, Santa Cruz, etc. El crédito que solicita es para comprar bambú, que es parte de los arreglos florales. Por su antecedente historico , puede acceder a un nuevo credito. Rosario es cliente antigua de IMPRO desde hace mas de tres años y siempre ha cancelado sus prestamos dentro de los periodos de pago establecidos.

loans.use: Working capital

loans.name: Shamama

texts.ru:
Shamama P. lives in Saatli, Azerbaijan located in the Southern Caucasus. She is 58 years old, married and has 5 children. Her family is large, has few resources and it is getting increasingly harder to support it with the high rates of unemployment. The only hope is the household’s plot of land and a small herd of sheep.

Once a year Shamama together with her husband sells sheep at the local market, and uses part of the earnings to purchase lambs and the rest for meeting the most important needs of the family. Her grandson helps in the business as well (see photo). Of course the profits from the sale of such a small herd are small and investment is needed to increase them. Shamama has applied for a loan with Normicor, a KIVA partner. After receiving a loan she plans to use it to expand the number of sheep in her herd and to increase profits from their sales. This will allow her to provide her children with an education at the local school.

Translated from Russian by Sabina Holzman, Kiva Volunteer.

Шамама Пирвердиева живет в городе Саатлы Республики Азербайджан, расположенном в Южном Кавказе. Ей 58 лет, она замужем, имеет 5-х детей. Семья большая, малообеспеченная и содержать её в условиях безработицы становится всё трудней. Единственная надежда на приусадебный участок и на очень маленькое стадо овец. Раз в году Шамама вместе с мужем продают овец на местном базаре, часть вырученных денег тратят на покупку ягнят, остальную часть - на удовлетворение самых насущных потребностей семьи. Так же ей в этом бизнесе помогает её внук (см. фото). Конечно, доход с продажи столь малого по численности стада очень мал и для его увеличения необходимы некоторые инвестиции. Поэтому Шамама обратилась с заявлением для получения кредита в микро кредитную организацию "Нормикро" - партнёру КИВА - для получения кредита. После получения кредита она планирует использовать его для расширения численности овец в стаде и получить более высокий доход от их продажи, что позволит ей обеспечить её детей обучением в местной школе.

loans.use: To increase number of sheep

loans.name: Mashura

texts.ru:
Mashura J. has been involved in an entrepreneurial business for 6 years. She got married after graduating from a technical school and has 4 children. Mashura's husband helps her with the business. She buys goods from local wholesale dealers and sells them retail. She needs a loan to renew the assortment of the clothes for the coming season. She also keeps a job as an accountant for the joint venture "Gulbogh". Mashura J. is a responsible, punctual person.

Translated from Russian by Elena Sheyner, Kiva Volunteer.

Чабборова Машхура после окончания техникума вышла замуж. Опыт прдепр инимательской деятельности 6 лет. Имеет 4 детей. Муж клиентки помогает ей по бизнесу. Товар приобретает у местных оптовиков и перепродает в розницу. В связи с сезонностью у нее возникли финансовые потребности для обновления ассортимента. Является бухгалтером группы солидарной ответственности «Гулбог». Ответственная и пунктуальная.

loans.use: Purchase of modern clothes.

loans.name: Rocio Del Pilar

texts.es:
Mrs. Rocío del Pilar is 36 years old, completed secondary school, and lives in the Moche district of Trujillo, La Libertad. She has three children, but only two are dependent on her. She entered the interim group “Las Sirenas Emprendedoras” (The Enterprising Sirens) through her neighbor that invited her to join the group. She received her first loan for S/.300.00, and used it to buy fabric, thread, buttons, trimmings, etc, for making clothing and costumes. Then she devoted herself to sewing costumes for rent, and also to sewing all types of clothing, according to the requests of her customers. With this loan for $250, which she will pay in four months, she will buy fabric, thread, closures, magazines to create masks of famous people, and some dresses that have been ordered for proms. Her greatest dream is to expand her business and have all the machinery she needs.

Translated from Spanish by Shannon Skoglund, Kiva volunteer.

La señora Rocío del Pilar tiene 36 años de edad, estudió secundaria completa, vive en el Balneario de Las Delicias distrito de Moche de la Provincia de Trujillo del Departamento de La Libertad. Tiene 3 hijos. pero solo 2 dependen de ella. Ingresó al Grupo Mientras Tanto “Las Sirenas Emprendedoras” por medio de su vecina que le invitó a formar parte de este grupo; obtuvo su primer préstamo de S/.300.00 soles con los cuales compró telas, hilos, botones, adornos, etc. para la confección de ropa y disfraces; pues ella se dedica a confeccionar disfraces para alquilarlos y también confecciona ropa de todo tipo según pedido de sus clientes. Con este préstamo de S/.700.00 soles, que cancelará en cuatro meses, comprará telas, hilos, cierres, botones y revistas para confeccionar disfraces de personajes de moda y también algunos vestidos ya que tiene pedido para fiestas de promoción. Su mayor sueño es ampliar su negocio y tener toda la maquinaria necesaria.

loans.use: Purchase goods for her clothing production

loans.name: Norma

texts.es:
Norma, who is 29 years of age, has been living with her partner José—who is 31 years old—for many years. Together they have two daughters who are 10 and 9 years old and attend elementary school.

Her partner works in an automotive repair shop in the capital city of Asunción. Norma is a hairstylist. She says that because of her humble beginnings, she was unable to attend college, so she decided to study cosmetology. She has been working in this field for 7 years.

She comments that she started off as an assistant in a beauty salon, until she was able to save enough money to set up her own beauty salon. Her greatest dream is to buy her own home and open a bigger salon there, since she cannot currently do so because she is renting her house.

Norma is requesting this loan in order to buy beauty supplies for her salon. She vows to repay her loan punctually every month.

Translated from Spanish by Elizabeth Casian, Kiva Volunteer.

Norma tiene 29 años, vive en pareja desde hace muchos años con José que tiene 31 años. De dicha unión nacieron dos hijas que actualmente tienen 10 y 9 años respectivamente. Ambas aún van a la escuela primaria.

Su pareja trabaja en un taller mecánico situado en Asunción, capital del país. Norma es peluquera de profesión. Comenta que debido a que provenía de una familia muy humilde tomó la decisión de estudiar dicho oficio ya que no pudo ir a la universidad y hace 7 años que trabaja en lo mismo.

Comenta que comenzó trabajando como ayudante de una peluquería hasta que logró ahorrar lo suficiente para montar su propio negocio. El mayor sueño de Norma es el de comprar una casa propia debido a que vive en una de alquiler para luego allí abrir una peluquería mas amplia.

Norma solicita el crédito para comprar insumos y productos para su peluquería y se compromete a pagarlos de forma puntual y mensual.

loans.use: Purchase of hair cream, conditioner, hair dye, brushes, hair rollers, curling irons, etc.

loans.name: Eyvaz

texts.en: Eyvaz A. is a 37 year-old man, is married and has one son. He lives in Beylagan, a small city in Azerbaijan. Eyvaz owns and operates a food market in Beylagan. He established his business six years ago. He applied to Normicro Beylagan Branch for the KIVA loan in the amount of $600, and he plans to purchase more kinds of goods and increase his daily income.

loans.use: To expand business

loans.name: Sala

texts.en:
Mambo from Dar es Salaam, Tanzania! This is 35-year-old Sala M.. She is married, and has three children, ages 3, 8 and 12. In 2006, Sala established her general retail business. Sala requires a loan in order to purchase additional stock of small items, such as phone credit vouchers, peanuts and candy, in bulk. She thanks you for your support.

SELFINA is engaged in the economic empowerment of women in Tanzania through the provision of leasing and leaseback microfinance, as a practical way to achieve the economic and social emancipation of women.

SELFINA has taken a lead role as a pioneer of micro-credit in Tanzania through Micro-Leasing. Customs and traditions in Tanzania normally make it difficult for women to own land and assets, thus they are termed not-creditworthy by financial institutions as they lack tangible collateral assets. This leads to poor financial support, hence poor access to basic needs and services for women with low incomes.

SELFINA buys and leases equipment to women. Where a client needs working capital, SELFINA buys equipment from said client, extending a loan to her, then leasing back the same equipment – a process called a sale and leaseback arrangement.

loans.use: To purchase additional stock in bulk.

loans.name: Ayinonkpo Sotonhoue Group

texts.fr:
This micro project focuses on the conversion of palm nuts into red palm oil. It is the initiative of the all-woman group AYINONKPO SOTONHOUE that was created in 1992 and has 9 members. It is located in Kpanou-Kpade in the township of Akpro Misserete, on the border of the political capital Benin. This micro project will enable the group to increase its production capacity, record a profit and improve the living conditions of its members.

Translated from French by Sarah Llewellyn, Kiva Volunteer.

Le présent micro projet porte sur la transformation de noix de palme en huile rouge. Il est l’initiative du groupement féminin AYINONKPO SOTONHOUE crée en 1992 et composé de 9 membres. Il est situé à KPANOU – KPADE dans la commune D’AKPRO MISSERETE, commune frontalière à la capitale politique du BENIN. Ce micro projet permettra d’augmenter la capacité de production du groupement, de dégager un bénéfice et d’améliorer les conditions de vie de ses membres.

loans.use: To buy 6 metric tons of palm nuts

loans.name: Felicia

texts.en: Felicia S. is 43 years old. She is married with 3 children who are currently attending school. It is her fervent wish to provide these children with better life opportunities through education. She owns and operates a grocery shop in one of the busy local markets with items like rice, sugar, vegetable oil, bottled water, canned foods, peanuts, evaporated milk, etc. She wants to use the loan to buy more bags of rice and sugar, cartons of evaporated milk, cartons of vegetable oil, etc to increase her stock. She belongs to the community group called Israel Trust Group. In this group, members guarantee for one another as a form of social collateral in order to access loans and provide peer pressure to repay the loans.

loans.use: To buy more bags of rice and sugar, cartons of evaporated milk, cartons of vegetable oil, etc

loans.name: Le Thi

texts.vi:
Mrs. Le Thi A., 47 years old, joined TYM since 2003.  Her family main sources of incomes are farming, raising cattles and weaving mattress.  With the first loA. of 500,000 dong from TYM, she bought materials to weave and was able to achieve some early success.  Due to her good planning, she had been able to repay all the payments and has been willing to borrow larger amount in following cycle to buy foodstuff for her pigs.  She has 3 children but one is already working (making 1.5 million VND per month) so her family's income is quite stable.  Her family would like to borrow 6 million VND to buy more material for weaving mattress.  Her family income is about 3 million VND per month.

 Translated from Vietnamese by Anh Hoai Nguyen, Kiva Volunteer.

Chị Lê Thị Ân 47 tuổi, tham gia vào Quỹ năm 2003, nghề nghiệp chính của gia đình chị là làm ruộng, chăn nuôi và dệt chiếu, được vay vốn của Quỹ là cơ hội để gia đình chị phát triển kinh tế, với 500.000đ vốn vay bA. đầu được anh chị sử dụng vào mua vật liệu để dệt chiếu, sử dụng vốn hiệu quả nên việc trả tuần là phù hợp với gia đình chị, khi đã quen với việc trả tuần gia đình chị đã mạnh giạn vay ở mức vốn cao hơn và đầu tư thêm vào chăn nuôi lợn, vừa dệt chiếu vừa chăn nuôi nên thu nhập gia đình chị rất ổn định, chi có 3 con, 2 con chị đang đi học, 1 con đã đi làm thu nhập bình quân  1.500.000đ/ tháng. Vợ chồng chị bàn bạc vòng vốn này xin vay 6.000.000đ đầu tư vào mua vật liệu dệt chiếu.
Thu nhập bình quân 3.000.000đ/tháng

loans.use: Weaving mattress

loans.name: Sabina

texts.en:
Sabina S. is a 24-year-old married woman who lives in Tikhedewol, Lalitpur. Tikhedewol is one of the growing towns in Lalitpur. Most people in this region are engaged in small business. Mrs. S. lives with her husband and one daughter. Her daughter is studying in grade 3.

Mrs. S. 's husband's name is Kumar. He is a photographer who works in a photo studio. He is not satisfied with his salary and it's difficult for him to meet the requirements of his family. He decided to open his own photo studio but due to lack of funds he cannot do this.

So to help her husband open his own photo studio, Mrs. S. is requesting an Rs 10000.00 loan.

loans.use: To open photo studio

loans.name: Ith

texts.en: Mrs. Ith C. is a 48-year-old widow with a 26-year-old child who helps her in her business activities. Mrs. Ith C. is a scarf middleman in Preak Thom Village in Kandal Province. Aside from this business, she is a poultry breeder who raises about 120 chickens. Since Mrs. Ith C.'s family now lives in an old house and in poor conditions, she wants to improve her standard of living.  She asks for a loan to add to her savings to build a new house for her family.

loans.use: To help to build a new house for her family.

loans.name: Kidawa

texts.en:
Kidawa is 39 years old, is married, and has 5 children between the ages of 12 and 5. She has sold charcoal, firewood and coconuts since 2006. She works every day from 6 am to 8 pm at her business.

In the past, Kidawa has taken out one successful loan from BRAC Tanzania to expand her business. Kidawa is now requesting a loan to expand her business by adding to her current stock.

loans.use: To expand her business by adding to her current stock.

loans.name: Ni Luh Putu Supartini

texts.id: Meskipun tergolong ibu yang masih muda tetapi Putu Supartini sangat tekun menggeluti usaha membuat tempat banten atau di Bali biasa disebut Mejejaitan untuk upacara keagamaan. Usaha yang ditekuni sejak masih remaja ini awalnya hanya untuk dipasarkan disekitarnya saja tetapi lama-kelamaan karena banyak yang memerlukan bantuan untuk dipasarkan lebih luas akhirnya dengan modal hanya Rp.500.000,- awalnya, Putu menampung hasil karya dari para tetangganya dan kemudian dijualnya di pasar tradisional kota. Per ikatnya Putu biasanya membeli seharga Rp.7000,- dan kemudian dijualnya di pasar seharga Rp.10.000,- sampai Rp.15.000,- tergantung situasi banyaknya upacara yang terselenggara. Dengan pinjaman modal dari DINARI melalui program Tempek, Putu mampu meningkatkan omset jual beli tempat bantennya dengan cara mengambil hasil karya sampai keluar dari desanya dan memang sudah menjadi langganan tetap dari Putu. Pinjaman ini berjangka waktu selama 12 bulan dengan pengembalian dicicil setiap bulannya. Dengan bertambahnya modal tentunya hasil penjualannya juga bertambah dan keuntungan yang didapatpun lumayan besar sehingga dapat membantu suaminya yang hanya mengandalkan hasil dari kebun yang diolahnya. Keuntungan ini sedikit demi sedikit ditabung untuk keperluan anaknya nanti karena memang sekarang Putu masih belum dikaruniai seorang anak. Program DINARI ini sangat penting pengaruhnya terhadap taraf ekonomi keluarga Putu Supartini untuk mencukupi biaya kebutuhan sehari-hari yang dirasakan semakin tinggi saja.
texts.en:
Even though Putu Supartini is still young, she is very keen in running her small business: “Mejejaitan” production. “Mejejaitan” is a plate to put Balinese ceremonial offering (“Banten”), knitted from coconut leaves. Putu Supartini has started her business since she was very young. She started to produce “Mejejaitan” by her own, and market her product to her neighbor, but then because of the increasing demand, she started to need helpers. With Rp 500,000 at the beginning, she purchased finished “Mejejaitan” from her neighbor, and then sell them in the nearby traditional market. Putu pays Rp 7,000 for a bunch of “Mejejaitan”, and sell it for Rp 10,000 up to Rp 15,000, according to the ceremonial session. With loan from DINARI through Tempek Program, Putu was able to increase her revenue. The loan is a 12 months loan with monthly installment. With higher capital, Putu Supartini is able to earn more income that she is able to help her husband, a farmer who only count on the result of their garden, to fulfill their family’s daily needs. Right now Putu Supartini and her husband have not had any children yet, but they are saving some of their income to be able to fund their children’s tuition fee in the future. Loan from DINARI through Tempek Program is very important for Putu Supartini’s economics to fulfill her family daily needs.

Translated from Indonesian by Hestyana Dyah Kuntari, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Increase the capital to increase revenue

loans.name: Osman

texts.en: Osman (his wife is pictured) lives in the Khachmaz region in the Kohna-Khacmaz village. He was born in 1950. This family has run this business for 4 years. Osman has 3 children. Now the O. family need a loan of 970 AZN to buy clothes, shoes, bags and perfumes for improving their business.

loans.use: to buy clothes, shoes, bags and perfumery

loans.name: Akmalkhoja

texts.en: As a boy, S. Akmalkhoja learned from his parents that a business, if properly managed, can give you a  good living. He has been renting a store where he sells sim-cards from the mobile company “Babilon-mobile”. He also works part time in construction. Between the store, the construction work, and his homework, Akmalkhoja works very hard to get ahead. At this time, he would like to buy more sim-cards and cards for the replenishment of the balance amount and be able to better serve his customers. He is asking for a loan of $600 which he promises to repay within 9 months. With your help, S. Akmalkhoja can finish his studies and find success.

loans.use: Purchasing of the sim-cards and cards for replenishment of the balance amount

loans.name: Fatuma

texts.en: Fatuma Uliza is a Tanzanian micro-businesswoman. She sells clothing in a traditional clothes shop (Kanga and Vitenge) at Buguruni trading center. She purchases her inventory from Mnazi Mmoja wholesale shops and makes other clothes purchases from Kariakoo business center. She derives her income to support her family from the business. She has been in the business for five years now. She requests a loan of Tshs 1,000,000 to boost her business.

loans.use: To expand her business

loans.name: Mrs. Yoeun Ros Village Bank Group

texts.en:
Twenty-four people living in Trakuon village in Kampong Cham province comprise this village bank, and they will use the loan for various purposes. 

Mrs. Yoeun R., the 49-year-old village bank president, is a farmer who owns a plot of land to cultivate both rice and vegetables. On this plantation, she faces a problem because she does not have enough money to grow vegetables. Thus, she decided to ask for a loan for this purpose. 

Her husband, Mr. Sun Ann, is a farmer who helps on her plantation. Mrs. Yoeun R. has six children, four of whom are employed in the garment factory, while another is a comedian and the last is attending the local school.

loans.use: To buy vegetable seeds.

loans.name: Juliana

texts.en: Juliana D. is married and has 4 dependants. She has received no formal education. Juliana sells fish which she buys from the fishermen, brings them home for processing and preservation, and then sends them to the market for sale at Bantama in Elmina, which she has done since 1994. Her husband is a fisherman. Juliana uses her income to help pay the children's school fees and other family expenses. Juliana will use the loan to increase her capital to buy fish in larger quantities for processing and sale. With the new profits from her expanded business, Juliana plans to save towards a house she wants to put up for the children.

loans.use: Juliana will use the loan to increase her capital to buy fish in larger quantities for processing and sale.

loans.name: Rosario Del Carmen

texts.es:
ROSARIO C. P., pertenece al Banco Comunal “Nuevo Edén” con domicilio en el Jr. Ruperto Pérez N°   del distrito de Yarinacocha, tiene 35 años, 06 hijos, y su cónyuge se dedica al comercio de plátano.

Como todas las socias obtuvo su primer préstamo de S/.300.00 Nuevos Soles, con el que incremento un poco de capital en su negocio de venta de plátanos, el cual ha ido creciendo con el tiempo, hasta convertirse en un negocio regular, que realiza sus ventas al por mayor y menor, por lo tanto necesita incrementar su capital constantemente.
Con este préstamo de S/. 1,000. Nuevos Soles, invertirá en una gran cantidad de plátano, y granos, para poder surtir su negocio.
texts.en:
Rosario C. P. belongs to the "Nuevo Edén" Communal Bank in the district of Yarinacocha. She is 35 years old, has six children, and works with her husband selling plantains. Like all members, she received her first loan for 300 soles, which she used to increase the capital for her plantain business. It has grown over time, and has become a regular business. She conducts both wholesale and retail sales, and thus needs to increase her capital constantly. With this loan of 1,000 soles, she will invest in a large quantity of plantains and grains to be able to stock her business.

Translated from Spanish by Trisha Bury, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase wholesale plantains and grains

loans.name: Rebecca

texts.en:
Rebecca A. has been selling building materials like paints in Elmina for eleven years. She is married with two children, and her husband is employed as a trader. Rebeccas is responsible for paying her family’s light bill and her children’s school fees.

Rebecca will use her loan to buy additional building supplies, such as lining bottoms (used to support ceilings) and other items necessary for the building process, which she will then resell. She hopes to reinvest her new profits back into her business to ensure that it is successful for years to come.

loans.use: To buy additional building supplies to resell

loans.name: María Teresa

texts.es: María Teresa Q. V. D. S. D. 65 años D. edad resiD. en San Martín junto a su hijo. Ella posee una tienda en su propia casa, ahí comercializa golosinas, bebidas, shampoo, y otros productos más. María tiene 40 años D. poseer su negocio, y es por esto que es muy conocida en el lugar, contando con la fidelidad D. muchos clientes. María Teresa, es una mujer que goza D. muy buena reputación, ya que al morir su esposo ella tuvo que trabajar muy duro para poder seguir adelante junto a su hijo. Ella solícita un préstamo a través del cual pueda obtener el capital D. trabajo necesario para aumentar más productos en su tienda y D. esta manera tener una vida más tranquila, en la cual posea todo lo necesario para tener una vida digna en su vejez.
texts.en:
María Teresa Q. V. D. S. is 65 years old and lives in San Martín next to her son. She has a store in her house where she sells sweets, drinks, shampoo, and other products. María has had her business for forty years and is therefore very well known in her area and can count on loyal clients. María Teresa enjoys a great reputation because since her husband died she has had to work very hard to get ahead, together with her son. She's asking for a loan so she can get the necessary working capital to increase the amount of products she has in her store. In this way she can have a more relaxed life in which she'll have everything necessary to have a dignified life in her old age.

Translated from Spanish by Shelly Hubman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Compra de más productos para negocio.

loans.name: Bakam Koffi

texts.fr: Ce monsieur est un résident du quartier de gblinkomé, il a très tôt abandonné les classes, pour subvenir à ses propres charges, il a commencé en 2005 le commerce de cartes de recharge TOGOCEL et MOOV qu’il vend en gros et en détail à ses clients de façon ambulante. Il est très dynamique et arrive à conquérir tous les jours de nouveaux clients. Il veut agrandir son activité et commencer par vendre des cartes ILLICO, pour cela il doit donc se réapprovisionner et sollicite de WAGES un crédit pour acheter 10 boîtes de cartes TOGOCEL, 10 boîtes de cartes MOOV et 5 boîtes de cartes ILLICO.
texts.en:
This is a gentleman who resides in the Gblinkomé district. He dropped out of school quite early in order to support himself. In 2005 he started doing commerce in TOGOCEL and MOOV mobile phone cards that he sells wholesale and retail to customers as he goes door-to-door. He is a very energetic man and manages to win over new customers very day. He wants to expand his business first by selling ILLICO cards. To do so, he must resupply himself and is requesting a WAGES loan to buy ten boxes of TOGOCEL cards, ten boxes of MOOV cards, and five boxes of ILLICO cards.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy mobile phone recharge cards

loans.name: Grupo Solidario Los Mangles Group

texts.es: Las señoras del Grupo Solidario Los Mangles esta conformado por la Señora Victoria Nicolasa Pérez P. tiene la edad de 40 años, es una mujer esforzada que ha sacado adelante a sus 5 hijos de los cuales cuatro de ellos aun estudian y dependen de ella.Victoria se dedica al destace de cerdos desde hace 10 años, este negocio esta ubicado en su casa de habitación, luego de dedicarse a la crianza de cerdos destazo uno para vender la carne, al ver que este negocio le dio resultado resolvió poner en su vivienda el negocio de destace.Con el préstamo que le otorgue Fundación León 2000 tiene pensado aumentar la crianza y destace de cerdos. Y Carla del Socorro García Rodríguez tiene la edad de 40 años, su estado civil es casada. La actividad económica de de Carla es una pulpería. Carla inicio este negocio hace 15 años que se dedica a este negocio, ella inicio vendiendo golosinas, y con el tiempo las personas comenzaron a pedirles otros productos. Con el financiamiento invertirá en su negocio. sus deseos son de seguir trabajando con Fundación León 2000 ya es por medio de ella que ayudan las organizaciones amigas.
texts.en:
Victoria Nicolasa Pérez P. and Carla del Socorro García Rodríguez are the women who make up Grupo Solidario Los Mangles.
Victoria is 40 years old and a very hard-working woman who has raised 5 children, 4 of whom still attend school and depend on her. Victoria has worked as a pork butcher for 10 years from her home. Having only raised pigs she decided to try selling the meat of one of them; seeing that this business was profitable she decided to set up a butcher’s shop in her home. With this loan granted through Fundación León 2000, she plans to increase the number of pigs she raises and butchers.
Carla del Socorro García Rodríguez is 40 years old and married. Carla runs a small grocery store. She started off selling sweets 15 years ago, but as time went on people began to ask for other products. She will invest the funding in her business. She wishes to continue working with Fundación León 2000 since it is through them that partner organizations are able to help.

Translated from Spanish by Carolyn McCaffrey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Working capital

loans.name: Elisa

texts.es: Elisa tiene 37 años, vive con su esposo y sus 2 hijos de 13 y 8 años en su casa propia. Se dedica a ofrecer el servicio de renovación y tapizado de sillones, trabaja todas las mañanas recorriendo las calles de su localidad en busca de nuevos clientes, su principal herramienta de trabajo es su muestrario de telas que siempre lleva con ella, una vez que ha conseguido un contrato se lo comunica a su esposo, pues trabajan juntos, tienen un taller en su casa donde elaboran los tapizados al gusto del cliente. Según la calidad de la tela y el trabajo realizado definen el precio de su servicio, este negocio lo vienen realizando desde hace 2 años y han notado que sus clientes van en aumento debido a las recomendaciones de sus clientes anteriores. Para más adelante tienen planes de implementar su taller con mayor cantidad de herramientas y abastecerse de nuevos modelos de telas. Esta es la primera vez que Elisa tiene un préstamo con MFP, ella fue invitada a formar parte de su banco comunal, y se siente muy contenta de esta decisión por lo que se compromete a ser responsable en sus pagos. El dinero que está utilizando será invertido en la compra de telas, además del pago para una persona que contratará para que les ayude en su taller.
texts.en:
Elisa, 37, lives in her own home with her husband and two children ages 13 and 8. She reupholsters chairs. She works every morning traveling the streets of her area looking for new customers. Her primary work tool is her sample board of fabrics that she always takes with her. Once she has gotten a contract, she lets her husband know. They work together. They have a shop in their home where they make the upholstery to the customers’ liking. According to the quality of the fabric and the work done, they determine a price for their service. They have been doing this for two years, and they notice that they have an increased number of customers due to the recommendations of previous customers. In the future they have plans to outfit their shop with more tools and stock new styles of fabric. This is the first time that Elisa needs a loan with MFP. She was invited to be part of her Community Bank. She is very happy about this decision, and she promises to be responsible with her payments. The money is to buy fabric and to pay a person who she will contract to help them in their shop.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy material and pay a helper

loans.name: Cresencio

texts.en:
Having two children is very challenging for a farmer like Cresencio G.. He wants to provide them a better quality of life. That is why he is doing his best to be able to maintain the abundant harvest he is having on his farm. Cresencio is 44 this year. He is tilling a 1-hectare farm in walking distance from his home.

Thinking of improving his harvest, he applied for a loan worth Php 10,000 from Community Economic Ventures. With God's help, he believes that this move will help increase his yield so he is able to better support the needs of his family.

CEVI helps small business grow. CEVI provides their clients with not just loans but training and insurance coverage as well.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer and herbicides

loans.name: Batsuren

texts.en:
Batsuren Y. is 38 years old and lives with his three daughters in the Bayanzurh district of Ulaanbaatar, the capital city of Mongolia. Two of his daughters are students in a local high school #84. His youngest daughter is just 3 years old and stays home with her mother. Batsuren's family moved to Ulaanbaatar after selling off all their livestock in the countryside where they were born.

Batsuren's family runs a small convenience store which is located just next to their small house. They sell various food products such as soft-drinks, bread, candies, etc. His wife works as a saleswoman at the store and Batsuren frequently goes to the wholesale markets in the city to purchase food products for his store. Batsuren and his wife dream of making their small convenience store into a large supermarket where they will be able to sell a more diverse range of products in the neighborhood.

Batsuren requests a loan to purchase more food products for their store and, with the left-over money, would also would like to fix the roof of the store before the harsh winter.

loans.use: To purchase more food products for their store and to fix the roof

loans.name: Souleymane

texts.fr:
Monsieur Souleymane C. est un célibataire âgé de 30 ans qui vit chez ses parents dans le quartier Hérémakono-Nord de Bougouni (troisième région administrative de la république du Mali).
Après les études secondaire et supérieure, il est resté pendant des années sans emploi. Alors il s’essaya à plusieurs activités génératrices de revenus sans réussite, il décida de faire de l’aviculture. Après 2 années d’apprentissage auprès de son oncle,  il maîtrise bien son activité.
Dans le souci de mieux rentabiliser son entreprise, Monsieur Souleymane C. décida de collaborer avec Soro Yiriwaso pour acheter un stock important en nourritures pour les pondeuses et des poussins  destinés à préparer la relève.
Il est à son deuxième prêt individuel avec Soro Yiriwaso, et le prêt précédent a été correctement remboursé.
Il s’approvisionne en nourritures à Bougouni et à Bamako (capitale de la république du Mali). Les œufs sont vendus, à la maison et au marché, à  une clientèle constituée de  détenteurs de boutiques  de vente d’articles divers, d’alimentations, de restaurants et de quelques particuliers.
Avec ce prêt, Monsieur Souleymane C. compte réaliser un bénéfice mensuel de 72 500 FCFA qui servira  à élargir son entreprise.
texts.en:
Mr. Souleymane C., age 30, is unmarried and lives at his parents’ place in the Hérémakono-Nord district of Bougouni (3rd administrative region of the Republic of Mali). After secondary school and higher, he remained unemployed for years. Then he tried several kinds of income-generating work without success. He decided to raise poultry. After two years of apprenticeship with his uncle, he has a good command of his business. Concerned about making his enterprise more profitable, Souleymane decided to collaborate with Soro Yiriwaso to buy a sizable stock of food for hens and for the chicks destined to become their replacements. He is on his second individual loan with Soro Yiriwaso. The preceding loan was correctly repaid. He stocks up with food in Bougouni and in Bamako (capital of Mali). The eggs are sold at the house and at the marketplace to customers made up of shop owner selling general items and groceries, restaurant owners, and a few individuals. With this loan, he plans on realizing a monthly profit of 72,500 francs CFA that will serve to expand his enterprise.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy food and baby chickens

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Construction supplies

loans.name: Carolina

texts.en:
Carolina is a member of the Uvumilivu borrower group in Sakina, Arusha. She is 22 year old woman, she is single.

Carolina has owned a Tailoring business for 4 years, she works 12 hours a day and earns a monthly profit approximately 300,000 Tanzanian shillings.

This is Carolina`s first loan from BRAC_Tanzania, she requested the amount of 350,000 Tsh in order to buy more materials for her business.

With the additional profit she gains from the use of this loan,Carolina hopes to save more money and expand her business.

loans.use: To buy more materilas for her business

loans.name: Matute Group

texts.es:
El grupo M. esta formado por tres mujeres emprendedoras que vienen de la comarca las Conchitas, ubicada en la zona céntrica de la ciudad de Masaya. La coordinadora del grupo es doña María del Carmen M. G. de 31 años de edad quien posee un negocio de destace de cerdos.

Tiene ya un año trabajando en este tipo de negocio, que aprendió con su tía, quien realiza dicha actividad, ella miraba como lo hacia y le gustaba. Por el dinero que se gana y la facilidad de venta que posee el negocio.

Agradece a su tía que le ha ayudado a iniciar, le ha instruido y su esposo y ella trabajan en conjunto.  Su crédito lo invertirá en mayor el destace para satisfacer la demanda de sus clientes.

Jeaneth Alemán de 28 años trabaja en la venta de refrescos,  bebidas gaseosas y pollo; Paulina M. trabaja en la venta de lencería en la zona franca donde labora.

loans.use: Capital de Trabajo

loans.name: Cielo Group

texts.es:
El Banco Comunal Cielo inicia su ciclo 17 con 21 socias.
Las socias además realizan diferentes negocios como L. venta D. ropa, artesanía, panes, helados, cosméticos, abarrotes en general, tubérculos, comida, además brindan servicios D. transporte y peluquería.
Sus ventas los realizan en sus casas, en locales alquilados, en mercados D. L. ciudad y D. manera ambulatoria.
Como es el caso D. Yesica que tiene 32 años y 2 hijos, Yesica venD. ropa a pedido que ofrece a amigos, familiares, sus productos los compra en L. ciudad D. Lima.
Las socias necesitan diferentes montos D. prestamos como 300 soles, 450 soles, 600 soles, 1000 soles haciendo un total D. 13650 soles en prestamos en el Banco Comunal.
Sus prestamos serán invertidos en L. compra D. polos, chompas, helados, arroz, azúcar, papa.
Los sueños D. las socias son que sus hijos sean profesionales, ampliar sus negocios y tener casa propia.

loans.use: Para la compra de polos, chompas, helados, arroz, azúcar, papa.

loans.name: Alie Osman

texts.en:
Alie Osman K. is seeking a loan of SLL 1,000,000 to help him invest in his market food business.

Alie is thirty-five years old, married to a businesswoman and they have five children. One of Alie’s children is in secondary school, three are in primary schools and the last is not of school-going age.

loans.use: To invest in his business.

loans.name: Rodolfo Alfredo

texts.es: Rodolfo Alfredo S. S. reside en San Lorenzo del departamento de Ahuachapán. Rodolfo tiene 41 años de edad vive con su  madre doña Lorenza de 67 años de edad. Rodolfo es una persona trabajadora y responsable, es un cliente muy conocido de Integral con excelente record crediticio. El se dedica a su negocio una carpintería con ocho años a flote, pero él posee una gran experiencia en este negocio, ya que se ha dedicado desde muy joven a este oficio, empezó trabajando en ello hace veinte años, los que hoy le dan la ventaja que tiene para manejar su negocio. El destino del crédito que solicita es para la compra de madera que utilizara en la elaboración de pedidos por parte de sus clientes
texts.en:
Rodolfo Alfredo S. S. resides in San Lorenzo in the department of Ahuachapán. Rodolfo is 41 years old and lives with his mother Doña Lorenza, who is 67 years old. Rodolfo is a responsible and hard working person. He is a very well known client of Integral, an affiliate of Kiva, with an excellent credit record. He has worked in his business as a carpenter for eight years, trying to get it going, but he possesses a lot of experience in this business. He has worked since he was very young in this position, since he started working over twenty years ago, which today gives him the advantage to handle his business. The reason he is requesting a loan is for the purchase of wood to use in the elaboration of orders for his clients.

Translated from Spanish by Lois Parshley, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy wood for his business

loans.name: Doris

texts.es:
la sra. Doris P. tiene 57 años de edad, se dedica a la produccion y venta de rosquillas, quesadillas y tustacas, tiene mucho tiempo de dedicarse a este tipo de actividad, las rosquillas son un producto muy vendido en esta zona de honduras, la mayoria de las personas que visitan choluteca y sus alrededores compran rosquillas. 
este tipo de alimento es muy sabroso y se acompaña con cafe negro bien caliente y es muy exquisito su sabor.
la sra. Doris nos dio a probar una de sus rosquillas con cafe y la verdad son muy sabrosas.
su producto lo vende en mercaditos y ambulante en el centro y el mercado de la ciudad de choluteca.
ahora necesita el credito para comprar mas materia prima para la produccion de sus rosquillas.
esta vendiendo bastante y no le ajustan las que produce.
texts.en:
Mrs. Doris P. is 57 years old and produces and sells rosquillas (a doughnut shaped cracker), quesadillas (a cake made with cheese) y tustacas (a type of corn cake with sugar). Rosquillas are often sold in this part of Honduras, the majority of people who visit Choluteca and the surrounding areas buy them. This type of food is very delicious and it goes well with hot black coffee and its flavor is exquisite. Doris told us to try one of her rosquillas with some coffee and they truly were very delicious. She sells her product in little markets and by travelling to the center and to the market in the city of Choluteca. She now needs a loan to buy more raw materials for the production of her rosquillas. She is selling enough and is not adjusting what she is producing.

Translated from Spanish by Lauren Jackson, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to buy wheat flour, cheese, butter, oil, salt

loans.name: Bagu

texts.en:
Bagu P. is currently in the business of selling bread and groundnut paste (a product of groundnut or simsim that has been ground or crushed into liquid). She is requesting a loan to purchase dried fish and tomatoes to sell.

Bagu is 40 years old and widowed. She has two children and her children go to school. With the extra profits from her loan, she hopes to be able to build a house for her family's settlement.

BRAC's holistic approach to poverty alleviation and empowerment of the poor encompasses a range of core programs in economic and social development, health, education, human rights and legal services, which are delivered through an extensive network of village organizations. BRAC has become one of the world's largest NGOs as measured by the scale and diversity of its interventions. In 2007, BRAC started operations in Southern Sudan. The micro-finance program, which is targeted toward returning war refugees, has already formed 418 village organizations with more than 14,000 women members.

loans.use: Purchase dried fish and tomatoes to sell

loans.name: Murotali

texts.en:
S. Murotali is 42 years old. He is married with 6 adorable children. Murotali has always opted to make his life on his land, grow on it, and work hard. That is how he decided to rear cattle and dedicate himself to agriculture. He has been doing this kind of work for a very long time for he comes from a family with an entirely agricultural background. Today Murotali wishes to increase the number of his animals; he would like to buy cattle with the hope of increasing his income and the well-being of his family with the innumerable benefits that these special little animals provide him. That is why he is requesting a loan of $1000 USD. Extend your solidarity to Murotali so that he can move forth successfully and accomplish all his goals.    

More about Tajikistan and IMON International

Tajikistan is known for its rich history, which includes a key post along the Silk Road and the end of Alexander the Great's rule. It has also produced great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets, including Rudaki, Avicenna, Ferdowsi, Omar Khayyam, Jomi, and Rumi. The country is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language, epic mountain passes, and a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium BC. And, even today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture and Central Asian traditions.

But Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics. The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged the already weak economy. In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous and only 7% of the land is arable. These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia. While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty.

IMON's History

Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low income clients represent a viable business proposition. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj

loans.use: purchase cattle

loans.name: Iyabo Amira

texts.fr: Cette dame est spécialisée dans la vente de vêtements de qualité pour dames. Elle a débuté cette activité depuis 2006 et livre sa marchande à ses clients à domicile. La plupart de ses clientes apprécient la très bonne qualité des vêtements ; c’est pour cela qu’elle s’approvisionne non seulement à Lomé, mais aussi au Bénin et au Ghana, les deux pays voisins. C’est pour lancer une nouvelle commande qu’elle sollicite un crédit de WAGES pour acheter des bals de vêtements. Elle assure seule l’éducation de son enfant.
texts.en:
This lady specialises in selling quality clothing for women. She began this activity in 2006 and home-delivers her merchandise. Most of her customers appreciate the excellent quality of the clothes, which is why she gets her supplies not only from Lomé, but also from Benin and Ghana, the two neighbouring countries. She is requesting a loan from WAGES so that she can place a new order for bales of clothes. She is sole support for her child’s education.

Translated from French by René McConnell, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy clothes

loans.name: Natalya

texts.en:
Natalya is married with two grown daughters. She lives in Pavlograd. Natalya owns two vending locations and runs her business selling sporting clothing in two different marketplaces: the central market and the one called “Yulana”. Natalya’s merchandise is always in high demand. She has been running this venture for fourteen years. Presently, her turnover capital amounts to 50,000 UAH. Her net profit amounts to about $1000 a month. 

Natalya is requesting an 11,200 UAH loan to increase her turnover capital. She is hoping to see her business developing consistently and bringing her a stable income. Natalya is a determined entrepreneur. She hasn’t had any late payments with previous loans.

loans.use: to increase her turnover capital

loans.name: Josephine

texts.en:
Josephine I., 47, is making sure that her family has enough provisions for their daily needs. She is married to Segismundo I., a rice dealer, and they are blessed with three children. She makes sure that she helps her husband earn so that their family can have a better life.  She has been a rice dealer for two years now.

Josephine has been a regular member of Center for Community Transformation* (CCT) for more than a year now. She regularly attends their weekly fellowship meetings and pays her weekly dues consistently. Because of her good repayment performance with her previous loans, she has been able to borrow four times in CCT’s Cooperative.  She is consistent in paying her dues because she uses the money she borrows to expand and improve her rice business.     

Now with your help, she would like to apply for a 12,000 PHP loan. This amount will be used as a source of added capital to her expanding business by allowing her to continue to buy and sell rice and thus sustain the business. 

She dreams that her business will continue to grow so that she can help other people by providing cheap rice for them to buy, especially now that the economy is bad. She also wants her children to have a good life and finish their education.


* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: to sustain the rice business.

loans.name: Suiti

texts.en:
Suiti K. is 50 and married with 5 children.  She owns a business venture selling fruit.  Suiti has many years of experience in this business.  Suiti needs a loan of WST $2500 .  She plans to use the earnings from her business to improve/expand the business.

Suiti joined SPBD.This is her 5th loan with SPBD. SPBD's loans are Suiti's only access to capital because she was never able to qualify for a loan with traditional banks.

The following social metrics for Suiti K. are provided by SPBD*:
Overall Social Metric Score:                1.6 out of 3
Level of Education:                              2 out of 3
Level of total Household Income:         2 out of 3
Quality of Household Assets:              3 out of 3

*SPBD measures the living conditions of each of its borrowers to track her loan progress. The overall social metric score, provided by SPBD, is based upon a number of factors, such as the condition of the house/household assets, health, education, income level, and family reputation. A higher number represents a higher score. For example, a ""3 out of 3"" on education would mean that the borrower has graduated from university; a ""2 out of 3"" = secondary/high-school, and a ""1 out of 3"" would mean that the borrower is uneducated.

For more information on this score, please see SPBD's partner page at: http://partners.kiva.org/about/aboutPartner?id=15

About SPBD
In 2000, Greg Casagrande founded SPBD and since then, it has expanded from the main island of Upolu in Samoa to Savaii, as well as Tonga. SPBD's philosophy of lending is based upon the Grameen Bank lending method.

Please join SPBD's lending team on KIVA to receive on-the-spot updates on SPBD: http://www.kiva.org/community/viewTeam?team_id=8375

loans.use: to purchase additional seeds and farming equipments

loans.name: Peter

texts.en:
Peter, 48, is married with four children, two of whom attend school. He has been running a timber workshop for thirteen years. He has three employees who assist him in the business. He also practices mixed farming for commercial purposes. Since he has been a member of Faulu Kenya, his business has expanded and his standard of living has improved. He plans to grow his farming and workshop business and to open outlets. 

He has requested a loan of Kes 40,000 from Faulu Kenya to buy timber. He describes himself as ambitious.

loans.use: To buy timber to make furniture and wood products

loans.name: Ivo

texts.en:
Ivo T. is 38 and married with 5 children.  She owns a business venture, selling baked goods in the local community.  Ivo has 3 years of experience in this business.  Ivo needs a loan of WST $1000 to buy raw ingredients for cooked foods.  She plans to use the earnings from her business (estimated to be 350 talas or US $146 per week) to improve/expand the business.

In 2010, Ivo joined SPBD.  This is her 1st loan with SPBD. SPBD's loans are Ivo's only access to capital because she was never able to qualify for a loan with traditional banks.

About SPBD
In 2000, Greg Casagrande founded SPBD and since then, it has expanded from the main island of Upolu in Samoa to Savaii, as well as Tonga. SPBD's philosophy of lending is based upon the Grameen Bank lending method.

Please join SPBD's lending team on KIVA to receive on-the-spot updates on SPBD: http://www.kiva.org/community/viewTeam?team_id=8375

loans.use: to buy raw ingredients for cooked foods

loans.name: Kutmidinova Baktygul`s Group

texts.ru:
Бактыгул 33 года. Она замужем и мать 4 детей. Старшие дети учатся в школе. Ее супруг работает строителем-плотником. Она помогает ему в цехе и производят домашнюю мебель. У них есть своя постоянная клиентура. Клиент собирается купить КРС для откорма и разведения и таким образом получить дополнительный источник дохода.

Шахзада, 50, замужем. У нее 7 детей: 4 дочери и 3 сына. Вся семья занимается земледелием. Они выращивают технические культуры. Кредит нужен для закупа минеральных удобрений.

Бурмакан 43 года. У нее 6 детей. Супруг клиента занимается частным извозом по району. Клиент дома имеет свое маленькое хозяйство и планирует купить еще одну корову, чтобы получать молоко и производить молочные продукты. 

Галбай, 39, женат. является единственным мужчиной в данной группе. Он оказывает услуги мельницы. На полученную прибыль от заработков в Казахстане купили китайскую мельницу и стабильно обслуживают население по помолу муки. Кредит запрашивается для закупа минеральных удобрений для использования при посеве картофеля.


--- Where Did This Loan Come From? ---
This loan is brought to you by Mol Bulak Finance, a young and ambitious socially-focused MFI in Kyrgyzstan.

Mol Bulak Finance is strongly committed to the principles of sustainable development on the basis of 3-Ps concept - People (building human capital and taking care of its customers and the society as well), Profit (to be profitable to grow further) and the Planet (taking care of the environment). It is also the only MFI in Kyrgyzstan who delivers its services to customers 365 days a year. To learn more about Mol Bulak and view a Video presentation about the organization, please visit: http://www.kiva.org/about/aboutPartner?id=135

If you would like to support and learn more about Kyrgyzstan and micro-finance in Central Asia, please join our Lending Team - Supporters of Kyrgyzstan - at http://kiva.org/team/kyrgyzstan. Members will get special updates and news from the Kiva Fellows in Kyrgyzstan and Mol Bulak staff.
texts.en:
Baktygul, 33, is married and has 4 children. The older children attend school. Baktygul's husband is a construction worker/carpenter. Baktygul and her husband work together in a woodwork workshop making furniture. The business has earned loyal customers. Baktygul will use this loan to purchase cattle to start a cattle farm providing an additional source of income. Shahzada, 50, is married and has 7 children: 4 daughters and 3 sons. The whole family is farming land where they grow technical crops (such crops include cotton, sugar beets, sunflowers, etc.). This loan will be used to purchase mineral fertilizers. Burmakan, 43, has 6 children. Her husband has a private livery service. Burmakan has a small cattle farm and plans to purchase a cow to produce milk and dairy products. Galbay, 39, is the only male in this group of entrepreneurs. Galbay purchased a Chinese-made mill with the money he earned in Kazakhstan. He now provides reliable milling services to the local grain farmers. Galbay will use this loan to purchase mineral fertilizer to grow potatoes.

Translated from Russian by Aleksandr Zhuk, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase cattle and mineral fertilizers

loans.name: M. Germaine

texts.fr: B. M. Germaine est née le 29 Mai 1975 à Adjohoun, dans le département de l’Ouémé au Bénin. Germaine est une veuve vivant depuis une dizaine d’année à la zone des Ambassades à Cotonou, capitale économique du Bénin. Germaine a quatre enfants qui sont tous scolarisés. Germaine vit seule avec ses enfants et assure donc seule, leurs différentes charges. Germaine n’a jamais été à l’école. Il y une dizaine d’année que Germaine mène comme activité la vente de boissons de SOBEBRA (Société Béninoise de Brasserie) et des vins de palme à son domicile. Germaine s’approvisionne à Dantokpa, marché international du Bénin, et dans les dépôts de boissons. C’est une ancienne cliente deALIDé, ayant déjà obtenu quatre prêts qui ont tous été bien remboursés.  Cependant, Germaine a été malade lors de son dernier crédit, mais ce problème ne l’a pas empêché de  bien rembourser son prêt. Germaine voudrait rehausser son activité et faire face à la demande de plus en plus nombreuse de sa clientèle. C’est ce qui l’amène à solliciter auprès de ALIDé, un autre prêt.
texts.en:
M. Germaine B. was born May 29, 1975 in Adjohoun, in Benin's Ouémé department. Germaine is a widow, living for the past decade in the embassy zone in Cotonou, the economic capital of Benin. Germaine has four children who are all in school. She lives alone with her children and thus must provide alone for their various expenses. Germaine never went to school. For ten years, Germaine has run a business out of her home in the sale of drinks from SOBEBRA (Société Béninoise de Brasserie [Beninese Brewery Society]) and palm wines. She gets her supplies in Dantokpa, Benin's international market, and from beverage warehouses. Germaine is a previous Alidé client, having already received four loans that have all been completely repaid. Though she was ill at the time of her last loan, this challenge didn't prevent her from fully repaying her loan. Germaine would like to build up her business and keep up with the increasing demand of her customers. That is what brings her to approach Alidé for another loan.

Translated from French by Jessalyn Pinneo, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buying cases of alcoholic beverages and sweets

loans.name: Eric

texts.es:
El Señor Eric P. A. tiene 36 años de edad, está separado de su mujer ya más de 10 años, el vivía en Cochabamba con su mujer pero ella lo abandono y le dejo sin nada en otras palabras lo dejo en la calle llevándose todas sus cosas (muebles y  electrodomésticos de su hogar), el tiene la voluntad de superarse y volver a empezar de nuevo, se vino a ivirgarzama a buscar su suerte de lo cual se animo y monto un nuevo taller sencillo e humilde.

El Señor Eric P. A. se dedica a la reparación de mascaras de plástico y fibra de vidrio (mascarero) y a la venta de repuestos pequeños de automotores por ejemplo: guiñadores, stops, faroles, etc. El tiene la seguridad que así podra levantar su tienda y poder tener una vida mejor, para que en un futuro no muy lejano pueda rehacer su vida y formar una nueva familia. 

El solicita el crédito para la compra de mercadería para ampliar su taller, y así poder incrementar más sus ingresos y poder ofrecer un mejor servicio a sus clientes.
texts.en:
Sr. Eric P. A. is 36 years old and has been separated from his wife for more than 10 years. He was living in Cochabamba when his wife literally left him with nothing (she had taken all the furniture and household appliances). Eric found the will to overcome and start a new life. Fate brought him to Ivirgarzama where he was inspired to open a new workshop that was simple and modest.

Eric repairs headlight and taillight covers made of plastic and fiberglass. He also sells small automotive parts such as turn signals, brake lights, headlights, and other items. Eric is confident in his ability to improve his business and have a better life. In the near future, he hopes to rebuild his life and start a new family.

The loan he is requesting will be used to buy merchandise to expand his shop so that he can generate more revenue and offer better service to his customers.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase inventory to sell in his auto repair shop

loans.name: Porfirio

texts.es:
A la vivienda del señor Porfirio V. le esta haciendo falta el techo pero no cuenta con el dinero necesario para poder realizar la mejora.
Solicita el préstamo para poder comprar el material y pagarle a la persona que se encargara de realizar la mejora.
Desea terminar si casa ya que actualmente esta pagando renta, y le están cobrando mucho.
Planea pagar el crédito con una parte del ingreso que obtiene de su trabajo como mesero de un restaurante.
texts.en:
Porfirio V.'s house needs a roof, but he doesn't have the money needed to finish this part of his home. He is asking for a loan to buy the materials needed and to pay the person who will be in charge of completing the job. He would like to finish construction of the house because he is currently paying quite a bit in rent. He plans to repay the loan with part of the income he earns as a waiter in a restaurant.

Translated from Spanish by Catherine Fountain, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Construction of a wooden roof

loans.name: Analiza

texts.en: Analiza S. is from the village of Villaramos. She is 38 years old. Analiza is married and has three school-aged children. To make a living, Analiza raises crops. The main source of income for the business comes from planting and harvesting corn and rice for sale. Analiza has been engaged in her business for more than seven years and earns an average of approximately 2,300 Philippine pesos (PHP) a month from it. In 2010, Analiza joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities.
