Analiza is requesting a new loan of 2,500 PHP, which will be used as additional capital for her corn and rice production. This will be the first loan taken out by Analiza from PMPC, a Kiva partner. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family. About PMPC Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: Additional capital for corn and rice production

loans.name: Set

texts.en: Mrs. Set M. is married and the mother of four school-aged children. She earns a living by raising rice and a few pigs, while her husband works in construction. Recently, her crop is not growing well because it needs fertilizer. That is why Set M. has applied for a loan to buy fertilizer to increase her crop yield and improve her family's living standards.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer.

loans.name: Odelio

texts.en:
Odelio A. is from the village of Brgy, Lantap, Bagabag, Nueva Vizcaya. He is 42 years old. Odelio is married and has four school-aged children. To make a living, Odelio owns and operates a business venture in the food sector making and selling food. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from preparing and selling cooked food for daily meals. Odelio has been engaged in his business for over seven years and earns approximately 3,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2010, Odelio joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve his living situation and his ability to engage in business activities. Odelio is requesting a new loan of 5,000 PHP which will be used to purchase raw ingredients needed to make the food products he sells. This loan will be the first loan taken out by Odelio from ASKI. He plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to financially support immediate members of his family.

About ASKI:

ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 29 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase raw ingredients to make the food he sells

loans.name: Mirael

texts.es:
El Sr. Mirael Ríos M. a sus  40 años con 4 hijos junto a su esposa trabajan en la agricultura, vive en la Comunidad de Molle Aguada Alta Provincia Mizque del departamento  de Cochabamba  por la lejanía del pueblo y por los suelos áridos en el lugar donde vive no tiene una producción continua al año tiene una sola cosecha. 

El Sr. Mirael y toda su familia intentaron buscar vidas mejores en el pueblo y en la ciudad por su estado de salud el Sr. Mirael no pudo resistir en los lugares que intento vivir. El Sr. Mirael sufre de presión alta y diabetes  por este motivo tuvo que regresar a la Comunidad de Molle Aguada Alta, pero él se preocupa demasiado por sus hijos ellos están creciendo en el campo y la distancia para ir a la escuela es muy lejos  y por la pobreza que llevan no les alcanza para que sus hijos se queden a estudiar en  el pueblo.

Con el crédito que solicitan  ellos esperan aumentar su  producción, desean comprar más semillas y abonos para mejorar  y aumentar su producción y aumentar sus recursos económicos para tener una mejor vida con toda su familia.
texts.en:
Mr. Mirael Ríos M., 40, together with his four children and wife are farmers. They live in Molle Aguada Alta, Mizque province, Cochabamba department. Due to the remoteness of the town and the arid conditions of the soil he cannot farm continuously and has only one crop per year. Mirael and his entire family tried to seek better lives in town and in the city but due to his health he wasn’t able to withstand any of the places he attempted to live. He has hypertension and diabetes so he had to return to Molle Aguada Alta. But he worries about his children because they are growing up in the wilderness far away from schools and because of the poverty in which they live they can’t afford to leave their children in town to go to school. With the requested loan they hope to improve production. They want to buy more seed and manure to improve and increase production thus increasing income which will lead to a better life for the entire family.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy manure and seed.

loans.name: La Piramide De San Judas Tadeo Group

texts.es:
El Sr. Luis Felipe, tiene 43 años, es casado y tiene un hijo. El forma parte del grupo "L. PirámiD. D. San Judas Tadeo", formado por 8 integrantes, ellos residen en L. zona D. Collique en el distrito D. Comas.
El Sr. Luis Felipe se dedica hace 8 años al servicio D. taxi, debido al poco ingreso económico con el que contaba, decidió comprarse un carro y salir a taxear, y tener un trabajo independiente.
Con su trabajo a logrado construir su casa, educar a su hijo.
Uno D. sus proximos proyectos es terminar D. estudiar L. carrera D. abogado que dejo pendiente.
Con el préstamo recibido apoyará a su esposa en L. implementación D. sus salón D. belleza.
texts.en:
Luis Felipe is 43 years old, he is married and he has a son. He is a member of the group named "The Pyramid of San Judas Tadeo". The group is maD. up of 8 members, all residents of the Collique region of the Comas district. Luis Felipe has been a taxi driver for the past 8 years. Given the low income that he once earned he decided to purchase a car and offer public transportation, and to be independent. With his business he has managed to build his own house and to send his son to school. His next project will be to complete his studies in law, studies that he once had abandoned. With this loan he will support his wife by helping her set up a beauty salon.

Translated from Spanish by Erika Lindig, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To help set up a beauty salon.

loans.name: Kyaliwajala  Womens Group A -Kampala

texts.en: Jane N., age 35, belongs to the Kyaliwajjala Group in Kampala. This mother of five has operated a retail shop for a year and a half, selling merchandise such as sugar, salt, beans, rice, flour, and other cooking supplies. She also earns additional income raising pigs and selling charcoal.  Jane credits her husband who helped her get started with his financial support. Before opening her shop, she sold bricks and raised crops. Now, she can earn about 100,000 shillings (UGX) per week.  With this loan she will buy merchandise for her shop.

loans.use: To buy merchandise for her shop.

loans.name: Aurora Pastora

texts.es:
En la parroquia Quiroga de la  ciudad de Calceta, localidad donde la gente dedicada  en gran parte a la agricultura y cría de  animales, se reúne cada quince días  El Banco Comunal Quiroga.

La señora aurora tiene 46 años,  está casada hace 27 años, de esta relación tuvo 5 hijos tres de ellos son mayores de edad, el menor tiene 11 años y recuerda con mucha tristeza que uno de sus hijos falleció hace algunos años.  Su esposo es comerciante.

Ella y su esposo se dedican a la compra y venta de frutas y ganado, trabajan de lunes a sábado casi todo el día, recorren los campos comprando los productos de la zona  como naranjas, mandarinas, limón, sandias, melón, etc. Y las llevan a entregar una pequeña parte en Portoviejo pero el resto lo llevan a Quito ya que allá los venden a mejor precio por ser frutas de la costa. También de allá traen frutas de la sierra la misma que entregan a comerciantes de Portoviejo y Calceta. Con ellos trabaja uno de sus hijos.

Este crédito lo va a emplear en comprar frutas 	ya que tuvo que arreglar el carro y se quedo desfinanciado por lo cual utilizara este crédito para comprar mas de sus productos. Lleva en el Banco Comunal 30 ciclos es socia fundadora y siempre le  ha gustado por los beneficios que ha recibido de parte de la Fundación Espoir.
 
Su sueño es  tener una casa bien construida.
texts.en:
Every fifteen days the Quiroga Village Bank meets in the Quiroga parish in the city of Calceta, a region whose population is largely dedicated to agriculture and raising animals.  

Aurora is forty-six and has been married for twenty-seven years.  They've had five children, three now grown.  The youngest, eleven, remembers with great sadness how one of the other children passed away a few years ago.  Her husband is a merchant.

Aurora and her husband earn their living buying and selling fruit and cattle.  They work nearly all day Monday through Saturday.  They travel the countryside buying local produce like oranges, tangerines, lemons, watermelons, melons, etc.  They deliver a small percentage to Portoviejo, and take the rest to Quito where they can get the best price for coastal fruits.  They also deliver fruits from the mountains of Quito to merchants in Portoviejo and Calceta.  One of their children works with them.

Aurora plans to use her loan to purchase more fruits.  She'll use it to buy more product because she had to fix her car and she's out of money.  She's been with the bank for thirty loan cycles; she's a founding member and has always liked the benefits Fundación Espoir has provided her.  

Her dream is to have a well-constructed house.

loans.use: To buy oranges, melons, pineapples, watermelon, etc.

loans.name: Alliance Group

texts.fr:
Composé de 5 femmes mariées, les membres du groupe ALLIANCE de l’association SABOUGNOUMA, ont une moyenne d’âge de 28 ans et de 2 enfants. Elles vivent dans des familles conjugales traditionnelles avec leurs frères, sœurs, enfants et époux. Ces femmes résident dans le quartier TORAKABOUGOU de la ville de BOUGOUNI, troisième région administrative de la république du Mali. 
Par des relations d’amitiés et de commerce, ces femmes se sont connues et font le commerce de beurre de karité et de céréales avec DIAKASSA T. qui a la grande tasse en mains. 
Dans le souci d’améliorer ses capacités d’achat afin et de faire le stock, elle décida d’adhérer à  l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso, avec qui elle est à sa première expérience. 
Madame DIAKASSA T. fait le commerce de céréales dans le grand marché de BOUGOUNI. Elle a appris cette activité auprès de sa belle mère.
Avec ce prêt elle compte acheter 400kg de petit mil, 200kg de fonio et 100kg de maïs. Elle s’approvisionne auprès des fournisseurs venant des villages environnants. Toutes les ventes se font dans le marché de BOUGOUNI en détail et au comptant à une clientèle composée d’hommes et de femmes. 
Avec ce prêt le elle envisage obtenir un bénéfice mensuel de 
25000 FCFA alors que les autres membres du groupe comptent sur un bénéfice mensuel de 20 000FCFA qui sera utilisé dans les frais éducatifs des enfants.
texts.en:
All five of them married women, the members of the ALLIANCE group from the SABOUGNOUMA association are on average 28 years old and have on average two children. They live in traditional connubial families with their husbands, children, brothers and sisters. These women reside in the TORAKABOUGOU neighborhood of the town of BOUGOUNI (Mali's third administrative region).
They have met through bonds of friendship and trade, and trade in shea butter and cereals with DIAKASSA T. (who holds the large container).
In order to improve her buying power and to build up her stock, she decided to adhere to the micro-finance institution Soro Yiriwaso, with which this is her first experience.
Mrs. DIAKASSA T. trades in cereals at the grand market of BOUGOUNI. She learned this activity from her mother-in-law. With this loan, she plans on purchasing 400 kilos of millet, 200 kilos of fonio and 100 kilos of corn. She gets her stocks from suppliers coming from neighboring villages. She only sells cash and retail at the BOUGOUNI market, to a customer base made of men and women.
With this loan, she expects to create a monthly benefit of 25,000 CFA francs while the other group members count on a 20,000 CFA francs monthly benefit, to be used towards the children's schooling expenses.

loans.use: Purchase of cereals

loans.name: Elaine

texts.en:
Elaine P. is from the village of Lapasan Clarin Misamis Occidental. She is 39 years old. Elaine is married and has 4 school-aged children. To make a living, Elaine owns and operates a business venture in the transportation services sector. The main source of income for the business comes primarily from operating service-based services. Elaine has been engaged in her business for over 2 years and earns approximately 10000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2010, Elaine joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Elaine is requesting a loan of 18000 PHP that will be used to repair an existing vehicle for better service. This loan will be the first loan taken out by Elaine from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family. 

About GDMPC:
GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has four branches and three unit offices covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To repair existing vehicle for better service

loans.name: Beatrice

texts.en:
Beatrice is 26 years old and married. She and her husband, Christopher Chemosong, have four children who range in age from eight to two years old. She makes a living running a posho (or corn meal) mill in Kabarnet town. Beatrice has been in this business for two years and earns a monthly income of Kshs 3,000. 

She has applied for her first loan from KADET, for Kshs 20,000, which she will use to buy maize to mill and resell to people in her area. She plans to use the additional profits made possible by this loan to buy more maize. 

Beatrice hopes to open a retail shop in the near future, and earn enough money so that her children can have as much education as possible.

loans.use: To buy maize to mill and resell

loans.name: Edwina Rosauro's Group

texts.en:
Edwina is from the village of Pob.1 Clarin, Misamis Occidental. She is 37 years old. Edwina is the group leader of this group loan offered by PMPC. While each member of the group receives an individual loan, they are all collectively responsible for paying back the loans of their fellow group members if someone is delinquent or defaults. The official name of this borrowing group is Edwina R.'s Group.

Edwina is married and has four school-aged children. To make a living, Edwina owns & operates a business venture in the food sector, making and selling food in the local community. Edwina has been engaged in her business for over 10 years and earns approximately 3,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2009, Edwina joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Edwina has successfully repaid a previous loan of 14900 PHP from PMPC. This previous loan was used to purchase ingredients needed to make product for sale. Edwina is requesting a new loan of 20,000 PHP, which will be used to invest in expanding the business. This loan will be the fifth loan taken out by Edwina from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family.

About PMPC:

Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To expand food business

loans.name: Rosenda

texts.en:
Rosenda is fifty-three years old.  She lives in the village of San Martin in the district of Tambogrande, a tropical region of northern Peru populated primarily by small farmers who raise animals and have fruit plantations.  She lives with her husband and children in a home they own. 

Rosenda manages a small general store out of the front of her home.  She sells various basic items to her neighbors, assisting them in reducing the time it takes to complete their shopping errands.  She can be found in her shop daily at almost all hours.  Her husband is a farmer.  He manages a small plot of land on which the family raises various crops throughout the year.

Rosenda's family have worked with this lender in the past.  They are well known in the region and have always used credit responsibly and repaid punctually.  Rosenda plans to use the loan to increase her stock of merchandise and to purchase fertilizers for the farm.  She is a responsible and dedicated woman who is constantly striving to get her family ahead.  She appreciates having access to credit to help her achieve her dreams.

loans.use: to purchase additional merchandise for her general store

loans.name: Emma

texts.es:
La señora Emma vive en casa de su suegra en a zona de Alto Sopocachi de la ciudad de La Paz , esta casada y el esposo es rentista jubilado.

Emma, para ayudar en la casa a la familia, vende productos Avon, Essika, Yambal donde percibe un ingreso que le ayuda para solventar algunos gastos en el hogar.

El crédito que solicita es para aumentar su capital por la época de Navidad y tener más disponibilidad de productos para sus ventas de fin de año. Para esta actividad utilizará $us 200 y los restantes $us 400 los usará para pagar la matrícula y pensión en la Universidad UNIVALLE para su hijo.

Esta es la primera vez que se aproxima a  Impro para solicitar un crédito, pero por la actividad califica para obtener uno.
texts.en:
Ms. Emma lives in her mother-in-law's house in the Alto Sopocachi zone of the city of La Paz.  She is married and her husband is a retired pensioner.

In order to help her family, she sells products from Avon, Essika, and Yanbal.  She earns income that helps cover their household expenses.

She will use this loan to increase her capital going into the Christmas season and to have more products available for her year-end sales. She will use $200 USD for this purpose and will use the remaining $400 USD to pay her son's tuition, room and board at the Univalle University.

This is her first time coming to Impro to request a loan, but she qualifies to obtain one for this purpose.

loans.use: to buy more merchandise for her beauty products business and to pay her son's university tuition

loans.name: Eduardo Rafael

texts.es:
Eduardo tiene 47 años, nació en el departamento de Chiclayo y actualmente vive junto con su esposo y sus tres hijos en el distrito de Wanchaq provincia del Cusco.

Eduardo trabaja en el ejército en el área de logística pero también tiene un pequeño negocio de venta de calzados a pedido del cliente. La mercadería lo compra del departamento de Trujillo y expende sus productos con un catalogo.    Ya son 3 años que se dedica a este negocio y le va excelente gracias al empeño que le pone a su trabajo. Con su próximo préstamo, Eduardo que espera recibir de $ 300 USD  y desea aumentar el capital del negocio y va comprar mercadería como por ejemplo zapatos. Su anhelo de Eduardo es abrir una tienda de venta zapatos.

Eduardo pertenece al banco comunal “El Templo del Inca” de la Asociación Arariwa. El banco comunal está empezando una nueva etapa y estará bien administrado por la antigua junta directiva.
texts.en:
Eduardo is 47 years old.  He was born in Chiclayo department and currently lives with his wife and three children in Wanchaq district, in Cusco province.

Eduardo's works for the army in logistics.  He also has a small business selling footwear to order.  He buys his merchandise in Trujillo department and sells his products with a catalog.  He has been in this business for 3 years and it is going very well indeed thanks to the hard work that he puts in.  Eduardo hopes to receive $300USD in his next loan and would like to increase his working capital, buying merchandise such as shoes.

Eduardo's wish is to open a shoe store.  He belongs to Asociación Arariwa's "El Templo del Inca" (The Incan Temple) community bank which is starting a new stage and will be well managed by its former board of directors.

loans.use: To buy merchandise such as shoes

loans.name: Patricia Evelyn

texts.es:
Patricia, reside en El Transito departamento de San Miguel, tiene 31 años de edad, tiene una hija de 10 años, posee un negocio de medicamentos naturales.
Actualmente está solicitando un préstamo para la compra de mercadería,  para el negocio, con esta ayuda estará fortaleciendo el inventario y podrá dar salida a la demanda de los clientes.
Su propósito es proveer del negocio los ingresos que necesita para cubrir todas sus necesidades, así también velar por el bienestar de su hija.
texts.en:
Patricia lives in El Transito, in the San Miguel department. She is 31 and has one 10-year-old daughter. She has a natural medicines business. She is requesting a loan for the purchase of merchandise for her business. With this help, she will strengthen her inventory and supply her customers' demand.
She plans to use her business to earn the necessary income to cover all of her needs and provide for her daughter's well-being.

loans.use: the purchase of natural products

loans.name: Isabel

texts.en:
Isabel B. is from the town of Tagbilaran. She is 44 years old and married. She has 5 children aged 24, 22, 20, 11 and 8. To make a living, Isabel owns & operates a tailoring business. The main source of income for the business comes from providing general  alteration & tailoring services to local community members. Isabel's husband is a fisherman who also works hard to provide for their family's needs.

Isabel joined CEVI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Isabel has successfully repaid a previous loan from CEVI. Isabel is requesting a new loan of 11000 PHP which will be used to invest in expanding the business.

loans.use: to invest in expanding the business

loans.name: Sok

texts.en:
Sok N., 42, resides with her family in Takeo Province, Cambodia, an area known for pre-angkorean temples. Sok and her husband sell duck eggs, earning an income of USD 5 each per day. Each month, the family has to spend USD 40 on food and USD 75 on other necessary expenses.

Sok is requesting a loan of USD 1000 to purchase more duck eggs to resell. In the future, she would like to use the additional income to repair her house. This will be her first from CREDIT, a long-standing Kiva partner.

loans.use: To purchase more duck eggs to sell

loans.name: Lucilo

texts.es:
Lucilo tiene 52 años y es casado. Vive con su esposa, seis de sus nueve hijos y un nieto. Vive en casa propia en el distrito de Colasay en el departamento de Cajamarca, a más de seis horas de la ciudad de Chiclayo, la capital de la región de Lambayeque. Su casa es hecha de material rústico y no cuenta con servicios básicos como luz o agua. La única fuente de agua es la que obtiene de una pequeña vertiente que pasa por su terreno.

Gana su vida dedicándose al cultivo de café, maíz, menestras y yuca. Entre los meses de abril y junio, proyecta cosechar 10 quintales de café, 15 quintales de menestras y 20 quintales de maíz. Además, cuenta con dos vacas que cría en terreno cerca de su domicilio. Cuenta con 20 años de experiencia en estos rubros.

Desea invertir una parte de su crédito en el abono de su finca de café y otra parte para la siembra de 5 mil plantones de café en un área que está preparando. Para lograr su meta, ha creído conveniente solicitar a Edpyme Alternativa un préstamo de 2000 nuevos soles.
texts.en:
Lucilo is 52 years old and he is married. He lives with his wife and six of their nine children and a grandson. He lives in his own house in the district of Colasay, in the department of Cajamarca. It is located more than six hours from the city of Chiclayo, the capital of the Lambayeque region. His house is made of very rustic materials and he doesn't have basic services such as hydro and water. His only source of water is from a small stream that passes through his land.

His earns his living by cultivating coffee, corn, beans, and yuca. Between the months of April  and June he expects to harvest 10 quintals of coffee, 15 quintals of beans, and 20 quintals of  corn. Additionally, he has two cows which he keeps in some land near his house. He has 20 years’ experience in these businesses.

He wishes to invest a part of his loan in the purchase of fertilizer for his coffee plantation,  and another part will be used to plant five thousand coffee seedlings in a piece of land he is  readying. In order to reach his goal he has approached Edpyme Alternativa (Kiva Field Partner) for a loan of 2000 nuevos soles.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizer and to plant coffee

loans.name: Good Friends Group

texts.en:
Isatu B. is the leader of this group of entrepreneurs. Isatu was born in a place call Deep Eye Water, near Freetown, about 58 years ago. She is married and has 4 children. 

This is the first loan that Isatu and her group members have applied for from SMT/Kiva lenders. With the help of this loan, they will be able to expand their businesses, make more sales and consequently improve on their living conditions. 

For over 22 years now, Isatu has been selling cigarettes, soft drinks, gari (fast food made out of cassava roots), etc.  She will use her share of the loan (SLL 600,000) to expand her business; she will buy the above mentioned items in large quantity to add to her business.

loans.use: to buy cigarettes, soft drinks, gari, etc., in large quantity

loans.name: Elma

texts.en:
Elma is a hardworking entrepreneur who buys & sells rice, charcoal & coconuts in the Philippines. 

She is borrowing PHP 25,000 through NWTF to purchase charcoal, rice & coconuts to resell.

Elma has been in this business for three years. Elma earns more income from pig fattening and also sells soft drinks and beer.

Elma has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams of saving enough so that her children could finish college.

loans.use: to purchase more charcoal, rice & coconuts

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase inventory: rice, cooking oil, seasonings, detergent, etc

loans.name: Sonia

texts.es: Sonia tiene 29 años, vive con su esposo en su casa propia. Desde que era muy niña aprendió el trabajo del campo agrícola, hoy a lado de su esposo e hijos trabajan sobre las tierras que le fue heredado por sus padres, y que saca provecho para su propia manutención y la de su familia.  Ahí cultiva papa, maíz, oca, habas entre otros productos así como pastizales que le sirve de forraje para sus animales, que son vendidos para generarse más ingresos mientras espera el tiempo de cosecha de sus productos para luego comercializarlos. Para Sonia estas actividades favorecen mucho en el progreso de su familia, por tanto ha planeado incrementar la cantidad de animales para intensificarse en esta actividad. Es su primer crédito con MFP, fue invitada a formar parte de su banco comunal porque conocen  que es una persona responsable y comprometida, por lo que  esta muy agradecida con los demás integrantes de su grupo por su parte se compromete a ser puntual en sus pagos. Con el crédito que solicita, lo invertirá en la compra de sacos de abono para sembrar nuevamente pastizales para sus animales.
texts.en: Sonia is 29 years old and she lives with her husband in a house which they own. When she was a young girl she learned about agricultural work. Today, with her husband and children by her side, she works on the land that was inherited to her by her parents. She is able to earn enough to support herself and her family. She cultivates potatoes, corn, okra, fava beans and other products, such as hay that she uses for her livestock. She sells her livestock while she waits for the harvest to be ready and to sell the products. Sonia believes that these businesses are very helpful for the progress of her family. She plans on increasing the number of livestock in order to expand the business. This is her first loan with MFP (Kiva Field Partner) and she was invited to take part in her communal bank because she is known to e a responsible and committed person. She is very thankful to the other members of the group and she is committed to be on time with her payments. She will invest the loan she requests in the purchase of fertilizers to replant hay for her livestock.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizers.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to pay for a gas balloon for his car.

loans.name: Erasmo Osmar

texts.es:
Erasmo, tiene 34 años de edad, habita en la comarca el Jicarito ubicada en el departamento de León, de oficio agricultor, el se dedica a sembrar maíz, es padre de 2 hijos de 2 y 6 años respectivamente.  El aprendió este oficio por su padre ya que también era agricultor, el recuerda que desde temprana edad su padre lo llevaba al campo para que aprendiera a preparar la tierra, desde la 4 de la mañana estaba despierto  para prepararse e irse al campo a trabajar largas jornadas, y caminar 10 km para poder llegar  hasta los terrenos de siembra, el solo estudio hasta tercer año de secundaria pues tuvo que dedicarse  a trabajar con su padre para poder comer, seguir sobreviviendo.   Cuando el cumplió 22 años de edad se independizó de su padre e inicio su propio negocios de siembras además el vende leche pues tiene dos vacas y vende leña también. El es un hombre muy trabajador que busca como sacar su familia adelante. 
El solicito el préstamo para la compra de insumos agrícolas y pago de mano de obra que va a utilizar para la siembra de 5 manzanas de maíz. Este crédito le ayudara a sembrar y obtener ganancias que le permitan ahorrar y compra tierras para siembra. En sus planes futuros quiere siempre seguir sembrando, poder comprar mas ganado y aumentar sus aéreas de siembra.
texts.en:
34-year old Erasmo lives in the Jicarito region in the department of León. He is a farmer and grows corn. He has two children aged two and six. His father taught him how to work the land as he also was a farmer. He remembers that from an early age his father used to take him to the fields and show how him how to prepare the earth. He used to wake up at four in the morning to get ready to leave for long workdays, walking 10km to get to the fields. 

Erasmo only completed third year of secondary school because he had to leave to work with his father in order to be able to eat and survive. When he was 22 years old, he left home and began to work on his own land. He also sells milk (he has two cows) and firewood.  He is a hardworking person who is trying to find ways to help his family get ahead.

The loan that Erasmo is seeking is to buy agricultural supplies and hire someone to help him sow five manzanas (one manzana = 1.68 acres) of corn. In this way the money will help him earn profits from his fields that he can save and then use to buy more land. In the future he wishes to continue farming, and buy more livestock and land.

loans.use: to buy agricultural supplies and sow five manzanas of corn

loans.name: Segundo Jose

texts.es:
Segundo tiene 37 años de edad, el es soltero, cuenta con casa propia en la cual vive con su papá y una hermana, dicha casa está ubicada en el Caserío Pueblo Libre en el distrito de Tambogrande en Piura, al norte del Perú. Segundo vive en la parte rural de este distrito, pero solo cuenta con servicio de luz a motor.

Segundo se dedica a la crianza y comercialización de ganado ovino, esta actividad la realiza desde hace 5 años. Cuenta con corrales apropiados y espaciosos. Los animales cuando alcanzan tamaño y peso ideal los comercializa en el mercado local. Segundo también se dedica a la agricultura, en una pequeña área que su padre le dado en herencia para que la trabaje, en dicho terreno cuenta con limón en producción y complementariamente es peón agrícola en los fundos del sector.

Segundo está solicitando un préstamo a Edpyme Alternativa de1000 nuevos soles para la compra de alimento balanceado para sus animales y la fertilización de sus plantas de limón.

Segundo es un hombre responsable y trabajador que con esfuerzo desea que su padre y hermana salgan adelante y que poco apoco obtengan una mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Segundo tiene 37 años de edad, el es soltero, cuenta con casa propia en la cual vive con su papá y una hermana, dicha casa está ubicada en el Caserío Pueblo Libre en el distrito de Tambogrande en Piura, al norte del Perú. Segundo vive en la parte rural de este distrito, pero solo cuenta con servicio de luz a motor.

Segundo se dedica a la crianza y comercialización de ganado ovino, esta actividad la realiza desde hace 5 años. Cuenta con corrales apropiados y espaciosos. Los animales cuando alcanzan tamaño y peso ideal los comercializa en el mercado local. Segundo también se dedica a la agricultura, en una pequeña área que su padre le dado en herencia para que la trabaje, en dicho terreno cuenta con limón en producción y complementariamente es peón agrícola en los fundos del sector.

Segundo está solicitando un préstamo a Edpyme Alternativa de1000 nuevos soles para la compra de alimento balanceado para sus animales y la fertilización de sus plantas de limón.

Segundo es un hombre responsable y trabajador que con esfuerzo desea que su padre y hermana salgan adelante y que poco apoco obtengan una mejor calidad de vida.

loans.use: Compra de alimento para sus animales y compra de fertilizantes para su cultivo.

loans.name: Subdra

texts.en:
Subdra is 40 years old. She is married and has three children, aged 15, 10 and 5. In 2000, she established  her cow-raising business. Working seven days a week and four hours a day, she supports her family.  

She has already received and successfully repaid three loans from Patan BPW and used her most recent to buy a young milk-giving cow. In the future, Subdra plans to uplift the economic conditions of her family. She thanks you for your support. 

Dairy cows are an important source of nutrition and income in Nepal. Cows are never raised for beef, but for their milk, from which curd (duy) and fresh cheese (paneer) are made. Jersey cows are the preferred breed for milking. On average, a dairy cow in Nepal will produce about 10 liters of milk each day. In the local market, a liter of milk sells for about USD $0.50. In addition to producing milk, cows provide dung that is used in home construction, as fuel for fires, and can be captured in methane storage tanks. The purchase of a dairy cow, made possible through a Kiva loan, is an investment that will repay itself many times over.

loans.use: to buy a young cow.

loans.name: Tendo Winner's Group

texts.en:
Retailing is one business genre that appeals to many prospective business people in Uganda. By and large, many Ugandans find this kind of business much easier to start up and maintain unlike other business sectors, which require substantial start up and operating capital.

One Ugandan who has found retail trading worthwhile the last two decades is 54 year old Wilfred, who is a widower and father of 5, and who operates in Kayunga. Wilfred sells a variety of general merchandise retail commodities such as sugar, salt, plastics, rice, beans, cooking oil, bread, etc. Wilfred also does agriculture as a side source of income. 190,000 Ugandan shillings is what this business generates for him on a monthly basis.

With this kiva loan, Wilfred says he is going to purchase more retail commodities such as sugar, beans, rice, maize flour, cooking oil and bread to resell in his shop.

loans.use: to purchase more retail commodities such as sugar, beans, rice, maize flour, cooking oil, and bread to resell in his shop.

loans.name: María Dayce

texts.es:
El Grupo De Crédito María Auxiliadora se reúne en La parroquia La Sequita que  pertenece al cantón Montecristi prospero cantón manabita, conocido como la cuna  del viejo luchador Eloy Alfaro y por los famosos sombreros de paja toquilla que son apreciados dentro y fuera del país.

En este lugar vive la señora Dayce, tiene 51 años de edad, y mantiene una relación de unión libre de la cual tiene cinco hijos todos mayores de edad, el menor de ellos que es soltero aun vive con ella. El esposo es comerciante.

Ella es una muy buena ama de casa y esposa que realiza el crédito para ayudar a su esposo en su negocio, el se dedica a la venta de frutas, legumbres y verduras, su esposo se desplaza de madrugada a comprar verduras y frutas en los campos cercanos y algunos otros productos en el mercado de mayoristas en Portoviejo para luego recorrer sus productos en su carro por toda la ciudad de Manta,  esto lo realiza cinco días a la semanas y viene realizando esta actividad por más de 20 años.

Este crédito lo va a emplear en comprar frutas, verduras y legumbres. Lleva más de 10 años en el Grupo De Crédito y le gusta porque a través de los créditos ella puede ayudar a su esposo.

Su sueño es comprar otro carro ya que el que tienen está muy deteriorado.
texts.en:
The María Auxiliadora (Mary Help of Christians) Loan Group meets in La Sequita parish, which belongs to Montecristi Canton, a flourishing canton in Manabi, known as the birthplace of the Viejo Luchador ("Old Fighter" and a former president of Ecuador) Eloy Alfaro, and known for its famous Panama hats, which are known in and outside of the country.

Dayce lives here. She is 51 years old and is in an open relationship, from which she has five grown children. The youngest, who is a single man, still lives with her. Her husband is a businessman.

She is a very good housekeeper and wife who is getting the loan to help her husband with his business. He sells fruits, legumes and vegetables. Our friend Dayce tells us that he leaves at dawn to buy fruits and vegetables at the nearby farms and to buy some other products at the wholesale market in Portoviejo. He later takes these products through the whole city of Manta in his car. He does this five days per week and has been working in this business for more than 20 years.

They will use this loan to buy fruits, vegetables and legumes. Dayce has been in the Loan Group for more than ten years, and she likes it because she can help her husband through the loans.

Her dream is to buy another car since the one they have is in very poor condition.

loans.use: to buy fruits, vegetables and legumes.

loans.name: Breyner

texts.es:
Breyner de 28 años de edad, vive con su esposa e hijos en su casa propia, no cuenta con servicios básicos, ubicada en la zona rural del distrito de Tambogrande que pertenece al departamento de Piura.  Esta zona es agrícola, ganadera y artesana.

Breyner se dedica a la agricultura, tiene sus propias tierras de cultivo donde siembra limón, actividad que realiza desde hace 4 años, además de ser productos consumido diariamente por las personas, una vez que realiza su cosecha lo comercializa en los diferentes mercados de la zona y fuera de ella,  con los ingresos que adquiera puede brindarles una mejor calidad de vida a sus hijos y esposa.  También cría y vende animales de corral (ovinos y pavos), una vez que los engorda los comercializa a sus clientes y obtiene otro ingreso para su hogar.

Ha solicitado un préstamo a Edpyme Alternativa de 500 nuevos soles para comprar fertilizantes para mejorar su cosecha de limón y alimentos balanceados para sus animales, con las ganancias que obtenga de ambas actividades podrá pagar su crédito y solventar las necesidades diarias de su familia.  Breyner con trabajo y dedicación le brinda lo mejor a sus hijos, con la intensión de que ellos se puedan defender en la  vida y logren todos sus objetivos.
texts.en:
Breyner is 28. He lives with his wife and children in his own house which has no basic services. He lives in the rural district of Tambogrande in the department of Piura. This district is devoted to agriculture, livestock and crafts.

Breyner works in agriculture. He has his own farmland where he has grown lemons for the last 4 years. In addition to being used on a daily basis, the lemons once harvested can be sold at different markets in the area and beyond. With the revenue gained, he can offer his wife and children a better quality of life. He also raises and sells livestock (sheep and turkeys). Once fattened, he sells them to his customers as another source of income for his household.

He has asked Edpyme Alternativa for a loan of 500 nuevos soles (PEN) to buy fertilizers to improve his lemon crop and nutritionally-balanced feed for his livestock. With the profits obtained from both these ventures, he will be able to pay off his loan and cover his family's daily needs. Breyner does his best for his children by working hard and with commitment. He does this so that they will be able to take care of themselves in the future and achieve all they set themselves to.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers to improve his land and nutritionally-balanced feed for his livestock.

loans.name: Veronicah

texts.en: Veronicah is 28 years old and a single-mother of an eight-year-old child.  She has been operating a grocery shop to earn a living.  Her business is five years old and she has employed one person. She is also employed. Since she joined Faulu Kenya, she has been economically empowered. Veronicah hopes to improve her business and become financially stable in the future. She needs 30,000 Kenya shillings to buy fruits and vegetables.

loans.use: To buy fruits and vegetables

loans.name: Soth

texts.en:
Soth, 41 years old, sells eggs earning $10 per day. Her husband is a carpenter with $4 per day for his income. She has two children, and both of them are studying. Every month, she has to spend $66 on food, $5 on electricity, and $10 for other expenses. She would like to request a loan of $1000 to buy a motorbike for her husband's motor taxi service.

 In the future, she wants to have a better store where she can sell eggs. For her children, she wants to support them to study until they finish university so that they can get a good job to do.

loans.use: To buy a motorbike for her husband's motor taxi service.

loans.name: Rosamie

texts.en:
Rosamie wakes up early in the morning to cook foods, selling menus and snack foods from a cart that she pulls around their village. In the afternoon, she offers manicure and pedicure services to her village customers.

With a strong desire to uplift her family's living conditions and finance her children's education until college, Rosamie continues her daily routine, steadily earning higher returns on the business. She dreams of buying a sewing machine to create an additional source of income for the family.

Rosamie needs more working capital in order to expand her services in their village. She is requesting a loan of P6,000 to buy spices, meat, carrots and potatoes that she will use to cook more foods to sell.

loans.use: to buy spices, meat, carrots and potatoes that will used in cooking foods.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To pay for food preparation equipment.

loans.name: Erlinda

texts.en:
Erlinda is married with six children. She is a very hard-working entrepreneur. Erlinda is 38 years old and two of her children are in school.

Erlinda has a fishing business in the Philippines. She requested a loan of 15,000 Philippines pesos (PHP) through NWTF to buy a new engine for her fishing boat.

Erlinda has been in this business for 15 years. She would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: To buy new engine for her fishing boat.

loans.name: Radegunda

texts.en: Radegunda is 53 years old. She is married with six children. Radegunda has a shop that sells ready-to-wear items like shirts and pants and home products like plastic wares, plates, and more. She has had this business for seven years. She requested a loan of PHP 20,000 to purchase additional items to sell. Radegunda has been a member of HSPFI since 2006. In the future, Radegunda hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: To purchase more items like plastic wares and ready-to-wear items

loans.name: Edward

texts.en:
Edward is 51 years-old. He is married to Millicent and together they have four children aged 30, 26, 23 and 20 years-old.

He works in a quarry besides keeping poultry. He has been in the business for the past two years. He gets a monthly income of KES 15,000 from his business.

This is his first loan term from Kiva partner KADET LTD. He will use the loan to purchase another quarry.  He will use the anticipated profit to expand his poultry business. His dream is to become a chicken supplier  to large hotels

loans.use: to purchase another quarry.

loans.name: Virgen Las Mercedes Group

texts.es:
El Comité “ Virgen las Mercedes" es un grupo del Programa D. Comité D. Mujeres D. la Fundación Paraguaya, está conformado por 10 integrantes que viven en el barrio Virgen las Mercedes D. la ciudad D. Curuguaty.  Ellas realizan actividades en manera conjunta para poder desarrollarse íntegramente dentro del programa y ayudarse las unas a las otras.
Una D. las miembros es Dora, ella tiene un copetín (lugar D. venta D. comidas rápidas) bien cargado con mucha variedad D. comestibles. Gracias a este negocio ella obtiene el dinero necesario para ayudar a su familia y cubrir los gastos que diariamente surgen en la casa.
Ella solicita el crédito para la compra D. galletitas, golosinas, gaseosas y demás productos para vender en su copetín. Agradece la ayuda que le brinda la fundación para con su negocio.
texts.en:
The communal bank “ Virgen las Mercedes" is a group that belongs to the Programa D. Comité D. Mujeres D. la Fundación Paraguaya. It consists of 10 members who live in the neighbourhood of the Virgen las Mercedes in the city of Curuguaty. They jointly undertake activities in order to develop fully within the program and help one another.

One of the members is Dora. She has a snack store ( a place that sells fast food) well stocked with a great variety of products. Thanks to this business she makes the money necessary to help her family and cover the daily household expenses.

She is asking for a loan to buy cookies, candies, soft drinks and other products to sell in her store. She is grateful for the help given her and her business by the Fundacion.

loans.use: to buy cookies, candies, soft drinks and other products.

loans.name: John

texts.en:
John is 66 years old. He is married to Lucia and they have two children. For the past eight years, he has been in the livestock sales business in Olkalau town. John was introduced to KADET LTD by an existing client and this will be his first loan.  

John is requesting a loan to buy sheep to raise and sell and later to buy a dairy cow. In the future, he hopes to purchase more dairy cows and sustain his milk production business.

loans.use: to buy sheep

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase cosmetics, equipment and supplies.

loans.name: Martha Cecilia

texts.es:
Martha es una persona de 52 años, es divorciada y tiene 4 hijos, vive en Ibarra en la Provincia de Imbabura al Norte de Ecuador. Martha es una persona emprendedora y luchadora, estuvo enferma pero la necesidad y las ganas de salir adelante le ayudaron a recuperarse rápido.

Martha tiene un pequeño negocio de frutas junto al mercado, negocio que le ayuda a obtener ingresos para poder mantener a su familia, lo cual tuvo la necesidad de realizar un nuevo crédito en Fodemi que va a invertir en la compra de bananos, papayas, tomates, limones , entre otros que le ayudarán a surtir su negocio y que mejorarán su ingresos económicos.

Su sueño es progresar en su negocio y ayudarle a su hija impulsandole para que forme su propio negocio.
texts.en:
Martha is a 52 years old. She is divorced and has 4 children. She lives in the province of Imbabura in northern Ecuador. Martha is an enterprising person who is a fighter. She was sick, but need and a desire to get ahead helped her recover more quickly.

Martha has a small business selling fruit next to the market. The business helps her obtain income to be able to support her family It was necessary for her to take out a loan again with Fodemi, which she is going to invest in buying bananas, papayas, tree tomatoes, lemons and more which will help her stock her business and improve her income. 

Her dream is to progress in her business and help her daughter, encouraging her to start her own business.

loans.use: to buy fruit such as bananas, papayas, tree tomatoes, and lemons to grow her business.

loans.name: Joseph Mbaabu

texts.en: Joseph is married and has two children, ages five and sixteen years. He is an ambitious man. He runs three businesses:  a cattle sales business, a grocery store, and a retail store.  He has been running these businesses for the last fifteen years. Joseph has one employee. His business challenge is the high cost of home products and vegetables when buying.   He will use the loan for Kes 20,000 to buy more home products and vegetables. Joseph hopes and plans to diversify his businesses in the next five years.

loans.use: buy home products and vegetables

loans.name: Maria Del Carmen

texts.es:
María, de nuevo solicita un préstamo debido a la buena atención que les brida nuestra institución y por la necesidad de mejorar en su granja, comprara tres cerdos para engordarlos y luego venderlos al mercado esperando darlos a buen precio.
Los prestamos anteriores le beneficiaron porque le permitió crecer en su negocio y mejoraron mucho sus ingresos ya actualmente están en mejores condiciones de vida.
texts.en:
María has just asked for a loan due to the good service provided by our institution as well as the need to improve her farm. She will buy three pigs to raise and later sell in the market, and she is hoping to sell them at a good price. 

Previous loans benefited her because they allowed her to grow her business and greatly increase her income. Now her family has a better quality of life.

loans.use: to buy three pigs to raise and later sell.

loans.name: Adela Paulina

texts.es: La señora Adela es cliente antigua de nuestra institución, viene trabajando con bancos de emprendimiento desde el año 2006 en el grupo PIO XII, es una de las integrantes mas responsables del grupo, la señora Adela vive en la zona de barrio municipal, su familia la  integran de tres integrantes con sus dos hijos que se encuentran en edad escolar y ella, hace mas de un año se separó de su pareja ella tiene su pensión donde cocina almuerzos y  por las noches vende silpanchos de miércoles a domingo y los días lunes y martes trabaja de limpieza en una empresa donde tiene un buen ingreso por los dos días que solo son por la mañana. Ella en este momento quiere el dinero para la compra de heladera y otros artículos para su negocio y compra de insumos por mayor motivo por el cual se solicita el crédito y se siente muy feliz y agradecida con la institución por brindarle  un apoyo cuando mas lo necesita.
texts.en: Adela is a long time client of our institution. She has been working with 'Bancos de Emprendimiento' since 2006, in the group PIO XII. She is one of the most responsible members of her group. Adela lives in the area of the municipal district. In her family there are three members, her two school aged children and herself. More than a year ago she separated from her partner. She has a small restaurant out of her home where she cooks lunch and on Wednesday thru Sunday nights she makes 'silpanchos' [a traditional Bolivian dish that consists of rice, boiled potatoes, a thin schnitzel-style meat, chopped tomato, onion and parsley and topped with a fried egg]. Monday and Tuesday mornings she provides cleaning service to a business, and for the small amount of time makes a good income. Right now she wants the money to buy a refrigerator and other items for her business and to buy supplies at wholesale.  This is why she has asked for the loan and she is very happy and grateful to the institution for providing support when she needs it the most.

loans.use: to purchase appliances (refrigerator) and supplies at wholesale

loans.name: Benkadi Group

texts.fr:
Les dix membres du groupe BENKADI   sont des femmes mariées avec une moyenne d’âge de 32 ans et  en moyenne  3 enfants. Elles vivent la plupart dans des  familles monogamiques au quartier  SANOUBOUGOU MILIONKIN   un des quartiers populaires de la ville de Sikasso 
Elles sont à leur deuxième prêt  avec l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso, dans le souci de satisfaire le besoin de leur clientèle.
MINATA  fait le commerce de TISSUS dans ce groupe de femmes. Elle est debout au milieu.
Elle compte acheter avec son  prêt  50 pagnes wax  et revend en détail  sur place  et au marché à une clientèle composée de femmes au comptant. 
Elle  envisage réaliser un bénéfice mensuel moyen de 20 000 FCFA  dont une partie est  utilisée  pour payer le prêt et son intérêt et l’autre pour son épargne .
Elle ambitionne d’augmenter son chiffre d’affaire pour mieux satisfaire sa clientèle.

loans.use: Pour acheter des pagnes wax

loans.name: Ester

texts.en:
Ester works hard to support her family. Ester is married and has a fish vending business in the Philippines.

She requested a PHP 30000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional boxes of fish to sell.

Ester has been in this business for 20 years now.

In the future, Ester would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase additional boxes of fish to sell

loans.name: Graciela Gomez

texts.en:
I started my business just as a take-out restaurant for local catrachos*, but I have expanded to sell other packaged products that my customers want. I think my business is successful because my customers like how I treat them.

*A Honduran can be called a Catracho or Catracha. The comes from the last name of Honduran General Florencio Xatruch, who led Honduran armed forces in defense of Honduran territories in 1857 against an attempted invasion led by a North American named William Walker. The nickname is considered complimentary, not derogatory so when you come to Graciela's we will say `Hola catracho!

loans.use: Working capital

loans.name: Dora María

texts.en:
Dora and her husband live alone in the city of Querétaro; they have no children and are an elderly couple. A few years ago, she began to sell second-hand clothing in local markets, as her husband lost his job and they had no income. The business has brought them the resources they need to survive, covering their most basic necessities.

The struggle has not been easy, and she now needs a loan of $750 to acquire more merchandise and increase her revenue. They need your support, so don't let them struggle alone. They sincerely appreciate your help.

Translated from Spanish by Leo Duran, Kiva Volunteer.

Doña Dora y su esposo viven solos en la localidad de Querétaro, pues no tiene hijos y ya son personas de edad avanza. Hace varios años ella comenzó a vender ropa usada en los mercados de la localidad, pues su esposo se quedó sin empleo y no tenían más ingresos. Es así como esta actividad le ha brindado los recursos necesarios para sobrevivir, cubriendo sus necesidades más elementales.

La lucha no ha sido fácil y ahora ella necesita de un crédito de $ 750 DLLS para poder comprar más mercancía e incrementar sus ingresos. Ellos necesitan de tu apoyo, no los dejes solos, ellos te agradecen sinceramente tu apoyo.

loans.use: Purchase merchandise

loans.name: Leala

texts.en: Leala is a 45-year old woman with six grown children and numerous grandchildren.  She began a small vegetable farm six years ago to supply her flea market stand with fresh vegetables.  Her entrepreneurial success has enabled her to provide an improved standard of living and a good education for children.  Leala is now seeking to expand her vegetable farm and increase the variety and supply of goods that she brings to the flea market for her customers.  A loan to Leala would help her purchase the vegetable seeds and fertilizers she needs to expand her business.  Additionally, Leala takes great pride in her home, and she plans to use a portion of loan proceeds to effect some improvements to the roof and floor of her house and upgrade some of her home furnishings.

loans.use: :  Buy agricultural supplies and perform home improvements

loans.name: Betty

texts.en: Betty N. is a 30-year old entrepreneur and mother of three school-aged children.  She and her husband live in Bware Migori, Kenya.  Betty is a very hardworking entrepreneur who runs three businesses all in one location. She initiated her current businesses ( posho mill, retail shop, and a community pharmacy) in the year 2006. All her businesses are the only ones in the area. She used the funds from her first loan to invest in the shop where she sells the daily necessities, like bread, flour, cooking oil and soap. At her pharmacy she sells a wide range of fast moving drugs such as those for painkillers, antimalarials, family planning drugs, and drugs for worms and various syrups for children. Betty has employed three people to assist her in running her businesses.   She requires US $ 600 to purchase a new posho mill that can cope up with the demand.

loans.use: Purchase modern posho mill

loans.name: Marcelino

texts.es:
“My wife and I prepare food and go out to sell them in the streets in a Troca Van that we have, but it creates problems to transport the food and keep them warm enough to sell. We would like to purchase a mobile stall so we can sell them in one place and we can bring this stall around to other places to sell the food. I would like a loan of $1200 to buy a mobile stall.”

Translated from Spanish by Geraldine Kim, Kiva volunteer.

“Mi esposa y yo preparamos comida y salimos a venderla a la calle en una Troca Van que tenemos pero se nos dificulta mucho transportarla y que llegue caliente para venderla, nos gustaría comprar un puesto móvil para poder vender en un lugar y poder transportarnos a otros lugares a vender la comida”. Solicito $ 1,200.00 dlls para la compra del puesto móvil.

loans.use: To buy a mobile stall

loans.name: Try

texts.en: Mrs. Try M., age 24, works with her husband to make chopping boards to sell to wholesalers, earning about $3 per day. They have three children, two of whom are students and one of whom is too young to attend school. In order to increase the number of cutting boards they can make, she would like to request a loan of $200 to purchase additional wood, saws, and other tools for their business. Selling these additional cutting boards will increase revenue and help pay for her children’s education.

loans.use: To purchase materials to make chopping boards

loans.name: Mahmadusuf

texts.ru:
Mahmadusuf S., 23, has a college degree in teaching. Mahmadusuf owns a store in the village of Samoni, Bokhtarsky region—15 km from the center of Kurgan-Tube. Mahmadusuf sells clothing for adults and children, kitchenware and other essential items. He has been in business for 6 years. Mahmadusuf plans to use the loan to purchase new inventory to generate more sales. The residents of Samoni, Mahmadusuf’s main customers, would benefit from having more items to choose from at the local store. Mahmadusuf plans to repay the loan within 3 months.

Translated from Russian by Aleksandr Zhuk, Kiva Volunteer.

Солиев Махмадюсуф, возраст – 23 года, образование высшее педагогическое. Махмадюсуф имеет свой магазин в посёлке Сомони, Бохтарского района, который находится в 15 км от центра города Курган-Тюбе. Товар которым он торгует это детские и взрослые вещи, кухонная утварь и другие вещи первой необходимости. Этим видом деятельности он занимается уже в течение 6 лет. На полученный кредит он планирует приобрести новый ассортимент товара, тем самым увеличив свой товарооборот. Основными его покупателями являются жители посёлка Сомони и близлежащих населенных пунктов, которые расположены ещё дальше от центра города. Увеличив свой ассортимент товара он даст возможность местным жителям приобретать необходимые им вещи и товары необходимые для ведения домашнего хозяйства при этом не покидая пределы своего района, при этом не неся дополнительных денежных и временных затрат. Клиент планирует выплатить кредит в течение 3 месяцев.

loans.use: Increase sales volume

loans.name: Yovana's Group

texts.es:
Victoria is 25 years and is single, while Nelly and Yovana are both 29 years old and each has 1 child. They are partners of the Communal Bank Florecer and joined 3, 4, 3 years ago respectively. The Communal Bank wants all partners to be happy, united and to also learn to be punctual and responsible.

Yovana has a grocery store that she opened 2 years ago with a capital of 300 suns and sold only a few products, but now her business has grown and she has many customers.

Victoria, along with her mom, have a sales post in the grocery market Carmen Alto. Her mom travels to fairs to buy cereal, which she then grinds, and sells at their post.

Nelly sells candy at the door of Jose Condorcanqui Carmen Alto College, and also sells "salchipapas" at night at Avenue Libertadores.

Their loans are 600 soles each, which will be invested in the purchase of beans, barley, wheat, corn, peas, potatoes, oil, disposable dishes, cookies, candies, chocolates, rice, sugar, soap, milk, oil and panetones . The dreams of Yovana, Victoria and Nelly are buying a plot of land on which to build their own house someday. They dream of living happily with their husbands (and future husbands) and children. They want their children to grow and become professionals.

Translated from Spanish by Mayra Gould, Kiva volunteer.

Victoria tiene 25 años y es soltera, mientras que Nelly y Yovana tienen 29 años y cada una tiene 1 hijo. Ellas son socias del Banco Comunal Florecer hace 3, 4, 3 años respectivamente. En el Banco Comunal todas las socias son alegres, unidas y además aprenden a ser puntuales y responsables. Yovana tiene una tienda de abarrotes que inició hace 2 años con un capital de 300 soles y solo vendía pocos productos, pero en la actualidad su negocio ha crecido y tiene muchos clientes. Por otro lado Victoria junto a su mamá tienen un puesto de venta de abarrotes en el mercado de Carmen Alto y también su mamá viaja a las ferias a traer cereales para luego elaborar molidos y luego venderlos en su puesto. Mientras que Nelly vende golosinas en la puerta del colegio José Condorcanqui de Carmen Alto, y además vende salchipapas por las noches en la Av. Libertadores. Sus préstamos son de 600 soles cada una, que serán invertidos en la compra de haba, cebada, trigo, maíz, arveja, papa, aceite, platos descartables, galletas, caramelos, chocolates, arroz, azúcar, jabón, leche, aceite y panetones. Los sueños de Yovana, Victoria y Nelly son comprar un terreno y luego construir su casa, vivir feliz con su esposo e hijo, casarse y tener una familia y que sus hijos sean profesionales.

loans.use:
The loans will be used for investing in the purchase of beans, barley, wheat, corn, peas, potatoes, oil, disposable dishes, cookies, candies, chocolates, rice, sugar, soap, milk, oil and panetones . 
(Sus préstamos son de 600 soles cada una, que serán invertidos en la compra de haba, cebada, trigo, maíz, arveja, papa, aceite, platos descartables, galletas, caramelos, chocolates, arroz, azúcar, jabón, leche, aceite y panetones.)

loans.name: Rolando

texts.es:
Mr Rolando lives with his family in the Santo Domingo neighborhood in Managua. He is a merchant who has a grocery store in his house. He runs this business along with his wife. She is a housekeeper and also dedicates herself to the care of their children. Mr Rolando asks for a loan to purchase basic grains and perishable goods for his business. This will allow him to support his children's education. Mr Rolando is a very venturous man. In two years he has built his business and little by little has increased the variety and quantity of his products.

Translated from Spanish by Marco Alves, Kiva Volunteer.

Don Rolando habita junto a su familia en el Barrio Santo Domingo de Managua. Es un comerciante que tiene una pulpería en su casa de habitación, negocio que lleva adelante día a día con su esposa, ella es ama de casa y se dedica también al cuido de sus hijos. Don Rolando necesita el crédito para comprar granos básicos y productos perecederos para su hogar, ya que por la época escolar necesita dinero para poder brindarles a sus dos pequeños educación. Don Rolando es un hombre muy emprendedor en 2 años ha podido llevar adelante este negocio y hacerlo crecer cada vez un poco más en variedad y cantidad de productos.

loans.use: To purchase basic grains and perishable goods

loans.name: Em

texts.en: Mrs. Em K., 53, works as a vendor of grocery products makes on average $2 a day of profit. Her husband Mr. Sous Ton, 51, is a pig raiser, earning about $2 a day of profit. They has five children two of who works in the factory typically earns $60 each a month. This couple is in needs of some money about $250 to breed the pigs. To purchase more pigs they are now requesting a loan from Kiva around $250.

loans.use: This couple hopes to use this loan to purchase more pigs to breed.

loans.name: Austine .

texts.en: Austine T. E. is 29 years old, married and has 2 children. He resides in Benin-City, Edo state, Nigeria. Austine sell male and female clothes and shoes and has been in this business since 2005. He needs a loan of $875 to buy more clothes and shoes for sale.

loans.use: To buy more clothes and shoes for sale.

loans.name: Aida

texts.en:
Mambo (Hello!) from Mbeya, Tanzania! This is 40-year-old Aida M.. She is married and has four children between the ages of 4 and 15.

In 2005, Aida established her fish business. Aida requires a loan in order to purchase additional stocks of fish in bulk for resale. She thanks you for your support.

SELFINA is engaged in the economic empowerment of women in Tanzania through the provision of a leasing and leaseback microfinance facility as a practical way to achieve the economic and social emancipation of women.

SELFINA has taken a leading role as a pioneer of microcredit in Tanzania through micro-leasing. Because customs and traditions in Tanzania normally make it difficult for women to own land and assets, the women lack tangible collateral assets, and financial institutions do not consider them to be credit-worthy. This leads to poor financial support and, as a result, limited access to basic needs and services for women with low incomes.

SELFINA buys and leases equipment to women. When a client needs working capital, SELFINA buys the equipment from the client, extends a loan to her, and then leases back the same equipment – a process called a "sale and leaseback" arrangement.

loans.use: To purchase fish in bulk.

loans.name: Flor

texts.es:
Flor belongs to the Las Dalinas 2 Communal Bank, located in Market #5 in the Calleria District of the Department of Ucayali. She is 37 years old and a mother of three; her husband is an electrician. With the first loan she received from Manuela Ramos of 300 soles, Flor decided to invest in a business to sell miscellaneous household and sewing items.

Today, Flor owns a stand in one of the markets of our city. Each day, before opening her stand, she prepares breakfast for her children, drops them off at school, then goes to work. In the evening, she helps her kids with their homework and talks to her husband about what happened during their respective days.

With this loan of 800 soles, which will be paid back within 6 months, Flor will buy rubber bands, glue, underwear, silk lace, notebooks, zippers, buttons, cosmetics, needles, etc.

Flor wants to provide her children with the best. She believes it is very important to grow a bit each day in order to continue to improve as an entrepreneur and a working woman.

Translated by Cynthia McMurry, Kiva volunteer

La señora Flor pertenece al Banco Comunal Las Dalinas 2, ubicado en el Mercado N° 3, del Distrito de Calleria del Departamento de Ucayali. Tiene 37 años y es madre de 3 hijos, su esposo es técnico electricista, es así que Flor con el primer préstamo recibido de Manuela Ramos S/. 300 decidió invertirlo en un negocio de venta de pasamanería.

En la actualidad tiene un puesto de venta en uno de los mercados de nuestra ciudad, antes de irse a abrir su puesto prepara el desayuno de sus hijos los lleva al colegio y de ahí se dirige a trabajar, por las noches ayuda a sus hijos a hacer sus tareas, conversa con su esposo lo que les paso durante el día.

Con este préstamo de S/. 800 el cual será pagado en 6 meses, comprará: elásticos, pegamentos, ropa interior, blondas, papelotes, cuadernos, cierres, botones, cosméticos, agujas, etc.

Flor quiere brindar lo mejor a sus hijos, para ella es muy importante seguir creciendo cada día mas para seguir mejorando como empresaria y mujer trabajadora.

loans.use: Purchase more merchandise to sell

loans.name: Him

texts.en: Him S., 33, is married and lives with her three young children in the Kampong Cham province. She is a farmer who works for less than US$1 each day, while her husband works in construction making US$5 each day. The weather conditions have been difficult for farming in Cambodia this past year and inflation has caused food prices to skyrocket. These factors have played into a difficult economic year for many Cambodians, Him S. included. In light of these economic difficulties, she is asking for a loan of US$250 to expand her farmland. In order to increase her profits and possibly raise her standard of living, she would like to purchase more land to produce rice with the loan given to her through CREDIT.

loans.use: Purchase farmland

loans.name: Thi Kim's Group

texts.vi:
Mrs. T. thi Kim was born in 1962. She wants to borrow 3,604,000 VND (equivalent to 215 USD) to buy wood for her son to carve at home. Her husband is a communal police officer, who gets a very consistent source of income. Mrs. Kim works all day in the steel factory. During free time, she helps her son in his carving factory. On average, her family income is about 4,500,000 VND (equivalent to 265 USD) per month. Microfinance institutions such as TYM Fund allow Mrs. Kim to have small repayments. This is one idea that Mrs. Kim likes the most because it helps her to save more. Mrs. Kim's group includes:

T. Thi Xam (born in 1966), D. Thi Chinh (born in 1971), D. Thi Thong (born in 1960), and L. Thi Nghia (born in 1973), each wants to borrow 3,604,000 VND (equivalent to 215 USD) to invest in their wood carving business.

V. Thi Nghien (born in 1960) with the loan mount of 3,604,000 VND (equivalent to 215 USD) to sell chicken and eggs.

Translated from Vietnamese by Phuong Nguyen, Kiva's Volunteer.

Trương Thị Kim, sinh năm 1962 (Ms 03070017), mức vay: 3.604.000 vnđ để đầu tư làm đồ gỗ cho con trai làm tại nhà.Chồng chị là công an xã có lương ổn định, bản thân chị hàng ngày đi làm tại xưởng sắt. Những lúc nhàn rỗi, chị lại giúp con đục gọt tại xưởng gỗ. Thu nhập bình quân của gia đình chị khoảng 4.500.000 vnđ. Với những khoản vốn vay trả dần, chị rất thích vì giúp chị tiết kiệm tiền. Nhóm vay vốn của chị có sáu người đó là: Trương Thị Xâm, sinh năm 1966(Ms 03070018), mức vay: 3.604.000 vnđ để đầu tư làm đồ gỗ. Đỗ Thị Chình, sinh năm 1971(Ms 03070022), mức vay: 3.604.000 vnđ để đầu tư làm đồ gỗ. Đỗ Thị Thông, sinh năm 1960 (Ms 03070021), mức vay: 3.604.000 vnđ để đầu tư làm đồ gỗ. Lê Thị Nghĩa, sinh năm 1973 (Ms 03070019), mức vay: 3.604.000 vnđ để kinh doanh đồ gỗ, Vương Thị Nghiên, sinh năm 1960 (Ms 03070020), mức vay: 3.604.000 vnđ để đi chợ gà, chợ trứng.

loans.use: sản xuất

loans.name: Mosi's Sisi Kwa Sisi Group

texts.en:
Mosi is 30 years old and married with 4 children, aged between 14 and 7. She also takes care of 4 other people between 20 and 60 years old. She has been a perfume seller since 2005. Every day she works from 7 AM to 4 PM at her business and can earn a monthly profit of about $60 from her sales.

Mosi now hopes for a loan to buy more items for her business. She will share this loan with her subgroup members, who also have businesses dealing with food sales, firewood and charcoal sales, and clothes sales.

loans.use: To increase her inventory.

loans.name: Florence

texts.fr: Née le 04 mars 1982, dame A. Florence est célibataire et vit actuellement avec ses parents. Elle vend des produits de consommation courante tels que lait concentré, lait en poudre, biscuits , bonbons, savons et autres qu'elle achète au marché Dantokpa de Cotonou. Elle distribue ses produits dans une boutique devant la maison de ses parents. Pour diversifier ses activités et pour augmenter son stock elle a fait recours au prêt.
texts.en:
Florence A. was born on March 04, 1982. She is single and lives with her parents. She sells basic consumer products such as concentrated milk, powered milk, biscuits, candies, soaps and other items that she buys from the Dantokpa market in Cotonou. She sells these products from a stall located in the front of her parents house. Florence requires this loan to increase her stock and diversify her business activities.

Translated from French by David Gibbons, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase 10 boxes of concentrated milk, 120 boxes of powered milk, and candies

loans.name: Ruzigul

texts.en:
Ruzigul Y. is 52 years old. She is married and is the loving mother of four children.

Since childhood, Ruzigul has worked on a farm. She is disciplined and dedicated. She is a strong-willed woman with sound morals, a good heart and good energy. She gets strength and energy from her grandchildren, who come to visit her often. She is very active in her community and would like to develop her leadership skills further. Recently, the town people selected her as their representative in the community. Since then she has been able to achieve many things that benefit the entire community.

In order to support her family, she raises cows and sheep. She began this business 8 years ago with only one calf. As time has gone by, she has expanded her business. Currently she has four bulls and a calf. Today she wants to expand her business. She wants to purchase a small milking cow so she can sell the milk for profit and also fatten her animals. For this reason she is requesting 2500 Somoni ($750 USD) for the term of 12 months. The well-being of this family is in your hands.

loans.use: To purchase cattle to breed and sell

loans.name: 41-Quảng Hưng Group

texts.en:
Loan Group 41 consists of 5 poor women who live in Village 3, Quang Hung Commune in Thanh Hoa City.  Thanh Hoa City is the provincial capital of Thanh Hoa province, one of the poorest provinces in Vietnam. It is located approximately 150 kilometers south of Hanoi, the capital of Vietnam. 

Mrs Chung is the lead borrower of the group.  She is 37 years old, and has a husband and children. During the day, she works in the Le Mom Industrial Zone.  

As with her previous loans, all of which have been fully repaid, Mrs Chung will use the funds from this loan to buy and raise pigs and chickens. Her share of the loan will probably be sufficient to buy 3 pigs and 50 chicken. With the profits from selling eggs and the animals themselves, she intends to improve her family’s life.  

The loan will be split equally between all five borrowers. The other borrowers in the group will use their share of the loan for similar purposes.
   
Mrs. Hoa is borrowing 2.761.200 Vietnam dong (~ $163 USD) to buy cows.
Mrs. Duong is borrowing to buy food and vegetables for pigs.
Mrs. Dam is borrowing to buy chicken and ducks.
Mrs. Huong is borrowing to buy pigs.

loans.use: Buying and raising animals

loans.name: Maria Faustina

texts.es: Faustina Díaz tiene un negocio de venta de ropa típica, la y crianza y venta de marranos, pollos y chompipes (pavos) los cuales vende un poco de cada cosa.  Ella tiene cuatro hijos y tres están estudiando, la mayor ya trabaja y le ayuda económicamente.  Ella ha salido adelante sola porque su esposo tiene el vicio del alcohol y es muy irresponsable, ella no cuenta con el apoyo de el.  La mayor responsabilidad la tiene Faustina es el sostén de su casa, ella sale fuera de su casa para poder vender sus productos.  Ahora necesita el préstamo para poder comprar mas mercadería, lo que se refiere a  ropa y comprar algunos marranos que en esta época de fin de año se vende más y a mejor precio. Faustina desea poder vender agrandar su negocio, y así poder seguir apoyando a sus hijos y que sigan estudiando ya que ella lamentablemente no tuvo la oportunidad de estudiar.
texts.en:
Faustina D. has a business selling typical clothes, and the raising and selling of pigs, chickens and turkeys of which she sells a few of each. She has four children and three are studying, the oldest is now working and helps her economically. She has moved forward alone because her husband has an alcohol problem and is very irresponsible, so she doesn't count on his support. The major responsibility that Faustina has is the maintenance of her house, she leaves the house to be able to sell her products. Now she needs a loan to be able to buy more merchandise, which refers to clothes and buy some pigs, which this time of year sell more and at a better price. Faustina hopes to be able to grow her business, and like that she can continue supporting her children and they can continue to study, since she unfortunately did not have the opportunity to study.

Translated from Spanish by Zach Frey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buying clothes and pigs for her business

loans.name: Khodor

texts.en:
Khodor is a 26-year-old man who lives in Saida, southern Lebanon with his wife and their three children. Khodor has been collecting broken iron for eight years. He collects the iron and then sells it to his friends or to iron workers who use the iron in their work. He decided to start his business because he had the help of his parents.

Khodor has requested a loan of USD$1200 from A. Majmoua for household expenses. This is his third loan and he has always paid on time. In the future, he plans to purchase a bigger truck.

loans.use: Khodor needs the loan for household expenses.

loans.name: Mahfirat

texts.ru:
