Сониева Махфират Исламовна родилась 1966 году. После развода с мужем осталась с 3 -мя детьми. У нее особое направление в бизнесе. Приготовление и продажа пищи. Этим делом она занимается 6 лет. Она взяла в аренду маленькое помещение в городе Душанбе, где, наняв работников, ведет свою предпринимательскую деятельность. В продаже все виды национальных блюд и кое-что из европейской кухни. Там у нее можно вкусно пообедать, выпить прохладительных напитков, покушать фруктов и овощей или просто посидеть с друзьями. 
  Узнав, о программе Кива она захотела участвовать. Махфират хочет получить займ в сумме 3500 сомони сроком на 4 месяцев.
texts.en:
Mahfirat Islamovna S. was born in 1966. After the divorce with her husband she was left with three children. She has a unique direction in business which is food preparation and sale. She has been doing this for six years. She rented out a small place in Dushanbe where she hired employees and runs her business. She offers all kinds of national Tajik dishes as well as some European cuisine. One can enjoy a delicious meal at Mahfirat's place, drink cold beverages, eat some fruits and vegetables and spend some time with friends.

When she found out about Kiva she wanted to participate. Mahfirat wants to get a loan for 3500 somoni (USD$975) for a four months term.

Translated from Russian by Elena Fedorchuk, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Wants to buy fixtures - shelves, cabinets and drawers

loans.name: Enrique

texts.es: Don Enrique hombre trabajador desde joven se ha dedicado a diferentes labores para ganar el pan de cada día, hoy en día trabaja en una casa  de jardinero lleva diez años y se ha ganado la confianza de sus patrones. Tiene 56 años de edad,  reside en el barrio German Pomares en la capital de Managua, su esposa trabaja en un bar del colegio y le tiene un hijo de 21 años que esta en la universidad. Esta es su segunda solicitud que quiere invertir en repellar las paredes y comprar portón de hierro, para el estos prestamos en Afodenic han sido de muchos beneficios y ha logrado partes de sus metas, con el primer crédito hizo un muro de su casa para estar mas seguro de la delincuencia, ahora espera terminar el trabajo anterior y da gracias a Dios y a la institución. Sus planes a futuro es apoyar a su hijo a que culmine su carrera universitaria.
texts.en:
Enrique is a hardworking man who has worked various jobs since his youth to earn his daily bread. He has been working as a private gardener for 10 years and has won the confidence of his employers. He is 56 years old and lives in the neighborhood of German Pomares in the capital city of Managua. His wife works in a college bar, and they have a 21-year-old son attending university. This is his second loan, and he wishes to invest in plastering his walls and buying an iron gate. With these loans from Afodenic, he has benefited a great deal and has achieved some of his goals. His first loan was used to build a wall around his house to protect it from vandalism, and now he hopes to finish the job with the help of God and the institution. His plan for the future is to help his son complete his college education.

Translated from Spanish by Trisha Bury, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase construction materials to plaster walls and purchase iron gate

loans.name: Faatulouna

texts.en: Faatulouna P., 26, is married with two children. She has been in the business of making ice cakes, pancakes and banana chips since the past two years. She sells to the village people for five days a week. She has no previous loan with SPBD. She expects her weekly net cash flow to be 250 Tala (~104 USD). SPBD loans are Faatulouna’s only access to capital because she was never able to qualify for a loan with traditional banks. Her loan will be used to fund things like paper cups, cordials, sugar, banana, and oil needed to upgrade her business, which will be her main focus.

loans.use: Purchase paper cups, cordials, sugar, banana and oil

loans.name: Suraiya Shahadat Mahmood Group

texts.en:
Suraiya baji is the wife of S. M., who lives in a city named Riwind, Pakistan. Riwind City is famous for its shrines. Her husband has a vehicle named “Shahzore” by which he delivers different items (e.g., fruits & vegetables and construction supplies) from one place to another and thereby earns income. He has been in this profession for the past 10 years. Suraiya baji is applying for a loan to repair her husband’s vehicle because its engine is creating trouble. 

Suraiya baji is the group leader of four other women from her locality.  Parveen baji wants a loan to buy material (mirror, razors, and chairs) for her beauty salon. Razia baji wants a loan to buy wood for her furniture-making business. Zahida parveen baji wants a loan to buy thread to sell. Sugran baji wants a loan to buy ingredients (lentils, cooking oil and spices) for her food business. 

This is a group loan. The loan funds will be distributed among the group members, each of whom will invest in her own business. The members mutually guarantee one another's loans. If one member does not repay, the other members are responsible.

loans.use: For vehicle repairs

loans.name: Smith

texts.es:
Smith es socia del Bancomunal Virgen de las Mercedes 
Smith es casada tiene 47 años. Dos hijos de 27 y 26 años, que trabajan.
Smith termino la escuela estatal, se preparaba para postular a la universidad y salio embarazada, sus planes cambiaron. Su mama vendía en la parada kiliando y ella le  ayudaba, aprendió y se independizo puso su puesto de venta de papa al por mayor; su esposo administra el negocio.   
Smith necesita un crédito de 1800 soles, para la compra de mercadería de papa 300  kilos.
Desde que esta en Finca, los prestamos han ayudado ha incrementar mas su negocio, aprendió a escuchar ha preguntar a opinar y ha desenvolverse. 
El sueño Smith es viajar a provincia para comprar papa en las chacras.
texts.en:
Smith is a member of the Community Bank Virgen de las Mercedes. Smith is married and is 47 years old, having two children aged 27 and 26 years old. Both are working. Smith completed high school and was preparing for university but she became pregnant and her plans were changed. Her mother conducted sales in the Kiliando station and she used to help her. Having learned from her experience she became independent and set up her own stand selling potatoes wholesale. Her husband administers the business. Smith requires loan in the amount of 1800 soles to purchase a 300 Kg load of potatoes. Since she has been working with Finca (Kiva Field Partner) the loans have helped her expand her business, and she has learned to listen, ask, and to speak up and to get involved. Smith's dream is to travel to another province to purchase potatoes in the plantations.

Translated from Spanish by Erika Lindig, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Smith requires a loan in the amount of 1800 soles to purchase a 300 Kg load of potatoes.

loans.name: Ronel

texts.en:
Ronel is 25 years old and married to Jennifer. His wife works as a barangay (village) treasurer in their village of San Isidro, Quirino, Isabela in the Philippines. They have been blessed with one child, Janel, who is three years old.

Ronel is hoping to lift his family out of poverty. He hopes to be able to support his only child throughout her education. He would like her to complete her college degree in the future.

He manages a one-hectare field of rice and corn. Since he lacks the capital to maintain his farm, Ronel is requesting a loan of $375 (17,000 PHP). His past loans enabled him to increase his income and improve his house by replacing a wrecked roof. He hopes he will have a good harvest and gradually improve his family’s way of life.

Romel knows that, in order to achieve his goal, he must be responsible and pursue a higher goal. He prays to God above that He will guide him toward his life goals.

loans.use: To build business capital.

loans.name: John

texts.en:
John K. is thirty years old. He is married and has three children, one daughter and two sons. He lives with his wife and children in a rented apartment in a town called Kofiase. Kofiase is a farming/trading community near Dormaa, the district capital, in the Brong Ahafo region.

Kwabena says his children are currently in junior high and primary school. His wife is a food vendor. Kwabena is a petty trader. He runs a cold store in his community. Kwabena says his cold store is located on the street. He sells all kinds of fresh fish, beef, chicken, turkey, etc. He wants a loan to procure goods in bulk to increase his stock. Kwabena has been in business for two years. He is hopeful to expand his business and improve his standard of living. Kwabena is hopeful to give his children a sound education.

loans.use: To procure fresh fish and meat

loans.name: Sonia

texts.en:
Sonia began her business for the same reason that many other entrepreneurs do: to be her own boss. Recognizing the need for a hardware store in their neighborhood, she and her husband decided to make a dream a reality. In the year and a half that Sonia and her husband have owned their own business, they have learned that it is a time-consuming and demanding endeavor.  They still appreciate the flexibility it allows.

With a loan from ACCION USA, they will be able to acquire working capital and buy inventory for the store. They will purchase a key-making machine, supplies, tiles, and drills.

Sonia splits her time between the store and her job in pharmaceuticals, and will continue to do so until the family business is able to generate greater profit. Fortunately their 9-year-old son is able to offer a helping hand on occasion. Looking to the future, Sonia and her husband plan to continue growing their business and hope to someday be able to hire additional employees.

loans.use: A key making machine and other tools

loans.name: Cooperative Biira Jane Group

texts.en:
Jane B. is 20 years old and a single mother of three children, two of whom are in school. She also takes care of four dependants.

Jane has operated a coffee business for over two years. She will use her loan to purchase coffee in greater volume to add capital to her business and increase her sales.

Jane is a very hardworking lady and lives as an example to others. Her future dream is to purchase a plot of land.

loans.use: To purchase coffee in greater volume

loans.name: Gretchen

texts.en:
Gretchen G. is from the village of Puli, Carmen Cagayan De Oro City. She is 36 years old. Gretchen is married and has 3 school-aged children. To make a living, Gretchen owns and operates a sari-sari (variety) retail shop. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes from selling a variety of different products in the local community. Gretchen has been engaged in her business for over 4 years and earns approximately 3,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2009, Gretchen joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Gretchen is requesting a new loan of 5,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This will be the 1st loan taken out by Gretchen from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business and support the education of her children.

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and reaches out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase additional products to sell

location.town: Puli, Carmen, Cagayan De Oro, Misamis Oriental

loans.name: Asha

texts.en:
Asha is a member of the Uamsho borrower group in Kola Morogoro. She is 39 years old and is married. She is the mother of three children, ages four, eight, and 22. She also cares for two other dependents.

Asha started her own business selling charcoal 10 years ago. She works 10 hours a day and earns a monthly profit of approximately 90,000 Tanzanian shillings.

This is Asha's first loan from BRAC Tanzania. She is requesting a loan in the amount of 150,000 Tsh in order to buy more charcoal for sale.

With the profit she expects to gain from the use of this loan, Asha hopes to save money and expand her business.

loans.use: To buy more charcoal for sale

loans.name: Maritza

texts.es: Maritza tiene 21 años, vive con su esposo y su pequeño hijo de 5 años en la casa de un familiar. Desde hace 7 años se dedica a la venta de carne y queso, productos que reparte en el principal mercado de la ciudad donde radica. Diariamente realiza la comercialización, mientras que los días jueves de cada semana viaja a su tierra natal para abastecerse de quesos. Adicionalmente, también vende truchas (pez de agua dulce), las cuales compra frescas y las vende durante el fin de semana. Debido a la calidad de sus productos sus ventas está aumentando poco a poco y esto la anima a continuar con su negocio. Este es su tercer préstamo con MFP, Maritza está muy contenta de pertenecer a su banco comunal porque le permite crecer progresivamente. El dinero que viene solicitando será invertido en la compra de quesos y baldes nuevos, que es donde transporta sus productos. Asimismo, quiere incursionar en la venta de otros comestibles, por lo que también comprará menestras, fideos y aceite.
texts.en:
Maritza is 21 years old and lives with her husband and 5-year-old son in the home of a relative. For the past 7 years she has sold meat and cheese which she distributes in her home town's main market. She sells her product daily but on each Thursday of the week she travels to her home town to replenish her supply of cheese. She also sells fresh-water trout which she buys fresh and sells on the week-end. Because of the good quality of her products, her sales have been increasing little by little which encourages her to continue her work. This is her third loan from MFP and she is very happy to be part of the communal bank because it permits her to progressively grow. The loan she is requesting now will be used to buy cheeses and new buckets which she uses to transport her products. She also wants to expand into the sales of other foodstuffs so she will also be purchasing vegetables, pasta and oil.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To increase her inventory.

loans.name: Nghiêm's Group

texts.en:
L. Nguyễn Thị is a 43 year-old woman living in the town of Yên Phong - Bắc Ninh. L. is the group leader of a group helped by SEDA. While each member of the group receives an individual loan, each is responsible for paying back the entire loan. The official name of this borrowing group is Nghiêm xá 15 (15).

L. is married and has three adult children. She owns and operates a butcher shop and sells in the local community. L. has been in business for over 15 years and earns approximately 5.000.000 VND a month.

L. joined SEDA to gain access to financial services to improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. She is requesting a new loan of 5.152.000 VND to expand her business. The loan will be her first from SEDA. L. plans to supplement her family's income.

Other Borrowers in the group...

1. Nghiêm Thị H. (20201020055) is a 49 year-old female who is requesting a 5.152.000 VND loan to support her business raising livestock.

2. Nghiêm Thị M. (20201020056) is a 42 year-old female who is requesting a 5.152.000 VND loan to support her business raising livestock.

3. Mẫn Thị D. (20201020057) is a 37 year-old female who is requesting a 5.152.000 VND loan to support her furniture making business.

4. Nguyễn Thị L. (20201020058) is a 36 year-old female who is requesting a 5.152.000 VND loan to support her business raising livestock.

----------------------------------- About SEDA: The mission of SEDA (Center of Small Enterprise Development Assistance) is to provide microfinance services to the low income and disadvantaged people in rural areas of Hanoi and the Northern provinces of Vietnam. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in Vietnamese while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders. L. Nguyễn Thị (20201020054) là 43 tuổi nữ. Cô ấy sống ở thành phố Yên Phong - Bắc Ninh. L. là trưởng nhóm của nhóm vay gồm có 5 các thành viên. Mặc dù mỗi thành viên trong nhóm nhận được từng khoản vay cá nhân, nhưng tất cả họ đều chịu trách nhiệm hoàn trả lại khoản vay của các thành viên trong nhóm của mình nếu một người nào đó trễ hạn hay không trả được nợ.. Tên chính thức của nhóm vay này là Nghiêm xá 15 (15). Trong khi không phải chỉ có các phương thức tạo nên thu nhập, mà nguồn thu nhập chính của công việc kinh doanh chủ yếu từ giết mổ & bán T.t heo trong cộng đồng địa phương. L. thực hiện công việc kinh doanh này trong hơn 15 năm. Từ các hoạt động này, L. kiếm được khoảng 5.000.000 VND. L. đã tham gia SEDA để có thể tiếp cận với các dịch vụ tài chính giúp cải thiện sinh hoạt và khả năng tham gia vào các hoạt động kinh doanh của cô ấy/ anh ấy. 0 Cô ấy hiện đang đề nghị một khoản vay mới là 5.152.000 VND. Khoản vay sẽ là 1st khoản vay của người vay từ SEDA. Về Những Người vay khác trong Nhóm: 1. Nghiêm Thị H. (20201020055) là 49 tuổi nữ. Cô ấy đề nghị khoản vay là 5.152.000 VND. Khoản vay này sẽ được sử dụng để hỗ trợ công việc kinh doanh trong lĩnh vực nông nghiệp. Mục đích chính của việc kinh doanh là chăn nuôi gia súc. 2. Nghiêm Thị M. (20201020056) là 42 tuổi nữ. Cô ấy đề nghị khoản vay là 5.152.000 VND. Khoản vay này sẽ được sử dụng để hỗ trợ công việc kinh doanh trong lĩnh vực nông nghiệp. Mục đích chính của việc kinh doanh là chăn nuôi gia súc. 3. Mẫn Thị D. (20201020057) là 37 tuổi nữ. Cô ấy đề nghị khoản vay là 5.152.000 VND. Khoản vay này sẽ được sử dụng để hỗ trợ công việc kinh doanh trong lĩnh vực sản xuất. Mục đích chính của việc kinh doanh là vận hành công việc kinh doanh chế tạo hàng nội thất. 4. Nguyễn Thị L. (20201020058) là 36 tuổi nữ. Cô ấy đề nghị khoản vay là 5.152.000 VND. Khoản vay này sẽ được sử dụng để hỗ trợ công việc kinh doanh trong lĩnh vực nông nghiệp. Mục đích chính của việc kinh doanh là chăn nuôi gia súc. Về SEDA: Nhiệm vụ của SEDA (Trung Tâm hỗ Trợ Phát Triển các Doanh Nghiệp Nhỏ) là cung cấp các dịch vụ tài chính vi mô cho những người có thu nhập thấp và kém may mắn trong các vùng nông thôn tại Hà Nội và các tỉnh phía Bắc Việt Nam *Lưu ý: Để phát huy tối đa hiệu quả & giảm chi phí, khoản vay này đã được thông báo bằng biểu mẫu để có thể được Kiva tự động biên dịch. . Do việc biên dịch thủ công các danh mục rất tốn kém, nên Kiva đã tạo biểu mẫu này cho phần Field Partner (Trường Đối Tác) cho phép họ tiếp tục thông báo các khoản vay bằng Vietnamese trong khi cung cấp thông tin có chất lượng & chính xác cho người cho vay Kiva.

loans.use: Invest in expanding businesses.

loans.name: Eduardo

texts.en:
Eduardo R. lives in the village of Lower Manggahan, Balulang, Cagayan De Oro City. He is 49 years old, married and has two school-aged children. To make a living, he owns and operates a specialized retail shop where he sells seafood products such as dried fish and shrimp. Eduardo has been in his business for more than four years and earns approximately 5,200 PHP a month from his work.

Earlier this year, Eduardo joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve his life and business opportunities. He has applied for a loan, his first, for 5,000 PHP to buy additional products to sell. He plans to use the additional revenue generated by this loan to support the education of children. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to buy additional products to sell

location.town: Balulang, Cagayan de Oro, Misamis Oriental

loans.name: Josefa

texts.en:
Josefa is the mother of 12 children and she is engaged in two businesses: hog raising and retailing of goods in her general store. She has been in her business for 19 years, which is almost half of her age. Eight of her children are presently taking their education. There are two in college, three in high school and three still in elementary school.  Since they have bonded well, cooperate and help each other, some of her children contribute to their income when they sell candy and junk food in their school during vacant time.

Josefa's husband works their field planting corn and rice. During harvesting, they sell some of their products to have money for their children's tuition and some of their harvested rice is for their food. The couple also plants vegetables in a small area of their field and in their backyard in order to minimize their food expenses. Josefa's income from her general store is insufficient if she counts the expense for her pig feed. Josefa needs additional capital amounting Php 6,000 to buy additional items for her general store to gain a bigger income for her family.

loans.use: To buy additional items for her store

loans.name: Blanca Segunda

texts.en:
Blanca Segunda S. A. is 42 years old and lives in the Fortin district of Guayaquil. Fortin  is a peri-urban, marginalized zone without paved roads, water pipes, or a sewer system.  Ms. S. has a mobile hair salon; her services include hairstyling, hair cuts, and hair coloring. Over the last 12 years, she has built a client base throughout Guayaquil, and she travels to their homes armed with round brushes, hair dye, blow dryers and beauty supplies.  Ms. S. and her husband dedicate a portion of their incomes to keeping their only daughter in private school.

Ms. S. is requesting a loan to purchase sheet metal to secure her roof; it is currently very fragile, making their home susceptible to harsh weather.   She is grateful for any support we can provide her family!

loans.use: to buy sheet metal to repair roof of home

loans.name: Lolita Soriano Group

texts.es:
El grupo Lolita Soriano lo conforman Luis Felipe G., Jerónima M. S. y María Engracia G. D.. El señor G. vende frutas y verduras en el mercado de Masaya y con sus ganancias les proporciona buena educación a sus cuatro hijos.

Jerónima M. S. vende frutas con lo que se ayudado para cubrir los gastos del hogar y  María Engracia G. D. tiene una pequeña pulpería la cual inicio vendiendo chiverías y luego empezó a crecer poco a poco.
texts.en:
The Lolita Soriano Group is comprised of Luis Felipe G., Jerónima M. S., and María Engracia G. D.. Mr. G. sells fruits and vegetables in the Masaya market. He uses his earnings to give his four children a good education. Jerónima M. S. sells fruits. This has helped cover the household expenses. María Engracia G. D. has a small mini market. She started out selling yogurt. Later, the business started to grow little by little.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy fruits and vegetables

loans.name: Alicia

texts.es: La  Señora Alicia se dedica a la venta de pescado al por mayor (en latas),ella se provee de sus parientes que viven en Tiquina(poblacion cercana al lago Titicaca) y se dedican a la pesca. La rutina de la señora Alicia comienza los dias lunes que viaja a las 4 de la mañana hasta tiquina para comprar el pescado que pueda, a un precio mas bajo por ser pariente de los proveedores, para volver en la tarde y dejar la mayor parte de la mercaderia en la ciudad de El Alto a sus clientes que se encargan de vender la misma por unidad. durante la semana, de martes a jueves, se levanta a las 5 de la mañana para llegar a la ciudad de el Alto a las 7 30 y cobrar por la mercancia, en las tardes se dedica a cuidar a sus 2 pequeños que aun no van al colegio y tambien ayuda a su esposo que trabaja como albañil, trabaja cerca a su domicilio ya que en la zona en que viven esta comenzando a poblarse y la oferta de trabajo nunca falta
texts.en:
Alicia sells fish wholesale (in cans). Her relatives, fishermen who live in Tiquina (a community near the Titicaca Lake), supply her. Alicia’s routine starts on Monday when she travels to Tiquina at four in the morning to buy the fish that she can at a lower price because her relatives are the providers. She returns in the afternoon and leaves a major part of the merchandise with her customers in the city of El Alto. They sell the fish by the unit. During the week from Tuesday to Thursday, she gets up a five in the morning to arrive in the city of El Alto at 7:30 to collect for her merchandise. In the afternoons she takes care of her two little ones, who still do not go to school. She also helps her husband, who works as a bricklayer. He works close to home. The area where they live is getting more populated, and he is never without work.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy more merchandise

loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.en:
Elizabeth R. is currently in the business of selling groundnut paste and charcoal and is requesting a loan to stock more groundnuts for making paste to sell.  Elizabeth is 22 years old and is married to a soldier. She has five children and her children go to school.  With the extra profits from her loan, she hopes to be able to pay school fees for her children.

 BRAC's holistic approach to poverty alleviation and empowerment of the poor encompasses a range of core programs in economic and social development, health, education, human rights and legal services, which are delivered through an extensive network of village organizations. BRAC has become one of the world's largest NGOs as measured by the scale and diversity of its interventions.  In 2007, BRAC started operations in Southern Sudan. The microfinance program, which is targeted towards returning war refugees, has already formed 418 village organizations with more than 14,000 women members.

loans.use: To buy more groundnuts for making paste to sell

loans.name: Francisca

texts.en: Francisca M. is 54 years old and she grows rice. She is proud of her tenure as a farmer. She has four children. Unfortunately, the older ones were not able to go to college because her income is not yet sufficient. She uses her harvest to feed her family, but when they have enough, they sell the excess to supplement the family income. She is hoping to receive a loan from Community Economic Ventures Inc. She will use the loan to fund her farm and buy the farm supplies that she needs.

loans.use: Farm Supplies

loans.name: Ta-Tai-Theke Group

texts.en:
Here are members of the 'Ta-Tai-Theke' group. Mariatu S. who is on the left in the photo is the leader of the group. Thirty-year-old Mariatu is married to a soldier and they have 3 children. Mariatu owns a “cigarette box” where she sells cigarettes, mints, gum, drinks, (soft drinks and Bitter Kolo - a locally produced non-alcoholic drink believed to be good for men), matches, and so on. She has been a businesswoman for 3 years now. 

Mariatu wants a SLL 500,000 loan in order to expand her business. Thus with her share of the loan, she will buy crates of soft drinks/Bitter Kolo drink and boxes of cigarettes. Consequently, Mariatu will be able to make better sales, earn more profit so that she can repay her loan, and look after her 3 children who are attending primary school.

loans.use: Buy crates of soft drinks/Bitter Kolo drink and boxes of cigarettes

loans.name: Zema

texts.es:
Zema, de 33 años, es una mujer que siempre ha luchado por sobre salir en la vida. Vive en la casa de uno de sus familiares junto a sus 2 hijos; Carlos de 6 y Erick de 2, a quienes desea brindar una mejor vida.

Su negocio está ubicado en el mercado “Las Mercedes” de la ciudad de Juliaca, ella se dedica a la venta de carretillas, actividad que le ha dado los ingresos necesarios para mantener a su familia. Su puesto es muy visitado por la personas, ya que las carretillas que vende son de muy buena calidad y ya tiene una reputación ganada.
Lo que más le gusta de su trabajo es conversar con sus vecinas de venta, así hace más amenas sus largas jornadas de trabajo. Lleva 5 años realizando esta actividad y considera que lo más difícil es cargar las pesadas carretillas hasta su puesto de venta. 
Para más adelante, espera instalar una ferretería donde pueda ofrecer también otros artículos para construcción.

Este es el segundo préstamo al que accede Zema con MFP, sabe que ese dinero le ayudará a mejorar su futuro, pero también tiene presente que tiene que pagarlo a tiempo para no meter en problemas a su banco comunal. Con los dos mil nuevos soles solicitados comprará más carretillas para implementar mejor su stock.
texts.en:
Zema, 33, is a woman who has always struggled to get ahead in life. She lives in the house of one of her relatives along with her 2 children: Carlos, 6, and Erick, 2, for whom she wants to provide a better life. Her business is located in the "Las Mercedes" market in the city of Juliaca. She sells dollies (handtrucks), an activity that has given her the income needed to support her family. Her stand is visited by many people, since the dollies that she sells are of very good quality and she has already won a good reputation. What she likes most about her work is to chat with neighboring tradespeople; this makes her long working days more pleasant. She has been carrying out this activity for 5 years, and what she considers most difficult is to transport the heavy dollies to her sales stall. In the future, she hopes to have a hardware store where she can offer additional items related to construction for sale. This is her second loan with MFP. She knows that this money will help her to have a better future, but she also remembers that she must make her payments on time so as to avoid problems with her communal bank. With the 2,000 Peruvian soles requested she will buy more dollies to better supply her business.

Translated from Spanish by Lisa Grobar, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to increase merchandise (buy more dollies)

loans.name: Phall

texts.en: Mr. Phall P. is 56 years old and lives in Sam raong village, Takeo province. He and his wife, Mrs. Srey Nou Par, are farmers who own a 3-hectare field where they grow crops. They now face a problem because the soil is infertile. Mr. Phall P. is, therefore, requesting 2,000,000 Riel from AMK to purchase fertilizer and pesticide. As well as farming, he works as a laborer and can earn a small income to support his family. The couple have four children. Three are students in the local school while the youngest one is too young to study or work. His wife is on the left of the picture.

loans.use: To purchase fertilizer and pesticide

loans.name: Ligia

texts.es:
Ligia Jiménez D. A., es una mujer viuda y tiene 6 hijos que han conformado ya su familia,  a sus 65 años vive en el barrio Quiroga D. Bogotá, la capital D. Colombia y se dedica a la comercialización D. víveres y abarrotes en una cigarrería D. su propiedad; se inició como negociante con artesanías, específicamente  fabricación D. escobas y también D.  flores; allí nació el deseo D. tener una  cigarrería, la cual comenzó en su vivienda con recursos propios y un crédito D. $1.000.000 que le hizo a Fundación Mario Santo Domingo en el año 2003; desD. entonces ha recibido 8 créditos que ha tenido el cuidado D. reembolsar oportunamente, pues los ha invertido en su negocio y también en mejoras que ha realizado en su vivienda. En la actualidad Solicita financiamiento por valor D. $2.200.000 para mejoras D. su vivienda, estará dirigido al cambio D. la cubierta, arreglo D. canales y pintura D.  puertas y ventanas. Respecto al beneficio social del crédito Ligia dice  que los créditos D. la fundación la han ayudado a crecer lo mismo que a su   negocio, ellos  son la fuente principal D. sus  ingresos y   ha podido arreglar gradualmente  su casa, ella desea seguir creciendo con su microempresa  y surtirla  con lo que los clientes necesitan.
Los desafíos han estado asociados a la perdida D. seres queridos como su esposo su madre y su yerno, que aunque son irremplazables debe superar.
texts.en:
Ligia Jiménez D. A. is a widow with 6 children who make up her family. At the age of 65, she lives in the Quiroga neighborhood of Bogotá, the capital of Colombia. Her work is selling groceries in a small store she owns. She began as a businesswoman dealing in handicrafts, especially the production of brooms and artificial flowers. Out of this grew the desire to have her own store, which she began in her home using her own resources as well as a loan of 1,000,000 Colombian pesos granted to her by the Mario Santo Domingo Foundation in 2003. Since that time, she has received 8 loans, and she has always been careful to repay them on time. She has invested them in her business and also in improvements to her home. Currently, she is requesting financing in the amount of 2,200,000 Colombian pesos for improvements to her home. These funds will be used to replace the roof, repair the pipes and paint the doors and window frames. With respect to the social benefit of the loan, Ligia says that credit from the Foundation has helped her to grow personally along with her business. The business is the main source of her income, and she has gradually been able to renovate her home. She wants to continue expanding her small business and stock it with products that her customers need. The challenges she has faced have included the loss of loved ones such as her husband, her mother and her son-in-law, which she must overcome although they are irreplaceable.

Translated from Spanish by Patricia Linderman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Home improvement: replacing roof tiles, repairing pipes and painting doors and window frames

loans.name: Martha Del Socorro

texts.es: Doña Martha es madre de familia de dos hijos los cuales estudian, de 51 años de edad, su esposo es albañil el cual ha sido quien la apoyado para comenzar con su negocio, una pulpería. El cual inicio con dinero propio y el financiamiento que la institución dio, para ella ha sido difícil ya que anteriormente le fue mal en su negocio, debido a cambio de domicilio lo cual decide cambiar de venta y pone venta de fritanga, los meses pasan y las ventas bajas por lo que refuerza otra vez la pulpería en donde tiene una variedad de productos que se venden día a día. La cual la tiene en la sala lo que vino a tener menos espacios, menos privacidad para su familia. Es por eso con este préstamo hará una división para dar mejor servicios a sus clientes y lograr una mejor visión. Contenta con esta mejora lo que espera captar clientes nuevos, mejores ventas, lo cual vendrá a beneficiar a toda mi familia.
texts.en:
51-year old Doña Martha is a mother of two children who are students. Her husband is a bricklayer and helped her get started in her own business, a corner store. They used their own money as well as financing from the institution. Running the store has been difficult. At first it didn’t do well. Then because of a change in housing, she decided to sell fried foods. Time passed, and still sales were low, so she opened up the corner store once again and now sells a variety of products that are needed on a daily basis. Martha runs the store in the living room of their house which means that the family has less space and less privacy. For this reason she will use the loan to divide the room. She’ll be able to provide her customers with better service and conditions. She is hopeful that this improvement will bring in new customers and higher sales and thus provide benefits for the whole family.

Translated from Spanish by Jane Agg, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to buy construction materials to separate the living room from the store

loans.name: Ana María

texts.es:
En el Mercado Mayoreo en Managua, la señora Ana María S. se dedica a la venta de verduras y abarrotes en su localidad donde todos los días llega desde las cinco de la mañana al tramo debido a que ella es una mujer muy trabajadora.

Actualmente está solicitando el crédito para la compra de las verduras como lo son tomates cebollas, chiltomas, remolacha, zanahorias, repollo y también comprará otros productos como son huevos, mortadela, entre otros.

Ella requiere la compra de estos productos y para ello solicita el crédito esperando que le sea otorgado para proceder con dicha compra para ofertarlo en su localidad.
texts.en:
Ana María S. sells groceries and vegetables in her sales stall in Managua's Mayoreo market every day; she opens for business at 5am because she's a very hard-working woman. She is asking for funding to buy vegetables like: tomatoes, onions, peppers, beets, carrots, cabbage, as well as other products like: eggs and mortadela (bologna sausage), among others. She needs to buy these products and requires funding to do so; she hopes that the loan will be approved so that she can proceed with said purchase and be able to offer the products for sale at her location.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy vegetables and groceries.

loans.name: Nasreen's Group

texts.en:
Nasreen is a 57-year-old woman and her husband's name is M. R.. She lives in a city named Multan famous for its shrines and sweetmeats in Pakistan. She is a very hard-working lady. She has a decorative embroidery business. Earlier she did this in her free time but later on she chose it as a profession and now she earns approximately Pak Rs. 15,000 from this business.

She has four kids: two sons and two daughters. She wants to raise her children with a good education and she utilizes her income to pay for their education expenses and to fulfill their needs. Her husband runs a grocery shop in the community to earn income. They both earn well to improve their living standards.
 
Nasreen is a regular client of Asasah (a microfinance institute in Pakistan). She has successfully repaid three loans to Asasah and now she is applying for a loan to purchase groceries to diversify her husband’s grocery shop into a store.

loans.use: Purchase groceries for grocery shop

loans.name: Kikelomo

texts.en:
Kikelomo own a shop where she sells drinks, sachet water and pepper soup to costumers and she has been in the business for the past 9 years. She is a member in LAPO micro finance with good repayment history. 
She is married with 4 children and she is 31 years old. Her husband works with a construction company and they reside in Lagos. She hopes for increase her business and profit. She is requesting for the loan of NGN50, 000 to purchase more drinks, sachet water and pepper soup items to sell. She thanks all Kiva lenders and LAPO micro finance for their support.

loans.use: To purchase more drinks, sachet water and pepper soup items to sell.

loans.name: Renka Group

texts.en:
These are the members of Renka Group. They are small-scale businesspeople in Makeni city in northern Sierra Leone. They are requesting a loan of SLL 800,000 each to enable them improve their businesses. With a loan, they will be able to add more goods to their stalls, make more sales and better profits. Consequently, their living standards will improve so that they can better look after themselves and their children.

Mariatu K. is the leader of the group. She was born in a village called Wala Maboleh, in northern Sierra Leone and is forty-six years of age. She is married to a farmer and they have three children. Two of her children are in secondary schools and one is already married.

Mariatu sells palm-oil (the most popular cooking oil), bread and fried cakes. She has been a businesswoman for over twenty years now. With this loan, she will buy palm-oil, vegetable oil, a bag of sugar and a bag of flour to add to her business.

loans.use: To buy palm-oil, vegetable oil, a bag of sugar and a bag of flour to add to her business

loans.name: Sisters Trust Bank Group

texts.en:
Mary is a humble young lady. She is married to a farmer with four children. She is now thirty-three years old. She loves selling cereals like maize, a business through which she makes a living for her family. Mary has sold maize for the past two years. She plans to invest the loan to purchase maize in bulk to meet the demand. Mary dreams that one day she will be able to expand her business to meet her customers growing demands. She always wishes for happiness and good health for her family.

Mary is currently the leader of a trust bank group called 'Sisters' made up of eight members. Members of the group provide assistance to one another in times of difficulty to settle their repayments.

loans.use: To purchase maize in bulk

loans.name: Enhtaivan

texts.en:
Enhtaivan A. is 37 years old and lives with her son in Arhangai province of Mongolia. She and her family live in a 'ger', a traditional Mongolian nomadic tent. Her son studies in a local high school. Enhtaivan operates a dairy product retail business in her town at the local market. She began her business in 1998  with  capital of  30,000 MNT. After years of successful operations, she has increased her capital to 1,360,000 MNT.  

Enhtaivan has an open heart  and works hard to improve her business. She has many plans for the future and said,  “ My only wish is to be able to support my son to be a better person in the future.” She is  requesting a 2,000,000 MNT loan in order to purchase more dairy products to sell in her business.

loans.use: To purchase more diary products

loans.name: Mẫn

texts.en:
P. Mẫn Thị (20201060046) is a 27-year-old female living in the town of huyện Yên Phong - tỉnh Bắc Ninh. She is married and has 2 school-aged children.  To making a living, P. owns & operates a furniture-making business.  While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from making & selling general household furniture to local businesses and community members.  P. has been engaged in this business for over 4 years and earns approximately 4.000.000 VND a month from these activities.


In 2008, P. joined SEDA to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities.  P. has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5.600.000 VND from SEDA.  This previous loan was used to purchase additional raw materials to expand product offerings.  P. is now requesting a new loan of 8.288.000 VND which will be used to purchase additional inventory and for working capital. The loan will be the 3rd loan taken out by the borrower from SEDA.  P. plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business  to improve the general living conditions of the her family.


About SEDA:

The mission of SEDA (Center of Small Enterprise Development Assistance) is to provide microfinance services to the low income and disadvantaged people in rural areas of Hanoi and the Northern provinces of Vietnam.


*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in Vietnamese while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.


P. Mẫn Thị (20201060046) là 27 tuổi nữ.  Cô ấy sống ở thành phố huyện Yên Phong - tỉnh Bắc Ninh.  Cô ấy đã lập gia đình và có 2 trẻ ở độ tuổi đi học.  Để kiếm sống, P. Sở hữu và thực hiện hoạt động kinh doanh.  Công việc kinh doanh hoạt động tại lĩnh vực sản xuất.  Mục đích chính của việc kinh doanh là vận hành công việc kinh doanh chế tạo hàng nội thất.  Trong khi không phải chỉ có các phương thức tạo nên thu nhập, mà nguồn thu nhập chính của công việc kinh doanh chủ yếu từ sản xuất & bán trang thiết bị gia dụng thông thường cho các doanh nghiệp và người dân trong cộng đồng địa phương.  P. thực hiện công việc kinh doanh này trong hơn 4 năm.  Từ các hoạt động này, P. kiếm được khoảng 4.000.000 VND một tháng.


Vào 2008, P. đã tham gia SEDA để có thể tiếp cận với các dịch vụ tài chính giúp cải thiện  sinh hoạt và khả năng tham gia vào các hoạt động kinh doanh của cô ấy/ anh ấy.  P. đề nghị khoản vay lần đầu tiên từ SEDA.  Khoản vay trước đây được sử dụng mua nguyên liệu thô bổ sung để mở rộng việc giới thiệu sản phẩm.  Cô ấy hiện đang đề nghị một khoản vay mới là 8.288.000 VND.  Khoản vay hiện tại sẽ được sử dụng để mua thêm hàng hóa tồn kho & vốn lưu động.  Khoản vay sẽ là 3rd khoản vay của người vay từ SEDA.  P. dự định sẽ sử dụng nguồn thu nhập bổ sung từ công việc kinh doanh  cải thiện điều kiện sống chung của gia đình người vay.


Về SEDA:

Nhiệm vụ của SEDA (Trung Tâm hỗ Trợ Phát Triển các Doanh Nghiệp Nhỏ) là cung cấp các dịch vụ tài chính vi mô cho những người có thu nhập thấp và kém may mắn trong các vùng nông thôn tại Hà Nội và các tỉnh phía Bắc Việt Nam

*Lưu ý: Để phát huy tối đa hiệu quả & giảm chi phí, khoản vay này đã được thông báo bằng biểu mẫu để có thể được Kiva tự động biên dịch. .  Do việc biên dịch thủ công các danh mục rất tốn kém, nên Kiva đã tạo biểu mẫu này cho phần Field Partner (Trường Đối Tác) cho phép họ tiếp tục thông báo các khoản vay bằng  Vietnamese trong khi cung cấp thông tin có chất lượng & chính xác cho người cho vay Kiva.  .

loans.use: For working capital and to purchase additional inventory

loans.name: Anonymous

texts.en:
The Kiva borrower is a 24-year-old single man living with his mother and 3 siblings. After the death of his father, he decided to stop his education and start working to earn income for his family. He started working as a constructor specialized on gypsum board work. He works with his brothers to cover the family expenses, home rental, hospitality expenses etc. He has been involved in his occupation for the past 5 years and he has been able, despite his young age, to build a good business reputation where a lot of entrepreneurs ask for his construction services. He is asking to borrow $1200 from Kiva partner Ameen s.a.l. to purchase additional construction tools because his work is increasing and he needs to be prepared for any new projects.

Note: Based on the political and social challenges of Lebanon, personally identifiable attributes of this entrepreneur have been altered to protect him or her (i.e., blacking out portions of the entrepreneur in his/her picture, not indicating his/her name and location, etc.) Ameen s.a.l. appreciates Kiva lenders' understanding of these challenges and encourages lenders to continue their support for Lebanon's borrowers.

About Ameen:

Ameen s.a.l. has been a major player in the Lebanese Microfinance sector since 1999. Originally, a micro-credit program created by CHF International, Ameen evolved to become Ameen s.a.l. in 2003, a Lebanese services company. In 2007, Ameen s.a.l. registered with the Central Bank of Lebanon to become the first Lebanese financial institution specialized in Microfinance.

At Ameen s.a.l. we pledge to provide financial services to the largest number of micro and small entrepreneurs and to the working poor, to help them develop their businesses and improve their incomes.

Ameen has been able to use its interest-free loans Kiva to offer lower-interest loans with faster disbursement for their micro-loan borrowers. Since its inception, Ameen has provided high-quality financial services to over 41,000 borrowers and disbursed over 81,000 loans totaling $115 million. To learn more about Ameen, please visit http://partners.kiva.org/partners/115

loans.use: To purchase additional construction tools.

loans.name: Royah Group

texts.en:
Lawou M., who is holding the sign, is the leader of this group of five borrowers called Royah. Lawou is 48 years old, married and has six children who range from 8 to 27 years old. She was not able to attend school due to a lack of financial support. 

For 16 years, she has been selling lappas (a traditional dress for women) in the Redlight Market on the outskirts of Monrovia, Liberia.

She plans to use her 5,000 Liberian dollar portion of this 25,000 Liberian dollar group loan to buy more cartons of lappas. She describes herself as an easy-going woman. 

Her goal is to improve her business and continue to educate her children. In the photo that accompanies this profile, Annie S. is inset at the lower right because she was absent during the meeting.

loans.use: To buy more lappas (dresses) for resale

loans.name: Alberto

texts.es: Alberto, de 25 años, vive en casa de sus padres en compañía de ellos y de su esposa Haydee de 28 años y de sus 2 pequeños hijos, juntos habitan un tranquilo paraje de la fría sierra central peruana. Cada día es diferente para este trabajador de campo, pues se despierta con los primeros rayos de sol y se dirige a vigilar sus chacras. Luego de pasar toda la mañana vigilando con dedicación sus plantas de papa y olluco, se alista para regresar a su casa y en su establo le esperan sus carneros que los saca a pastar, en compañía y apoyo de su esposa. Manifiesta que le gusta mucho el trabajo agrícola porque es bastante apacible y rentable, logra vender la papa y el olluco que produce a regulares precios, en cuanto le toca momentos de escasez o alguna deuda pendiente, vende algunos de sus animales en la feria de su ciudad. En adelante tiene muchos planes entre ellos comprar un terreno para sembrar en cantidad pues quiere mejorar sus ganancias. Es el décimo crédito con MFP, y promete pagar puntualmente todas sus cuotas pues quiere continuar trabajando para salir adelante, además esta muy satisfecho con el trabajo de su grupo ya que esta integrado por personas bastante responsables. Alberto tiene planeado invertir el crédito solicitado en la compra de abono y fertilizantes, pues desea que la producción de la próxima campaña sea mas fructífera.
texts.en:
Alberto is 25 years old and lives in his parent’s house. He lives there with them, his wife Haydee, who is 28 years old, and their 2 small children. They live together in a quiet spot in the cold mountainous region in central Peru. Every day is different for this agricultural worker. He gets up when the sun rises and sets out to take care of his fields. After spending the morning carefully tending his potato and olluco (root crop) plants, he is ready to head back to his rams waiting in the stable. He takes them out to graze, accompanied and supported by his wife. He says he likes agricultural work a lot because it is quite gentle and profitable. He manages to sell the potatoes and olluco he grows at reasonable prices. Whenever he goes through a period of crop shortage or has any debt outstanding, he sells some of his animals at the market in the city. He has many plans for the future, among them to purchase a plot of land on which to sow in large quantities, as he wants to increase his profits. This is his tenth loan with MFP, and he promises to make all his repayments on time because he wishes to continue working to move forward. He is also very satisfied with the work of his group because it is made up of quite responsible people. Alberto plans to invest the loan requested in the purchase of manure and fertilisers, as he wants to make his next growing season more fruitful.

Translated from Spanish by Kate Stansfield, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy fertiliser.

loans.name: Jeanette

texts.en:
Jeanette A. is from Gala, Ozamiz City. She is 31 years old and is separated from her spouse. She has one school-aged child. Jeanette owns and operates a general store, selling a variety of different products such as candies, shampoo, canned goods, eggs and other products in the local community. She has been engaged in her business for over three years and earns approximately 10,000 PHP a month. In 2008, Jeanette joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 12,000 PHP from GDMPC. Jeanette is requesting a new loan of 15,000 PHP which will be used to invest in expanding her business. This loan will be her seventh from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family. About GDMPC: GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has four branches and three unit offices covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolk and small-business entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To invest in expanding her business

loans.name: Nenita

texts.en:
This is Nenita E., a 52-year-old resident of Caloocan City, Philippines. She is married to Julio E. and the mother to four young adults. By the grace of God, Nenita has managed to support her children's schooling up to the college level. At this time, she is working hard to continually provide income for their everyday expenses.

Nenita operates a variety store. In the Philippines, a variety store is basically a small convenience store that retails groceries, toiletries and beverages piecemeal to the local neighborhood. It is the place to go to buy one sachet of shampoo, 5 pesos worth of cooking oil or an egg. She earns by getting supplies at wholesale prices and selling at a piece rate. Her store is located adjacent to her house. Her regular customers are her neighbors and the local community.  She earns a minimum of 350 Philippine pesos (Php) in sales every day.

To help her continue operations of her business, she is requesting a Php10,000 loan. She will be utilizing the loan to buy more quantities of products like groceries, toiletries and beverages to expand her product inventory. She expects a boost in her business income as she expands her business.  

Nenita dreams to be able to renovate her house soon with all of her work with the business. She faithfully meets up with her fellowship* co-members to share stories of her work every week.

* All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital and pay microfinance loans.

loans.use: To buy more quantities of products like groceries, toiletries and beverages to expand her product inventory

loans.name: Cissy

texts.en:
Cissy M. lives in Kisaasi, a neighborhood in the city of Kampala, Uganda. She is widowed and has five children, four of whom are in school. Cissy sells used clothes at market for a living and has been in this business for over 10 years. She works six days a week. Her primary business challenges are transportation and the rainy season. 

Cissy has requested a loan of 600,000 Ugandan Shillings from MCDT SACCO, which she will use to buy more bales of second-hand clothes. Her business goal is to start importing bales of second-hand clothes. 

Cissy owns her own home and has access to electricity and piped water. Her major monthly expenses include school fees and medication.

loans.use: To buy more bales of second-hand clothes to offer for sale at market

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase bags of cement for resale

loans.name: María Hilaria

texts.es: María Hilaria R. Vda. D. T. D. 50 años D. edad, resiD. en el departamento D. San Salvador, en donD. vive junto a su hija D. 18 años D. edad, y junto a su padre D. 87 años y su madre D. 85 años D. edad. María se dedica a la elaboración D. tamales, un platillo típico el cual esta hecho a base D. masa D. maíz, la cual se rellena con verduras y se envuelve en hojas D. huerta D. guineos, los cuales posteriormente comercializa D. forma ambulante, así mismo sus hija le ayudan vendiendo algunos tamales en su casa D. habitación, María solicita un préstamo por medio del cual pueda comprar toda la materia prima para la elaboración D. mayor cantidad D. tamales, todo con el enorme deseo D. aumentar sus ganancias.
texts.en: María Hilaria R. is a 50 year old widow who lives in San Salvador department with her 18 year-old daughter, her 87 year-old father and her 85 year-old mother.  María works making tamales, a traditional dish which is maD. from corn dough, filled with vegetables and wrapped in banana leaves.  She then sells them in the street.  Her daughter also helps selling some tamales from her home.  María is requesting a loan so that she can buy all the ingredients she needs to make more tamales as she has an enormous desire to increase her profits.

loans.use: To buy corn, vegetables and other ingredients for making tamales

loans.name: Ma. Luisa

texts.en:
With perseverance, one is sure to achieve success. This seems to be the mindset of 54-year-old community partner Ma. Luisa T. of Caloocan City, Philippines. Luisa reached college and is married to Dante, who works as a printer. They have three children: one in college, another in high school, and the youngest in elementary school.

Luisa is a persevering entrepreneur, juggling three small-scale businesses at one time. She buys and sells laptops; she runs a sari-sari (variety) store and sells school supplies; and she manages a burger, siomai, and mami stand. All of these products Luisa offers to her neighbors and to everyone in the community who find these products worth their money. Given these three businesses, Luisa earns around 10,000 PHP monthly.

To continue her business operations, Luisa applied for a 36,000 PHP loan. She plans to use the loan to purchase additional stock for her variety store and food stand businesses. She believes that through her perseverance and being a faithful steward, God will bless her businesses and establish them successfully. Luisa dreams that with her businesses going strong and gaining, her children will be able to finish their college education and get stable jobs someday.

Luisa faithfully attends her weekly fellowship meetings together with her co-members of Center for Community Transformation (CCT). All CCT community partners and clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay microfinance loans.

loans.use: To replenish stocks for her businesses

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to expand his business and meet the needs of his family

loans.name: Simon

texts.en: Simon is 29 years old.  He is married and is blessed with a 4-year-old child.  For ten years, he has been selling shoes.  He also does farming to supplement his family’s income.  Through Faulu Kenya, he has learned how to save his money.  He dreams of acquiring his own business premise in the future instead of renting. With the 20,000 Kenyan shillings, he will buy shoes.

loans.use: To buy shoes

loans.name: Geronima

texts.en: To make a living, Geronima R. raises crops. She is 72 years old, married, and has one grown-up child. She is from the village of Lupagan, Clarin, Misamis Occidental. She's able to earn a monthly net income of 7,000 from harvesting rice for sale. Geronima has been in her business for more than twenty years. In 2008, Geronima joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living conditions and enable her to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 25,000 Philippine pesos (PHP) from PMPC which was used as additional capital for her business. Geronima is requesting a new loan of 20,000 PHP which will be used to invest in rice retailing. This will be her sixth loan from PMPC. About PMPC: Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model. Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional fertilizer

loans.name: Juan Manuel

texts.es:
El señor Juan Manuel P., esta agradecido por su cooperación en el anterior crédito el cual pudo operar realizarle la operación que su hijo requería en ese momento.
A su vivienda le esta haciendo falta la barda alrededor, pero no cuenta con el dinero necesario para poder comprar el materia. Es por eso que esta solicitando un préstamo ya que le preocupa la protección y la seguridad de su familia. 
Planea pagar el crédito con una parte de los ingresos que obtiene de su trabajo como ingeniero de electrónica de una maquiladora.
texts.en: Señor Juan Manuel P. is grateful for your cooperation with his previous loan, which allowed him to pay for an operation that his son needed.  His home lacks a protective wall around it, but he does not have the necessary money to be able to buy the materials.  That is why he is requesting a loan, since he is worried at the lack of protection and security for his family.  He plans to repay the loan with a part of the income that he earns from his work as an electronics engineer in a bonded assembly plant.

loans.use: To build a protective wall around his house.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Purchase of generic products

loans.name: Leydi

texts.es:
Leydi tiene una tienda donde comercializa variedad de verduras; la tienda esta ubicada en la zona de Achachicala en la Ciudad de La Paz. El crédito lo necesita para adquirir más verduras y frutas para aumentar la cantidad de clientes.
Vive  en casa  de sus padres ubicada en la zona de Alto Lima de la ciudad  de El Alto. Es la primera vez que trabaja con IMPRO y con KIVA. Leydi es soltera.
texts.en:
Leydi has a store where she sells a variety of vegetables. The store is located in the Achachicala area of the city of La Paz. She needs the loan to acquire more fruits and vegetables and increase the quantity of her customers.
She lives with her parents in a house in the Alto Lima area of the city of El Alto. This is the first time she has worked with IMPRO or Kiva. Leydi is single.

loans.use: To buy vegetables in greater quantity to satisfy the demands of her customers.

loans.name: Marleni Areli

texts.es: Marleni Areli P. M., es una persona muy alegre y trabajadora quien reside en el municipio de Aguilares en el departamento de San Salvador, en donde reside junto a dos hijos de crianzas, cuya madre vive en Los Estados Unidos por lo que Marleni cuida de ellos y vela por su bienerstar. Ella posee una tienda en la que comercializa productos perecederos y de primera necesidad, la cual está ubicada en su casa de habitación. Ella solicita un préstamo por medio del cual tenga la capacidad económica de surtir su negocio, esto debido a que Marleni no cuenta con el dinero necesario para hacerlo, y es muy necesario tanto para ella como para sus hijos, ya que es este el negocio que les permite solventar gran parte de sus gastos familiares. Ella desea poder surtir su tienda con productos como detergente, comida enlatada, pan, golosinas, bebidas y otros productos más, los cuales son de primera necesidad en un hogar y que también son los que se solicitan más en una tienda. Marleni espera mejorar las ganancias y de esta forma contar con una vida más estable.
texts.en:
Marleni Areli P. M. is a cheerful, hardworking person who lives in the municipality of Aguilares in the department of San Salvador. She is raising two children whose mother lives in the United States. She takes care of them and looks out for their wellbeing. 

Marleni has a store selling basic perishable goods located in her house. She is seeking a loan so she can afford to buy more stock for her store. This is a very necessary step as she and the children depend on the income from the store to live on. 

She wishes to buy items such as detergent, canned food, bread, candy, drinks etc--anything that people use or order on a regular basis. In this way Marleni hopes to improve her financial situation and have a more stable lifestyle.

loans.use: to buy items such as detergent, canned food, bread, candy, drinks

loans.name: Joyce

texts.en: 66 year-old N. Joyce owns a Kindergarten and Primary school in Kasenge-Mukono. She has been overseeing the running of her schools for 12 years now. N. is happily married with six kids and she says it was after she finished her teacher training course that she began these schools. At first she had to make do with teaching in a government school. After some time, she made a decision to start her own school. N. also has a flower sales business. Monthly this businesses bring in shillings 362,500 as profits. Joyce says with this loan, she is going to purchase more scholastic materials for her school and also improve her flower sales business. In the picture, Joyce is shown with some of the toddlers who study at her school.

loans.use: to purchase more scholastic materials for her schools and also to improve her flower sales business

loans.name: María Emilia

texts.es:
La Señora. María Q. es socia del banco comunal El Cisne, vive en la comunidad de San Miguel que pertenece a la parroquia del Valle, esta parroquia es de clima frió, su gente se dedica al comercio, cría de animales y a la agricultura, son personas muy trabajadoras y siempre están en la lucha para sacar adelante a sus familias.
 
La Señora. María tiene de 66 años, es casada y tiene 5 hijos quienes son todos mayores de edad, casados e independientes. Su esposo labora como oficial de albañil, con el trabajo de los dos han logreado construir su casa propia.

Nuestra socia se dedica a la cría de chanchos, gallinas y cuyes a los cuales los vende cuando tiene alguna necesidad económica.

En el banco comunal esta hace 6 años y los créditos le han beneficiado para comprar mas animales, su nuevo crédito lo va a invertir en la compra de chanchos y pollos.

Su meta es seguir creciendo en su negocio.
texts.en:
María Q. is a member of "El Cisne" (The Swan) community bank.  She lives in San Miguel community which is located in El Valle parish.  This parish has a cold climate.  Its people work in commerce, raise animals and farm.  They are very hard-working people and are always striving to get their families ahead in life.

María is 66 years old, married, and has 5 grown-up children who are all married and live independently.  Her husband is a construction worker.  Through their joint work they have managed to build their own home.

María's business is raising pigs, hens and guinea pigs which she sells when she has a financial need to.

María has been a member of her community bank for 6 years and the loans she has received have helped her to buy more animals.  She will invest her new loan in buying pigs and chickens.

María's goal is to continue growing in her business.

loans.use: to buy pigs and chickens

loans.name: Elmer Alirio

texts.es:
Elmer, reside en San Francisco Gotera, departamento de Morazán, se dedica a la venta de llaves y alarmas para  vehículo y venta de CDs. Vive con su esposa y su hija de un año de edad.
Él tiene 3 años de dedicarse al negocio, y actualmente necesita un préstamo para la compra de mercadería como alarmas y CD variados, esta inversión contribuirá para el desarrollo con su negocio y ampliarse más para los clientes.
Su aspiración es ser un gran comerciante, poseer lo mejor en artículos para vehículo y así mismo velar por las necesidades de su familia.
texts.en:
Elmer resides in San Francisco Gotera in the Department of Morazán. He sells keys, vehicle alarms, and CDs. Elmer lives with his wife and one-year-old daughter. He has worked in his business for three years and currently needs a loan to buy merchandise such as alarms and various CDs. This investment will contribute to the development of his business and expand it for his customers.

His aspiration is to be a successful merchant by providing the best vehicle merchandise so that he can provide for the needs of her family.

loans.use: to purchase vehicle alarms and various music discs.

loans.name: Francisco Placido

texts.es:
Francisco es un hombre de familia de 43 años de edad, vive con su esposa y su pequeño hijo de 5 años. Su casa está ubicada en el distrito de Tambogrande, departamento de Piura.

La actividad que desarrolla Francisco, desde hace más de  4 años, es la agricultura. Éste cuenta con un terreno donde tiene plantación de mango, limón y plátanos. Además de ello Francisco se dedica al trabajo permanente en labores de campo en el terreno de un vecino y esto le permite recibir ingresos semanales con los que compra el alimento para su esposa e hijo.

Francisco solicita un crédito a Edpyme Alternativa de 1500 nuevos soles y el destino de éste será para la compra de fertilizantes, para abonar las plantaciones de mango y limón y asegurar una buena producción, algo que le permitirá incrementar sus ventas y tener mayores ingresos que serán destinados para la educación de su pequeño hijo.
texts.en:
Francisco is 43 years old and lives with his wife and their little five-year-old son. Their house is located in the Tambogrande district in the department of Piura.
Francisco has been working as a farmer for more than four years. He has a plot of land where he grows mangos, limes, and bananas. In addition, Francisco also works in a neighbor's fields, which affords him a weekly income that he can use to buy food for his wife and son.
Francisco is requesting a loan of 1500 soles from Edpyme Alternativa, which he will use to buy fertilizers for his mango and lime trees and increase his harvest. This will allow him to increase his sales, and he will use those higher earnings to send his little son to school.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers for his mango and lime orchards.

loans.name: Mareta

texts.en: This client lives in Zovasar village, Aragatsotn region, with her family of six members. The client is engaged in agriculture, which is her family’s main source of income. The client wants to increase her livestock and develop agriculture. With the requested loan, she plans to purchase more livestock and forage. With the loan’s help, the client will increase her income and improve her family’s living conditions.

loans.use: to pay for livestock and forage

loans.name: Noche De Luna Group

texts.es: Este grupo se llama "Noche de L." y se ubica en el estado de México. Esta comunidad se distingue porque cuenta con varias actividades economicas que fomentan el autoempleo. El grupo está conformado por 9 integrantes y es la primera vez que solicita un prestamo. La señora Mercedes es integrante del grupo. Ella es originaria de la comunidad y se dedica a la venta de pruductos naturistas; actividad que inició hace 4 años. Sus ventas las realiza en los alrededores de su comunidad haciendolas de casa en casa. Mercedes comenta que su negocio le permitio salir adelante y como es madre soltera busca dia a dia darle los valores a sus hijos y fortaleza para seguir con sus estudios, ahora su sueño es seguir invirtiendo en su negocio para tener siempre productos que ofrecer. La señora tiene 33 años, estudio la primaria, es divorciada y tiene 1 hijo que en la actualidad depende económicamente de ella. Gracias a su negocio los ha sacado adelante con sus estudios. Quiere el prestamo para seguir invirtiendo en su negocio, durante los últimos 4 años le ha dado la oportunidad de mantener a su familia. Actualmente tiene la fe de que saldra adelante así como tener más ventas. Y así seguir logrando sus sueños, que su hijo llegue a tener una carrera que les permita tener una mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en: This group is named "Noche de L." (moonlit night) and is located in the state of Mexico. This community is significant because it has many economic activities that promote self-employment. The group consists of 9 members and this is the first time that it is requesting a loan. Mercedes is a member of the group. She is originally from the community and she has been selling natural products for four years. She carries out her sales around the community making them from house to house. Mercedes says that this business allowed her to succeed. Since she is a single mother she strives every day to give her children values ​​and to have the strength to continue her studies. Her dream now is to continue investing in her business so that she always has products to offer. Mercedes is 33, she went to elementary school, is divorced and has one child who is currently financially dependent on her. Thanks to her business she has been able succeed with her studies. She wants this loan to continue investing in her business which has given her the opportunity to support her family during the last four years. She has faith that she will succeed and will have more sales and will continue to achieve her dream that her son will have a career that will allow them to have a better quality of life.

loans.use: to purchase natural products for her business.

loans.name: Daliz De La Luz

texts.es: Daliz De La Luz tiene 62 años, su actividad económica es la compra y venta de comida. Hace más de 24 años que se dedica a este negocio, por lo que Daliz tenía que buscar la forma de las deudas del hogar, empezó a vender ciertas comidas en su humilde vivienda, y con las ganancias logro comprar poco a poco mas inventario y fue así que estableció su negocio. Ahora acude a Fundación León 2000 para la compra de granos básicos, aceite, platos, bolsas y otros.
texts.en: Daliz De La Luz is 62 years old. She has been buying and selling meals for 24 years. Looking for a way to way for her family expenses, she started selling some meals in her humble house: with the earnings she bought more and more products, thus establishing her activity in this way. She is now asking a loan to Fundación León 2000 to buy basic grains, oil, dishes and bags.

loans.use: To buy basic grains, oil, dishes and bags.

loans.name: Salve Mae

texts.en:
Salve Mae is 22 years old and single. She works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 14,000 loan through NWTF to purchase more stock to sell.

Salve Mae has borrowed and repaid six loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for three years and also earns an income from farming rice and raising pigs.

Salve Mae aspires to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase more stock to sell.

loans.name: Magdaline

texts.en:
Magdaline is 63 years old. She is a humble and talkative businesswoman. She is married and blessed with two children who are 24 and 20 years old. One of her children is in school. She has been making her living for the last 10 years by engaging in farming. Previously, she used to sell groceries.
She had taken a prior loan of 60,000 Kenyan shillings, which she has paid back. She is now requesting a loan of 40,000 Kenyan shillings to buy spinach and kale seedlings, fertilizer and water pipes.

loans.use: To buy spinach and kale seedlings, fertilizer and water pipes

loans.name: Verónica Johanna

texts.es:
El Grupo De Crédito María Auxiliadora se reúne en La parroquia La Sequita que  pertenece al cantón Montecristi prospero cantón manabita, conocido como la cuna  del viejo luchador Eloy Alfaro y por los famosos sombreros de paja toquilla que son apreciados dentro y fuera del país.

En este lugar conocimos a la señora Verónica, tiene 26 años de edad, está casada y de esta relación  tiene un hijo de 5 años de edad que estudia en escuela, actualmente está en su sexto mes de embarazo de su segundo hijo. Su esposo trabaja en una fábrica en Manta.

Ella para ganarse algo por su cuenta y poder ayudar a su esposo con los gastos del hogar hace dos años atrás emprendió un negocio el mismo que lo tiene en su casa, allí ella se dedica a la compra y venta de maíz, balanceado y otros alimentos para animales de granja, nos cuenta que este negocio es muy bueno ya que la mayoría de las personas de su localidad se dedican a la cría de estos animalitos por lo cual sus ventas están aseguradas, nos cuenta que le gusta lo que hace ya que se gana algo sin tener que salir de su casa y esto le permite estar al tanto de las necesidades de sus hijos y de su hogar. 

Va a utilizar este crédito para comprar maíz, balanceado, arrocillo y otros alimentos para animales. Es socia del Grupo De Crédito hace 4 ciclos y le gusta porque con sus primer crédito empezó su negocio.
 
Su sueño es seguir creciendo en su negocio.
texts.en:
The communal bank María Auxiliadora meets in the parish of La Sequita which belongs to the Montecristi Canton, a prosperous Manabí canton, known as the birth place of the famous fighter Eloy Alfaro and for the famous straw hats much appreciated in and outside the country.

Here we meet Mrs. Verónica, 26, who is married and has a five-year old son who is in school.  She is also expecting her second child in three months.  Her husband works in a factory in Manta.

In order to earn her own income and help her husband with the household expenses, she started a business in her house two years ago.  She buys and sells corn and balanced feeds for farm animals.  She claims the business is good and most people living in the area raise small animals so her sales are sure to be successful.  She enjoys what she does and is able to earn a living without leaving home.  This helps cover her children's and the household's needs.

She plans to use the loan to buy corn, rice, balanced and other animal feed.  She has been in the communal bank for four terms and likes it because she was able to establish her business with the first loan.

Her dream is to continue expanding her business.

loans.use: To buy corn, rice, balanced and other animal feed.

loans.name: María Angelita

texts.es:
La Señora. María es socia del banco comunal La Florida, vive por los alrededores de la ciudad de Cuenca, esta ciudad  es conocida por la belleza de su centro histórico, también tiene varios lugares para visitar, cuenta con una amplia gastronomía la misma que cautiva el paladar de sus visitante, su gente mantienen su cultura y tradiciones.

Doña María tiene 53 años, es madre soltera de 3 hijas de 29, 27, 22 años de edad, su primera y tercera hija son casadas e independientes, su segunda hija estudia en la universidad de la ciudad y también le ayuda en su negocio. No tienen casa propia por lo que viven arrendando.
