La Señora. María tiene un local donde vende comida, esta actividad le ha permitido mantener a su familia, lleva 15 años en este negocio y trabaja de lunes a sábado desde las 7 de la mañana hasta las 7 de la noche.

Este es su primer crédito que realiza en el banco comunal al cual fue  invitada por su hermana. Este crédito lo va a invertir en la compra de sillas, vajilla y víveres ya que va a ampliar su local. 

Su sueño es tener su casa propia.
texts.en:
María is a member of the La Florida community bank. She lives in the outskirts of the city of Cuenca. This city is known for the beauty of its historic center and also has various places to visit. The city has good food that captivates the palates of visitors and the people maintain their culture and traditions. 
María is 53 years old and is a single mother of three daughters who are 29, 27, and 22 years old. Her first and third daughters are married and independent. Her second daughter is studying at the university in the city and also helps María with her business. They don't have their own home so they rent. 
María has a store where she sells food. This work has enabled her to support her family and she has been doing it for 15 years. She works Monday through Saturday from 7am to 7pm.
This is the first loan that she will have from the community bank, which she was invited to join by her sister. She will use this loan to buy chairs, dishes, and food so that she can grow her business. 
Her dream is to have her own home.

loans.use: to buy chairs, dishes, and supplies.

loans.name: Maria

texts.pt:
Nasceu  em Magude,  provincia  de Maputo, sul  de Moçambique, viúva  e  mãe  de 7 filhos  dos  quais  1 frequenta  a  escola e os outros constituiram suas familias. Nunca teve oportunidade de estudar  por  falta  de condições financeiras. Vive na casa propria com a sua familia e não sustenta mais ninguem. 

Saiu da sua terra natal quando contraiu matrimonio, é agricultora ha mais de 16 anos e explora grandes hectares de terra, e  tem um rendimento de cerca de 6.500.00mt por mês que aplica nas despesas de casa e poupa algum na sua conta bancaria.
Fez emprestimo na PROCRIDIT e na SOCREMO para investir na sua actividade e conseguiu pagar sem dificuldades, conheceu a Hluvuku atravez de uma amiga que tambem é cliente desta instituição. Este é o seu primeiro emprestimo na Hluvuku no valor de 10.000.00mt com qual pretende aplicar na sua actividade (COMPRA DE  sementes de feijão e milho).
Pretende comprar um trator para aumentar o nível de produção e obter mais lucros, assim irá solicitar mais emprestimos a Hluvuku.
texts.en:
Maria was born in Magude, province of Maputo in the south of Mozambique, is a widow and mother of 7 children, 1 of which attends school whilst the others now have families of their own. She never had the opportunity to study due to a lack of financial means. She lives in her own house with her family and does not support anyone else.

She left her birth-town when she got married, has been a famer for more than 16 years and works on large hectares of land with an income of around 6,500 meticals (MZN) per month which she uses for household expenses and saves in her bank account.

Maria has had loans with PROCRIDIT and SOCREMO which she invested in her activities and managed to pay off without difficulties. She learned of Hluvuku through a friend who is also a client of this institution. This is her first loan with Hluvuku for the amount of 10,000 MZN which she intends to apply to her activity (purchasing bean and corn seeds).

She intends to purchase a tractor to increase the levels of production and obtain more profits and as such will solicit further loans from Hluvuku.

loans.use: purchase agricultural raw materials (bean and corn seeds)

loans.name: Casimiro

texts.en:
Casimiro has been managing his two-hectare rice field for almost 20 years. He has been exerting more effort in maintaining his crop to produce better yield.

He is 58 years old and married having five children who are in school. Casimiro's children serve as an inspiration for him in pursuing his dreams of providing them with a good education and a successful life despite his poverty. 

Casimiro is asking for a loan of P15,000 to buy hybrid seeds, insecticides and herbicides used in farming. With the help of this loan he can provide enough sustenance for his crop and produce a bountiful harvest. 

Casimiro wants to enjoy the fruits of his sacrifices. He wants to see his children earn their degrees and obtain good employment someday.

loans.use: to buy hybrid seeds, insecticides and herbicides used in farming

loans.name: Jumagul's Group

texts.en:
Jumagul is the leader of this group. She is 27 and together with her husband, who works as an inspector, she is bringing up a daughter and a son. Both children are preschool age (under seven). 

In order to earn additional money for the family budget, Jumagul breeds livestock. At the moment, she is keeping two cows and eight sheep. With money received from the loan, she wants to purchase five animals for breeding. 

In the future Jumagul plans to purchase a family car.

--- Where Did This Loan Come From? ---
This loan is brought to you by Mol Bulak Finance (MBF), a young, ambitious and socially-focused microfinance institution in Kyrgyzstan. MBF is strongly committed to the principles of sustainable development and upholds the triple bottom line: people (building human capital and taking care of its customers as well as society), planet (keeping environmentally friendly) and profit (earning revenue to expand autonomously). MBF is the only microfinance institute in Kyrgyzstan that delivers its services to customers 365 days a year. To learn more about MBF and view a video presentation about the organization, please visit http://www.kiva.org/about/aboutPartner?id=135 

If you would like to support and learn more about Kyrgyzstan and microfinance in Central Asia, please join our Lending Team - Supporters of Kyrgyzstan – Mol Bulak Finance at http://kiva.org/team/kyrgyzstan. Members will get special updates and news from Kiva Fellows in Kyrgyzstan and from the MBF staff.

loans.use: to purchase livestock.

loans.name: Deilyn

texts.es:
Deilyn
Costura e Hidroponía
350000

	Deilyn tiene 27 años de edad, vive en la comunidad de San Pedro de Poas, lugar ubicado en las faldas del Volcán que lleva el mismo nombre. Ha trabajado con el Banco Mujer Emprendedoras de Chilamate, pero en esta oportunidad, y para apoyar su nueva actividad opta por un préstamo individual. Vive con su esposo y dos hijos menores de edad, quienes están en la escuela primaria de la localidad.
	 Ella se levanta muy temprano, prepara a sus hijos para la escuela y le alista la comida a su esposo, para el trabajo. Inicia las labores en  la hidroponía como a las 8 am, y en la tarde se dedica a la costura.
	Su actividad principal es la costura, pero al trasladarse a una casa más grande y llevar un curso sobre hidroponía, se ha dedicado a aprovechar este espacio y sembrar lechugas, chiles, tomates y vender en la comunidad. Ante el éxito tenido se desea invertir este crédito para ampliar la siembra y ofrecer una mayor cantidad de productos a sus clientes.
	Dentro de sus metas esta poder organizarse para llegar a tener un negocio más grande y estable, ya que una de sus debilidades es la parte de mercadeo, ella quiere negociar mejor sus contratos y así obtener un mayor ingreso para su familia.
texts.en:
Deilyn
Seamstress and hydroponics
350000

Deilyn is 27 years old and she lives in the community of San Pedro de Poas. The place is located in the area immediately surrounding the volcano of the same name. She has worked with the communal bank named "Banco Mujer Emprendedoras de Chilamate" in the past but at this opportunity she opts for an individual loan. She lives with her husband and their two young children, who attend primary school in the locality.

She starts her days very early in the morning, getting her children ready for school and preparing the food for her husband to take to work. She starts work with her hydroponics at around 8am and in the afternoons she dedicates her time to sewing.

Her primary activity is sewing but when they moved to a larger house she took a course on hydroponics. She has taken advantage of their larger space to grow lettuces, chilies, and tomatoes to sell in the community. Given its success, she wishes to invest this loan in expanding her produce business and offer larger quantities of products to her clients. 

Among her goals is to organize herself to achieve a larger and more stable business. One of her weaknesses is marketing and she wants to negotiate better contracts in order to obtain a better income for her family.

loans.use: to invest in the purchase of raw materials and to expand her hydroponics business.

loans.name: Mamerta

texts.en:
Mamerta works hard to support her family. She is married and has a fish vending business in the Philippines. Mamerta has been in this business for 20 years. She would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

Mamerta requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to buy more fish to sell in her food stall.

loans.use: to buy more fish to sell in her food stall

loans.name: Darlene

texts.en:
Darlene is 28 years old and married with one child. Darlene works very hard to provide for them.

Darlene runs a sari-sari (convenience) store in the Philippines and requested a loan of PHP 12,000 through NWTF to buy stocks of merchandise for her store.

Darlene has been in this business for three years and sells a variety of items such as soap, basic grains, detergent, and other groceries. 

In the future, Darlene would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her child to college.

loans.use: to buy stocks of merchandise for her store

loans.name: Saidi

texts.es: Saidi de 29 años  reside en el barrio la pradera con sus padres y una hermana menor; es comerciante de productos por catálogo y mercancías varias,  tales como jeans, camisetas, blusas, sandalias; ella. Comercializa productos mediante guías especializadas de  cuatro empresas de cosmeticos y prendas de vestir, con su negocio ayuda en los gastos familiares, tiene  una amplia clientela de la que goza por su estrategia comercial relacional. Con su rentabilidad cubre sus costos y aporta gran parte de los gastos familiares, sus activos están representados básicamente en cuentas por cobrar e inventarios; su rentabilidad es alta debido a que aprovecha la mayor parte de las ofertas de los productos por catálogos y también a que el margen de ganancia de las mercancías varias es elevado. Tiene un buen capital de trabajo, y las rotaciones de cartera e inventarios son ágiles. En la actualidad está aplicando a su primer credikiva primer financiamiento que hace a la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, para invertir especialmente en prendas de vestir que tiene encargadas para la temporada de fin de año,  época de gran repunte en sus ventas y esto se lo dice su experiencia comercial.
texts.en:
Saidi is 29, and lives in the La Pradera neighborhood with her parents and younger sister. She sells catalogue products and a variety of merchandise, such as jeans, t-shirts, blouses, sandals, and other things. She sells products through specialized guides from four cosmetic and clothing companies. With her business she helps with the family's expenses. 

She has a broad clientele, who enjoy dealing with her because of her personalized sales approach. With her profit she covers her costs, and contributes a great part of the family's expenses. Her profitability is high, because she takes advantage of most of the special offers in the product catalogues, and because the profit margin is high on her other merchandise.

She has good working capital, and turnover of accounts payable and inventory is rapid. 

Currently she is applying for her first Credikiva loan from Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, to invest especially in articles of clothing that she has ordered for the end of year season, a peak sales period based on what her sales experience tells her.

loans.use: To buy articles of clothing that she has ordered for the end of year season.

loans.name: Sizouhoin

texts.fr:
Sizouhoin est une femme âgée de 44 ans. Elle est mariée å un agent de sécurité. Elle a 3 enfants, tous scolarisé. Le premier a 17 ans et le dernier a 7 ans.  
Sizouhoin travaille comme revendeuse depuis 2005. Elle vend de l’argile pour tous clients et est ambulante. Elle achète les produits à Lomé. Elle travaille seule. Au moment, elle n’a pas de difficulté principale. 
Sizouhoin a requis son 1er crédit de WAGES afin d’acheter de l’argile. Elle veut réinvestir dans l’activité. 
Dans les prochaines années, Sizouhoin voudrait agrandir son activité. Elle dit qu’avec les profits, elle prévoit d’améliorer les conditions de vie de la famille.
texts.en:
Sizouhoin is 44 years old. She's married to a security agent, and has three school-attending children. The oldest is 17, the youngest is 7 years old.

Sizouhoin has been working as a reseller since 2005. She sells clay as a traveling saleswoman to any customer. She gets her products in Lomé and works alone. At this time, she doesn't have any specific problems.

She's seeking her first loan from Kiva's partner, WAGES, in order to buy clay. She wants to reinvest in her business. In the forthcoming years, she would like to expand it.

She says that with her profits, she intends to improve the standard of living of her family.

loans.use: to buy clay

loans.name: Sundos

texts.en:
Sundos is a 21-year-old lady, who has five sisters and one brother. Sundos is studying to get her bachelor degree in X-ray technology, and she is now in her third year.
After completing her bachelor degree, Sundos hopes to continue her studies to get a higher degree and work in the field. She wants to help her family's financial situation and help in teaching the rest of her sisters and brother. Sundos has applied for this loan to pay her semester tuition fees, so she can finish her studies.

loans.use: to pay her semester's tuition fees.

loans.name: Licel

texts.en:
Licel, a 27-year-old woman from Trinidad, Bohol, is married to a farmer. Licel has had a sari-sari store business for five years, selling various items including soy sauce, vinegar, soap, shampoo and canned goods. She also assists her husband in planting rice on their land.

Licel, who does her best to support her family, is requesting this loan to purchase fertilizers and additional items to sell such as canned goods and noodles. She hopes for this loan to help their businesses and family.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizers and additional items to sell such as canned goods and noodles.

loans.name: Liset Vanessa

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal “LAS ORQUIDEAS”; El banco está ubicado en el distrito de Cusco, perteneciente a la provincia de Cusco y departamento de Cusco.

La socia es la Sra. Liset Vanessa; ella tiene 20 años de edad y es conviviente y tiene 1 hijo; La socia alterna sus actividades diarias con el negocio de venta de artesanía, ella lleva sombreros, polos, llaveros y chompas a lugares como Bolivia, por medio de este negocio la socia saca adelante a sus hijo, su sueño de la socia es tener una tienda donde pueda vender la artesanía. La socia solicita el préstamo para comprar artesanía como polos, llaveros, chompas al por mayor.

 La socia está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en:
This member belongs to the “LAS ORQUIDEAS” communal bank. The bank is located in the district, province and department of Cuzco.

This member's name is Liset Vanessa. She is 20 years old, in a common law marriage and has a 1 year old. She alternates her daily activities with the business of selling artisanal crafts. She takes hats, t-shirts, key chains and sweaters to places like Bolivia. With this business, she is getting her son ahead. Her dream is to have a store where she can sell her artisanal crafts. She is asking for the loan to buy artisanal crafts such as t-shirts, key chains, and sweaters wholesale.  

She is happy with the loan and committed to making her payments.

loans.use: to buy artisanal crafts such as t-shirts, key chains, and sweaters wholesale.

loans.name: Anaprofes 4 Group

texts.fr: Le groupement "ANAPROFES 4" est composée de 5 femmes mariées qui exercent toutes dans le commerce de produits alimentaires, de légumes et de poisson frais et séché.Elles habitent dans le même quartier et s'appuient mutuellement dans leurs activités à travers une tontine qui les réunie un après midi du 5 de chaque mois.Elles soutiennent leurs maris dans les dépenses de la famille notamment celle de la nourriture.Le chef du groupe ( en vert, à gauche) est mère de quatre enfants qui vont tous à l'école. Elle vend des légumes et du poisson frais sur une table installée devant son domicile. Elle parvient à subvenir à la plupart de ses besoins et à améliorer l'alimentation de la famille.Elle supplée aussi de temps en temps son mari dans la prise en charge des frais médicaux des enfants. Son ambition est de construire une cantine devant chez elle.Le groupe , pour augmenter ses revenus , sollicite un pret de 600000f afin d'acheter des produits alimentaires et des produits halieutiques.
texts.en: The Anaprofes 4 group is made up of five married woman who all trade in groceries, vegetables and fresh and frozen fish. They live in the same neighborhood and mutually rely on a "tontine" system (a revolving finance system where each member contributes periodically an agreed amount and this is passed on in rotation to different members) whereby they meet in the afternoon of the fifth day of every month. They help out their husbands with the family expenditure, notably food. The leader of the group (in green on the left of the photo) is mother to four children, who all attend school. She sells vegetables and fresh fish on a table which has been set up in front of her house. She manage to provide for most of her needs and improve her family's food. She also stands in for her husband sometimes in covering her children's medical costs. Her ambition is to build a stall in front of her house. In order to increase its income, the group is requesting a loan of 600,000 francs so that they can buy food and fishing products.

loans.use: to buy food and fishing products

loans.name: Andres

texts.es: Andrés tiene 52 años, casado con Felicitas de 46 años, fruto de esta relación tienen dos hijos. Juntos habitan en su casa propia ubicada en el centro poblado de Canayre del distrito de LLochegua. Andrés es un hombre de buenos principios, nso comenta que cuando empezó en este negocio al principio no se ganaba mucho pero poco a poco fue ganando clientela. Actualmente tiene buenos ingresos gracias al esfuerzo que le puso en la atención al cliente. Es así que se levanta muy temprano para abrir su negocio, y recibir a sus clientes que desde muy temprano comprarn lo necesario para preparar sus alimento y luego enrumbrar a sus campor agrícolas que es donde trabajan la gran mayoría. En el futuro piensa surtir su tienda, con prendas de vestir y generarse más ingresos. Asimismo Andres se dedica a la agricultura donde cultiva cacao y otros productos que tienen mucha demanda en el mercado. Este será su tercer credito con MFP, por lo que se compromete en cancelar puntualmente el pago de sus cuotas. Con los 2,000 nuevos soles realizará la compra de más productos para el expendio en su tienda.
texts.en:
Andrés is 52 years old.  He is married to Felicitas, 46.  They have two children together and live in their own house in the heart of Canayre in the district of Llochegua.  Andrés is a principled man. 

He tells us that in the beginning when he started this business he didn't earn much, but, little by little, he increased his clientele.  Currently, he has a good income thanks to the effort that he put into customer service.  This is why he gets up very early to open his store for his customers.  Early in the morning they buy what they need to prepare food and then they head to the fields where the vast majority of them work.   

In the future he plans to stock his store with clothing to generate more income.  Andrés also works as a farmer, growing cocoa and other products that are in high demand.  

This will be his third loan with MFP and he is committed to paying off his loan on time.  With the 2,000 nuevos soles [Peruvian currency] he will buy more products to sell in his store.

loans.use: buy more products to stock his store.

loans.name: Fabiola Margarita

texts.es:
La señora Fabiola Margarita es una mujer trabajadora y emprendedora quien ha hecho de todo un poco desde vender artesanías, cosa de horno, frutas, cerdo…etc. Ella invierte según la temporada  desde hace 15 años. Ella con su negocio a lo grado comprar y mejorar su hogar lo último que adquirió fue su cama y una DVD.
En la actualidad está realizando tortillas en lo que invertirá el crédito con la compra de materia prima que sería maíz, leña y cal.
texts.en:
Fabiola Margarita is a hard-working and entrepreneurial woman who has done a bit of everything, from selling handicrafts to cooking, selling fruit, pigs, etc.  She has been investing according to the season for 15 years.  Through her business, she has managed to buy and improve her home.  The latest things she acquired were a bed and a DVD player.

She is currently working making tortillas.  She will invest her loan in buying raw materials (corn, firewood and lime).

loans.use: to buy corn and firewood

loans.name: Chhory's Group

texts.en: As a farmer in Moung Russey district of Battambang province, Chhory is a mother of one kid who remains in school and is 61 years old. To deal with her daily cost of living, she grows rice as the mains source of income which has returned her about 45,000 KHR per day. This is first loan for Chhory with VisionFund (Kiva’s partner). She is group leader of two members and she is leader. For Chhory, she will spend her entire loan to buy rice seed and fertilizer for her crop. She hopes that this loan will help her to earn more income.

loans.use: To buy rice seed and fertilizer for her crop

loans.name: Lucrèce

texts.fr: Lucrèce est âgée de 30 ans et est mariée à un certain Laurent. Le couple a trois enfants, dont certains scolarisés et tous leur charge. Lucrèce vit ensemble avec son mari et ses enfants. Lucrèce  assure ensemble avec son mari les diverses charges familiales.  Lucrèce  a arrêté l’école au niveau primaire. Pour subvenir à ses différents besoins, Lucrèce vend depuis treize ans des tissus et de façon secondaire des sacs. Lucrèce s’approvisionne dans un marché du Bénin. En vue de renforcer davantage son activité par l’augmentation du stock de ses produits, afin de mieux satisfaire la demande de sa clientèle, Lucrèce sollicite pour une cinquième fois l'appui financier de ALIDé. Les crédits consentis antérieurement ont été bien remboursés.

loans.use: Acheter des sacs.

loans.name: Donna

texts.en:
Donna is a single woman, 25 years old with one child. She is a very hard working entrepreneur.

Donna has a fishing business in the Philippines. Donna requested a PHP 11000 loan amount through NWTF to buy new fish net, gasoline for her boat and other materials for her business.

Donna has been in this business for 3 years. She would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy new fish net, gasoline for her boat and other materials for her business

loans.name: Dina Arely Lagos

texts.en:
I studied to be a beautician and I always hoped to have my own salon. With great effort and deliberation, my husband and I invested our savings in our salon, but we did not have sufficient funds left to invest in products.

A year ago, we made our first loan for $500 which we used to buy product inventory such as shampoos, polishes and other products. Women come to us for hair styling, massages, and nails. With this second loan, I am buying inventory in hair and nail beauty-products. Thank you for your trust in me which has provided a sustainable business and some profits to improve my sonâ€™s education.

loans.use: Invest in inventory and materials such as make-up, polishes, hair-dryers, shampoos, coloring and other products.

loans.name: Olga

texts.en:
Olga is divorced with three kids. Her husband was an alcoholic and left the family 7 years ago. As the one left with the responsibility of raising her children, Olga was forced to find ways to provide for her family. The owner of the grocery store where she worked was moving to a different city and decided to sell the store. Olga took a risk and used her savings to purchase the store which is located on one of the main highways in town. Lending services from “Nadiya Ukraine” have helped promote the growth of Olga’s business. She was able to remodel the interior of the store and hire three people to help her run it. Olga received her first loan in 2005 and since then has never had a single late payment – even when it’s been freezing cold and her sales were down. The loans have enabled Olga to increase her business income allowing her to buy a comfortable, private home for her family. Olga is requesting a loan of $1,200 to expand the selection of groceries in her store. She is planning to introduce new items and purchase assorted cereals, fruits, dairy products, bread and beverages that always sell well with travelers in Ukraine. As a very intelligent, hard-working entrepreneur, Olga is a woman people look up to in her community. Her good reputation and customer-friendly service have a very positive impact on her business. Increased funding will help ensure her ongoing success and continue to improve the quality of life for her family.

Ольга – розлучена, в неї троє дітей. Її чоловік алкоголік покинув родину ще 7 років тому. Ольга залишилася сам на сам з усіма проблемами, вона була відповідальна за виховання дітей, отже змушена була шукати шляхів для забезпечення родини. Власник крамниці, де працювала Ольга, переїжджав до іншого міста й вирішив продати крамницю. Вона вирішила ризикнути та, використавши власні заощадженні, викупила крамницю, яка знаходиться на одній з головних автострад міста. Кредитні послуги „Надії України” сприяли росту бізнесу Ольги. Вона змогла відремонтувати магазин та взяти на роботу трьох реалізаторів. Першу позику Ольга отримала в 2005 році. За весь час роботи з „Надією України” в неї не було жодного прострочення – навіть коли на дворі було дуже холодно та обсяги продажів впали. Позики надали Ользі можливість збільшити доходи та придбати зручний будинок, де зараз живе її родина. Ольга просить про позику в 1 200 доларів для того, щоб збільшити вибір продовольчих товарів в своїй крамниці. Вона планує поповнити асортимент новими продуктами та закупити різні крупи, фрукти, молочні вироби, хліб та напої, які завжди користуються попитом серед подорожуючих в Україні. Ольга – дуже розумний та працьовитий підприємець. Її шанують як покупці, так і колеги по роботі. Гарна репутація та ввічливе обслуговування позитивно вливають на її бізнес. Фінансова підтримка сприятиме подальшій успішній роботі та росту бізнесу, а також якісно покращить рівень життя її родини.

loans.use: To increase the variety of products in her store

loans.name: Samira

texts.en:
Samira is 24 years old and lives with her nine-member family in District 13 of Kabul. She is single. Samira and her brother are in business together. She and three other sisters create flowers in their home, and her brother sells them at his shop in the main market place. He also does the marketing for the business.

She is on her 4th cycle loan from AFSG, and these loans have enabled her to grow her business. Now she is able to continue her studies that she missed during the Taliban years. She could not have done this without the help of the AFSG loan program. She is requesting another loan of $400 to further expand her business and improve her family's standard of living and education.

Note: The picture featured in this business profile is the brother of Samira. With some families in Afghanistan, it is culturally unacceptable to post a picture of a woman on the internet, but the loan is to the female entrepreneur.

loans.use: To purchase color paper and plastic to make flowers

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Purchase of lumber for his carpentry shop

loans.name: Rosa

texts.es:
Business Description

Rosa has 4 years experience. While she was still young she started working in houses doing domestic chores. Bit by bit she saved up some money and started a small sewing factory in her house. Along with her daughter, she started making clothes and then selling them. She also sells household items on the weekend. She works at home from 8am – 3pm everyday, and in the afternoon and evening she dedicates herself to her business.

Loan Use

She will use the credit to buy material to make clothes. She will also buy a better sewing machine for a better finish. She would also like to invest in household articles to sell.

Personal Information

Rosa is a single mother and has 4 kids, 3 of whom are studying, while the eldest helps her in her business. Their house is made of sugar cane stalks and has a dirt floor. Their desire is to be able to build their house out of cement, improving the family’s way of life.

Translated from Spanish by Liz Harvey, Kiva Volunteer

Descripción del Negocio

Rosa tiene una experiencia de 4 años con su actividad. Desde joven se inicio trabajando en casa realizando quehaceres domésticos. Poco a poco logro tener unos ahorros con los que monto un pequeño taller de costura en su domicilio. Con su hija comenzó a elaborar prendas de vestir para luego venderlas. Además se dedica a la venta de artículos de hogar los fines de semana. Trabaja en casa todos los días de 8 a.m. hasta 3 p.m. Por las tardes se dedica a su negocio.

Uso del Préstamo

El crédito lo invertirá en compra de materia prima para elaborar sus prendas de vestir. Además de comprar una maquina de coser con el que pueda darle un mejor acabado sus prendas. Otra parte poder invertir en la compra de artículos de hogar para su venta.

Información Personal

Rosa es madre soltera. Tiene 4 hijos. Tres de ellos estudian y la mayor le ayuda con su taller de costura. Su casita es de caña y tiene piso de tierra. Su mayor deseo es poder tener ahorros con el que puede construir su casita de cemento. Mejorando de esta manera la vida de su familia.

loans.use: To buy a sewing machine and material/Comprar una maquina y materia prima

loans.name: Viviano

texts.es:
Viviano is a farmer and producer of cow’s milk, which he sells in his community to wholesale markets.

He lives in the Huayhuasi Community in Rio Abajo located two hours from the city of La Paz.

The credit will be used to purchase a high-end breed of cattle in order to increase milk production and, in turn, increase his income.

This is his first credit with Impro; the evaluation carried out demonstrated a steady stream of income and qualified him for the loan.

Translated from Spanish by Rebecca Pendleton, Kiva Volunteer.

Viviano es agricultor y productor de leche de vaca, la cual pone a la venta en su comunidad, a comercializadores mayoristas.

Vive en la Comunidad de Huayhuasi sector rio Abajo ubicado a dos horas de la ciudad de La Paz.

El crédito lo destinara para la compra de una vaca de raza mejorada para incrementar la producción de leche y asi mejorar sus ingresos.

Es el primer crédito con Impro; la evaluación realizada muestra un flujo de caja aceptable y lo califica para otorgarle el préstamo.

loans.use: Purchase of a milking cow

loans.name: Hun

texts.en: Mrs. Hun C., aged 23, works selling drinks in front of her house earning, on average, $7.50 per day in revenue.  Her husband, aged 34, works as a taxi driver earning $10-$12.50 per day in revenue before expenses.  They have two children who are too young to attend school yet.  She would like to request a loan of $1000 in order to build a proper house with a tin roof to shelter her family from the rain.  This will also give her a place to store her inventory of drinks.  In the future, Mrs. Hun would like to open a stand for selling rice, food, noodles and drinks to increase her income and the living standards of her family.

loans.use: To build a better house to protect her family and merchandise from the rain.

loans.name: Teresa

texts.es:
Teresa belongs to the "Las Margaritas" Grupo Mientras Tanto (a "Grupo Mientras Tanto" is an interim group of borrowers not large enough to form a communal bank), and lives in the province of San Martin, district of La Banda de Shilcayo. She sells medicine and first aid supplies.

She shares the responsibilities her home with her husband and has four children, but currently only cares for a grandson. Her husband also supports her in the business since he is a health technician at a hospital, and with the help of a microcredit she has been able to expand her business.

With a loan, which will be repaid in 4 months, she will buy medicines such as analgesics, antipyretics and material for giving injections, which is most in demand.

Teresa is 61 years old and is a woman who for most of her life has worked in rural zones where she learned to serve persons with many health needs; this motivated her to learn more about medicine, with her husband advising her. She is happy to be able to help others with her business, which has no set hours and is always at the service of people.

Translated from Spanish by Molly Puglisi, Kiva Volunteer.

La señora Teresa pertenece al Grupo Mientras Tanto “Las Margaritas”, vive en la Región San Martín, provincia de San Martín, distrito de La Banda de Shilcayo, su domicilio y negocio están ubicados en el Jr. Césa Vallejo Nº 217 Asociación de Vivienda San Juan y se dedica a la venta de medicinas para primeros auxilios.

Las responsabilidades del hogar las comparte con su esposo, tiene cuatro hijos, pero actualmente sólo tiene a cargo a un nieto, el esposo también la apoya en el negocio ya que es Técnico Sanitario en un hospital y con la ayuda del microcrédito ha podido implementar más su negocio.

Con el préstamo, el cual pagará en 4 meses, comprará medicinas como analgésicos, antipiréticos en cajas y material para dar servicio de inyectables que son los que tienen mayor movimiento diario en el negocio.

La señora Teresa tiene 61 años y es una mujer que la mayor parte de su vida ha trabajado por zonas rurales donde aprendió a servir a personas con muchas necesidades de salud y esto la motiva a aprender más sobre el mundo de la medicina con el asesoramiento de su esposo. Se siente feliz de poder servir a los demás con un negocio que no tiene horario definido y que siempre está al servicio de las personas.

loans.use: Purchase of medicines.

location.town: La Banda de Shilcayo - San Martín

loans.name: Dina's Group

texts.en:
Rayda, Dina, and Claudia have been members of the community bank “Arco Iris II.” Through their bank, they have learned about customer service, saving, and financial literacy. They feel that the other members are like sisters.

Rayda is 31 years old and has three children, who are ages 16, 12, and 7. For the past five years she has been traveling to different communities around Ayacucho to buy grains, which she then sells in a market in Ayacucho. She was able to start this business after receiving a loan from the community bank. The business enables her to provide for her children.

Dina is 35 and has three children. They are 12, 11, and 7 years old. She is an artisan weaver. She learned how to weave from her husband and they now run the business together.

Likewise, Claudia also has three children. She is 38 years old. For the past 13 years she has been selling fruit in a market in Ayacucho. With her new loan, she will expand her business and begin to sell prepared meals.

Rayda, Dina, and Claudia need loans of 400, 1000, and 1000 soles respectively (3 soles = $1), which will be invested in buying grains (such as wheat and cornmeal), thread, and groceries (such as meat, potatoes, and oil) to make meals. A large part of participating in the community bank learning how to save. The women are encouraged to keep a savings account at the bank. With their savings, these women plan to improve their homes and pay for their children’s education. Rayda, Dina, and Claudia dream that their children will have a better life.

loans.use: to invest in buying grains (such as wheat and cornmeal), thread, and groceries (including meat, potatoes, and oil) to make meals

loans.name: Zainabu's Tuimarike Group

texts.en:
Zainabu M. is 35 years old, married, with five children, ages 15, 14, 8, 7 and 4. She and her husband also take care of one other person, age 58. Everyday, she works from 6am to 6pm at her clothing shop which she started in 2006. She can earn a monthly profit of about $40 from her sales.

She now hopes for a loan to buy more items for her business.

loans.use: To buy more clothes

loans.name: Baenka Group

texts.fr:
Notre projet consiste à la mise en place de différents points de vente de fourrage animale et d'autres  types 

d'aliments pour élevage. Nous avons constaté que le ravitaillement en détail des aliments de bétail marche t

rès bien, car les populations ont tendance à élever leur propre animaux domestiques chez eux. Ainsi, nous 

avons pensé qu'il serait judicieux de pouvoir disposer d'un stock de fourrage à proximité des populations. Ce 

projet nous permettra de créer des emplois pour tous les membres du groupe qui pourront ainsi disposer 

d'un point de vente chacun. Ainsi tout le monde sera occupé et personne n'aura le temps de songer à 

l'immigration. Ainsi les jeunes restertons sur place et participeront au développement de notre pays. Nous 

croyons que grâce à Kiva, nous pourrons tous travailler et gagner honnêtement notre vie.

loans.use: Achat d'aliment de Bétail

loans.name: Taras

texts.en:
Taras is a taxi driver from the city of Ivano-Frankivsk in western Ukraine. He has been working as a driver for many years. After serving for a time in the military he drove for a government official and then later worked as a driver for a private person. About seven years ago he decided to become self-employed and started working as a taxi driver. Taras is married and has one daughter who is fourteen. His taxi business is the main source of income for his family. Currently he makes about $30-$35 per day.

Taras has requested a loan to help take care of some repairs to his taxi. He has repaid all previous loans from Nadiya Ukraine. We are happy for this opportunity to support him in his business and help keep him on the road making a living.

loans.use: Taras would like to make repairs to his taxi.

loans.name: Aloumouvi

texts.fr:
Mr. Aloumouvi E. was born in 1986 in the department of Vo, he still lives in the same village where he is a trader. He is married and the father of four (04) children. Thanks to the lubrication oil he is selling, he is able to provide for the needs of his family. However, since he noticed an increase in his clientele, his trade has waned considerably. For his stability, and for his clientele to feel confident in him, he is requesting financing to remedy his difficulties. He is very confident that this project will be very profitable and he will be able to solve his problems.

Translated from French by Véronique Fourment, Kiva volunteer.

Né en 1986 à Atsansi dans la préfecture de Vo, monsieur Aloumouvi E. vit dans le même village et exerce son métier de commerce. Marié, il est père de quatre (04) enfants. C’est grâce à son commerce de lubrifiants qu’il arrive à prendre en charge ses besoins et ceux de sa famille. Mais depuis qu’il a constaté une augmentation de sa clientèle, son commerce a considérablement déchu. Pour sa stabilité et la mise en confiance de sa clientèle, il sollicite un financement pour pouvoir remédier ses difficultés. Il est très confiant que ce projet lui sera très rentable dans la mesure où il pourra résoudre ses problèmes.

loans.use: Buying a supply of lubrication oil

loans.name: Sardaran

texts.en:
Sardaran baji, wife of M.S., lives in a two-room brick house in Kasur, Pakistan. Sardaran baji is a housewife and prefers to do household work. She is a mother of four children. Sardaran baji and her husband have a good reputation in their neighborhood. Her husband drives an auto-rickshaw taxi (a three-wheeled vehicle often known as a 'tuk-tuk'). He has been in this profession for the last 10 years. Now, she is applying for a loan to buy an auto-rickshaw for her husband to drive.

NOTE: 'Baji' (elder sister) is an Urdu term of respect for women.

loans.use: To buy an auto-rickshaw

loans.name: Khosiyat

texts.en:
Khosiyat K. is 39 years old. She has been married for 20 years, and she has 4 children. Her husband works in Russia. Khosiyat and her husband raise their children with love, and they try to ensure that their children have everything they need as they grow older.

Khosiyat has been running her business for 11 years. Specifically, she sells fabrics for the national dresses and different kinds of items at her store, including the following: detergents, razors, hair products, creams, etc. Khosiyat is always very polite with her clients and she has great taste when it comes to clothing, so she can easily advise her customers as to which textiles they should choose for particular occasions.

Khosiyat is trying to have a wide range of goods on hand at her store so that she can meet the needs of her customers irrespective of their income levels. Therefore, Khosiyat hereby requests a loan in the amount of 800 Somoni ($250 USD) to order a new stock of fabrics. She would like to thank everybody for their support, and she promises to repay the loan in 4 months.

loans.use: To meet her customers' demands and to diversify her product line by purchasing additional goods

loans.name: Phon

texts.en: Mr. Phon N. is 48 years old and the father of four children who are all attending junior high school.  He is a construction worker in Preak Ta Ong Ti Bey Village in Kandal Province. His wife, Mrs. Song Thy, is a mat maker. Since her business is going well, she wants to expand it but she does not have enough money to buy more raw materials to make mats. Therefore, her husband, Mr. Phon N., asks for a loan for his wife.  Mr. Phon N. and his wife are shown in the picture.

loans.use: To buy more raw materials to make mats.

loans.name: Joyce

texts.en:
Mambo from Dar es Salaam, Tanzania! Joyce K. is 38 years old, married with three children between the ages of 8 and 17. She is a successful entrepreneur who owns two business, namely a beauty salon and a poultry business. She started these businesses in 2006 and currently earns monthly profits of US$ 500 from them. She is requesting a loan of US$ 700 to purchase additional hair products such as weaves (hair extensions) for her beauty salon and to purchase additional chicks and feed for her poultry business.

SELFINA has taken a lead role as a pioneer of micro-credit in Tanzania through Micro-Leasing. The organization is engaged in the economic empowerment of women in Tanzania through the provision of a leasing and leaseback microfinance facility. Customs and traditions in Tanzania make it difficult for women to own land and assets, thus they are termed non-creditworthy by financial institutions. This leads to poor financial support and poor access to basic needs and services for women with low incomes. One of the primary advantages of microleasing is that it allows clients to use the equipment as collateral for future loans with SELFINA, thus enabling them to borrow larger sums in the future.

loans.use: To buy chicks and feed for her poultry business and hair products for her beauty salon

loans.name: Abdumutalib

texts.en: L. Abdumutalib was born in 1950 in the Spitamen region. He applied to MicroInvest in 2008 and bought a pedigree bull thanks to his first loan. The first loan helped him grow his business and now he is ready to take the next loan step. Mr. L. Abdumutalib has been in the livestock business for 14 years. He works at the collective farm but it is seasonal work so the livestock business brings in general family income. He has 2 pedigree bulls, 3 milk-cows and 4 rams. Mr. L. Abdumutalib applies to KIVA for a business support loan of 2600 STJ for 4 months to build a cowshed. He thanks KIVA for its support and wishes KIVA lenders all the best.

loans.use: To build a cowshed

loans.name: Kumri

texts.en:
M. Kumri is 53 years old. She is married and the loving mother of four children. Kumri owns a successful clothing and shoe sales business located at the Sakhovat market in Dushanbe, Tajikistan. She has been doing this business for about 13 years. Her business has benefited from a good sales location and constant demand for her products. Kumri tries to offer good prices to her customers while still making a profit. A normal monthly income from her business is around 1500 Somoni.

Kumri has requested a loan of 2500 Somoni (US$750) for a term of nine months to increase her product inventory. This is a busy time for many market vendors as the cold season is coming and everyone is preparing for winter season. By purchasing additional inventory, Kumri will be better prepared to meet increased demand and earn a good income.

We believe her perseverance and natural liveliness will help her continue to succeed in her trade and repay this loan on time.

loans.use: To increase her product inventory.

loans.name: Yesica

texts.es: Yesica tiene 20 años, vive con su pareja Humberto de 24 años, el cual es chofer, y con sus dos hijas, Joselin de 4 años y Shamely de 11 meses. Ella se dedica a la venta de “salchimote”, que no es otra cosa que granos de maíz sancochado con salchichas fritas, en un pequeño carrito, donde brinda este rico platillo a sus clientes, los cuales son muy asiduos a su pequeño puesto. Lo que le gusta a Yesica de su trabajo es el poder realizarlo en compañía de sus dos pequeñas y así poder compartir junto a ellas, mientras que lo más difícil radica en tener que trasladarse desde su hogar que queda en Cabana, a casi una hora de la ciudad de Juliaca, siendo muy trabajoso trasladarse con su carrito y sus dos pequeñas. Yesica se encuentra en su primer préstamo con Microfinanzas Prisma. Con el dinero solicitado refaccionará su carrito y además comprará mayor cantidad de productos para aumentar el número de platos para vender.
texts.en:
Yesica is 20 years old and lives with her 24-year-old husband, Humberto--a driver--and their two daughters, 4-year-old Joselin and 11-month-old Shamely. She sells "salchimote", a simple corn and sausage dish, from a small cart, which her customers visit regularly. What Yesica likes about her work is that she is able to stay with her two small children, but the most difficult part is having to transport her cart and daughters from their home in Cabana to the city of Juliaca, almost an hour away. Yesica is seeking her first loan from Microfinanzas Prisma. She will use the money to repair her cart and to buy more produce to increase the number of dishes she can sell.

Translated from Spanish by Trisha Bury, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Repair cart and increase food sales

loans.name: Houwayda

texts.en:
Houwayda A. H. is a 36 year old widow who lives in Bint Jbeil, southern Lebanon with her two children. Houwayda has owned a bakery shop for ten year. She makes “markouk” and “mankoucheh” on the “saj”. The “saj” is the metA. oven where you bake the saj bread. The saj oven is a traditionA. Lebanese cooking dome used to make markouk (“thinned”) bread and doughy confections called mankoucheh. A mankoucheh looks like a folded pizza. Most common toppings are zaatar (thyme), jebneh (cheese) and lahm bi ajin (minced meat). You can eat it anytime of the day, but somehow it tastes better in the morning. 

Houwayda requested a loan of 1000 US dollars from A. Majmoua in order to purchase flour and some tools for her bakery shop. This is the first time that Houwayda has requested a loan. Houwayda hopes that the loan will help her to cross the bridge to a better situation. She specialty is the good quality and taste of her markouk. Her clients are her friends, family members, neighbors and neighborhood shops. Houwayda got into this business because she had learned the business from her mother and she does it well. In the future, she plans to expand her business.

loans.use: To purchase flour and tools for her bakery shop.

loans.name: Sopheak

texts.en:
Mrs. Sopheak N. is a villager in Preak Svay Village in Kandal Province. She is a housewife who cooks delicious food for her family. Her husband, Mr. Leng Malin, repairs TVs and VCDs. Because he does not have enough money to buy TV and VCD supplies, Mrs. Sopheak N. has decided to ask for a loan to buy the supplies for her husband's business. 

She hopes to increase their income and provide a better life for their family. She is 24 years old and the mother of three children. One child attends the local school. The other two are too young to work or study. Her husband is presented with her in the picture.

loans.use: To buy TV and VCD supplies

loans.name: Ramona

texts.en:
Mrs. Ramona G. is 50 years old and she is married with three children.  Her business, which she started more than 25 years ago, is a small store that she runs from her home and it is very well known in her neighborhood.  And now, with the help of a loan, she will be able to keep her business very well stocked.  She also plans to increase the size of her store because the small amount of space she has available now is not able to hold the merchandise she has in stock.

Mrs. G. said she was a fighter through the sacrifices involved in her business because she works seven days a week and does not have a weekend.  She begins work at the store at 5:00 am but she feels happy to run her own business and with it she is able to cover her family’s expenses and provide a good education for her children. 

Her main customers are the salaried workers in the neighborhood as well as local salesmen and factory workers, to whom she provides breakfast and snacks.

loans.use: For the purchase of goods such as beef, chicken, fruits, vegetables, sugar, milk, and beverages of all types.

loans.name: Ostiana

texts.en:
Ostiana T. is 37 years old. She lives in Manutapen village, Kupang District. She became widowed in 2003. She has 2 children, they are Melkianus T., Grade 2 in Senior High School and Dervin T., Grade 3 in junior High School. She runs a kiosk business where she sells a variety of goods for household needs. She is requesting her  second loan from TLM amounting to Rp.3.000.000. The kiosk business is the main source of income for her to meet their daily needs and to finance her children's education.

TLM is the newest partner of Kiva operating in Kupang, West Timor, Indonesia.

loans.use: To purchase more goods to sell in her store

loans.name: Nawidullah

texts.en: Nawidullah M. A. lives in Kabul, Afghanistan's 6th district. He is single and lives with his six-member family. His older brother, who is 30, wants to get married but lacks the money to cover the expenses. He would like to take out an individual loan of 50,000 Afghani ($1,075), with a repayment term of six months, to support his brother. He would like to state that Kiva is an effective process that helps people solve their problems.

loans.use: To cover wedding expenses.

loans.name: Nidia Marilu

texts.es:
Nidia es socia del Banco Comunal Rikchary que significa Despierta en quechua.
Nidia es casada, tiene 31 años y 2 hijos, Nidia junto a su esposo se dedican a la venta de cerveza, para lo cual tienen un local ubicado en una avenida transitada, además tienen una taberna.
Nidia necesita un préstamo de 2100 soles dinero que será invertido en la compra de ron, wisky.
Los sueños de Nidia son que sus hijos sean profesionales, tener casa propia y aperturar otro local.
texts.en:
Nidia is a member of the Rikchary Community Bank which means Wake Up in quechua.

Nidia is 31 years old, married and has 2 children. Nidia and her husband sell beer. They have a place on a busy avenue and they also have a pub.

Nidia needs a loan of 2100 PEN, money she will invest to buy rum and whiskey.

Nidia’s dreams are that her children become professional workers, to have her own home and to open another place.

Translated from Spanish by Susan Haynes, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase rum and whiskey.

loans.name: Fanesa

texts.en:
Fanesa is a resident of Purok 2 (district 2) of San Isidro, Quirino, Isabela. She is 33 years old and married to Samuel S. who is 35 years old and a farmer in their village. They are blessed with one child, John Ray, who is 10 years old and attending primary school. Fanesa is glad and thankful that in their family there is cooperation and they are bonded with love.

Fanesa works with her husband in their rice fields which serve as their source of income. Fanesa is requesting a loan amounting to PHP 11,000 for her farming needs. Every harvest, she only earns a net income of PHP 10,000 because some of her harvested rice is used for their rice consumption. Fanesa has been managing the business for almost 12 years and she always hopes to have an increase in production in order to send her child to school all the way through college.

Fanesa stated that if you commit everything to God, He will do the rest that is best for you. But, it should also be accompanied by actions, she added.

loans.use: For farming needs

loans.name: Mary

texts.en:
Mary T. is an achiever and her focus is to save enough to provide her kids with quality education for their future careers. But she knows that without adequate funds it won't be possible to realize that dream. She is 45 years old and married with five kids who are currently in school.They live in Dorma Ahenkro in the Brong Ahafo region of Ghana. She sells food like bags of maize, plantain and cassava in the local market.

Mary is humbly requesting your help to make her dream come true. She needs a loan so that she will be better resourced to take care of her children. With the loan, she wants to increase her stock of maize, plantain, cassava and charcoal by purchasing directly from the farmers to satisfy her customers’ needs. This will enable her to save more to support her husband in taking care of the home. She belongs to a village bank called Yewoha Nhyira which means Jehovah’s Blessing.

loans.use: To purchase cassava, charcoal, plantain and maize in bulk

loans.name: Eveling Violeta

texts.es: Doña Eveling Violeta Sánchez tiene la edad de 50 años, su negocio es la venta cosméticos y alquiler de cuarto, en sus ventas lleva doce años en el mercado, alquilando cuarto cuatro años el cual ha sido de muchos beneficios para apoyar  a sus cinco hijos tres son mayores y dos están cursando sus estudios. La señora Eveling tiene la edad de 50 años, reside en el barrio Villa Reconciliación, su esposo es maestro de obra y esta laborando en el país de Costa Rica. Este es su cuarto crédito en Afodenic y lo invertirá en la compra de materiales de construcción para hacer mejoras a los cuartos que tiene alquilando así podrá tener mejor precio y mejor servicios a sus clientes. A futuro espera lograr hacer otros cuartos que le generen más ganancias. Da las gracias a la institución por el apoyo otorgado.
texts.en:
Dona Eveling Violeta S., 50, operates a business selling cosmetics and renting rooms. She's been selling cosmetics for twelve years and renting rooms for four years and the business has provided her a means to support her five children, three now grown and two still in school. Sra. Eveling is 50 years old and lives in the Villa Reconciliacion neighborhood. Her husband is a construction foreman and he's working in Costa Rica. This is her fourth Afodenic loan. She will use the loan to purchase construction materials so that she can improve the rooms that she rents and, in turn, increase her prices and provide a better service to her customers. In the future, she hopes to be able to rent other room and generate more revenue. She's very grateful to the institution for helping her.

Translated from Spanish by Jere Wiseman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy construction materials for room-rental business.

loans.name: Tarciana

texts.en:
Mrs. Tarciana M. is 66 years old and married with no children. She is a pensioner and lives at Taboo, Jimenez, Misamis Occidental.

She joined Paglaum in May 2009 to secure financial assistance for house repair. The repayments will come from her monthly pension. She aspires to have a decent abode where she can spend the remaining days of her life.

loans.use: To repair her house

loans.name: Truphena

texts.en:
Truphena A. is a 29-year-old married mother of one. She lives with her husband Michael and daughter Marion in Mikindani, Mombasa, where she runs a pharmacy and also sells cosmetics. She has been in that business for the last three years. She also offers counseling services to her clients in the area.

This will be Truphena's first loan from KADET, and her first from any source to finance her business. With the money, she plans to purchase more cosmetics and sanitary products in order to meet the demands of her customers.  Truphena says the satisfaction her customers get from her services motivates her to grow her business more.

About KADET:
The Kenya Agency for the Development of Enterprise and Technology (KADET) is committed to economically empowering its clients by providing financial services to rural communities in order to relieve suffering and improve living conditions within those communities.

loans.use: To purchase more cosmetics and sanitary products.

loans.name: Zamoyoni

texts.en:
Zamoyoni started her own food business selling vegetable three years ago. She is a 22-year-old woman, married and the mother of one child. Her child is 1 year old. She works 12 hours a day and earns a monthly profit of approximately 240,000 Tanzanian shillings. Zamoyoni is a member of the Ushirikiano borrower group in Kola, Morogoro.

This is Zamoyoni's first loan from BRAC Tanzania. She requested 200,000 in order to buy more vegetables for sale.  With the additional profit she gains from the use of this loan, Zamoyoni hopes to save money and expand her business.

loans.use: To buy more vegetables

loans.name: Sabina

texts.en:
Sabina N. is married and has two children. She has received some formal education. Sabina sells porridge at Yamoransa, which she has done since 2004. Her husband is a carpenter. Sabina uses her income to pay for feeding her family and also paying utility bills.

Sabina will use the loan to purchase millet from Techiman and sugar to prepare porridge for sale. With the new profits from her expanded business, Sabina plans to save towards building a house and also for educating her children.

loans.use: to purchase millet from Techiman and sugar to prepare porridge for sale

loans.name: Hawa

texts.en:
Hawa is a member of the Vumilia borrower group in Sakina, Arusha. She is 40 year old woman, she is divorced and a mother of 3 children. Her children are 25,19, and 13 years old.

Hawa has owned a clothing business selling clothes 6 years. She works 10 hours a day and earns a monthly profit approximately 150,000 Tanzanian shillings.

This is Hawa`s second loan from BRAC_Tanzania, she requested the amount of 450,000 Tsh in order to buy more clothes for sale.

With the additional profit she gains from the use of this loan,Hawa hopes to save more money and expand her business.

loans.use: To buy more clothes for sale

loans.name: Celso

texts.en: Celso V. is from the city of Bañadro, Ozamiz City. He is 41 years old, is married, and has two school-aged children. Celso owns and operates a specialized "sari-sari" (variety) store, selling a variety of different products in the local community. He has been engaged in his business for over eight years and earns approximately 5,000 PHP a month. In 2009, Celso joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve his living situation and his ability to engage in business activities. He is requesting a loan of 8,000 PHP which will be used to invest in expanding his business. This loan will be his second from GDMPC. He plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of his family. About GDMPC: GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has four branches and three unit offices covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolk and small entrepreneurs. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To invest in expanding his business

loans.name: Maribel

texts.en:
Maribel is already 31 years old, and she is married to Allan B., who works as a farmer on their own land. They now have two children: Alainebless, three years old, and Alaiza, four months old. They are the couple’s main source of inspiration. Their family lives in Minallo, a village of Naguilian, Isabela.

Maribel has been raising ducks and hogs at the back of their house for two years already. She needs additional working capital to maintain her livestock business. She hopes to avail of a loan of 9,000 PHP from lenders. This amount will be of great help in purchasing feed for her livestock. She hopes that lenders will entrust her with the loan she is trying to obtain. This will make her business more productive.

loans.use: To buy feed for her livestock

loans.name: Rezan

texts.en:
Rezan P. is from the village of Plaridel St. Mambajao Camiguin Province. She is 31 years old. Rezan is married and has five school-aged children. To make a living, Rezan runs a sari-sari (variety) retail shop, selling both food & daily use products in the local community. Rezan has been engaged in her business for over nine years and earns approximately 3,200 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2009, Rezan joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Rezan is requesting a loan of 5000 PHP, which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This loan will be the first loan taken out by Rezan from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to support the education of her children. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Bonifacia

texts.en:
Mrs. Bonifacia E., 61 years of age, is a resident of Mandih, Sindangan, Zamboanga del Norte. She has four children.

Bonifacia is a member of PDP-LP or Paglaum Development Program for Landless People. She has obtained a loan of Php 3,000 which is intended for her banana and charcoal vending business. Her customers are the people in their village and people of neighboring places.

Bonifacia started this business with only a small amount of capital. Her future plan is to make this business big in order to cater to her customers from faraway places.

loans.use: To use as additional capital for her banana and charcoal business

loans.name: Delfina Del Carmen

texts.es: Doña Delfina es soltera, vive en la zona # 2 de Nueva Guinea, tiene cuatro hijos dos mayores de edad y unos gemelos que actualmente estan cursando cuarto año de educación secundaria,  trabaja para el MINED Nueva Guinea como docente de primaria en la colonia el Serrano desde hace 4 años a 28 km de la ciudad,está solicitando su 9no crédito para invertirlo en mejora de su vivienda (construcción de una habitación), todos los dias Delfina tiene que levantarse a las cuatro de la mañana para dejar hecho los quehaceres del hogar y abordar el camión a las 6 de la mañana a impartir el pan de la enseñanza a niños campesinos de esa colonia, el padre de sus hijos a pesar que no vive con ellos es muy responsable el cual ayuda con los gastos familiares a sus hijos, su sueño que sus hijos estudien, trabajo, salud y poco a poco ir mejorando su vivienda para tener mejor comodidad.
texts.en:
Doña Delfina is a single mother of four children who lives in District #2 of New Guinea. Her two older children are twins who are currently in their fourth year of high school.

Delfina works for MINED (the Ministry of Education) as an elementary school teacher in the Serrano neighborhood. She has been teaching for four years and her school is located 28km away from the city. At the moment, she is requesting her ninth loan to invest in home improvements (specifically the construction of a room). Every day, Delfina wakes up at 4am to complete her household chores before catching a passenger truck at 6am to leave for her teaching job. Even though he does not live with them, the father of her children is very responsible and contributes toward their expenses. Delfina hopes that her children continue to study, find work, and remain healthy. She also wants to improve their living conditions so that they will be more comfortable.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Build a room

loans.name: Sorra

texts.en: Mrs. Sorra S. is a villager in Tralach village in Takeo province. She is a farmer who owns a 2-hectar field of land to cultivate rice. In this plantation, she faces an obstacle because she does not have enough money. Thus, she decided to ask for a loan to buy rice seed and fertilizers to support the rice field. Her husband, Mr. Huong Rathana, is a motorbike taxi driver. Mrs. Sorra S. is 27 years old and the mother of a child who is just three years old. Her husband and a child are presented in the picture with her.

loans.use: To buy rice seed and fertilizers to strengthen the rice field.

loans.name: Abibatu

texts.en: Abibatu is a trader. He sells foodstuffs: rice, beans, groundnut oil, and other items. He purchases his goods from Idumota market. He has been running this business for over eight years now, and he has been with LAPO for two years. Abibatu is a 44-year-old father of three children. He hopes to increase his capital in the future and improve his family's standard of living. He is requesting a loan of NGN 100,000 to purchase more foodstuffs to sell. He believes that having an assortment of foodstuffs will increase his sales and increase his capital.

loans.use: To purchase more foodstuffs to sell.

loans.name: Las Responsables 1, 2 ,3 & 4 Group

texts.en:
Maribel is the coordinator of her group Las Responsables (The Responsible Ones), and her story is representative of her group and of Esperanza's Haitian and Dominican (many of whom recently emigrated to the DR from Haiti) clients generally. Her group is located in the rural areas surrounding La Romana which is economically based on the sugarcane harvest and where running water (none of which is potable) and electricity are unreliable. She makes her home here in a simple structure with her long-term partner and their three children.

Maribel is excited to be taking her first loan with Esperanza and she is excited about the potential to continue growing her business. She plans to use this loan to invest in her business running a "colmado" or small corner store. She will use the capital to stock her store with rice, cooking oil, beans and refreshments. She will use the profits to invest in her family and to continue growing in the future. She thanks you all for your support.

loans.use: To buy more rice, oil, beans and refreshments for her corner store

loans.name: Mayda

texts.es:
Mayda es socia del Banco Comunal Violeta.
Mayda es casada, tiene 36 años y 4 hijos, Mayda vende ropa variada, productos que vende en la selva ayacuchana a donde viaja cada 15 días y en algunas oportunidades vende carne y queso.
Mayda necesita un préstamo de 1200 soles dinero que será invertido en la compra de casacas y pantalones.
Los sueños de Mayda son que sus hijos sean profesionales y construir su casa.
texts.en:
Mayda is a member of the community bank "Violeta". She is married, she is 36 years old and she has 4 children. Mayda sells various types of clothing in the Selva Ayacuchana area to where she travels every 15 days. Sometimes she also sells meats and cheeses.

Mayda requires a loan of 1200 soles, funds that will be invested in the purchase of jackets and slacks.

Mayda's dreams are to see her children grow up to have good careers, and to build a home.


Translated from Spanish by Erika Lindig, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase jackets and slacks.

loans.name: Uth

texts.en: Mr. Uth O. is 50 years old and lives in Ou Kralang Duol village, Takeo province. He is a farmer who owns a three-hectare field to grow crops. In order to support the farm, Mr. Uth O. is requesting 2,000,000 Riel to buy a plowing machine. His wife, Mrs. Yar San, is a grocer at home who earns a small income to support her family. The couple has three children between the ages of 8 and 24. Two of their children are currently employees in the garment factory while the youngest one is a student in the local school. His wife is O. the right in the picture.

loans.use: To buy a plow machine for plowing.
